1 
  2 /**
  3  * The global CCC namespace. 
  4  * 
  5  * @namespace
  6  */
  7 pvc = {};
  8 
  9 /**
 10  * The CCC options namespace.
 11  * <p>
 12  * All types of this namespace,
 13  * as well as of the namespaces below this one, 
 14  * are 
 15  * <b>documentation</b> types -
 16  * they do not exist, in code, 
 17  * and serve only to document the structure of the options objects 
 18  * that each chart type accepts in its constructor.
 19  * 
 20  * <p>
 21  * The following code shows how to 
 22  * create and configure a very simple CCC Bar chart:
 23  * 
 24  * <pre>// Options are placed in a plain JS object
 25  * var options = {
 26  *     title:  "A CCC Bar chart",
 27  *     legend: true,
 28  *     crosstabMode: false
 29  * };
 30  * 
 31  * var data = {
 32  *     metadata: [
 33  *         {colIndex: 0, colType: "String", colName: "Series"}, 
 34  *         {colIndex: 1, colType: "String", colName: "Category"}, 
 35  *         {colIndex: 2, colType: "String", colName: "Value"}
 36  *     ],
 37  *     resultset: [
 38  *         ["London", "2010-01-02", 1],
 39  *         ["London", "2010-01-03", 2],
 40  *         ["London", "2010-01-04", 3],
 41  *         ["London", "2010-01-05", 2],
 42  *         ["Paris",  "2010-01-01", 3],
 43  *         ["Paris",  "2010-01-02", 6],
 44  *         ["Paris",  "2010-01-04", 1],
 45  *         ["Paris",  "2010-01-05", 7],
 46  *         ["Lisbon", "2010-01-01", 3],
 47  *         ["Lisbon", "2010-01-02", 2],
 48  *         ["Lisbon", "2010-01-03", 1],
 49  *         ["Lisbon", "2010-01-04", 5]
 50  *     ]
 51  * };
 52  * 
 53  * new pvc.BarChart(options)
 54  * .setData(data)
 55  * .render();
 56  * </pre>
 57  * Note that the options object is a plain JavaScript object,
 58  * and not a {@link pvc.options.charts.BarChart}
 59  * 
 60  * <p>
 61  * 
 62  * @namespace
 63  */
 64 pvc.options = {};
 65 
 66 /**
 67  * The namespace of CCC chart extension point classes. 
 68  * 
 69  * @namespace
 70  */
 71 pvc.options.ext = {};
 72 
 73 /**
 74  * The namespace of chart options classes. 
 75  * 
 76  * @namespace
 77  */
 78 pvc.options.charts = {};
 79 
 80 /**
 81  * The options documentation class of the basic chart facet.
 82  * 
 83  * <h2>Default Data Format</h2>
 84  * <p>
 85  * This section describes, in general, the data format accepted by CCC charts.
 86  * Most of what is here presented applies to all chart types.
 87  * <p>
 88  * The option {@link #crosstabMode} is by far the most important,
 89  * as it makes the top-level choice between the
 90  * two data formats: 
 91  * <i>relational</i> and 
 92  * <i>crosstab</i>.
 93  * <p>
 94  * Each of this formats has its own variants and,
 95  * also, both have some configuration options in common.
 96  * 
 97  * <h3>Relational Format</h3>
 98  * <p>
 99  * This format is a regular tabular format where each column of the data source
100  * corresponds to a different property of the described entity.
101  * <p>
102  * Each entity is described in a single row.
103  * Although not required,
104  * usually, one or more of the columns together identify the entity.
105  * 
106  * <h4>Example relational dataset</h4>
107  * 
108  * <pre>
109  * {
110  *     "metadata": [
111  *         {"colName": "city",  "colType": "String",  "colLabel": "City"},
112  *         {"colName": "date",  "colType": "String",  "colLabel": "Date"},
113  *         {"colName": "quant", "colType": "Numeric", "colLabel": "Quantity"}
114  *     ],
115  *     "resultset": [
116  *         ["London", "2011-06-05", 72],
117  *         ["London", "2011-06-06", 50],
118  *         ["Paris",  "2011-06-05", 27],
119  *         ["Paris",  "2011-06-06",  5],
120  *         ["Lisbon", "2011-06-05", 30],
121  *         ["Lisbon", "2011-06-12", 60]
122  *     ]
123  * }
124  *             
125  * </pre>
126  * 
127  * <h3>Crosstab Format</h3>
128  * <p>
129  * The cross-tabular format goes away from the one-to-one correspondence
130  * between 
131  * <i>row</i> and 
132  * <i>entity</i>, and 
133  * <i>column</i> and 
134  * <i>property</i>.
135  * <p>
136  * Instead, it provides a grouped and aggregated view of the entities and their properties:
137  * 
138  * <ul>
139  * 
140  * <li>One row is spawned per distinct combination of the values of the "rows" properties</li>
141  * 
142  * <li>One column is spawned per distinct combination of the values of the "columns" properties</li>
143  * 
144  * <li>One cell contains a single somehow aggregated value, or 
145  * <tt>null</tt>, corresponding to its row and column's value</li>
146  * </ul>
147  * <p>
148  * The way in which a cross-tabular form is encoded in a single-tabular structure is, in kind words, 
149  * <i>sui generis</i>.
150  * The first 
151  * <i>N</i> columns are "rows" properties, and maintain the column-property correspondence.
152  * The following columns, however, each correspond to a distinct combination of the 
153  * <i>values</i> of the "columns" properties.
154  * This leads to the 
155  * <i>values</i> of the "columns" properties being placed in a column's 
156  * <tt>colName</tt> attribute (see example, below).
157  * 
158  * <h4>Downsides</h4>
159  * <p>
160  * This form of encoding is nice and concise,
161  * but achieves that at the cost of occupying the space intended for metadata
162  * and, thus, resulting in absent metadata for the underlying entities "columns" and "measures" properties.
163  * <p>
164  * Because of this reason, unfortunately,
165  * CCC could never really rely on the values of the "colName" and "colLabel" metadata attributes.
166  * We do try to use these, when they actually contain metadata,
167  * to default dimensions' labels (see {@link #dataIgnoreMetadataLabels}).
168  * 
169  * <h4>Example crosstab dataset with one property per group</h4>
170  * This is a crosstab dataset with one "rows", one "columns" and one "measures" property.
171  * 
172  * <pre>
173  * {
174  *     "metadata": [
175  *         {"colName": "date",   "colType": "String",  "colLabel": "Date"  },
176  *         {"colName": "London", "colType": "Numeric", "colLabel": "London"},
177  *         {"colName": "Paris",  "colType": "Numeric", "colLabel": "Paris" },
178  *         {"colName": "Lisbon", "colType": "Numeric", "colLabel": "Lisbon"}
179  *     ],
180  *     "resultset": [
181  *         ["2011-06-05", 72,     27,   30],
182  *         ["2011-06-06", 50,      5, null],
183  *         ["2011-06-12", null, null,   60]
184  *     ]
185  * }
186  *             
187  * </pre>
188  * 
189  * <h4>Example crosstab dataset with two properties per discrete group</h4>
190  * This is a crosstab dataset with two "rows" properties, two "columns" properties and one "measures" property.
191  * 
192  * <pre>
193  * {
194  *     "metadata": [
195  *         {"colName": "date",   "colType": "String",  "colLabel": "Date"          },
196  *         {"colName": "family", "colType": "String",  "colLabel": "Product Family"},
197  *         {"colName": "London~Ready",      "colType": "Numeric", "colLabel": "London~Ready"      },
198  *         {"colName": "London~InProgress", "colType": "Numeric", "colLabel": "London~In Progress"},
199  *         {"colName": "Paris~Ready",       "colType": "Numeric", "colLabel": "Paris~Ready"       },
200  *         {"colName": "Paris~InProgress",  "colType": "Numeric", "colLabel": "Paris~In Progress" },
201  *         {"colName": "Lisbon~InProgress", "colType": "Numeric", "colLabel": "Lisbon~In Progress"}
202  *     ],
203  *     "resultset": [
204  *         ["2011-06-05", "Cars",     52,    0,   15,    2,   15],
205  *         ["2011-06-05", "Planes",   10,   10    10,    0,   15],
206  *         ["2011-06-06", "Cars",     10,   10,    1,    3, null],
207  *         ["2011-06-06", "Planes",   10,   20,    0,    1, null],
208  *         ["2011-06-12", "Cars",   null, null, null, null,   58],
209  *         ["2011-06-12", "Planes", null, null, null, null,    2]
210  *     ]
211  * }
212  *             
213  * </pre>
214  * 
215  * <h4>Example crosstab dataset with two properties in every group</h4>
216  * This is a crosstab dataset with two "rows" properties, two "columns" properties and two "measures" property.
217  * Yep. Sales are just ten times the quantity...
218  * <p>
219  * For this example to work,
220  * both options {@link #isMultiValued} and {@link #dataMeasuresInColumns} must be set to 
221  * <tt>true</tt>.
222  * 
223  * <pre>
224  * {
225  *     "metadata": [
226  *         {"colName": "date",   "colType": "String",  "colLabel": "Date"          },
227  *         {"colName": "family", "colType": "String",  "colLabel": "Product Family"},
228  *         {"colName": "London~Ready~quant",      "colType": "Numeric", "colLabel": "London~Ready~Quantity"      },
229  *         {"colName": "London~Ready~sales",      "colType": "Numeric", "colLabel": "London~Ready~Sales"         },
230  *         {"colName": "London~InProgress~quant", "colType": "Numeric", "colLabel": "London~In Progress~Quantity"},
231  *         {"colName": "London~InProgress~sales", "colType": "Numeric", "colLabel": "London~In Progress~Sales"   },
232  *         {"colName": "Paris~Ready~quant",       "colType": "Numeric", "colLabel": "Paris~Ready~Quantity"       },
233  *         {"colName": "Paris~Ready~sales",       "colType": "Numeric", "colLabel": "Paris~Ready~Sales"          },
234  *         {"colName": "Paris~InProgress~quant",  "colType": "Numeric", "colLabel": "Paris~In Progress~Quantity" },
235  *         {"colName": "Paris~InProgress~sales",  "colType": "Numeric", "colLabel": "Paris~In Progress~Sales"    },
236  *         {"colName": "Lisbon~InProgress~quant", "colType": "Numeric", "colLabel": "Lisbon~In Progress~Quantity"},
237  *         {"colName": "Lisbon~InProgress~sales", "colType": "Numeric", "colLabel": "Lisbon~In Progress~Sales"   }
238  *     ],
239  *     "resultset": [
240  *         ["2011-06-05", "Cars",     52,  520,    0,    0,  15,  150,    2,    20,  15,   150],
241  *         ["2011-06-05", "Planes",   10,  100,   10   100,  10,  100,    0,     0,  15,   150],
242  *         ["2011-06-06", "Cars",     10,  100,   10,  100,   1,   10,    3,    30, null, null],
243  *         ["2011-06-06", "Planes",   10,  100,   20,  200,   0,    0,    1,    10, null, null],
244  *         ["2011-06-12", "Cars",   null, null, null, null, null, null, null, null,   58,  580],
245  *         ["2011-06-12", "Planes", null, null, null, null, null, null, null, null,    2,  200]
246  *     ]
247  * }
248  *             
249  * </pre>
250  * 
251  * <h3>Physical Column Groups</h3>
252  * Traditionally, cross-tabular data contains "categories" in "rows" and "series" in "columns".
253  * Because of this, when in the context of the crosstab format,
254  * these terms end up being used interchangeably.
255  * <p>
256  * The separation of columns, at the data format layer,
257  * results in (what is referred to in this text as) 
258  * <i>physical column groups</i>.
259  * Three physical groups are identified: "series", "categories" and "measures".
260  * 
261  * <h4>Crosstab Format</h4>
262  * As explained, in the 
263  * <i>crosstab</i> format,
264  * the separation is physical, structural, unchangeable.
265  * <p>
266  * Remember, however,
267  * that the the "categories" 
268  * <i>physical group</i> is defined above as
269  * "the first 
270  * <i>N</i> columns are rows properties".
271  * By default, 
272  * <i>N</i> is determined as the number of initial, consecutive columns with a "string" type.
273  * If that is not the case, option {@link #dataCategoriesCount} allows stating otherwise.
274  * 
275  * <h4>Relational Format</h4>
276  * In the 
277  * <i>relational</i> format, however,
278  * the separation between "series" and "categories" is not physical, but, simply, convenient.
279  * As you'll see below, the separation helps in automatically loading data into common CCC's dimensions.
280  * <p>
281  * By default,
282  * when a data source contains a single discrete column,
283  * it is a considered a column of the "categories" 
284  * <i>physical group</i>.
285  * Otherwise, if it contains more discrete columns,
286  * the first is considered of the "series" 
287  * <i>physical group</i>,
288  * and all the remaining of the "categories" 
289  * <i>physical group</i>.
290  * This division is arbitrary.
291  * If you want more control, the option {@link #dataCategoriesCount}
292  * allows limiting the number of columns globbed by the "categories" 
293  * <i>physical group</i>.
294  * 
295  * <h4>Series in Rows, please</h4>
296  * It is common enough to want to swap the columns of the "series" and "categories" 
297  * <i>physical groups</i>.
298  * The option {@link #seriesInRows} exists for just that.
299  * 
300  * <h3>Logical Table</h3>
301  * The 
302  * <i>logical table</i>, or, in some contexts, the 
303  * <i>logical row</i>,
304  * is a reorganization of the source data
305  * into a logical format in which columns
306  * are properties of the underlying described entity
307  * and each entity is described in a single row.
308  * This is true, independently of the data source format being 
309  * <i>crosstab</i> or 
310  * <i>relational</i>.
311  * <p>
312  * In the 
313  * <i>relational</i> format, this is already the case.
314  * In the 
315  * <i>crosstab</i> format, however, a logical row contains information
316  * from one of the source rows and one of the source "columns" columns.
317  * <p>
318  * Apart from this restructuring,
319  * the columns of a logical row are also organized according to their
320  * source 
321  * <i>physical group</i>:
322  * 
323  * <style>
324  * .logicalrow {
325  * border-spacing: 0;
326  * margin: 1em 0;
327  * }
328  * .logicalrow td {
329  * border:  solid 1px;
330  * padding: 5px;
331  * }
332  * </style>
333  * 
334  * <table class='logicalrow' style='font-style: italic;'>
335  * 
336  * <tr>
337  * 
338  * <td>series</td>
339  * 
340  * <td>categories</td>
341  * 
342  * <td>measures</td>
343  * </tr>
344  * </table>
345  * <p>
346  * Because of this reordering,
347  * in the 
348  * <i>relational</i> format,
349  * the logical row can differ from the source row,
350  * when, in the latter,
351  * the columns of type "string" are not all before the columns of type "number".
352  * 
353  * <h3>Default Dimension Mapping</h3>
354  * Many chart types,
355  * like the pie, bar and point family, heat grid and box plot,
356  * automatically define and load dimensions —
357  * CCC's data column concept —
358  * for each of the 
359  * <i>logical table</i>'s 
360  * <i>physical groups</i>,
361  * with names from the corresponding 
362  * <i>dimension groups</i>:
363  * "series", "category" and "value". For example,
364  * if there are two columns of the "series" 
365  * <i>physical group</i>,
366  * two of the "categories" 
367  * <i>physical group</i> and
368  * one of the "measures" 
369  * <i>physical group</i>,
370  * the logical row would have its columns mapped
371  * to dimensions in the following way:
372  * 
373  * <table class='logicalrow'>
374  * 
375  * <tr>
376  * 
377  * <td>series</td>
378  * 
379  * <td>series2</td>
380  * 
381  * <td>category</td>
382  * 
383  * <td>category2</td>
384  * 
385  * <td>value</td>
386  * </tr>
387  * </table>
388  * <p>
389  * Other chart types,
390  * like the metric-point, bullet, sunburst, treemap charts,
391  * only rely on the discrete/continuous separation of the 
392  * <i>logical table</i> columns
393  * and automatically generate dimensions, from available columns, in other custom ways.
394  * See each chart type's options documentation page for information on its data format.
395  * 
396  * <h3>Explicit Dimension Mapping</h3>
397  * Whenever the default dimension mapping does not satisfy your needs,
398  * the {@link #readers} option allows mapping each position of the
399  * 
400  * <i>logical row</i> explicitly and independently.
401  * <p>
402  * For example, one could obtain the mapping:
403  * 
404  * <table class='logicalrow'>
405  * 
406  * <tr>
407  * 
408  * <td>category</td>
409  * 
410  * <td>series</td>
411  * 
412  * <td>series2</td>
413  * 
414  * <td>value</td>
415  * 
416  * <td>category2</td>
417  * </tr>
418  * </table>
419  * by specifying the following 
420  * <i>readers</i> value:
421  * 
422  * <pre>
423  * {
424  *     readers: ["category", "series", "series2", "value", "category2"]
425  * }
426  * 
427  * </pre>
428  * Another use of the 
429  * <i>readers</i> option is to be able to
430  * specify business names for the names of dimensions.
431  * For example, for the last crosstab format example,
432  * "crosstab dataset with two properties in every group",
433  * one would achieve the same effect, but using business dimension names,
434  * with the mapping:
435  * 
436  * <table class='logicalrow'>
437  * 
438  * <tr>
439  * 
440  * <td>city</td>
441  * 
442  * <td>orderState</td>
443  * 
444  * <td>date</td>
445  * 
446  * <td>family</td>
447  * 
448  * <td>quantity</td>
449  * 
450  * <td>sales</td>
451  * </tr>
452  * </table>
453  * by specifying the following 
454  * <i>readers</i> and probable 
455  * <i>visual roles</i> values:
456  * 
457  * <pre>
458  * {
459  *     readers: ["city", "orderState", "date", "family", "quantity", "sales"],
460  *     visualRoles: {
461  *         series:   "city, orderState",
462  *         category: "date, family",
463  *         value:    "quantity"
464  *     }
465  * }
466  * 
467  * </pre>
468  * 
469  * @class
470  * @abstract
471  */
472 pvc.options.charts.BasicChart = function(){};
473         
474         
475         
476         
477 /**
478  * A callback function that is called
479  * when the user clicks on a visual element.
480  * 
481  * @returns {undefined}
482  * @method
483  * @this pvc.visual.Context
484  * @param {pvc.visual.Scene} scene
485  * The scene associated with the visual item.
486  * 
487  * @category Chart > Actions
488  */
489 pvc.options.charts.BasicChart.prototype.clickAction = function(){};
490 /**
491  * A callback function that is called
492  * before the chart is rendered,
493  * but after if has been pre-rendered.
494  * <p>
495  * You can use this action to:
496  * 
497  * <ul>
498  * 
499  * <li>use the 
500  * <i>mark events</i> API on time-series categorical charts</li>
501  * 
502  * <li>extend in special ways the already created protovis marks.</li>
503  * </ul>
504  * 
505  * @returns {undefined}
506  * @method
507  * @this pvc.visual.Context
508  * @param {pvc.visual.Scene} scene
509  * The scene associated with the visual item.
510  * 
511  * @category Chart > Actions
512  */
513 pvc.options.charts.BasicChart.prototype.renderCallback = function(){};
514 /**
515  * A callback function that is called after the chart has finished rendering, including any animations.
516  * 
517  * @returns {undefined}
518  * @method
519  * @this pvc.visual.Context
520  * @param {pvc.visual.Scene} scene
521  * The scene associated with the visual item.
522  * 
523  * @category Chart > Actions
524  */
525 pvc.options.charts.BasicChart.prototype.renderedCallback = function(){};
526 /**
527  * An array of dimensions calculations.
528  * <p>
529  * Can be specified to calculate the values of certain dimensions.
530  * 
531  * @type list(pvc.options.DimensionsCalculation)
532  * @category Chart > Data
533  */
534 pvc.options.charts.BasicChart.prototype.calculations = undefined;
535 /**
536  * A map whose keys are
537  * the dimension type group names and whose values are
538  * the default dimension type group options.
539  * <p>
540  * A dimension type group is
541  * a group of dimension types
542  * that have a common non-numeric prefix in its name.
543  * <p>
544  * This property does not define any dimension types, per si,
545  * but allows specifying default values
546  * for dimension types of a group,
547  * that apply in case they are effectively used.
548  * 
549  * @type map(string : pvc.options.DimensionType)
550  * @category Chart > Data
551  */
552 pvc.options.charts.BasicChart.prototype.dimensionGroups = undefined;
553 /**
554  * A map whose keys are
555  * the dimension type names and whose values are
556  * the dimension type options.
557  * <p>
558  * You don't need to define dimensions
559  * unless you want to change their name or properties.
560  * Charts automatically define default dimensions
561  * to satisfy their visual roles' requirements.
562  * <p>
563  * Dimension options can be partial,
564  * so that it is possible to override only certain options.
565  * 
566  * @type map(string : pvc.options.DimensionType)
567  * @category Chart > Data
568  */
569 pvc.options.charts.BasicChart.prototype.dimensions = undefined;
570 /**
571  * The chart's format provider.
572  * 
573  * @type pvc.options.format.FormatProvider
574  * @category Chart > Data
575  */
576 pvc.options.charts.BasicChart.prototype.format = undefined;
577 /**
578  * The separator used to join the labels of the values of
579  * a multi-dimensional visual role.
580  * <p>
581  * For example, if a visual role,
582  * has the dimensions "Territory" and "ProductType",
583  * a compound value could be shown as "EMEA ~ Classic Cars".
584  * <p>
585  * See also {@link #dataSeparator}.
586  * 
587  * @type string
588  * @default ' ~ '
589  * @category Chart > Data
590  */
591 pvc.options.charts.BasicChart.prototype.groupedLabelSep = undefined;
592 /**
593  * Indicates if datums
594  * whose value in every measure dimension is null
595  * are ignored.
596  * <p>
597  * A dimension is considered a measure dimension if
598  * there is at least one measure visual role currently bound to it.
599  * 
600  * @type boolean
601  * @default true
602  * @category Chart > Data
603  */
604 pvc.options.charts.BasicChart.prototype.ignoreNulls = undefined;
605 /**
606  * A function that formats the 
607  * <i>non-null</i> values of 
608  * <i>numeric</i> dimensions.
609  * <p>
610  * When this property is specified,
611  * it sets also the
612  * {@link pvc.options.format.FormatProvider#number} format of the chart's format provider,
613  * {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart#format}.
614  * Consequently, its value is inherited by the number dimension types'
615  * {@link pvc.options.DimensionType#format}.
616  * <p>
617  * Conversely, if the chart's format provider
618  * {@link pvc.options.format.FormatProvider#number} format is specified,
619  * its value sets this property, {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart#valueFormat}.
620  * <p>
621  * When both are specified, the one in the chart's format provider has precedence.
622  * <p>
623  * Note: in a previous CCC version this property applied only to
624  * dimensions named 
625  * <tt>value</tt>, 
626  * <tt>value2</tt>, etc.
627  * It now applies to any numeric dimensions.
628  * 
629  * @returns {string!}
630  * The number formatted as a non-empty string.
631  * 
632  * @method
633  * @this null
634  * @param {number!} value
635  * The non-null number to format.
636  * 
637  * @category Chart > Data
638  */
639 pvc.options.charts.BasicChart.prototype.valueFormat = function(){};
640 /**
641  * Indicates if the data source is in the 
642  * <i>crosstab</i> format, or, when 
643  * <tt>false</tt>, the 
644  * <i>relational</i> format.
645  * 
646  * @type boolean
647  * @default true
648  * @category Chart > Data Source
649  */
650 pvc.options.charts.BasicChart.prototype.crosstabMode = undefined;
651 /**
652  * The number of columns of the "categories" 
653  * <i>physical group</i> that the data source contains.
654  * 
655  * <h4>Relational format</h4>
656  * Allows splitting the discrete columns between the
657  * "series" and "category" 
658  * <i>physical groups</i>, in a custom way.
659  * <p>
660  * By default, if only a single discrete column exists, it is a "category".
661  * Otherwise, the first column is a "series" column and all the remaining are "category" columns.
662  * 
663  * <h4>Crosstab format</h4>
664  * This is taken to be the number of consecutive discrete columns,
665  * from the first, or 
666  * <tt>1</tt>, if there are none.
667  * 
668  * @type number
669  * @category Chart > Data Source
670  */
671 pvc.options.charts.BasicChart.prototype.dataCategoriesCount = undefined;
672 /**
673  * Indicates if the data source translation should ignore
674  * the column labels present in the data source's metadata
675  * as defaults for the labels of dimensions that are directly
676  * loaded from those columns.
677  * <p>
678  * The capability to use the data source's provided metadata labels
679  * is most useful in the relational format, i.e., when {@link #crosstabMode} is 
680  * <tt>false</tt>.
681  * The crosstab format does not provide metadata information for the series/columns data.
682  * Also, only when both {@link #isMultiValued} and
683  * {@link #dataMeasuresInColumns} are 
684  * <tt>true</tt>,
685  * is there label information for the measures metadata.
686  * 
687  * @type boolean
688  * @default false
689  * @category Chart > Data Source
690  */
691 pvc.options.charts.BasicChart.prototype.dataIgnoreMetadataLabels = undefined;
692 /**
693  * Indicates if multiple measures "are in" columns or in rows (applies to crosstab data format).
694  * <p>
695  * This option only applies when {@link #isMultiValued} is 
696  * <tt>true</tt>.
697  * <p>
698  * When 
699  * <tt>true</tt>,
700  * the data source contains columns for each combination of "series" columns' values 
701  * <b>and</b> measure dimension.
702  * <p>
703  * When 
704  * <tt>false</tt>,
705  * the data source contains rows for each combination of "categories" columns' values 
706  * <b>and</b> measure dimension.
707  * 
708  * @type boolean
709  * @category Chart > Data Source
710  */
711 pvc.options.charts.BasicChart.prototype.dataMeasuresInColumns = undefined;
712 /**
713  * The separator character
714  * used to join multiple values in the crosstab format,
715  * and to build composite keys for multiple level groupings.
716  * <p>
717  * See also {@link #groupedLabelSep}.
718  * 
719  * @type string
720  * @default '~'
721  * @category Chart > Data Source
722  */
723 pvc.options.charts.BasicChart.prototype.dataSeparator = undefined;
724 /**
725  * The confirmation mode of the column types declared in a dataset's metadata.
726  * <p>
727  * The default value depends on the chart type.
728  * The 
729  * <i>bullet</i> chart type has a default of {@link pvc.options.varia.DataTypeCheckingMode#Extended}.
730  * All other chart types have a default of {@link pvc.options.varia.DataTypeCheckingMode#Minimum}.
731  * <p>
732  * Data type checking can be disabled by specifying the
733  * value {@link pvc.options.varia.DataTypeCheckingMode#None}.
734  * 
735  * @type pvc.options.varia.DataTypeCheckingMode
736  * @category Chart > Data Source
737  */
738 pvc.options.charts.BasicChart.prototype.dataTypeCheckingMode = undefined;
739 /**
740  * A function that filters 
741  * <i>datums</i> as they are being loading.
742  * 
743  * @returns {boolean}
744  * 
745  * <tt>true</tt> if the datum should be included,
746  * 
747  * <tt>false</tt> if it should be excluded.
748  * 
749  * @method
750  * @this null
751  * @param {pvc.data.Datum} datum
752  * The datum being loaded.
753  * 
754  * @category Chart > Data Source
755  */
756 pvc.options.charts.BasicChart.prototype.dataWhere = function(){};
757 /**
758  * Indicates if the data source contains multiple columns of the "measures" 
759  * <i>physical group</i>.
760  * 
761  * <h4>Relational format</h4>
762  * Controls whether the option {@link #measuresIndexes} applies.
763  * 
764  * <h4>Crosstab format</h4>
765  * Depending on the value of {@link #dataMeasuresInColumns}, measures are either in columns or in rows.
766  * 
767  * @type boolean
768  * @default false
769  * @category Chart > Data Source
770  */
771 pvc.options.charts.BasicChart.prototype.isMultiValued = undefined;
772 /**
773  * The indexes of columns of the "measures" 
774  * <i>physical group</i> (applies to relational data format).
775  * <p>
776  * This option only applies when {@link #isMultiValued} is 
777  * <tt>true</tt>.
778  * <p>
779  * By default, these are the indexes of continuous columns.
780  * 
781  * @type number|string|list(number|string)
782  * @category Chart > Data Source
783  */
784 pvc.options.charts.BasicChart.prototype.measuresIndexes = undefined;
785 /**
786  * A list of dimension names to load from corresponding 
787  * <i>logical table</i> columns.
788  * <p>
789  * Can be a string containing a comma separated list of dimension names.
790  * <p>
791  * More generally, this option accepts an array of dimensions readers.
792  * 
793  * @type string|list(pvc.options.DimensionsReader)
794  * @category Chart > Data Source
795  */
796 pvc.options.charts.BasicChart.prototype.readers = undefined;
797 /**
798  * Swaps the columns of the "series" and "categories" 
799  * <i>physical groups</i>.
800  * <p>
801  * The name of this option is inspired in the 
802  * <i>crosstab</i>/
803  * <i>matrix</i> format,
804  * where the "series" values are placed in the first row,
805  * and "category" values are placed in the first column
806  * (corner cell is empty).
807  * 
808  * @type boolean
809  * @default false
810  * @category Chart > Data Source
811  */
812 pvc.options.charts.BasicChart.prototype.seriesInRows = undefined;
813 /**
814  * The identifier of the HTML element,
815  * or the element itself,
816  * where the chart is to be created in.
817  * <p>
818  * The chart element will be a child of
819  * the canvas element.
820  * <p>
821  * When unspecified, the chart
822  * element will be added as the
823  * last child of the HTML document body.
824  * 
825  * @type string|object
826  * @category Chart > General
827  */
828 pvc.options.charts.BasicChart.prototype.canvas = undefined;
829 /**
830  * The set of compatibility flags.
831  * <p>
832  * See also {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart#compatVersion}.
833  * 
834  * @type pvc.options.varia.CompatibilityFlags
835  * @category Chart > General
836  */
837 pvc.options.charts.BasicChart.prototype.compatFlags = undefined;
838 /**
839  * The CCC version that the chart should run in.
840  * <p>
841  * The value 
842  * <tt>1</tt> emulates version 1 of CCC.
843  * <p>
844  * See also {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart#compatFlags}.
845  * 
846  * @type number
847  * @default Infinity
848  * @category Chart > General
849  */
850 pvc.options.charts.BasicChart.prototype.compatVersion = undefined;
851 /**
852  * Indicates if the chart is clickable by the user.
853  * <p>
854  * If this option is 
855  * <tt>false</tt>,
856  * any click-related actions will not be executed
857  * (ex:
858  * {@link #clickAction},
859  * {@link pvc.options.charts.Chart#doubleClickAction}, or
860  * {@link pvc.options.axes.DiscreteCartesianAxis#clickAction}).
861  * 
862  * @type boolean
863  * @default false
864  * @category Chart > Interaction
865  */
866 pvc.options.charts.BasicChart.prototype.clickable = undefined;
867 /**
868  * 
869  * Indicates if tooltips are enabled
870  * and contains additional tooltip presentation options.
871  * 
872  * @deprecated Use {@link #tooltip} instead.
873  * @type boolean
874  * @category Chart > Interaction
875  */
876 pvc.options.charts.BasicChart.prototype.showTooltips = undefined;
877 /**
878  * 
879  * Contains additional tooltip presentation options.
880  * 
881  * @deprecated Use {@link #tooltip} instead.
882  * @type pvc.options.Tooltip
883  * @category Chart > Interaction
884  */
885 pvc.options.charts.BasicChart.prototype.tipsySettings = undefined;
886 /**
887  * Indicates if tooltips are enabled
888  * and contains additional tooltip presentation options.
889  * 
890  * @type pvc.options.Tooltip
891  * @category Chart > Interaction
892  */
893 pvc.options.charts.BasicChart.prototype.tooltip = undefined;
894 /**
895  * The margins of the 
896  * <i>root</i> content panel, in pixel units or as a percentage.
897  * <p>
898  * In a 
899  * <i>small multiples</i> chart,
900  * the margins of the 
901  * <i>content panel</i> of a 
902  * <i>small</i> chart
903  * can be set with the property 
904  * <tt>smallContentMargins</tt>.
905  * <p>
906  * See {@link pvc.options.varia.Sides} for information about
907  * the different supported data types.
908  * 
909  * @type number|string|pvc.options.varia.Sides
910  * @default 0
911  * @category Chart > Layout
912  */
913 pvc.options.charts.BasicChart.prototype.contentMargins = undefined;
914 /**
915  * The paddings of the 
916  * <i>root</i> content panel, in pixel units or as a percentage.
917  * <p>
918  * In a 
919  * <i>small multiples</i> chart,
920  * the paddings of the 
921  * <i>content panel</i> of a 
922  * <i>small</i> chart
923  * can be set with the property 
924  * <tt>smallContentPaddings</tt>.
925  * <p>
926  * See {@link pvc.options.varia.Sides} for information about
927  * the different supported data types.
928  * 
929  * @type number|string|pvc.options.varia.Sides
930  * @default 0
931  * @category Chart > Layout
932  */
933 pvc.options.charts.BasicChart.prototype.contentPaddings = undefined;
934 /**
935  * The height of the 
936  * <i>root</i> chart, in pixels.
937  * 
938  * @type number
939  * @default 300
940  * @category Chart > Layout
941  */
942 pvc.options.charts.BasicChart.prototype.height = undefined;
943 /**
944  * The margins of the 
945  * <i>root</i> chart.
946  * <p>
947  * In a 
948  * <i>small multiples</i> chart,
949  * the margins of the 
950  * <i>small</i> charts can be set
951  * with the property 
952  * <tt>smallMargins</tt>.
953  * <p>
954  * See {@link pvc.options.varia.Sides} for information about
955  * the different supported data types.
956  * 
957  * @type number|string|pvc.options.varia.Sides
958  * @default 3
959  * @category Chart > Layout
960  */
961 pvc.options.charts.BasicChart.prototype.margins = undefined;
962 /**
963  * The chart orientation indicates if
964  * its main direction is vertical or horizontal.
965  * <p>
966  * This property is supported by most chart types.
967  * 
968  * @type pvc.options.varia.ChartOrientation
969  * @default 'vertical'
970  * @category Chart > Layout
971  */
972 pvc.options.charts.BasicChart.prototype.orientation = undefined;
973 /**
974  * The paddings of the 
975  * <i>root</i> chart.
976  * <p>
977  * In a 
978  * <i>small multiples</i> chart,
979  * the paddings of a 
980  * <i>small</i> chart can be set
981  * with the property 
982  * <tt>smallPaddings</tt>.
983  * <p>
984  * See {@link pvc.options.varia.Sides} for information about
985  * the different supported data types.
986  * 
987  * @type number|string|pvc.options.varia.Sides
988  * @default 0
989  * @category Chart > Layout
990  */
991 pvc.options.charts.BasicChart.prototype.paddings = undefined;
992 /**
993  * The width of the 
994  * <i>root</i> chart, in pixels.
995  * 
996  * @type number
997  * @default 400
998  * @category Chart > Layout
999  */
1000 pvc.options.charts.BasicChart.prototype.width = undefined;
1001 /**
1002  * The 
1003  * <tt>dataPart</tt> visual role is a chart-level visual role that
1004  * allows partitioning of the data into several datum subsets.
1005  * <p>
1006  * This is a shortcut property for
1007  * {@link pvc.options.visualRoles.BasicChartVisualRoles#dataPart}.
1008  * 
1009  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
1010  * @category Chart > Visual Roles
1011  */
1012 pvc.options.charts.BasicChart.prototype.dataPartRole = undefined;
1013 /**
1014  * The chart's visual roles map.
1015  * <p>
1016  * Besides the existing visual role properties
1017  * - named after the visual role's name followed by the word 
1018  * <tt>Role</tt> -
1019  * the visual roles map can be used, in code,
1020  * to specify the visual roles information.
1021  * The visual role name is the map's key,
1022  * and the value, its options.
1023  * 
1024  * @type map(string : pvc.options.VisualRole)|pvc.options.visualRoles.BasicChartVisualRoles
1025  * @category Chart > Visual Roles
1026  */
1027 pvc.options.charts.BasicChart.prototype.visualRoles = undefined;
1028 /**
1029  * The minimum size of the plot panel, in pixel units.
1030  * If a percentage is specified, this option is ignored.
1031  * <p>
1032  * To determine the actual minimum size of the plot panel,
1033  * the chart takes into account other restrictions imposed by options such as:
1034  * {@link #bandSize},
1035  * {@link #bandSizeMin},
1036  * {@link #bandSpacing} and
1037  * {@link #bandSpacingMin}.
1038  * <p>
1039  * In a 
1040  * <i>small multiples</i> chart,
1041  * this option is ignored.
1042  * <p>
1043  * See {@link pvc.options.varia.Size} for information about
1044  * the different supported data types.
1045  * 
1046  * @type number|string|pvc.options.varia.Size
1047  * @category Layout
1048  */
1049 pvc.options.charts.BasicChart.prototype.plotSizeMin = undefined;
1050 /**
1051  * The title panel of the root chart.
1052  * <p>
1053  * When a value of type 
1054  * <tt>string</tt> is specified,
1055  * it is the title text.
1056  * 
1057  * @type string|pvc.options.panels.ChartTitlePanel
1058  * @category Panels
1059  */
1060 pvc.options.charts.BasicChart.prototype.title = undefined;
1061 /**
1062  * An array of plots.
1063  * <p>
1064  * Can be specified to configure the options
1065  * of the chart's internal plots
1066  * (like 
1067  * <i>main</i> and 
1068  * <i>plot2</i> and 
1069  * <i>trend</i>, when supported by the chart type),
1070  * or to 
1071  * <b>define and configure extra plots</b>,
1072  * of compatible types.
1073  * <p>
1074  * The types of plots that can be used together in a chart depend on:
1075  * 
1076  * <ul>
1077  * 
1078  * <li>each plot's chart base class requirement, and</li>
1079  * 
1080  * <li>further axes compatibility requirements;
1081  * the visual roles being encoded by an axis must be compatible:
1082  * they must have the same value type (number, date, or discrete) and,
1083  * for discrete visual roles, they must also
1084  * be bound to the same dimension list.
1085  * </li>
1086  * </ul>
1087  * <p>
1088  * For additional information, specific of each chart type,
1089  * see its documentation for property 
1090  * <i>plots</i>.
1091  * 
1092  * @type list(pvc.options.plots.Plot)
1093  * @category Plots
1094  */
1095 pvc.options.charts.BasicChart.prototype.plots = undefined;
1096 /**
1097  * @class
1098  */
1099 pvc.options.ext.BasicChartExtensionPoints = function(){};
1100         
1101         
1102         
1103         
1104 /**
1105  * The extension point of the base (root) panel of the 
1106  * <i>root</i> chart.
1107  * 
1108  * @type pvc.options.marks.PanelExtensionPoint
1109  */
1110 pvc.options.ext.BasicChartExtensionPoints.prototype.base = undefined;
1111 /**
1112  * 
1113  * The extension point of the plot panel of the charts.
1114  * <p>
1115  * The plot panel is a child of the content panel.
1116  * 
1117  * @deprecated Use the extension point {@link #plot} instead.
1118  * @type pvc.options.marks.PanelExtensionPoint
1119  */
1120 pvc.options.ext.BasicChartExtensionPoints.prototype.chart = undefined;
1121 /**
1122  * The extension point of the content panel of the 
1123  * <i>root</i> chart.
1124  * <p>
1125  * The content panel is a child of the base panel.
1126  * 
1127  * @type pvc.options.marks.PanelExtensionPoint
1128  */
1129 pvc.options.ext.BasicChartExtensionPoints.prototype.content = undefined;
1130 /**
1131  * The extension point of the plot panel of the charts.
1132  * <p>
1133  * The plot panel is a child of the content panel.
1134  * <p>
1135  * The root of a small multiples chart does not have a plot panel.
1136  * 
1137  * @type pvc.options.marks.PanelExtensionPoint
1138  */
1139 pvc.options.ext.BasicChartExtensionPoints.prototype.plot = undefined;
1140 /**
1141  * The namespace of CCC visualRoles options classes.
1142  * 
1143  * @namespace
1144  */
1145 pvc.options.visualRoles = {};
1146 
1147 /**
1148  * The visual roles options base class.
1149  * 
1150  * @class
1151  * @abstract
1152  */
1153 pvc.options.visualRoles.VisualRoles = function(){};
1154         
1155         
1156         
1157         
1158 /**
1159  * The chart visual roles options base class.
1160  * 
1161  * @class
1162  * @extends pvc.options.visualRoles.VisualRoles
1163  */
1164 pvc.options.visualRoles.BasicChartVisualRoles = function(){};
1165         
1166         
1167         
1168         
1169 /**
1170  * The 
1171  * <tt>dataPart</tt> visual role is a chart-level visual role that
1172  * allows partitioning of the data into several datum subsets.
1173  * <p>
1174  * Plots may then specify the data part value which they represent.
1175  * <p>
1176  * The 
1177  * <tt>dataPart</tt> visual role
1178  * can be bound to a single dimension
1179  * that is, or is turned into, discrete.
1180  * <p>
1181  * The 
1182  * <tt>dataPart</tt> visual role automatically binds to
1183  * a dimension whose name has the 
1184  * <tt>dataPart</tt> prefix.
1185  * <p>
1186  * See {@link pvc.options.VisualRole}
1187  * for more information on supported data types.
1188  * <p>
1189  * See {@link pvc.options.plots.Plot#dataPart}
1190  * for more information on default values used by different plots.
1191  * 
1192  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
1193  * @category Chart > Visual Roles
1194  */
1195 pvc.options.visualRoles.BasicChartVisualRoles.prototype.dataPart = undefined;
1196 /**
1197  * The common options documentation class of all plots.
1198  * 
1199  * @class
1200  * @abstract
1201  */
1202 pvc.options.plots.BasicPlot = function(){};
1203         
1204         
1205         
1206         
1207 /**
1208  * The plot's visual roles map.
1209  * <p>
1210  * Can be used, in code, to configure the visual roles of the plot.
1211  * <p>
1212  * If this is the main plot of a chart,
1213  * its visual roles can also be configured directly at the chart level,
1214  * either in the direct visual roles properties -
1215  * named after the visual role's name followed by the word 
1216  * <tt>Role</tt> -
1217  * or, in code, in the chart's visual roles map, {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart#visualRoles}.
1218  * <p>
1219  * The visual role name is the map's key,
1220  * and the value, its options.
1221  * 
1222  * @type map(string : pvc.options.VisualRole)|pvc.options.visualRoles.BasicPlotVisualRoles
1223  * @category Visual Roles
1224  */
1225 pvc.options.plots.BasicPlot.prototype.visualRoles = undefined;
1226 /**
1227  * The visual roles options class of all plot types.
1228  * 
1229  * @class
1230  * @extends pvc.options.visualRoles.VisualRoles
1231  */
1232 pvc.options.visualRoles.BasicPlotVisualRoles = function(){};
1233         
1234         
1235         
1236         
1237 /**
1238  * The common options documentation class of (almost) all charts.
1239  * <p>
1240  * For information on the supported 
1241  * <b>data formats</b>
1242  * see {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart}.
1243  * 
1244  * @class
1245  * @extends pvc.options.charts.BasicChart
1246  * @abstract
1247  */
1248 pvc.options.charts.Chart = function(){};
1249         
1250         
1251         
1252         
1253 /**
1254  * The first color axis options.
1255  * <p>
1256  * This axis can also be accessed by the property name 
1257  * <tt>color</tt>.
1258  * <p>
1259  * See {@link pvc.options.axes.ColorAxis}
1260  * for more information on the way that
1261  * the color axes' properties may be accessed.
1262  * 
1263  * @type pvc.options.axes.ColorAxis
1264  * @category Axes
1265  */
1266 pvc.options.charts.Chart.prototype.color = undefined;
1267 /**
1268  * The extension points object contains style definitions for
1269  * the marks of the chart.
1270  * 
1271  * @type pvc.options.ext.ChartExtensionPoints
1272  * @category Chart
1273  */
1274 pvc.options.charts.Chart.prototype.extensionPoints = undefined;
1275 /**
1276  * Indicates if the layout should be preserved between renders.
1277  * 
1278  * @type boolean
1279  * @default false
1280  * @category Chart
1281  */
1282 pvc.options.charts.Chart.prototype.preserveLayout = undefined;
1283 /**
1284  * A callback function that is called
1285  * when the user double-clicks on a visual element.
1286  * 
1287  * @returns {undefined}
1288  * @method
1289  * @this pvc.visual.Context
1290  * @param {pvc.visual.Scene} scene
1291  * The scene associated with the visual item.
1292  * 
1293  * @category Chart > Actions
1294  */
1295 pvc.options.charts.Chart.prototype.doubleClickAction = function(){};
1296 /**
1297  * A callback function that is called
1298  * when, after selection has changed,
1299  * the chart is updated to reflect the change.
1300  * 
1301  * @returns {undefined}
1302  * @method
1303  * @this pvc.visual.Context
1304  * @param {list(pvc.data.Datum)} selectedDatums
1305  * An array with the resulting selected datums.
1306  * 
1307  * @param {list(pvc.data.Datum)} selectedChangedDatums
1308  * An array with the datums whose selected state has changed since
1309  * the last time that the action was handled.
1310  * 
1311  * @category Chart > Actions
1312  */
1313 pvc.options.charts.Chart.prototype.selectionChangedAction = function(){};
1314 /**
1315  * A callback function that is called
1316  * when the user performs a selection,
1317  * but before the corresponding datums' selected state is actually changed.
1318  * <p>
1319  * This function is usefull to restrict, amplify, or normalize the selection.
1320  * 
1321  * @returns {list(pvc.data.Datum)}
1322  * The datums that should be actually selected.
1323  * 
1324  * @method
1325  * @this pvc.visual.Context
1326  * @param {list(pvc.data.Datum)} selectingDatums
1327  * An array with the datums that will be selected by the current operation.
1328  * 
1329  * @category Chart > Actions
1330  */
1331 pvc.options.charts.Chart.prototype.userSelectionAction = function(){};
1332 /**
1333  * A function used to format 
1334  * <i>non-null</i> 
1335  * <i>numeric</i> values as percentages.
1336  * <p>
1337  * When this property is specified,
1338  * it sets also the
1339  * {@link pvc.options.format.FormatProvider#percent} format of the chart's format provider,
1340  * {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart#format}.
1341  * Consequently, its value is inherited by the numeric dimension types'
1342  * {@link pvc.options.DimensionType#format}.
1343  * <p>
1344  * Conversely, if the chart's format provider
1345  * {@link pvc.options.format.FormatProvider#percent} format is specified,
1346  * its value sets this property, {@link pvc.options.charts.Chart#percentValueFormat}.
1347  * <p>
1348  * When both are specified, the one in the chart's format provider has precedence.
1349  * 
1350  * @returns {string!}
1351  * The number formatted as a non-empty string.
1352  * 
1353  * @method
1354  * @this null
1355  * @param {number!} value
1356  * The non-null number to format.
1357  * 
1358  * @category Chart > Data
1359  */
1360 pvc.options.charts.Chart.prototype.percentValueFormat = function(){};
1361 /**
1362  * Indicates the existence of the sliding window.
1363  * 
1364  * @type boolean|pvc.options.SlidingWindow
1365  * @default false
1366  * @category Chart > Data
1367  */
1368 pvc.options.charts.Chart.prototype.slidingWindow = undefined;
1369 /**
1370  * Indicates that dimensions whose
1371  * name is "category1", "category2", etc,
1372  * have a 
1373  * <tt>Date</tt> value type,
1374  * by default.
1375  * <p>
1376  * This option has no effect on other dimensions,
1377  * even if bound to a "category" visual role.
1378  * In those cases,
1379  * explicitly define the dimension with
1380  * the 
1381  * <tt>Date</tt> value type.
1382  * <p>
1383  * Dimensions are considered continuous, by default,
1384  * when they have a continuous value type.
1385  * However,
1386  * not all visual roles support continuous dimensions.
1387  * In those cases,
1388  * the dimension is treated as a discrete dimension,
1389  * event though it has a continuous value type.
1390  * 
1391  * @type boolean
1392  * @default false
1393  * @category Chart > Data
1394  */
1395 pvc.options.charts.Chart.prototype.timeSeries = undefined;
1396 /**
1397  * The format string used to 
1398  * <i>parse</i>
1399  * dimensions of the 
1400  * <tt>Date</tt> value type,
1401  * by default.
1402  * <p>
1403  * The syntax of the format string is that of
1404  * 
1405  * <i>protovis</i>' date formats.
1406  * <p>
1407  * This property changes the default of the
1408  * {@link pvc.options.DimensionType#rawFormat}
1409  * property,
1410  * for dimensions with a 
1411  * <tt>Date</tt> value type.
1412  * 
1413  * @type string
1414  * @default '%Y-%m-%d'
1415  * @category Chart > Data
1416  */
1417 pvc.options.charts.Chart.prototype.timeSeriesFormat = undefined;
1418 /**
1419  * Indicates if a chart should show an entry animation,
1420  * every time it is fully rendered.
1421  * Most charts perform some sort of entry animation
1422  * of its main visual elements.
1423  * <p>
1424  * When a chart is rendered explicitly,
1425  * through its 
1426  * <tt>render</tt> method,
1427  * it is possible to control whether the entry animation
1428  * is performed or not.
1429  * <p>
1430  * This option is only taken into account when {@link #interactive} is 
1431  * <tt>true</tt>.
1432  * 
1433  * @type boolean
1434  * @default true
1435  * @category Chart > Interaction
1436  */
1437 pvc.options.charts.Chart.prototype.animate = undefined;
1438 /**
1439  * Controls if and how the selection can be cleared by the user.
1440  * <p>
1441  * This option applies even if {@link #selectable} is 
1442  * <tt>false</tt>.
1443  * This supports scenarios where
1444  * a custom selection implementation controls what can get selected,
1445  * but in which clearing selection is decided by the user, in the default way.
1446  * <p>
1447  * This option is only taken into account when {@link #interactive} is 
1448  * <tt>true</tt>.
1449  * 
1450  * @type pvc.options.varia.ChartClearSelectionMode
1451  * @default 'emptySpaceClick'
1452  * @category Chart > Interaction
1453  */
1454 pvc.options.charts.Chart.prototype.clearSelectionMode = undefined;
1455 /**
1456  * When 
1457  * <tt>true</tt>,
1458  * indicates that a selection made by the user
1459  * replaces the current selection, if any.
1460  * <p>
1461  * For the selection to be additive,
1462  * the 
1463  * <kbd>ctrl</kbd> key (or 
1464  * <kbd>cmd</kbd> in Mac) must be pressed,
1465  * by the end of the operation.
1466  * <p>
1467  * When 
1468  * <tt>false</tt>,
1469  * indicates that any selection made by the user is additive.
1470  * The 
1471  * <kbd>ctrl</kbd> or 
1472  * <kbd>cmd</kbd> keys have no effect.
1473  * 
1474  * @type boolean
1475  * @default true
1476  * @category Chart > Interaction
1477  */
1478 pvc.options.charts.Chart.prototype.ctrlSelectMode = undefined;
1479 /**
1480  * The maximum number of milliseconds,
1481  * between two consecutive clicks,
1482  * for them to be considered a double-click.
1483  * 
1484  * @type number
1485  * @default 300
1486  * @category Chart > Interaction
1487  */
1488 pvc.options.charts.Chart.prototype.doubleClickMaxDelay = undefined;
1489 /**
1490  * Indicates if the chart's visual elements
1491  * are automatically highlighted
1492  * when the user hovers over them with the mouse.
1493  * <p>
1494  * This option is only taken into account when {@link #interactive} is 
1495  * <tt>true</tt>.
1496  * 
1497  * @type boolean
1498  * @default false
1499  * @category Chart > Interaction
1500  */
1501 pvc.options.charts.Chart.prototype.hoverable = undefined;
1502 /**
1503  * Indicates if chart interaction is enabled.
1504  * <p>
1505  * Chart interaction is any of the following kinds of interaction:
1506  * animation,
1507  * on-hover highlighting,
1508  * tooltips,
1509  * selection,
1510  * clicking and double-clicking.
1511  * <p>
1512  * When 
1513  * <tt>false</tt>, all kinds of interaction are disabled.
1514  * The options controlling specific interaction types are ignored:
1515  * {@link #animate},
1516  * {@link #hoverable},
1517  * {@link pvc.options.Tooltip#enabled},
1518  * {@link #selectable},
1519  * {@link pvc.options.charts.Chart#clearSelectionMode} and
1520  * {@link #clickable}.
1521  * <p>
1522  * When 
1523  * <tt>true</tt> all kinds of interaction may be enabled,
1524  * that being controlled by its own control option.
1525  * <p>
1526  * When printing, with CGG, {@link #interactive} is always 
1527  * <tt>false</tt>,
1528  * independently of the specified value.
1529  * <p>
1530  * When not printing, the default value of this option is 
1531  * <tt>true</tt>.
1532  * 
1533  * @type boolean
1534  * @category Chart > Interaction
1535  */
1536 pvc.options.charts.Chart.prototype.interactive = undefined;
1537 /**
1538  * Contains options related to the way the pointing events are handled (ex: over, out).
1539  * 
1540  * @type pvc.options.Pointing
1541  * @category Chart > Interaction
1542  */
1543 pvc.options.charts.Chart.prototype.pointing = undefined;
1544 /**
1545  * The pointing mode used by the chart.
1546  * 
1547  * @type pvc.options.varia.PointingMode
1548  * @default 'near'
1549  * @category Chart > Interaction
1550  */
1551 pvc.options.charts.Chart.prototype.pointingMode = undefined;
1552 /**
1553  * Indicates if the chart's visual elements
1554  * can be selected by the user,
1555  * by clicking on them
1556  * or using the rubber-band.
1557  * <p>
1558  * This option is only taken into account when {@link #interactive} is 
1559  * <tt>true</tt>.
1560  * 
1561  * @type boolean
1562  * @default false
1563  * @category Chart > Interaction
1564  */
1565 pvc.options.charts.Chart.prototype.selectable = undefined;
1566 /**
1567  * The legend panel of the root chart.
1568  * <p>
1569  * When a value of type 
1570  * <tt>boolean</tt> is specified,
1571  * it indicates the visibility of the legend.
1572  * 
1573  * @type boolean|pvc.options.panels.LegendPanel
1574  * @default false
1575  * @category Panels
1576  */
1577 pvc.options.charts.Chart.prototype.legend = undefined;
1578 /**
1579  * The extension points common to (almost) all chart types.
1580  * <p>
1581  * Chart extension points can also be specified directly at the chart options level.
1582  * <p>
1583  * To use an extension point you must find its full name, by joining:
1584  * 
1585  * <ol>
1586  * 
1587  * <li>extension property (ex: 
1588  * <tt>base</tt>)</li>
1589  * 
1590  * <li>the "_" character</li>
1591  * 
1592  * <li>extension sub-property (ex: 
1593  * <tt>strokeStyle</tt>)</li>
1594  * </ol>
1595  * and obtaining, for the examples, the camel-cased name: 
1596  * <tt>base_strokeStyle</tt>
1597  * (see {@link http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CamelCase}).
1598  * 
1599  * @class
1600  * @extends pvc.options.ext.BasicChartExtensionPoints
1601  */
1602 pvc.options.ext.ChartExtensionPoints = function(){};
1603         
1604         
1605         
1606         
1607 /**
1608  * The extension point of a generic error label.
1609  * 
1610  * <p>
1611  * Use 
1612  * <tt>errorMessage_text</tt> to change the message
1613  * that is shown when the chart is provided with
1614  * no data or empty data.
1615  * </p>
1616  * 
1617  * <p>
1618  * Set 
1619  * <tt>errorMessage_visible</tt> to 
1620  * <tt>false</tt>
1621  * to hide the error message and not render the chart in such a case.
1622  * Rendering errors are made available through 
1623  * <tt>chart.getLastRenderError()</tt>.
1624  * </p>
1625  * 
1626  * @type pvc.options.marks.LabelExtensionPoint
1627  */
1628 pvc.options.ext.ChartExtensionPoints.prototype.errorMessage = undefined;
1629 /**
1630  * The extension point of the "invalid data" label.
1631  * 
1632  * <p>
1633  * Data is invalid when it does not satisfy the requirements
1634  * of a visualization.
1635  * For example, the Pie, Sunburst and Treemap charts require
1636  * that the sum of the absolute values be positive (zero excluded).
1637  * </p>
1638  * 
1639  * <p>
1640  * Use 
1641  * <tt>invalidDataMessage_text</tt> to change the message
1642  * that is shown when a chart is provided with
1643  * invalid data.
1644  * </p>
1645  * 
1646  * <p>
1647  * Set 
1648  * <tt>invalidDataMessage_visible</tt> to 
1649  * <tt>false</tt>
1650  * to hide the error message and not render the chart in such a case.
1651  * Rendering errors are made available through 
1652  * <tt>chart.getLastRenderError()</tt>.
1653  * </p>
1654  * 
1655  * @type pvc.options.marks.LabelExtensionPoint
1656  */
1657 pvc.options.ext.ChartExtensionPoints.prototype.invalidDataMessage = undefined;
1658 /**
1659  * The extension point of the "no data" label.
1660  * 
1661  * <p>
1662  * Use 
1663  * <tt>noDataMessage_text</tt> to change the message
1664  * that is shown when the chart is provided with
1665  * no data or empty data.
1666  * </p>
1667  * 
1668  * <p>
1669  * Set 
1670  * <tt>noDataMessage_visible</tt> to 
1671  * <tt>false</tt>
1672  * to hide the error message and not render the chart in such a case.
1673  * Rendering errors are made available through 
1674  * <tt>chart.getLastRenderError()</tt>.
1675  * </p>
1676  * 
1677  * @type pvc.options.marks.LabelExtensionPoint
1678  */
1679 pvc.options.ext.ChartExtensionPoints.prototype.noDataMessage = undefined;
1680 /**
1681  * The extension point of the selection rubber-band.
1682  * 
1683  * @type pvc.options.marks.BarExtensionPoint
1684  */
1685 pvc.options.ext.ChartExtensionPoints.prototype.rubberBand = undefined;
1686 /**
1687  * The common options documentation class of (almost) all plots.
1688  * 
1689  * @class
1690  * @extends pvc.options.plots.BasicPlot
1691  * @abstract
1692  */
1693 pvc.options.plots.Plot = function(){};
1694         
1695         
1696         
1697         
1698 /**
1699  * The index of the color axis to use for the plot.
1700  * <p>
1701  * The possible values are 
1702  * <tt>1</tt>, 
1703  * <tt>2</tt> and 
1704  * <tt>3</tt>.
1705  * <p>
1706  * The default value depends on the plot.
1707  * The main plot of a chart always uses the axis 
1708  * <tt>1</tt>.
1709  * The 
1710  * <tt>plot2</tt> plot uses the axis 
1711  * <tt>2</tt>, by default.
1712  * The 
1713  * <tt>trend</tt> plot uses the axis 
1714  * <tt>3</tt>, by default.
1715  * 
1716  * @type number
1717  * @category Axes
1718  */
1719 pvc.options.plots.Plot.prototype.colorAxis = undefined;
1720 /**
1721  * The data part value of the subset of data that the plot consumes.
1722  * <p>
1723  * This option can only be used in code,
1724  * from within {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart#plots}.
1725  * <p>
1726  * By default, for internal plots,
1727  * like 
1728  * <i>main</i> and 
1729  * <i>plot2</i>,
1730  * data is partitioned into two data parts,
1731  * 
1732  * <tt>"0"</tt> and 
1733  * <tt>"1"</tt>,
1734  * respectively,
1735  * according to the chart's
1736  * 
1737  * <tt>plot2Series</tt>, or 
1738  * <tt>plot2SeriesIndexes</tt>, options
1739  * (depending on the chart type,
1740  * {@link pvc.options.charts.BarChart#plot2Series}, or
1741  * {@link pvc.options.charts.PointChart#plot2Series}).
1742  * <p>
1743  * The internal 
1744  * <i>trend</i> plot, by default, represents the data part value 
1745  * <tt>"trend"</tt>.
1746  * <p>
1747  * For external plots, the default data part value is 
1748  * <tt>"0"</tt>.
1749  * <p>
1750  * See {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart#dataPartRole} for more information.
1751  * 
1752  * @type string
1753  * @category Data
1754  */
1755 pvc.options.plots.Plot.prototype.dataPart = undefined;
1756 /**
1757  * The name of the plot being defined or configured.
1758  * <p>
1759  * This option can only be used in code,
1760  * from within {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart#plots}.
1761  * <p>
1762  * To configure an internal plot, its reserved name is specified:
1763  * 
1764  * <dl>
1765  * 
1766  * <dt>
1767  * <i>main</i></dt>
1768  * 
1769  * <dd>the main plot of a chart; for example, a bar chart has a main plot of type 
1770  * <tt>bar</tt></dd>
1771  * 
1772  * <dt>
1773  * <i>plot2</i></dt>
1774  * 
1775  * <dd>the special second plot;
1776  * this is the plot that, in applicable chart types,
1777  * is activated when the option 
1778  * <i>plot2</i> is 
1779  * <tt>true</tt>;
1780  * configuring the second plot this way implicitly activates it,
1781  * and the value of option 
1782  * <i>plot2</i> is ignored.
1783  * </dd>
1784  * 
1785  * <dt>
1786  * <i>trend</i></dt>
1787  * 
1788  * <dd>the special trend plot;
1789  * this is the plot that, in applicable chart types,
1790  * is activated when other plots specify one of the options 
1791  * <i>trend</i> or 
1792  * <i>trendType</i>.
1793  * </dd>
1794  * </dl>
1795  * <p>
1796  * In this case, if {@link pvc.options.plots.Plot#type} is also specified,
1797  * it must match the plot type of the corresponding internal plot.
1798  * <p>
1799  * To define a new plot, specify a {@link pvc.options.plots.Plot#type}
1800  * and, no name, or one that is not reserved.
1801  * <p>
1802  * The name of a plot cannot have dot (".") character in it.
1803  * 
1804  * @type string
1805  * @category General
1806  */
1807 pvc.options.plots.Plot.prototype.name = undefined;
1808 /**
1809  * The type of the plot being defined or configured.
1810  * <p>
1811  * This option can only be used in code,
1812  * from within {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart#plots}.
1813  * <p>
1814  * The current list of plot types is:
1815  * 
1816  * <dl>
1817  * 
1818  * <dt>bar</dt>
1819  * <dd>bar plot</dd>
1820  * 
1821  * <dt>water</dt>
1822  * <dd>waterfall plot</dd>
1823  * 
1824  * <dt>box</dt>
1825  * <dd>box plot</dd>
1826  * 
1827  * <dt>heatGrid</dt>
1828  * <dd>heat-grid plot</dd>
1829  * 
1830  * <dt>point</dt>
1831  * <dd>point plot (area/line/dot)</dd>
1832  * 
1833  * <dt>scatter</dt>
1834  * <dd>metric point plot (area/line/dot)</dd>
1835  * 
1836  * <dt>pie</dt>
1837  * <dd>pie</dd>
1838  * 
1839  * <dt>sunburst</dt>
1840  * <dd>sunburst</dd>
1841  * 
1842  * <dt>treemap</dt>
1843  * <dd>treemap</dd>
1844  * 
1845  * <dt>bullet</dt>
1846  * <dd>bullet</dd>
1847  * </dl>
1848  * <p>
1849  * See {@link pvc.options.plots.Plot#name} for more information.
1850  * 
1851  * @type string
1852  * @category General
1853  */
1854 pvc.options.plots.Plot.prototype.type = undefined;
1855 /**
1856  * The values mask used to build the text of value labels.
1857  * <p>
1858  * The mask may contain scene variable names and/or scene atom names,
1859  * like in the examples:
1860  * 
1861  * <ul>
1862  * 
1863  * <li>scene variables: 
1864  * <tt>{category}: {value} EUR</tt>, could yield 
1865  * <tt>Drinks: 3.45 EUR</tt></li>
1866  * 
1867  * <li>atom variables:  
1868  * <tt>{#family} - {#product}</tt>, could yield 
1869  * <tt>Plains - Boeing 747</tt></li>
1870  * </ul>
1871  * <p>
1872  * The default value depends on the plot type.
1873  * 
1874  * @type string
1875  * @category Layout
1876  */
1877 pvc.options.plots.Plot.prototype.valuesMask = undefined;
1878 /**
1879  * 
1880  * Indicates if value labels are shown next to the visual elements.
1881  * 
1882  * @deprecated Use {@link #valuesVisible} instead.
1883  * @type boolean
1884  * @default false
1885  * @category Style
1886  */
1887 pvc.options.plots.Plot.prototype.showValues = undefined;
1888 /**
1889  * The point of a visual element onto which the associated value label is anchored to.
1890  * <p>
1891  * The possible values and the default value actually depend on the chart type
1892  * so be sure to access this property's documentation through the
1893  * concrete class' documentation.
1894  * 
1895  * @type pvc.options.varia.MarkAnchor|pvc.options.varia.WedgeAnchor
1896  * @category Style
1897  */
1898 pvc.options.plots.Plot.prototype.valuesAnchor = undefined;
1899 /**
1900  * The font of a value label.
1901  * <p>
1902  * This property can also be specified
1903  * through the "label" extension point of a plot.
1904  * <p>
1905  * In some charts the value label font is
1906  * taken into account for layout purposes.
1907  * 
1908  * @type string
1909  * @default '10px sans-serif'
1910  * @category Style
1911  */
1912 pvc.options.plots.Plot.prototype.valuesFont = undefined;
1913 /**
1914  * Indicates if value labels are shown next to the visual elements.
1915  * <p>
1916  * Most charts have some form of showing labels
1917  * with the 
1918  * <i>main</i> value next to the visual element.
1919  * <p>
1920  * The default value really varies with the chart type,
1921  * so be sure to confirm it in the most specific plot class.
1922  * 
1923  * @type boolean
1924  * @default false
1925  * @category Style
1926  */
1927 pvc.options.plots.Plot.prototype.valuesVisible = undefined;
1928 /**
1929  * The options documentation class of the 
1930  * <b>Pie</b> chart.
1931  * <p>
1932  * For information on the supported 
1933  * <b>data formats</b>
1934  * see {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart}.
1935  * 
1936  * @class
1937  * @extends pvc.options.charts.Chart
1938  */
1939 pvc.options.charts.PieChart = function(){};
1940         
1941         
1942         
1943         
1944 /**
1945  * The maximum number of 
1946  * <i>small</i> charts that should
1947  * be displayed in a row.
1948  * <p>
1949  * This property can receive a value of 
1950  * <tt>Infinity</tt>
1951  * to indicate that all charts should be laid out in a single row.
1952  * 
1953  * @type number
1954  * @default 3
1955  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
1956  */
1957 pvc.options.charts.PieChart.prototype.multiChartColumnsMax = undefined;
1958 /**
1959  * The maximum number of 
1960  * <i>small</i> charts that should
1961  * be displayed.
1962  * <p>
1963  * The first 
1964  * <i>small</i> charts are chosen.
1965  * 
1966  * @type number
1967  * @default Infinity
1968  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
1969  */
1970 pvc.options.charts.PieChart.prototype.multiChartMax = undefined;
1971 /**
1972  * The strategy to follow when the resulting multi-chart layout
1973  * does not fit entirely in the initial chart size.
1974  * 
1975  * @type pvc.options.varia.MultiChartOverflow
1976  * @default 'grow'
1977  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
1978  */
1979 pvc.options.charts.PieChart.prototype.multiChartOverflow = undefined;
1980 /**
1981  * Indicates that,
1982  * when the layout results in a single column
1983  * and the value of {@link #smallHeight}
1984  * is still to be determined,
1985  * it should be set to all the initially available content height,
1986  * instead of determining the height from the
1987  * {@link #smallAspectRatio} and the {@link #smallWidth}.
1988  * 
1989  * @type boolean
1990  * @default true
1991  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
1992  */
1993 pvc.options.charts.PieChart.prototype.multiChartSingleColFillsHeight = undefined;
1994 /**
1995  * Indicates that,
1996  * when the layout results in a single row
1997  * and the value of {@link #smallHeight}
1998  * is still to be determined,
1999  * it should be set to all the initially available content height,
2000  * instead of determining the height from the
2001  * {@link #smallAspectRatio} and the {@link #smallWidth}.
2002  * 
2003  * @type boolean
2004  * @default true
2005  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
2006  */
2007 pvc.options.charts.PieChart.prototype.multiChartSingleRowFillsHeight = undefined;
2008 /**
2009  * The ratio of the width over the height of a 
2010  * <i>small</i> chart.
2011  * <p>
2012  * It is used when the set of properties
2013  * {@link #smallWidth},
2014  * {@link #smallHeight},
2015  * {@link #multiChartColumnsMax},
2016  * {@link #multiChartSingleRowFillsHeight} and
2017  * {@link #multiChartSingleColFillsHeight},
2018  * is under-specified and
2019  * is not enough to determine the value of both
2020  * {@link #smallWidth} and
2021  * {@link #smallHeight}.
2022  * <p>
2023  * The default value of the aspect ratio depends on the chart type,
2024  * but is something around 
2025  * <tt>4/3</tt>.
2026  * 
2027  * @type number
2028  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
2029  */
2030 pvc.options.charts.PieChart.prototype.smallAspectRatio = undefined;
2031 /**
2032  * The margins of the 
2033  * <i>content panel</i> of a 
2034  * <i>small</i> chart.
2035  * <p>
2036  * See {@link pvc.options.varia.Sides} for information about
2037  * the different supported data types.
2038  * 
2039  * @type number|string|pvc.options.varia.Sides
2040  * @default 0
2041  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
2042  */
2043 pvc.options.charts.PieChart.prototype.smallContentMargins = undefined;
2044 /**
2045  * The paddings of the 
2046  * <i>content panel</i> of a 
2047  * <i>small</i> chart.
2048  * <p>
2049  * See {@link pvc.options.varia.Sides} for information about
2050  * the different supported data types.
2051  * 
2052  * @type number|string|pvc.options.varia.Sides
2053  * @default 0
2054  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
2055  */
2056 pvc.options.charts.PieChart.prototype.smallContentPaddings = undefined;
2057 /**
2058  * Fixates the height of each 
2059  * <i>small</i> chart, in pixel units or as a percentage.
2060  * <p>
2061  * A value of type 
2062  * <tt>number</tt>,
2063  * or of type 
2064  * <tt>string</tt>, but with numeric content,
2065  * is interpreted as being in pixel units.
2066  * <p>
2067  * A value of type 
2068  * <tt>string</tt>,
2069  * with numeric content that is suffixed by a "%" character,
2070  * is interpreted as a percentage of the initially available content height.
2071  * <p>
2072  * This property may cause the 
2073  * <i>small multiples</i> chart
2074  * to take up a greater width than the one specified in {@link #height}.
2075  * <p>
2076  * When this property is unspecified,
2077  * its value depends on the evaluation of the
2078  * {@link #smallWidth} property,
2079  * which may impose it a value.
2080  * If after the evaluation of {@link #smallWidth}
2081  * this property remains unspecified,
2082  * it is determined as follows.
2083  * <p>
2084  * If the layout will have a single column
2085  * and the property {@link #multiChartSingleColFillsHeight}
2086  * is 
2087  * <tt>true</tt> (it is by default)
2088  * then the height will be the initially available content height.
2089  * <p>
2090  * If the layout will have a single row
2091  * and the property {@link #multiChartSingleRowFillsHeight}
2092  * is 
2093  * <tt>true</tt> (it is by default)
2094  * then the height will be the initially available content height.
2095  * <p>
2096  * Otherwise, the property {@link #smallAspectRatio} is
2097  * used to determine the height of the small chart from its determined width.
2098  * <p>
2099  * The aspect ratio is defaulted to a value that depends on the chart type,
2100  * but is something around 
2101  * <tt>4/3</tt>.
2102  * 
2103  * @type number|string
2104  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
2105  */
2106 pvc.options.charts.PieChart.prototype.smallHeight = undefined;
2107 /**
2108  * The margins of a 
2109  * <i>small</i> chart.
2110  * <p>
2111  * See {@link pvc.options.varia.Sides} for information about
2112  * the different supported data types.
2113  * 
2114  * @type number|string|pvc.options.varia.Sides
2115  * @default '2%'
2116  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
2117  */
2118 pvc.options.charts.PieChart.prototype.smallMargins = undefined;
2119 /**
2120  * The paddings of a 
2121  * <i>small</i> chart.
2122  * <p>
2123  * See {@link pvc.options.varia.Sides} for information about
2124  * the different supported data types.
2125  * 
2126  * @type number|string|pvc.options.varia.Sides
2127  * @default 0
2128  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
2129  */
2130 pvc.options.charts.PieChart.prototype.smallPaddings = undefined;
2131 /**
2132  * Fixates the width of each 
2133  * <i>small</i> chart, in pixel units or as a percentage.
2134  * <p>
2135  * A value of type 
2136  * <tt>number</tt>,
2137  * or of type 
2138  * <tt>string</tt>, but with numeric content,
2139  * is interpreted as being in pixel units.
2140  * <p>
2141  * A value of type 
2142  * <tt>string</tt>,
2143  * with numeric content that is suffixed by a "%" character,
2144  * is interpreted as a percentage of the initially available content width.
2145  * <p>
2146  * This property may cause the 
2147  * <i>small multiples</i> chart
2148  * to take up a greater width than the one specified in {@link #width}.
2149  * <p>
2150  * When this property is unspecified,
2151  * a specified finite value, or a defaulted value, of the property {@link #multiChartColumnsMax} is
2152  * used to determine it:
2153  * by dividing the initially available content width
2154  * by the maximum number of charts in a row that 
2155  * <i>actually</i> occur
2156  * (so that if there are less small charts than
2157  * the maximum that can be placed in a row,
2158  * these, nevertheless, take up the whole width).
2159  * <p>
2160  * When an infinite value is specified for
2161  * {@link #multiChartColumnsMax},
2162  * the small charts are laid out in a single row,
2163  * and so the width is calculated from the height {@link #smallHeight},
2164  * using the aspect ratio {@link #smallAspectRatio}.
2165  * The height is defaulted to the initially available content height.
2166  * The aspect ratio is defaulted to a value that depends on the chart type,
2167  * but is something around 
2168  * <tt>4/3</tt>.
2169  * The width is then calculated.
2170  * 
2171  * @type number|string
2172  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
2173  */
2174 pvc.options.charts.PieChart.prototype.smallWidth = undefined;
2175 /**
2176  * The indexes of columns of the 
2177  * <i>logical table</i> that are to feed the
2178  * default
2179  * 
2180  * <tt>multiChart</tt>,
2181  * 
2182  * <tt>multiChart2</tt>, ...
2183  * dimensions.
2184  * <p>
2185  * See {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart#readers} for related information.
2186  * 
2187  * @type number|string|list(number|string)
2188  * @category Chart > Data Source
2189  */
2190 pvc.options.charts.PieChart.prototype.multiChartIndexes = undefined;
2191 /**
2192  * The 
2193  * <tt>multiChart</tt> visual role is a chart-level visual role that
2194  * allows turning a chart into a 
2195  * <i>small multiples</i> chart,
2196  * {@link http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Small_multiple}.
2197  * <p>
2198  * Almost all main chart types support being shown
2199  * as a small multiples chart.
2200  * Currently, the exceptions are the charts:
2201  * 
2202  * <i>Heat Grid</i>,
2203  * 
2204  * <i>Bullet</i>,
2205  * 
2206  * <i>Data Tree</i> and
2207  * 
2208  * <i>Parallel Coordinates</i>.
2209  * <p>
2210  * The 
2211  * <tt>multiChart</tt> visual role
2212  * can be bound to any number of dimensions,
2213  * that are, or will be turned into, discrete.
2214  * <p>
2215  * The 
2216  * <tt>multiChart</tt> visual role automatically binds to
2217  * every dimension whose name has the 
2218  * <tt>multiChart</tt> prefix.
2219  * <p>
2220  * One 
2221  * <i>small</i> chart is generated per
2222  * unique combination of the values of the bound dimensions
2223  * that is present in the source data.
2224  * Each small chart then receives as its data
2225  * the partition of the source data that shares its
2226  * unique combination of values.
2227  * <p>
2228  * See {@link pvc.options.VisualRole}
2229  * for more information on supported data types.
2230  * 
2231  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
2232  * @category Chart > Visual Roles
2233  */
2234 pvc.options.charts.PieChart.prototype.multiChartRole = undefined;
2235 /**
2236  * The title panel of the 
2237  * <i>small</i> chart.
2238  * <p>
2239  * The text of the title of small charts is the
2240  * compound label of the data bound to the 
2241  * <tt>multiChart</tt> visual role.
2242  * 
2243  * @type pvc.options.panels.ChartTitlePanel
2244  * @category Panels - Multi
2245  */
2246 pvc.options.charts.PieChart.prototype.smallTitle = undefined;
2247 /**
2248  * The first color axis options.
2249  * <p>
2250  * This axis can also be accessed by the property name 
2251  * <tt>color</tt>.
2252  * <p>
2253  * See {@link pvc.options.axes.ColorAxis}
2254  * for more information on the way that
2255  * the color axes' properties may be accessed.
2256  * 
2257  * @type pvc.options.axes.DiscreteColorAxis
2258  * @category Axes
2259  */
2260 pvc.options.charts.PieChart.prototype.color = undefined;
2261 /**
2262  * The extension points object contains style definitions for
2263  * the marks of the plot.
2264  * 
2265  * @type pvc.options.ext.PieChartExtensionPoints
2266  * @category Chart
2267  */
2268 pvc.options.charts.PieChart.prototype.extensionPoints = undefined;
2269 /**
2270  * 
2271  * The percentage size of the plot area that is
2272  * occupied by the pie.
2273  * <p>
2274  * An equivalent content paddings may be specified as:
2275  * ((1 - innerGap) * 100 / 2 ) + "%";
2276  * 
2277  * @deprecated 
2278  * Use {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart#contentPaddings} instead.
2279  * 
2280  * @type number
2281  * @category Chart > Layout
2282  */
2283 pvc.options.charts.PieChart.prototype.innerGap = undefined;
2284 /**
2285  * This chart type does not represent orientation.
2286  * 
2287  * @type pvc.options.varia.ChartOrientation
2288  * @category Chart > Layout
2289  * @constant
2290  */
2291 pvc.options.charts.PieChart.prototype.orientation = 'vertical';
2292 /**
2293  * The 
2294  * <tt>category</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
2295  * represents the grouping of data by slices of the pie.
2296  * <p>
2297  * This is a shortcut property for the main plot's
2298  * {@link pvc.options.visualRoles.PiePlotVisualRoles#category}.
2299  * 
2300  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
2301  * @category Chart > Visual Roles
2302  */
2303 pvc.options.charts.PieChart.prototype.categoryRole = undefined;
2304 /**
2305  * The 
2306  * <tt>color</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
2307  * is visually encoded by the fill color of each pie slice.
2308  * <p>
2309  * This is a shortcut property for the main plot's
2310  * {@link pvc.options.visualRoles.PiePlotVisualRoles#category}.
2311  * 
2312  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
2313  * @category Chart > Visual Roles
2314  */
2315 pvc.options.charts.PieChart.prototype.colorRole = undefined;
2316 /**
2317  * The 
2318  * <tt>value</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
2319  * represents the main measure under analysis,
2320  * and is visually encoded by the
2321  * relative angle span of each pie slice.
2322  * <p>
2323  * This is a shortcut property for the main plot's
2324  * {@link pvc.options.visualRoles.PiePlotVisualRoles#category}.
2325  * 
2326  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
2327  * @category Chart > Visual Roles
2328  */
2329 pvc.options.charts.PieChart.prototype.valueRole = undefined;
2330 /**
2331  * The chart's visual roles map.
2332  * <p>
2333  * See {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart#visualRoles} for more information.
2334  * 
2335  * @type map(string : pvc.options.VisualRole)|pvc.options.visualRoles.PieChartVisualRoles
2336  * @category Chart > Visual Roles
2337  */
2338 pvc.options.charts.PieChart.prototype.visualRoles = undefined;
2339 /**
2340  * The pie plot is the 
2341  * <b>main plot</b> of the pie chart,
2342  * which means that
2343  * its properties may be used 
2344  * <i>without</i> the "pie" property suffix.
2345  * 
2346  * @type pvc.options.plots.PiePlot
2347  * @category Plots
2348  */
2349 pvc.options.charts.PieChart.prototype.pie = undefined;
2350 /**
2351  * The extension points of the pie chart type.
2352  * <p>
2353  * Chart extension points can also be specified directly at the chart options level.
2354  * <p>
2355  * To use an extension point you must find its full name, by joining:
2356  * 
2357  * <ol>
2358  * 
2359  * <li>extension property (ex: 
2360  * <tt>smallBase</tt>)</li>
2361  * 
2362  * <li>the "_" character</li>
2363  * 
2364  * <li>extension sub-property (ex:
