2365  * <tt>strokeStyle</tt>)</li>
2366  * </ol>
2367  * and obtaining, for the examples, the camel-cased name: 
2368  * <tt>smallBase_strokeStyle</tt>
2369  * (see {@link http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CamelCase}).
2370  * 
2371  * @class
2372  * @extends pvc.options.ext.ChartExtensionPoints
2373  */
2374 pvc.options.ext.PieChartExtensionPoints = function(){};
2375         
2376         
2377         
2378         
2379 /**
2380  * The extension point of the multi-chart overflow/clip marker.
2381  * 
2382  * @type pvc.options.marks.DotExtensionPoint
2383  * @category Chart - Multi
2384  */
2385 pvc.options.ext.PieChartExtensionPoints.prototype.multiChartOverflowMarker = undefined;
2386 /**
2387  * The extension point of the base (root) panel of the 
2388  * <i>small</i> charts.
2389  * 
2390  * @type pvc.options.marks.PanelExtensionPoint
2391  * @category Chart - Multi
2392  */
2393 pvc.options.ext.PieChartExtensionPoints.prototype.smallBase = undefined;
2394 /**
2395  * The extension point of the content panel of the 
2396  * <i>small</i> charts.
2397  * <p>
2398  * The content panel is a child of the base panel.
2399  * 
2400  * @type pvc.options.marks.PanelExtensionPoint
2401  * @category Chart - Multi
2402  */
2403 pvc.options.ext.PieChartExtensionPoints.prototype.smallContent = undefined;
2404 /**
2405  * The visual roles options class of the pie chart type.
2406  * 
2407  * @class
2408  * @extends pvc.options.visualRoles.BasicChartVisualRoles
2409  */
2410 pvc.options.visualRoles.PieChartVisualRoles = function(){};
2411         
2412         
2413         
2414         
2415 /**
2416  * The 
2417  * <tt>multiChart</tt> visual role is a chart-level visual role that
2418  * allows turning a chart into a 
2419  * <i>small multiples</i> chart,
2420  * {@link http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Small_multiple}.
2421  * <p>
2422  * Almost all main chart types support being shown
2423  * as a small multiples chart.
2424  * Currently, the exceptions are the charts:
2425  * 
2426  * <i>Heat Grid</i>,
2427  * 
2428  * <i>Bullet</i>,
2429  * 
2430  * <i>Data Tree</i> and
2431  * 
2432  * <i>Parallel Coordinates</i>.
2433  * <p>
2434  * The 
2435  * <tt>multiChart</tt> visual role
2436  * can be bound to any number of dimensions,
2437  * that are, or will be turned into, discrete.
2438  * <p>
2439  * The 
2440  * <tt>multiChart</tt> visual role automatically binds to
2441  * every dimension whose name has the 
2442  * <tt>multiChart</tt> prefix.
2443  * <p>
2444  * One 
2445  * <i>small</i> chart is generated per
2446  * unique combination of the values of the bound dimensions
2447  * that is present in the source data.
2448  * Each small chart then receives as its data
2449  * the partition of the source data that shares its
2450  * unique combination of values.
2451  * <p>
2452  * See {@link pvc.options.VisualRole}
2453  * for more information on supported data types.
2454  * 
2455  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
2456  * @category Chart > Visual Roles
2457  */
2458 pvc.options.visualRoles.PieChartVisualRoles.prototype.multiChart = undefined;
2459 /**
2460  * The options documentation class of the 
2461  * <b>Pie</b> plot.
2462  * 
2463  * @class
2464  * @extends pvc.options.plots.Plot
2465  */
2466 pvc.options.plots.PiePlot = function(){};
2467         
2468         
2469         
2470         
2471 /**
2472  * The index of the color axis to use for the plot.
2473  * 
2474  * @type number
2475  * @category Axes
2476  * @constant
2477  */
2478 pvc.options.plots.PiePlot.prototype.colorAxis = 1;
2479 /**
2480  * Increment radius of an 
2481  * <i>active</i> slice,
2482  * in pixel units or as a percentage.
2483  * <p>
2484  * When the value is a string,
2485  * and if it is suffixed with "%",
2486  * it represents a percentage of the
2487  * biggest radius that can fit in the client area of the plot.
2488  * <p>
2489  * This property is only relevant if
2490  * {@link pvc.options.charts.Chart#hoverable} is 
2491  * <tt>true</tt>.
2492  * <p>
2493  * The 
2494  * <i>normal</i> radius is
2495  * the biggest radius that can fit in the client area of the plot
2496  * minus the space occupied by linked labels,
2497  * minus the resolved active radius and
2498  * minus the resolved exploded radius.
2499  * <p>
2500  * See {@link #explodedSliceRadius}.
2501  * 
2502  * @type number|string
2503  * @default '5%'
2504  * @category Layout
2505  */
2506 pvc.options.plots.PiePlot.prototype.activeSliceRadius = undefined;
2507 /**
2508  * The index of the exploded slice,
2509  * or 
2510  * <tt>null</tt>,
2511  * for all slices to be exploded.
2512  * <p>
2513  * The exploded slice or slices
2514  * are shown exploded
2515  * only when {@link #explodedSliceRadius}
2516  * is greater than 
2517  * <tt>0</tt>.
2518  * 
2519  * @type number
2520  * @default null
2521  * @category Layout
2522  */
2523 pvc.options.plots.PiePlot.prototype.explodedSliceIndex = undefined;
2524 /**
2525  * Increment radius of an 
2526  * <i>exploded</i> slice,
2527  * in pixel units or as a percentage.
2528  * <p>
2529  * When the value is a string,
2530  * and if it is suffixed with "%",
2531  * it represents a percentage of the
2532  * biggest radius that can fit in the client area of the plot.
2533  * <p>
2534  * The 
2535  * <i>normal</i> radius is
2536  * the biggest radius that can fit in the client area of the plot
2537  * minus the space occupied by linked labels,
2538  * minus the resolved active radius and
2539  * minus the resolved exploded radius.
2540  * <p>
2541  * See {@link #activeSliceRadius} and {@link #explodedSliceIndex}.
2542  * 
2543  * @type number|string
2544  * @default 0
2545  * @category Layout
2546  */
2547 pvc.options.plots.PiePlot.prototype.explodedSliceRadius = undefined;
2548 /**
2549  * The style used to place value labels.
2550  * 
2551  * @type pvc.options.varia.PieValuesLabelStyle
2552  * @default 'linked'
2553  * @category Layout
2554  */
2555 pvc.options.plots.PiePlot.prototype.valuesLabelStyle = undefined;
2556 /**
2557  * The values mask used to build the text of value labels.
2558  * <p>
2559  * The mask may contain scene variable names and/or scene atom names,
2560  * like in the examples:
2561  * 
2562  * <ul>
2563  * 
2564  * <li>scene variables: 
2565  * <tt>{category}: {value} EUR</tt>, could yield 
2566  * <tt>Drinks: 3.45 EUR</tt></li>
2567  * 
2568  * <li>atom variables:  
2569  * <tt>{#family} - {#product}</tt>, could yield 
2570  * <tt>Plains - Boeing 747</tt></li>
2571  * </ul>
2572  * <p>
2573  * The default value depends on the label style:
2574  * 
2575  * <ul>
2576  * 
2577  * <li>
2578  * <tt>inside</tt> - 
2579  * <tt>{value}</tt></li>
2580  * 
2581  * <li>
2582  * <tt>linked</tt> - 
2583  * <tt>{value} ({value.percent})</tt></li>
2584  * </ul>
2585  * <p>
2586  * The 
2587  * <tt>percent</tt> variable is a
2588  * sub-variable of the 
2589  * <tt>value</tt> scene variable.
2590  * 
2591  * @type string
2592  * @category Layout
2593  */
2594 pvc.options.plots.PiePlot.prototype.valuesMask = undefined;
2595 /**
2596  * The width of the link line handle width, in 
2597  * <i>em</i> units.
2598  * <p>
2599  * The 
2600  * <i>handle</i> is
2601  * the last segment of the link line,
2602  * an horizontal line segment just before the label.
2603  * 
2604  * @type number
2605  * @default 0.5
2606  * @category Layout > Linked Labels
2607  */
2608 pvc.options.plots.PiePlot.prototype.linkHandleWidth = undefined;
2609 /**
2610  * The length of the link line segment that is
2611  * inset into a slice,
2612  * in pixel units, or as a percentage.
2613  * <p>
2614  * When the value is a string,
2615  * and if it is suffixed with "%",
2616  * it represents a percentage of the
2617  * biggest radius that can fit in the client area of the plot.
2618  * 
2619  * @type number|string
2620  * @default '5%'
2621  * @category Layout > Linked Labels
2622  */
2623 pvc.options.plots.PiePlot.prototype.linkInsetRadius = undefined;
2624 /**
2625  * The width of the columns reserved,
2626  * on each side of the pie,
2627  * for laying out the linked label marks.
2628  * <p>
2629  * When the value is a string,
2630  * and if it is suffixed with "%",
2631  * it represents a percentage of the
2632  * 
2633  * <i>client width</i> of the plot.
2634  * 
2635  * @type number|string
2636  * @default '15%'
2637  * @category Layout > Linked Labels
2638  */
2639 pvc.options.plots.PiePlot.prototype.linkLabelSize = undefined;
2640 /**
2641  * The minimum vertical space between consecutive link labels,
2642  * in 
2643  * <i>em</i> units.
2644  * 
2645  * @type number
2646  * @default 0.5
2647  * @category Layout > Linked Labels
2648  */
2649 pvc.options.plots.PiePlot.prototype.linkLabelSpacingMin = undefined;
2650 /**
2651  * The width of the space
2652  * that separates the label from
2653  * the end of the line segment that starts in the link elbow,
2654  * in pixel units, or as a percentage.
2655  * <p>
2656  * The value of this property includes
2657  * the size of the link line handle.
2658  * <p>
2659  * When the value is a string,
2660  * and if it is suffixed with "%",
2661  * it represents a percentage of the
2662  * 
2663  * <i>client width</i> of the plot.
2664  * 
2665  * @type number|string
2666  * @default '2.5%'
2667  * @category Layout > Linked Labels
2668  */
2669 pvc.options.plots.PiePlot.prototype.linkMargin = undefined;
2670 /**
2671  * The length of the link line segment that
2672  * extends outwards from the slice,
2673  * until it reaches the link line "elbow",
2674  * in pixel units, or as a percentage.
2675  * <p>
2676  * When the value is a string,
2677  * and if it is suffixed with "%",
2678  * it represents a percentage of the
2679  * biggest radius that can fit in the client area of the plot.
2680  * 
2681  * @type number|string
2682  * @default '2.5%'
2683  * @category Layout > Linked Labels
2684  */
2685 pvc.options.plots.PiePlot.prototype.linkOutsetRadius = undefined;
2686 /**
2687  * The extension points object
2688  * contains style definitions for
2689  * various visual elements of the chart.
2690  * 
2691  * @type pvc.options.ext.PiePlotExtensionPoints
2692  * @category Style
2693  */
2694 pvc.options.plots.PiePlot.prototype.extensionPoints = undefined;
2695 /**
2696  * The alignment of a value label
2697  * relative to its corresponding visual element position.
2698  * <p>
2699  * Specifically, this property applies to non-linked labels.
2700  * 
2701  * @type pvc.options.varia.WedgeAnchor
2702  * @default 'outer'
2703  * @category Style
2704  */
2705 pvc.options.plots.PiePlot.prototype.valuesAnchor = undefined;
2706 /**
2707  * Indicates if legibility of value labels should be optimized.
2708  * <p>
2709  * Only applies when {@link #valuesLabelStyle} is 
2710  * <tt>inside</tt>.
2711  * <p>
2712  * The current algorithm varies the text color so that it has enough contrast
2713  * for the fill color of the associated pie slice.
2714  * <p>
2715  * It is applied only when a value label is considered to be 
2716  * <i>inside</i> its
2717  * associated slice. Presently, it is considered to be inside, if the center point
2718  * of the label is within the bounds of the slice.
2719  * 
2720  * @type boolean
2721  * @default false
2722  * @category Style
2723  */
2724 pvc.options.plots.PiePlot.prototype.valuesOptimizeLegibility = undefined;
2725 /**
2726  * The behavior to apply when the text of a value label does not fit within the bounds of its associated slice.
2727  * <p>
2728  * This option applies only when {@link pvc.options.plots.Plot#valuesVisible} is true.
2729  * <p>
2730  * Moreover, it also applies only for certain configurations of value label placement,
2731  * relative to the associated slice. Presently, the supported placements are:
2732  * 
2733  * <ul>
2734  * 
2735  * <li>
2736  * <b>non-negative text margin</b>,
2737  * {@link pvc.options.marks.LabelExtensionPoint#textMargin}.
2738  * </li>
2739  * 
2740  * <li>
2741  * <b>values anchor is outer</b> —
2742  * {@link pvc.options.plots.Plot#valuesAnchor}
2743  * is
2744  * {@link pvc.options.varia.WedgeAnchor#Outer}.
2745  * </li>
2746  * 
2747  * <li>
2748  * <b>text baseline is middle</b> —
2749  * {@link pvc.options.marks.LabelExtensionPoint#textBaseline}
2750  * is
2751  * {@link pvc.options.varia.TextBaseline#Middle}.
2752  * </li>
2753  * 
2754  * <li>
2755  * <b>text is inside and aligned with the middle angle of the slice</b> —
2756  * if the label has a
2757  * {@link pvc.options.marks.LabelExtensionPoint#textAlign}
2758  * of
2759  * {@link pvc.options.varia.TextAlignment#Right},
2760  * then
2761  * {@link pvc.options.marks.LabelExtensionPoint#textAngle}
2762  * must be (modulo) equal to the middle angle of the slice.
2763  * <p>
2764  * Otherwise,
2765  * if the label has a
2766  * {@link pvc.options.marks.LabelExtensionPoint#textAlign}
2767  * of
2768  * {@link pvc.options.varia.TextAlignment#Left},
2769  * then
2770  * {@link pvc.options.marks.LabelExtensionPoint#textAngle}
2771  * must be (modulo) equal to the middle angle of the slice plus 
2772  * <tt>PI</tt>
2773  * (the opposite angle).
2774  * </li>
2775  * </ul>
2776  * <p>
2777  * When an unsupported placement occurs, the label is shown.
2778  * <p>
2779  * Note that for the purposes of hiding and trimming,
2780  * the value of {@link pvc.options.marks.LabelExtensionPoint#textMargin}
2781  * is used for more that the distance between the anchor points of the label and the slice.
2782  * It is also included as a required margin at the opposite side of the
2783  * configured text alignment.
2784  * Also, half of the text margin is included on the bottom and top sides.
2785  * 
2786  * @type pvc.options.varia.ValuesOverflow
2787  * @default 'hide'
2788  * @category Style
2789  */
2790 pvc.options.plots.PiePlot.prototype.valuesOverflow = undefined;
2791 /**
2792  * Indicates if value labels are shown next to the visual elements.
2793  * 
2794  * @type boolean
2795  * @default true
2796  * @category Style
2797  */
2798 pvc.options.plots.PiePlot.prototype.valuesVisible = undefined;
2799 /**
2800  * The plot's visual roles map.
2801  * <p>
2802  * See {@link pvc.options.plots.BasicPlot#visualRoles} for more information.
2803  * 
2804  * @type map(string : pvc.options.VisualRole)|pvc.options.visualRoles.PiePlotVisualRoles
2805  * @category Visual Roles
2806  */
2807 pvc.options.plots.PiePlot.prototype.visualRoles = undefined;
2808 /**
2809  * The extension points of the pie plot type.
2810  * <p>
2811  * Plot extension points can be specified:
2812  * 
2813  * <ul>
2814  * 
2815  * <li>at the plot level, in the 
2816  * <i>extensionPoints</i> property,
2817  * without need to prefix the extension point with the
2818  * plot id or name.
2819  * </li>
2820  * 
2821  * <li>at the plot options level, directly,
2822  * without need to prefix the extension point with the
2823  * plot id or name.
2824  * </li>
2825  * 
2826  * <li>
2827  * if it is an internal plot (
2828  * <i>main</i>, 
2829  * <i>plot2</i> or 
2830  * <i>trend</i>),
2831  * at the chart options level, directly.
2832  * </li>
2833  * </ul>
2834  * <p>
2835  * To use an extension point you must find its full name, by joining:
2836  * 
2837  * <ol>
2838  * 
2839  * <li>plot property name (ex: 
2840  * <tt>pie</tt>)</li>
2841  * 
2842  * <li>extension property (ex: 
2843  * <tt>slice</tt>)</li>
2844  * 
2845  * <li>the "_" character</li>
2846  * 
2847  * <li>extension sub-property (ex: 
2848  * <tt>strokeStyle</tt>)</li>
2849  * </ol>
2850  * and obtaining, for the examples, the camel-cased name: 
2851  * <tt>pieSlice_strokeStyle</tt>
2852  * (see {@link http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CamelCase}).
2853  * <p>
2854  * The extension points of the 
2855  * <i>main plot</i> of a chart
2856  * may be used without the plot property name prefix.
2857  * In the example, when the 
2858  * <tt>pie</tt> plot is the main plot,
2859  * the extension point can be written as 
2860  * <tt>slice_strokeStyle</tt>.
2861  * 
2862  * @class
2863  */
2864 pvc.options.ext.PiePlotExtensionPoints = function(){};
2865         
2866         
2867         
2868         
2869 /**
2870  * The extension point of the value label mark.
2871  * 
2872  * @type pvc.options.marks.LabelExtensionPoint
2873  */
2874 pvc.options.ext.PiePlotExtensionPoints.prototype.label = undefined;
2875 /**
2876  * The extension point of the line mark that links the
2877  * pie slices and the linked labels.
2878  * 
2879  * @type pvc.options.marks.LineExtensionPoint
2880  */
2881 pvc.options.ext.PiePlotExtensionPoints.prototype.linkLine = undefined;
2882 /**
2883  * The extension point of the pie slice - the wedge mark.
2884  * 
2885  * @type pvc.options.marks.PieChartWedgeExtensionPoint
2886  */
2887 pvc.options.ext.PiePlotExtensionPoints.prototype.slice = undefined;
2888 /**
2889  * The class of the Pie chart's protovis Wedge extension points.
2890  * <p>
2891  * See the associated protovis documentation at
2892  * {@link http://mbostock.github.com/protovis/jsdoc/symbols/pv.Wedge.html}.
2893  * 
2894  * @class
2895  * @extends pvc.options.marks.WedgeExtensionPoint
2896  */
2897 pvc.options.marks.PieChartWedgeExtensionPoint = function(){};
2898         
2899         
2900         
2901         
2902 /**
2903  * The inner radius of each slice, in 
2904  * <i>pixel</i> units or as
2905  * a percentage of the outer radius.
2906  * <p>
2907  * This extension point is only defined in
2908  * the 
2909  * <i>pie</i> chart's wedge mark.
2910  * 
2911  * @type number|string
2912  */
2913 pvc.options.marks.PieChartWedgeExtensionPoint.prototype.innerRadiusEx = undefined;
2914 /**
2915  * The offset radius of each slice, from the center of the pie,
2916  * in 
2917  * <i>pixel</i> units or as a percentage of the outer radius.
2918  * <p>
2919  * This extension point is only defined in
2920  * the 
2921  * <i>pie</i> chart's wedge mark.
2922  * <p>
2923  * The default implementation of this extension point
2924  * honors the pie plot options
2925  * {@link pvc.options.plots.PiePlot#explodedSliceRadius}
2926  * and
2927  * {@link pvc.options.plots.PiePlot#explodedSliceIndex}.
2928  * <p>
2929  * The returned radius is kept within the interval:
2930  * 
2931  * <tt>0</tt> and the total reserved "interaction" radius —
2932  * the sum of
2933  * {@link pvc.options.plots.PiePlot#explodedSliceRadius}
2934  * and
2935  * {@link pvc.options.plots.PiePlot#activeSliceRadius}.
2936  * <p>
2937  * For example, this extension point can be used to
2938  * show selected slices with an "exploded" style.
2939  * This can be combined with the single selection mode.
2940  * 
2941  * @type number|string
2942  */
2943 pvc.options.marks.PieChartWedgeExtensionPoint.prototype.offsetRadius = undefined;
2944 /**
2945  * The visual roles options class of the pie plot type.
2946  * 
2947  * @class
2948  * @extends pvc.options.visualRoles.BasicPlotVisualRoles
2949  */
2950 pvc.options.visualRoles.PiePlotVisualRoles = function(){};
2951         
2952         
2953         
2954         
2955 /**
2956  * The 
2957  * <tt>category</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
2958  * represents the grouping of data by slices of the pie.
2959  * <p>
2960  * The 
2961  * <tt>category</tt> visual role automatically binds to
2962  * every dimension whose name has the 
2963  * <tt>category</tt> prefix.
2964  * <p>
2965  * The visual role itself is optional,
2966  * yet, when unbound,
2967  * a dimension with a "category" prefix
2968  * is automatically created for it,
2969  * and all datums will have the value 
2970  * <tt>null</tt>
2971  * in that dimension.
2972  * <p>
2973  * See {@link pvc.options.VisualRole}
2974  * for more information on supported data types.
2975  * 
2976  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
2977  * @category Visual Roles
2978  */
2979 pvc.options.visualRoles.PiePlotVisualRoles.prototype.category = undefined;
2980 /**
2981  * The 
2982  * <tt>color</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
2983  * is visually encoded by the fill color of each pie slice.
2984  * <p>
2985  * The 
2986  * <tt>color</tt> visual role automatically binds to
2987  * every dimension whose name has the 
2988  * <tt>color</tt> prefix
2989  * or, if none exists,
2990  * the dimensions of the "category" role.
2991  * <p>
2992  * The 
2993  * <tt>color</tt> visual role is discrete.
2994  * <p>
2995  * See {@link pvc.options.VisualRole}
2996  * for more information on supported data types.
2997  * 
2998  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
2999  * @category Visual Roles
3000  */
3001 pvc.options.visualRoles.PiePlotVisualRoles.prototype.color = undefined;
3002 /**
3003  * The 
3004  * <tt>value</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
3005  * represents the main measure under analysis,
3006  * and is visually encoded by the
3007  * relative angle span of each pie slice.
3008  * <p>
3009  * The 
3010  * <tt>value</tt> visual role automatically binds to
3011  * a single dimension whose name has the 
3012  * <tt>value</tt> prefix.
3013  * <p>
3014  * The 
3015  * <tt>value</tt> visual role is required.
3016  * <p>
3017  * See {@link pvc.options.VisualRole}
3018  * for more information on supported data types.
3019  * 
3020  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
3021  * @category Visual Roles
3022  */
3023 pvc.options.visualRoles.PiePlotVisualRoles.prototype.value = undefined;
3024 /**
3025  * The options documentation class of the 
3026  * <b>Treemap</b> chart.
3027  * <p>
3028  * Treemap charts display hierarchical data using nested rectangles.
3029  * They excel in revealing the location of valuable areas buried in a deep hierarchy.
3030  * 
3031  * <p>
3032  * The root data node is represented by the root rectangle,
3033  * which occupies the whole plot area.
3034  * </p>
3035  * 
3036  * <p>
3037  * The area of a leaf node is proportional to
3038  * the percentage of the 
3039  * <i>size</i> dimension over its sibling nodes.
3040  * The area of a non-leaf node is the sum of the areas of its child nodes.
3041  * If no 
3042  * <i>size</i> dimension is specified,
3043  * then all sibling-leaf nodes will have identical areas.
3044  * </p>
3045  * 
3046  * <p>
3047  * Rectangles are usually colored so that siblings have the same color.
3048  * This way, it is easy to identify sibling nodes and compare their relative sizes.
3049  * In this way, the colors that are shown are the colors of leaf nodes' parents.
3050  * </p>
3051  * 
3052  * <h3>Default Data Format</h3>
3053  * <p>
3054  * For general information on the supported 
3055  * <b>data formats</b>
3056  * see {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart}.
3057  * <p>
3058  * The treemap chart employs a non-default 
3059  * <i>logical row</i> to dimensions mapping:
3060  * 
3061  * <ol>
3062  * 
3063  * <li>
3064  * All of the free 
3065  * <i>discrete</i> columns of the 
3066  * <i>logical table</i>
3067  * generate and load free dimensions of the "category" 
3068  * <i>dimension group</i>:
3069  * "category", "category2", "category4", ...
3070  * </li>
3071  * 
3072  * <li>The first free 
3073  * <i>continuous</i> column of the 
3074  * <i>logical table</i>
3075  * generates and loads the "size" dimension, if free.
3076  * </li>
3077  * </ol>
3078  * 
3079  * <style>
3080  * .dataformat {
3081  * border-spacing: 0;
3082  * margin: 1em 0;
3083  * }
3084  * .dataformat td {
3085  * border:  solid 1px;
3086  * padding: 3px;
3087  * width:   80px;
3088  * }
3089  * </style>
3090  * <p>
3091  * The following is a possible default layout and dimension assignment:
3092  * 
3093  * <table class='dataformat'>
3094  * 
3095  * <tr>
3096  * <td>
3097  * <b>Index</b></td>
3098  * <td>0</td>
3099  * <td>1</td>
3100  * <td>2</td>
3101  * <td>3</td></tr>
3102  * 
3103  * <tr>
3104  * <td>
3105  * <b>Dimension</b></td>
3106  * <td>category</td>
3107  * <td>category2</td>
3108  * <td>category4</td>
3109  * <td>size</td></tr>
3110  * 
3111  * <tr>
3112  * <td>
3113  * <b>DataType</b></td>
3114  * <td>string</td>
3115  * <td>string</td>
3116  * <td>string</td>
3117  * <td>number</td></tr>
3118  * </table>
3119  * <p>
3120  * Note that the dimension "category3" was not assigned to index 3, hypothetically because it was not free (was explicitly bound to some index, using a reader).
3121  * 
3122  * <h3>How To Bind The Color Visual Role</h3>
3123  * The Treemap's 
3124  * <tt>color</tt> visual role can only be bound to discrete dimensions.
3125  * <p>
3126  * By default, the 
3127  * <tt>color</tt> role is bound to the
3128  * dimensions of the 
3129  * <tt>category</tt> role — its default 
3130  * <i>source role</i>.
3131  * <p>
3132  * The 
3133  * <tt>color</tt> role can also be bound to other discrete dimension(s), explicitly.
3134  * 
3135  * <h4>Solution 1</h4>
3136  * One possibility is to 
3137  * <i>switch</i> one of the automatically fed "category" dimensions
3138  * to the 
3139  * <tt>color</tt> visual role.
3140  * For example:
3141  * 
3142  * <pre>
3143  * categoryRole: "category", // steal one here
3144  * colorRole:    "category2" // and assign it here
3145  * 
3146  * </pre>
3147  * 
3148  * <h4>Solution 2</h4>
3149  * Another possibility is to configure the {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart#readers}
3150  * with the actual layout, using the default dimension names of
3151  * the desired visual roles.
3152  * For example:
3153  * 
3154  * <pre>
3155  * readers: "color, category, category2, size"
3156  * 
3157  * </pre>
3158  * 
3159  * <h4>Solution 3</h4>
3160  * Of course, you can (and probably should) use actual business names for the names of dimensions.
3161  * To that end, both the readers and the visual roles' mappings need to be specified:
3162  * 
3163  * <pre>
3164  * readers:      "orderType, productFamily, productType, sales"
3165  * categoryRole: "productFamily, productType",
3166  * colorRole:    "orderType",
3167  * sizeRole:     "sales"
3168  * 
3169  * </pre>
3170  * 
3171  * <h3></h3>
3172  * 
3173  * @class
3174  * @extends pvc.options.charts.Chart
3175  */
3176 pvc.options.charts.TreemapChart = function(){};
3177         
3178         
3179         
3180         
3181 /**
3182  * The maximum number of 
3183  * <i>small</i> charts that should
3184  * be displayed in a row.
3185  * <p>
3186  * This property can receive a value of 
3187  * <tt>Infinity</tt>
3188  * to indicate that all charts should be laid out in a single row.
3189  * 
3190  * @type number
3191  * @default 3
3192  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
3193  */
3194 pvc.options.charts.TreemapChart.prototype.multiChartColumnsMax = undefined;
3195 /**
3196  * The maximum number of 
3197  * <i>small</i> charts that should
3198  * be displayed.
3199  * <p>
3200  * The first 
3201  * <i>small</i> charts are chosen.
3202  * 
3203  * @type number
3204  * @default Infinity
3205  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
3206  */
3207 pvc.options.charts.TreemapChart.prototype.multiChartMax = undefined;
3208 /**
3209  * The strategy to follow when the resulting multi-chart layout
3210  * does not fit entirely in the initial chart size.
3211  * 
3212  * @type pvc.options.varia.MultiChartOverflow
3213  * @default 'grow'
3214  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
3215  */
3216 pvc.options.charts.TreemapChart.prototype.multiChartOverflow = undefined;
3217 /**
3218  * Indicates that,
3219  * when the layout results in a single column
3220  * and the value of {@link #smallHeight}
3221  * is still to be determined,
3222  * it should be set to all the initially available content height,
3223  * instead of determining the height from the
3224  * {@link #smallAspectRatio} and the {@link #smallWidth}.
3225  * 
3226  * @type boolean
3227  * @default true
3228  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
3229  */
3230 pvc.options.charts.TreemapChart.prototype.multiChartSingleColFillsHeight = undefined;
3231 /**
3232  * Indicates that,
3233  * when the layout results in a single row
3234  * and the value of {@link #smallHeight}
3235  * is still to be determined,
3236  * it should be set to all the initially available content height,
3237  * instead of determining the height from the
3238  * {@link #smallAspectRatio} and the {@link #smallWidth}.
3239  * 
3240  * @type boolean
3241  * @default true
3242  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
3243  */
3244 pvc.options.charts.TreemapChart.prototype.multiChartSingleRowFillsHeight = undefined;
3245 /**
3246  * The ratio of the width over the height of a 
3247  * <i>small</i> chart.
3248  * <p>
3249  * It is used when the set of properties
3250  * {@link #smallWidth},
3251  * {@link #smallHeight},
3252  * {@link #multiChartColumnsMax},
3253  * {@link #multiChartSingleRowFillsHeight} and
3254  * {@link #multiChartSingleColFillsHeight},
3255  * is under-specified and
3256  * is not enough to determine the value of both
3257  * {@link #smallWidth} and
3258  * {@link #smallHeight}.
3259  * <p>
3260  * The default value of the aspect ratio depends on the chart type,
3261  * but is something around 
3262  * <tt>4/3</tt>.
3263  * 
3264  * @type number
3265  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
3266  */
3267 pvc.options.charts.TreemapChart.prototype.smallAspectRatio = undefined;
3268 /**
3269  * The margins of the 
3270  * <i>content panel</i> of a 
3271  * <i>small</i> chart.
3272  * <p>
3273  * See {@link pvc.options.varia.Sides} for information about
3274  * the different supported data types.
3275  * 
3276  * @type number|string|pvc.options.varia.Sides
3277  * @default 0
3278  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
3279  */
3280 pvc.options.charts.TreemapChart.prototype.smallContentMargins = undefined;
3281 /**
3282  * The paddings of the 
3283  * <i>content panel</i> of a 
3284  * <i>small</i> chart.
3285  * <p>
3286  * See {@link pvc.options.varia.Sides} for information about
3287  * the different supported data types.
3288  * 
3289  * @type number|string|pvc.options.varia.Sides
3290  * @default 0
3291  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
3292  */
3293 pvc.options.charts.TreemapChart.prototype.smallContentPaddings = undefined;
3294 /**
3295  * Fixates the height of each 
3296  * <i>small</i> chart, in pixel units or as a percentage.
3297  * <p>
3298  * A value of type 
3299  * <tt>number</tt>,
3300  * or of type 
3301  * <tt>string</tt>, but with numeric content,
3302  * is interpreted as being in pixel units.
3303  * <p>
3304  * A value of type 
3305  * <tt>string</tt>,
3306  * with numeric content that is suffixed by a "%" character,
3307  * is interpreted as a percentage of the initially available content height.
3308  * <p>
3309  * This property may cause the 
3310  * <i>small multiples</i> chart
3311  * to take up a greater width than the one specified in {@link #height}.
3312  * <p>
3313  * When this property is unspecified,
3314  * its value depends on the evaluation of the
3315  * {@link #smallWidth} property,
3316  * which may impose it a value.
3317  * If after the evaluation of {@link #smallWidth}
3318  * this property remains unspecified,
3319  * it is determined as follows.
3320  * <p>
3321  * If the layout will have a single column
3322  * and the property {@link #multiChartSingleColFillsHeight}
3323  * is 
3324  * <tt>true</tt> (it is by default)
3325  * then the height will be the initially available content height.
3326  * <p>
3327  * If the layout will have a single row
3328  * and the property {@link #multiChartSingleRowFillsHeight}
3329  * is 
3330  * <tt>true</tt> (it is by default)
3331  * then the height will be the initially available content height.
3332  * <p>
3333  * Otherwise, the property {@link #smallAspectRatio} is
3334  * used to determine the height of the small chart from its determined width.
3335  * <p>
3336  * The aspect ratio is defaulted to a value that depends on the chart type,
3337  * but is something around 
3338  * <tt>4/3</tt>.
3339  * 
3340  * @type number|string
3341  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
3342  */
3343 pvc.options.charts.TreemapChart.prototype.smallHeight = undefined;
3344 /**
3345  * The margins of a 
3346  * <i>small</i> chart.
3347  * <p>
3348  * See {@link pvc.options.varia.Sides} for information about
3349  * the different supported data types.
3350  * 
3351  * @type number|string|pvc.options.varia.Sides
3352  * @default '2%'
3353  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
3354  */
3355 pvc.options.charts.TreemapChart.prototype.smallMargins = undefined;
3356 /**
3357  * The paddings of a 
3358  * <i>small</i> chart.
3359  * <p>
3360  * See {@link pvc.options.varia.Sides} for information about
3361  * the different supported data types.
3362  * 
3363  * @type number|string|pvc.options.varia.Sides
3364  * @default 0
3365  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
3366  */
3367 pvc.options.charts.TreemapChart.prototype.smallPaddings = undefined;
3368 /**
3369  * Fixates the width of each 
3370  * <i>small</i> chart, in pixel units or as a percentage.
3371  * <p>
3372  * A value of type 
3373  * <tt>number</tt>,
3374  * or of type 
3375  * <tt>string</tt>, but with numeric content,
3376  * is interpreted as being in pixel units.
3377  * <p>
3378  * A value of type 
3379  * <tt>string</tt>,
3380  * with numeric content that is suffixed by a "%" character,
3381  * is interpreted as a percentage of the initially available content width.
3382  * <p>
3383  * This property may cause the 
3384  * <i>small multiples</i> chart
3385  * to take up a greater width than the one specified in {@link #width}.
3386  * <p>
3387  * When this property is unspecified,
3388  * a specified finite value, or a defaulted value, of the property {@link #multiChartColumnsMax} is
3389  * used to determine it:
3390  * by dividing the initially available content width
3391  * by the maximum number of charts in a row that 
3392  * <i>actually</i> occur
3393  * (so that if there are less small charts than
3394  * the maximum that can be placed in a row,
3395  * these, nevertheless, take up the whole width).
3396  * <p>
3397  * When an infinite value is specified for
3398  * {@link #multiChartColumnsMax},
3399  * the small charts are laid out in a single row,
3400  * and so the width is calculated from the height {@link #smallHeight},
3401  * using the aspect ratio {@link #smallAspectRatio}.
3402  * The height is defaulted to the initially available content height.
3403  * The aspect ratio is defaulted to a value that depends on the chart type,
3404  * but is something around 
3405  * <tt>4/3</tt>.
3406  * The width is then calculated.
3407  * 
3408  * @type number|string
3409  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
3410  */
3411 pvc.options.charts.TreemapChart.prototype.smallWidth = undefined;
3412 /**
3413  * The indexes of columns of the 
3414  * <i>logical table</i> that are to feed the
3415  * default
3416  * 
3417  * <tt>multiChart</tt>,
3418  * 
3419  * <tt>multiChart2</tt>, ...
3420  * dimensions.
3421  * <p>
3422  * See {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart#readers} for related information.
3423  * 
3424  * @type number|string|list(number|string)
3425  * @category Chart > Data Source
3426  */
3427 pvc.options.charts.TreemapChart.prototype.multiChartIndexes = undefined;
3428 /**
3429  * The 
3430  * <tt>multiChart</tt> visual role is a chart-level visual role that
3431  * allows turning a chart into a 
3432  * <i>small multiples</i> chart,
3433  * {@link http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Small_multiple}.
3434  * <p>
3435  * Almost all main chart types support being shown
3436  * as a small multiples chart.
3437  * Currently, the exceptions are the charts:
3438  * 
3439  * <i>Heat Grid</i>,
3440  * 
3441  * <i>Bullet</i>,
3442  * 
3443  * <i>Data Tree</i> and
3444  * 
3445  * <i>Parallel Coordinates</i>.
3446  * <p>
3447  * The 
3448  * <tt>multiChart</tt> visual role
3449  * can be bound to any number of dimensions,
3450  * that are, or will be turned into, discrete.
3451  * <p>
3452  * The 
3453  * <tt>multiChart</tt> visual role automatically binds to
3454  * every dimension whose name has the 
3455  * <tt>multiChart</tt> prefix.
3456  * <p>
3457  * One 
3458  * <i>small</i> chart is generated per
3459  * unique combination of the values of the bound dimensions
3460  * that is present in the source data.
3461  * Each small chart then receives as its data
3462  * the partition of the source data that shares its
3463  * unique combination of values.
3464  * <p>
3465  * See {@link pvc.options.VisualRole}
3466  * for more information on supported data types.
3467  * 
3468  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
3469  * @category Chart > Visual Roles
3470  */
3471 pvc.options.charts.TreemapChart.prototype.multiChartRole = undefined;
3472 /**
3473  * The title panel of the 
3474  * <i>small</i> chart.
3475  * <p>
3476  * The text of the title of small charts is the
3477  * compound label of the data bound to the 
3478  * <tt>multiChart</tt> visual role.
3479  * 
3480  * @type pvc.options.panels.ChartTitlePanel
3481  * @category Panels - Multi
3482  */
3483 pvc.options.charts.TreemapChart.prototype.smallTitle = undefined;
3484 /**
3485  * The first color axis options.
3486  * <p>
3487  * This axis can also be accessed by the property name 
3488  * <tt>color</tt>.
3489  * <p>
3490  * See {@link pvc.options.axes.ColorAxis}
3491  * for more information on the way that
3492  * the color axes' properties may be accessed.
3493  * 
3494  * @type pvc.options.axes.DiscreteColorAxis
3495  * @category Axes
3496  */
3497 pvc.options.charts.TreemapChart.prototype.color = undefined;
3498 /**
3499  * The size axis options.
3500  * 
3501  * @type pvc.options.axes.SizeAxis
3502  * @category Axes
3503  */
3504 pvc.options.charts.TreemapChart.prototype.sizeAxis = undefined;
3505 /**
3506  * The extension points object contains style definitions for
3507  * the marks of the plot.
3508  * 
3509  * @type pvc.options.ext.TreemapChartExtensionPoints
3510  * @category Chart
3511  */
3512 pvc.options.charts.TreemapChart.prototype.extensionPoints = undefined;
3513 /**
3514  * This chart type does not support this property.
3515  * 
3516  * @type boolean
3517  * @category Chart > Data
3518  * @constant
3519  */
3520 pvc.options.charts.TreemapChart.prototype.timeSeries = false;
3521 /**
3522  * This chart type does not support this property.
3523  * 
3524  * @type string
3525  * @category Chart > Data
3526  * @constant
3527  */
3528 pvc.options.charts.TreemapChart.prototype.timeSeriesFormat = null;
3529 /**
3530  * The 
3531  * <tt>category</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
3532  * allows grouping data points to form a hierarchy.
3533  * <p>
3534  * This is a shortcut property for the main plot's
3535  * {@link pvc.options.visualRoles.TreemapPlotVisualRoles#category}.
3536  * 
3537  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
3538  * @category Chart > Visual Roles
3539  */
3540 pvc.options.charts.TreemapChart.prototype.categoryRole = undefined;
3541 /**
3542  * The 
3543  * <tt>color</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
3544  * is visually encoded by the color of visual elements.
3545  * <p>
3546  * This is a shortcut property for the main plot's
3547  * {@link pvc.options.visualRoles.TreemapPlotVisualRoles#color}.
3548  * 
3549  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
3550  * @category Chart > Visual Roles
3551  */
3552 pvc.options.charts.TreemapChart.prototype.colorRole = undefined;
3553 /**
3554  * The 
3555  * <tt>size</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
3556  * is visually encoded by the relative area amongst sibling-leaf rectangles.
3557  * <p>
3558  * This is a shortcut property for the main plot's
3559  * {@link pvc.options.visualRoles.TreemapPlotVisualRoles#size}.
3560  * 
3561  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
3562  * @category Chart > Visual Roles
3563  */
3564 pvc.options.charts.TreemapChart.prototype.sizeRole = undefined;
3565 /**
3566  * The chart's visual roles map.
3567  * <p>
3568  * See {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart#visualRoles} for more information.
3569  * 
3570  * @type map(string : pvc.options.VisualRole)|pvc.options.visualRoles.TreemapChartVisualRoles
3571  * @category Chart > Visual Roles
3572  */
3573 pvc.options.charts.TreemapChart.prototype.visualRoles = undefined;
3574 /**
3575  * The treemap plot is the 
3576  * <b>main plot</b> of the treemap chart,
3577  * which means that
3578  * its properties may be used 
3579  * <i>without</i> the "treemap" property suffix.
3580  * 
3581  * @type pvc.options.plots.TreemapPlot
3582  * @category Plots
3583  */
3584 pvc.options.charts.TreemapChart.prototype.treemap = undefined;
3585 /**
3586  * The extension points of the treemap chart type.
3587  * <p>
3588  * Chart extension points can also be specified directly at the chart options level.
3589  * <p>
3590  * To use an extension point you must find its full name, by joining:
3591  * 
3592  * <ol>
3593  * 
3594  * <li>extension property (ex: 
3595  * <tt>smallBase</tt>)</li>
3596  * 
3597  * <li>the "_" character</li>
3598  * 
3599  * <li>extension sub-property (ex: 
3600  * <tt>strokeStyle</tt>)</li>
3601  * </ol>
3602  * and obtaining, for the examples, the camel-cased name: 
3603  * <tt>smallBase_strokeStyle</tt>
3604  * (see {@link http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CamelCase}).
3605  * 
3606  * @class
3607  * @extends pvc.options.ext.ChartExtensionPoints
3608  */
3609 pvc.options.ext.TreemapChartExtensionPoints = function(){};

3644  */
3645 pvc.options.visualRoles.TreemapChartVisualRoles = function(){};
3646         
3647         
3648         
3649         
3650 /**
3651  * The 
3652  * <tt>multiChart</tt> visual role is a chart-level visual role that
3653  * allows turning a chart into a 
3654  * <i>small multiples</i> chart,
3655  * {@link http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Small_multiple}.
3656  * <p>
3657  * Almost all main chart types support being shown
3658  * as a small multiples chart.
3659  * Currently, the exceptions are the charts:
3660  * 
3661  * <i>Heat Grid</i>,
3662  * 
3663  * <i>Bullet</i>,
3664  * 
3665  * <i>Data Tree</i> and
3666  * 
3667  * <i>Parallel Coordinates</i>.
3668  * <p>
3669  * The 
3670  * <tt>multiChart</tt> visual role
3671  * can be bound to any number of dimensions,
3672  * that are, or will be turned into, discrete.
3673  * <p>
3674  * The 
3675  * <tt>multiChart</tt> visual role automatically binds to
3676  * every dimension whose name has the 
3677  * <tt>multiChart</tt> prefix.
3678  * <p>
3679  * One 
3680  * <i>small</i> chart is generated per
3681  * unique combination of the values of the bound dimensions
3682  * that is present in the source data.
3683  * Each small chart then receives as its data
3684  * the partition of the source data that shares its
3685  * unique combination of values.
3686  * <p>
3687  * See {@link pvc.options.VisualRole}
3688  * for more information on supported data types.
3689  * 
3690  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
3691  * @category Chart > Visual Roles
3692  */
3693 pvc.options.visualRoles.TreemapChartVisualRoles.prototype.multiChart = undefined;
3694 /**
3695  * The options documentation class of the 
3696  * <b>Treemap</b> plot.
3697  * 
3698  * @class
3699  * @extends pvc.options.plots.Plot
3700  */
3701 pvc.options.plots.TreemapPlot = function(){};
3702         
3703         
3704         
3705         
3706 /**
3707  * The index of the color axis to use for the plot.
3708  * 
3709  * @type number
3710  * @category Axes
3711  * @constant
3712  */
3713 pvc.options.plots.TreemapPlot.prototype.colorAxis = 1;
3714 /**
3715  * Controls how colors are drawn from the color scale to paint visual elements.
3716  * Indicates if the color is assigned to parent nodes or to leaf nodes.
3717  * 
3718  * @type pvc.options.varia.TreemapColorMode
3719  * @default 'byParent'
3720  * @category Style
3721  */
3722 pvc.options.plots.TreemapPlot.prototype.colorMode = undefined;
3723 /**
3724  * The extension points object
3725  * contains style definitions for
3726  * various visual elements of the chart.
3727  * 
3728  * @type pvc.options.ext.TreemapPlotExtensionPoints
3729  * @category Style
3730  */
3731 pvc.options.plots.TreemapPlot.prototype.extensionPoints = undefined;
3732 /**
3733  * The rectangle layout algorithm.
3734  * 
3735  * @type pvc.options.varia.TreemapLayoutMode
3736  * @default 'squarify'
3737  * @category Style
3738  */
3739 pvc.options.plots.TreemapPlot.prototype.layoutMode = undefined;
3740 /**
3741  * The label that is used for the root node.
3742  * The root node's label not always shows up to the user.
3743  * It depends on the used {@link #colorMode} and
3744  * of the existence of a first-level leaf node.
3745  * 
3746  * @type string
3747  * @default 'All'
3748  * @category Style
3749  */
3750 pvc.options.plots.TreemapPlot.prototype.rootCategoryLabel = undefined;
3751 /**
3752  * The treemap's value label is always anchored to the center of the associated rectangle.
3753  * 
3754  * @type pvc.options.varia.MarkAnchor
3755  * @category Style
3756  * @constant
3757  */
3758 pvc.options.plots.TreemapPlot.prototype.valuesAnchor = null;
3759 /**
3760  * Indicates if legibility of value labels should be optimized.
3761  * <p>
3762  * The current algorithm varies the text color so that it has enough contrast
3763  * for the known background color.
3764  * <p>
3765  * It is applied only when a value label is considered to be 
3766  * <i>inside</i> its
3767  * associated rectangle. Presently, it is considered to be inside, if the center point
3768  * of the label is within the bounds of the rectangle.
3769  * 
3770  * @type boolean
3771  * @default true
3772  * @category Style
3773  */
3774 pvc.options.plots.TreemapPlot.prototype.valuesOptimizeLegibility = undefined;
3775 /**
3776  * The behavior to apply when the text of a value label does not fit within the bounds of its associated rectangle.
3777  * <p>
3778  * This option applies only when {@link pvc.options.plots.Plot#valuesVisible} is true.
3779  * <p>
3780  * Moreover, it also applies only for certain configurations of value label placement,
3781  * relative to the associated rectangle. Presently, the supported placements are:
3782  * 
3783  * <ul>
3784  * 
3785  * <li>
3786  * <b>non-negative text margin</b>,
3787  * {@link pvc.options.marks.LabelExtensionPoint#textMargin}.
3788  * </li>
3789  * 
3790  * <li>
3791  * <b>horizontal or vertical text</b> —
3792  * Text is horizontal when
3793  * {@link pvc.options.marks.LabelExtensionPoint#textAngle}
3794  * is such that 
3795  * <tt>sin(textAngle) = 0</tt> (example: 
3796  * <tt>0</tt>).
3797  * Text is vertical when
3798  * {@link pvc.options.marks.LabelExtensionPoint#textAngle}
3799  * is such that 
3800  * <tt>cos(textAngle) = 0</tt> (example: 
3801  * <tt>Math.PI/2</tt>, 
3802  * <tt>-Math.PI/2</tt>, 
3803  * <tt>3*Math.PI/2</tt>, ...).
3804  * </li>
3805  * </ul>
3806  * <p>
3807  * When an unsupported placement occurs, the label is shown.
3808  * <p>
3809  * Note that for the purposes of hiding and trimming,
3810  * the value of {@link pvc.options.marks.LabelExtensionPoint#textMargin}
3811  * is used for more that the distance between the anchor points of the label and the rectangle.
3812  * <p>
3813  * It is included as a required margin in all of the sides of the label.
3814  * 
3815  * @type pvc.options.varia.ValuesOverflow
3816  * @default 'hide'
3817  * @category Style
3818  */
3819 pvc.options.plots.TreemapPlot.prototype.valuesOverflow = undefined;
3820 /**
3821  * Indicates if value labels are shown next to the visual elements.
3822  * 
3823  * @type boolean
3824  * @default true
3825  * @category Style
3826  */
3827 pvc.options.plots.TreemapPlot.prototype.valuesVisible = undefined;
3828 /**
3829  * The plot's visual roles map.
3830  * <p>
3831  * See {@link pvc.options.plots.BasicPlot#visualRoles} for more information.
3832  * 
3833  * @type map(string : pvc.options.VisualRole)|pvc.options.visualRoles.TreemapPlotVisualRoles
3834  * @category Visual Roles
3835  */
3836 pvc.options.plots.TreemapPlot.prototype.visualRoles = undefined;
3837 /**
3838  * The extension points of the treemap plot type.
3839  * <p>
3840  * Plot extension points can be specified:
3841  * 
3842  * <ul>
3843  * 
3844  * <li>at the plot level, in the 
3845  * <i>extensionPoints</i> property,
3846  * without need to prefix the extension point with the
3847  * plot id or name.
3848  * </li>
3849  * 
3850  * <li>at the plot options level, directly,
3851  * without need to prefix the extension point with the
3852  * plot id or name.
3853  * </li>
3854  * 
3855  * <li>
3856  * if it is an internal plot (
3857  * <i>main</i>, 
3858  * <i>plot2</i> or 
3859  * <i>trend</i>),
3860  * at the chart options level, directly.
3861  * </li>
3862  * </ul>
3863  * <p>
3864  * To use an extension point you must find its full name, by joining:
3865  * 
3866  * <ol>
3867  * 
3868  * <li>plot property name (ex: 
3869  * <tt>treemap</tt>)</li>
3870  * 
3871  * <li>extension property (ex: 
3872  * <tt>leaf</tt>)</li>
3873  * 
3874  * <li>the "_" character</li>
3875  * 
3876  * <li>extension sub-property (ex: 
3877  * <tt>strokeStyle</tt>)</li>
3878  * </ol>
3879  * and obtaining, for the examples, the camel-cased name: 
3880  * <tt>treemapLeaf_strokeStyle</tt>
3881  * (see {@link http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CamelCase}).
3882  * <p>
3883  * The extension points of the 
3884  * <i>main plot</i> of a chart
3885  * may be used without the plot property name prefix.
3886  * In the example, when the 
3887  * <tt>treemap</tt> plot is the main plot,
3888  * the extension point can be written as 
3889  * <tt>leaf_strokeStyle</tt>.
3890  * 
3891  * @class
3892  */
3893 pvc.options.ext.TreemapPlotExtensionPoints = function(){};
3894         
3895         
3896         
3897         
3898 /**
3899  * The extension point of the non-leaf rectangles.
3900  * 
3901  * @type pvc.options.marks.BarExtensionPoint
3902  */
3903 pvc.options.ext.TreemapPlotExtensionPoints.prototype.ascendant = undefined;
3904 /**
3905  * The extension point of the value label mark.
3906  * 
3907  * @type pvc.options.marks.LabelExtensionPoint
3908  */
3909 pvc.options.ext.TreemapPlotExtensionPoints.prototype.label = undefined;
3910 /**
3911  * The extension point of the leaf rectangles.
3912  * 
3913  * @type pvc.options.marks.BarExtensionPoint
3914  */
3915 pvc.options.ext.TreemapPlotExtensionPoints.prototype.leaf = undefined;
3916 /**
3917  * The visual roles options class of the treemap plot type.
3918  * 
3919  * @class
3920  * @extends pvc.options.visualRoles.BasicPlotVisualRoles
3921  */
3922 pvc.options.visualRoles.TreemapPlotVisualRoles = function(){};
3923         
3924         
3925         
3926         
3927 /**
3928  * The 
3929  * <tt>category</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
3930  * allows grouping data points to form a hierarchy.
3931  * <p>
3932  * The 
3933  * <tt>category</tt> visual role automatically binds to
3934  * every dimension whose name has the 
3935  * <tt>category</tt> prefix.
3936  * <p>
3937  * The visual role is required ad discrete.
3938  * <p>
3939  * See {@link pvc.options.VisualRole}
3940  * for more information on supported data types.
3941  * 
3942  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
3943  * @category Visual Roles
3944  */
3945 pvc.options.visualRoles.TreemapPlotVisualRoles.prototype.category = undefined;
3946 /**
3947  * The 
3948  * <tt>color</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
3949  * is visually encoded by the color of visual elements.
3950  * <p>
3951  * The 
3952  * <tt>color</tt> visual role automatically binds to
3953  * every dimension whose name has the 
3954  * <tt>color</tt> prefix
3955  * or, if none exists,
3956  * the dimensions of the 
3957  * <tt>category</tt> role.
3958  * <p>
3959  * The 
3960  * <tt>color</tt> visual role is optional and discrete.
3961  * <p>
3962  * See {@link pvc.options.VisualRole}
3963  * for more information on supported data types.
3964  * 
3965  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
3966  * @category Visual Roles
3967  */
3968 pvc.options.visualRoles.TreemapPlotVisualRoles.prototype.color = undefined;
3969 /**
3970  * The 
3971  * <tt>size</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
3972  * is visually encoded by the relative area amongst sibling-leaf rectangles.
3973  * <p>
3974  * The 
3975  * <tt>size</tt> visual role automatically binds to
3976  * a single dimension whose name has the 
3977  * <tt>size</tt> prefix.
3978  * <p>
3979  * The 
3980  * <tt>size</tt> visual role is optional and numeric.
3981  * <p>
3982  * See {@link pvc.options.VisualRole}
3983  * for more information on supported data types.
3984  * 
3985  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
3986  * @category Visual Roles
3987  */
3988 pvc.options.visualRoles.TreemapPlotVisualRoles.prototype.size = undefined;
3989 /**
3990  * The options documentation class of the 
3991  * <b>Bullet</b> chart.
3992  * <p>
3993  * This chart type was only partially updated,
3994  * to support some of the new CCC v.2 features.
3995  * 
3996  * <h3>Default Data Format</h3>
3997  * For general information on the supported 
3998  * <b>data formats</b>
3999  * see {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart}.
4000  * <p>
4001  * Note that, unlike most chart types,
4002  * the bullet chart has a default
4003  * {@link #dataTypeCheckingMode}
4004  * of {@link pvc.options.varia.DataTypeCheckingMode#Extended}.
4005  * <p>
4006  * Also, the bullet chart employs a non-default 
4007  * <i>logical row</i> to dimensions mapping:
4008  * 
4009  * <ol>
4010  * 
4011  * <li>The first free 
4012  * <i>discrete</i> column of the 
4013  * <i>logical table</i>
4014  * generates and loads the "title" dimension, if free.
4015  * </li>
4016  * 
4017  * <li>The second free 
4018  * <i>discrete</i> column of the 
4019  * <i>logical table</i>
4020  * generates and loads the "subTitle" dimension, if free.
4021  * </li>
4022  * 
4023  * <li>Free 
4024  * <i>continuous</i> columns of the 
4025  * <i>logical table</i> generate and load,
4026  * in order, skipping the dimension when not-free,
4027  * the following numeric 
4028  * <i>dimensions</i>:
4029  * 
4030  * <ol>
4031  * 
4032  * <li>value</li>
4033  * 
4034  * <li>marker</li>
4035  * 
4036  * <li>range</li>
4037  * 
4038  * <li>range2</li>
4039  * 
4040  * <li>range3</li>
4041  * 
4042  * <li>...</li>
4043  * </ol>
4044  * </li>
4045  * </ol>
4046  * <p>
4047  * All the following are possible 
4048  * <i>default layouts</i> and dimension assignments:
4049  * 
4050  * <style>
4051  * .dataformat {
4052  * border-spacing: 0;
4053  * margin: 1em 0;
4054  * }
4055  * .dataformat td {
4056  * border:  solid 1px;
4057  * padding: 3px;
4058  * width:   70px;
4059  * }
4060  * </style>
4061  * 
4062  * <table class='dataformat'>
4063  * 
4064  * <tr>
4065  * <td>
4066  * <b>Index</b></td>
4067  * <td>0</td></tr>
4068  * 
4069  * <tr>
4070  * <td>
4071  * <b>Dimension</b></td>
4072  * <td>value</td></tr>
4073  * 
4074  * <tr>
4075  * <td>
4076  * <b>DataType</b></td>
4077  * <td>number</td></tr>
4078  * </table>
4079  * 
4080  * <table class='dataformat'>
4081  * 
4082  * <tr>
4083  * <td>
4084  * <b>Index</b></td>
4085  * <td>0</td>
4086  * <td>1</td></tr>
4087  * 
4088  * <tr>
4089  * <td>
4090  * <b>Dimension</b></td>
4091  * <td>value</td>
4092  * <td>marker</td></tr>
4093  * 
4094  * <tr>
4095  * <td>
4096  * <b>DataType</b></td>
4097  * <td>number</td>
4098  * <td>number</td></tr>
4099  * </table>
4100  * 
4101  * <table class='dataformat'>
4102  * 
4103  * <tr>
4104  * <td>
4105  * <b>Index</b></td>
4106  * <td>0</td>
4107  * <td>1</td></tr>
4108  * 
4109  * <tr>
4110  * <td>
4111  * <b>Dimension</b></td>
4112  * <td>title</td>
4113  * <td>value</td></tr>
4114  * 
4115  * <tr>
4116  * <td>
4117  * <b>DataType</b></td>
4118  * <td>string</td>
4119  * <td>number</td></tr>
4120  * </table>
4121  * 
4122  * <table class='dataformat'>
4123  * 
4124  * <tr>
4125  * <td>
4126  * <b>Index</b></td>
4127  * <td>0</td>
4128  * <td>1</td>
4129  * <td>2</td></tr>
4130  * 
4131  * <tr>
4132  * <td>
4133  * <b>Dimension</b></td>
4134  * <td>title</td>
4135  * <td>subTitle</td>
4136  * <td>value</td></tr>
4137  * 
4138  * <tr>
4139  * <td>
4140  * <b>DataType</b></td>
4141  * <td>string</td>
4142  * <td>string</td>
4143  * <td>number</td></tr>
4144  * </table>
4145  * 
4146  * <table class='dataformat'>
4147  * 
4148  * <tr>
4149  * <td>
4150  * <b>Index</b></td>
4151  * <td>0</td>
4152  * <td>1</td>
4153  * <td>2</td></tr>
4154  * 
4155  * <tr>
4156  * <td>
4157  * <b>Dimension</b></td>
4158  * <td>title</td>
4159  * <td>value</td>
4160  * <td>marker</td></tr>
4161  * 
4162  * <tr>
4163  * <td>
4164  * <b>DataType</b></td>
4165  * <td>string</td>
4166  * <td>number</td>
4167  * <td>number</td></tr>
4168  * </table>
4169  * 
4170  * <table class='dataformat'>
4171  * 
4172  * <tr>
4173  * <td>
4174  * <b>Index</b></td>
4175  * <td>0</td>
4176  * <td>1</td>
4177  * <td>2</td>
4178  * <td>3</td></tr>
4179  * 
4180  * <tr>
4181  * <td>
4182  * <b>Dimension</b></td>
4183  * <td>title</td>
4184  * <td>value</td>
4185  * <td>marker</td>
4186  * <td>range</td></tr>
4187  * 
4188  * <tr>
4189  * <td>
4190  * <b>DataType</b></td>
4191  * <td>string</td>
4192  * <td>number</td>
4193  * <td>number</td>
4194  * <td>number</td></tr>
4195  * </table>
4196  * 
4197  * <table class='dataformat'>
4198  * 
4199  * <tr>
4200  * <td>
4201  * <b>Index</b></td>
4202  * <td>0</td>
4203  * <td>1</td>
4204  * <td>2</td>
4205  * <td>3</td>
4206  * <td>4</td></tr>
4207  * 
4208  * <tr>
4209  * <td>
4210  * <b>Dimension</b></td>
4211  * <td>title</td>
4212  * <td>subTitle</td>
4213  * <td>value</td>
4214  * <td>marker</td>
4215  * <td>range</td></tr>
4216  * 
4217  * <tr>
4218  * <td>
4219  * <b>DataType</b></td>
4220  * <td>string</td>
4221  * <td>string</td>
4222  * <td>number</td>
4223  * <td>number</td>
4224  * <td>number</td></tr>
4225  * </table>
4226  * 
4227  * <table class='dataformat'>
4228  * 
4229  * <tr>
4230  * <td>
4231  * <b>Index</b></td>
4232  * <td>0</td>
4233  * <td>1</td>
4234  * <td>2</td>
4235  * <td>3</td>
4236  * <td>4</td>
4237  * <td>5</td></tr>
4238  * 
4239  * <tr>
4240  * <td>
4241  * <b>Dimension</b></td>
4242  * <td>title</td>
4243  * <td>subTitle</td>
4244  * <td>value</td>
4245  * <td>marker</td>
4246  * <td>range</td>
4247  * <td>range2</td></tr>
4248  * 
4249  * <tr>
4250  * <td>
4251  * <b>DataType</b></td>
4252  * <td>string</td>
4253  * <td>string</td>
4254  * <td>number</td>
4255  * <td>number</td>
4256  * <td>number</td>
4257  * <td>number</td></tr>
4258  * </table>
4259  * <p>
4260  * To use the bullet chart's visual roles in its most general form,
4261  * it is required to manually configure the data translator,
4262  * by using {@link #readers}
4263  * (e.g. 
4264  * <tt>"title, value, value2, value3, marker, range, range2, range3"</tt>).
4265  * 
4266  * @class
4267  * @extends pvc.options.charts.BasicChart
4268  */
4269 pvc.options.charts.BulletChart = function(){};
4270         
4271         
4272

4276  * the marks of the chart.
4277  * 
4278  * @type pvc.options.ext.BulletChartExtensionPoints
4279  * @category Chart
4280  */
4281 pvc.options.charts.BulletChart.prototype.extensionPoints = undefined;
4282 /**
4283  * A callback function that is called
4284  * when the user double-clicks on a bullet's title or sub-title.
4285  * 
4286  * @returns {undefined}
4287  * @method
4288  * @param {object} datum
4289  * An object describing the data of the double-clicked bullet.
4290  * The object has the following properties:
4291  * 
4292  * <ul>
4293  * 
4294  * <li>title</li>
4295  * 
4296  * <li>formattedTitle</li>
4297  * 
4298  * <li>subtitle</li>
4299  * 
4300  * <li>formattedSubtitle</li>
4301  * 
4302  * <li>ranges</li>
4303  * 
4304  * <li>formattedRanges</li>
4305  * 
4306  * <li>measures</li>
4307  * 
4308  * <li>formattedMeasures</li>
4309  * 
4310  * <li>markers</li>
4311  * 
4312  * <li>formattedMarkers</li>
4313  * </ul>
4314  * 
4315  * @param {HTMLDOMEvent} ev
4316  * The HTML DOM event object
4317  * 
4318  * @category Chart > Actions
4319  */
4320 pvc.options.charts.BulletChart.prototype.axisDoubleClickAction = function(){};
4321 /**
4322  * A callback function that is called
4323  * when the user clicks on a visual element.
4324  * 
4325  * @returns {undefined}
4326  * @method
4327  * @param {string} title
4328  * The title.
4329  * 
4330  * @param {string} subtitle
4331  * The sub-title.
4332  * 
4333  * @param {list(string)} measures
4334  * The array of measures.

4337  * The HTML DOM event object
4338  * 
4339  * @category Chart > Actions
4340  */
4341 pvc.options.charts.BulletChart.prototype.clickAction = function(){};
4342 /**
4343  * The 
4344  * <tt>marker</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
4345  * represents a set of reference or target values for a given
4346  * title and sub-title categories,
4347  * and is visually encoded by the positions of markers/dots
4348  * along the bullet's axis.
4349  * <p>
4350  * This is a shortcut property for the main plot's
4351  * {@link pvc.options.visualRoles.BulletPlotVisualRoles#marker}.
4352  * 
4353  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
4354  * @category Chart > Visual Roles
4355  */
4356 pvc.options.charts.BulletChart.prototype.markerRole = undefined;
4357 /**
4358  * The 
4359  * <tt>range</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
4360  * represents classification threshold values of the
4361  * 
4362  * <tt>value</tt> visual role.
4363  * <p>
4364  * This is a shortcut property for the main plot's
4365  * {@link pvc.options.visualRoles.BulletPlotVisualRoles#range}.
4366  * 
4367  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
4368  * @category Chart > Visual Roles
4369  */
4370 pvc.options.charts.BulletChart.prototype.rangeRole = undefined;
4371 /**
4372  * The 
4373  * <tt>subTitle</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
4374  * represents the sub-title of each bullet.
4375  * <p>
4376  * This is a shortcut property for the main plot's
4377  * {@link pvc.options.visualRoles.BulletPlotVisualRoles#subTitle}.
4378  * 
4379  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
4380  * @category Chart > Visual Roles
4381  */
4382 pvc.options.charts.BulletChart.prototype.subTitleRole = undefined;
4383 /**
4384  * The 
4385  * <tt>title</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
4386  * represents the title of each bullet.
4387  * <p>
4388  * This is a shortcut property for the main plot's
4389  * {@link pvc.options.visualRoles.BulletPlotVisualRoles#title}.
4390  * 
4391  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
4392  * @category Chart > Visual Roles
4393  */
4394 pvc.options.charts.BulletChart.prototype.titleRole = undefined;
4395 /**
4396  * The 
4397  * <tt>value</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
4398  * represents the main measure under analysis, for a given
4399  * title and sub-title categories,
4400  * and is visually encoded by the length of a bar visual element.
4401  * <p>
4402  * This is a shortcut property for the main plot's
4403  * {@link pvc.options.visualRoles.BulletPlotVisualRoles#value}.
4404  * 
4405  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
4406  * @category Chart > Visual Roles
4407  */
4408 pvc.options.charts.BulletChart.prototype.valueRole = undefined;
4409 /**
4410  * The bullet plot.
4411  * 
4412  * @type pvc.options.plots.BulletPlot
4413  * @category Plots
4414  */
4415 pvc.options.charts.BulletChart.prototype.bullet = undefined;
4416 /**
4417  * The extension points of the 
4418  * <b>bullet</b> chart types.
4419  * <p>
4420  * This 
4421  * <b>bullet</b> chart type was only partially updated,
4422  * to support some of the new CCC v.2 features.
4423  * <p>
4424  * To use an extension point you must find its full name, by joining:
4425  * 
4426  * <ol>
4427  * 
4428  * <li>extension property (ex: 
4429  * <tt>base</tt>)</li>
4430  * 
4431  * <li>the "_" character</li>
4432  * 
4433  * <li>extension sub-property (ex: 
4434  * <tt>strokeStyle</tt>)</li>
4435  * </ol>
4436  * and obtaining, for the examples, the camel-cased name: 
4437  * <tt>base_strokeStyle</tt>
4438  * (see {@link http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CamelCase}).
4439  * 
4440  * @class
4441  * @extends pvc.options.ext.BasicChartExtensionPoints
4442  */
4443 pvc.options.ext.BulletChartExtensionPoints = function(){};
4444         
4445         
4446         
4447         
4448 /**
4449  * The options documentation class of the 
4450  * <b>Bullet</b> plot.
4451  * <p>

4453  * <b>bullet</b> chart type was only partially updated,
4454  * to support some of the new CCC v.2 features.
4455  * 
4456  * @class
4457  * @extends pvc.options.plots.BasicPlot
4458  */
4459 pvc.options.plots.BulletPlot = function(){};

4461

4463

4496 pvc.options.plots.BulletPlot.prototype.ranges = undefined;

4567 /**
4568  * The plot's visual roles map.
4569  * <p>
4570  * See {@link pvc.options.plots.BasicPlot#visualRoles} for more information.
4571  * 
4572  * @type map(string : pvc.options.VisualRole)|pvc.options.visualRoles.BulletPlotVisualRoles
4573  * @category Visual Roles
4574  */
4575 pvc.options.plots.BulletPlot.prototype.visualRoles = undefined;
4576 /**
4577  * The extension points of the bullet plot type.
4578  * <p>
4579  * Plot extension points can be specified:
4580  * 
4581  * <ul>
4582  * 
4583  * <li>at the plot level, in the 
4584  * <i>extensionPoints</i> property,
4585  * without need to prefix the extension point with the
4586  * plot id or name.
4587  * </li>
4588  * 
4589  * <li>at the plot options level, directly,
4590  * without need to prefix the extension point with the
4591  * plot id or name.
4592  * </li>
4593  * 
4594  * <li>
4595  * if it is an internal plot (
4596  * <i>main</i>, 
4597  * <i>plot2</i> or 
4598  * <i>trend</i>),
4599  * at the chart options level, directly.
4600  * </li>
4601  * </ul>
4602  * <p>
4603  * This 
4604  * <b>bullet</b> chart type was only partially updated,
4605  * to support some of the new CCC v.2 features.
4606  * <p>
4607  * To use an extension point you must find its full name, by joining:
4608  * 
4609  * <ol>
4610  * 
4611  * <li>plot property name (ex: 
4612  * <tt>bullet</tt>)</li>
4613  * 
4614  * <li>extension property (ex: 
4615  * <tt>panel</tt>)</li>
4616  * 
4617  * <li>the "_" character</li>
4618  * 
4619  * <li>extension sub-property (ex: 
4620  * <tt>strokeStyle</tt>)</li>
4621  * </ol>
4622  * and obtaining, for the examples, the camel-cased name: 
4623  * <tt>bulletPanel_strokeStyle</tt>
4624  * (see {@link http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CamelCase}).
4625  * 
4626  * @class
4627  */
4628 pvc.options.ext.BulletPlotExtensionPoints = function(){};
4629         
4630         
4631         
4632         
4633 /**
4634  * The extension point of the bullets panel mark,
4635  * must be used 
4636  * <b>without</b> the 
4637  * <tt>bullet</tt> prefix.
4638  * <p>
4639  * One instance of this panel is generated per datum.
4640  * 
4641  * @type pvc.options.marks.PanelExtensionPoint
4642  */
4643 pvc.options.ext.BulletPlotExtensionPoints.prototype.bulletsPanel = undefined;
4644 /**
4645  * The extension point of the bullet markers dot mark.
4646  * 
4647  * @type pvc.options.marks.DotExtensionPoint
4648  */
4649 pvc.options.ext.BulletPlotExtensionPoints.prototype.marker = undefined;
4650 /**
4651  * The extension point of the bullet measures bar mark.
4652  * 
4653  * @type pvc.options.marks.BarExtensionPoint
4654  */
4655 pvc.options.ext.BulletPlotExtensionPoints.prototype.measure = undefined;
4656 /**
4657  * The extension point of the bullet panel mark.
4658  * 
4659  * @type pvc.options.marks.PanelExtensionPoint
4660  */
4661 pvc.options.ext.BulletPlotExtensionPoints.prototype.panel = undefined;
4662 /**
4663  * The extension point of the bullet ranges bar mark.
4664  * 
4665  * @type pvc.options.marks.BarExtensionPoint
4666  */
4667 pvc.options.ext.BulletPlotExtensionPoints.prototype.range = undefined;
4668 /**
4669  * The extension point of the bullet axis ticks rule mark.
4670  * 
4671  * @type pvc.options.marks.RuleExtensionPoint
4672  */
4673 pvc.options.ext.BulletPlotExtensionPoints.prototype.rule = undefined;
4674 /**
4675  * The extension point of the bullet axis ticks label mark.
4676  * 
4677  * @type pvc.options.marks.LabelExtensionPoint
4678  */
4679 pvc.options.ext.BulletPlotExtensionPoints.prototype.ruleLabel = undefined;
4680 /**
4681  * The extension point of the bullet sub-title label mark.
4682  * 
4683  * @type pvc.options.marks.LabelExtensionPoint
4684  */
4685 pvc.options.ext.BulletPlotExtensionPoints.prototype.subtitle = undefined;
4686 /**
4687  * The extension point of the bullet title label mark.
4688  * 
4689  * @type pvc.options.marks.LabelExtensionPoint
4690  */
4691 pvc.options.ext.BulletPlotExtensionPoints.prototype.title = undefined;
4692 /**
4693  * The visual roles options class of the bullet plot type.
4694  * 
4695  * @class
4696  * @extends pvc.options.visualRoles.BasicPlotVisualRoles
4697  */
4698 pvc.options.visualRoles.BulletPlotVisualRoles = function(){};
4699         
4700         
4701         
4702         
4703 /**
4704  * The 
4705  * <tt>marker</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
4706  * represents a set of reference or target values for a given
4707  * title and sub-title categories,
4708  * and is visually encoded by the positions of markers/dots
4709  * along the bullet's axis.
4710  * <p>
4711  * Negative values are considered 
4712  * <tt>0</tt>.
4713  * <p>
4714  * Each dimension that is bound to the 
4715  * <tt>marker</tt> role
4716  * is represented by a different marker.
4717  * <p>
4718  * The 
4719  * <tt>marker</tt> visual role automatically binds to
4720  * all numeric dimensions whose name has the 
4721  * <tt>marker</tt> prefix.
4722  * <p>
4723  * See {@link pvc.options.VisualRole}
4724  * for more information on supported data types.
4725  * 
4726  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
4727  * @category Visual Roles
4728  */
4729 pvc.options.visualRoles.BulletPlotVisualRoles.prototype.marker = undefined;
4730 /**
4731  * The 
4732  * <tt>range</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
4733  * represents classification threshold values of the
4734  * 
4735  * <tt>value</tt> visual role.
4736  * <p>
4737  * The 
4738  * <tt>value</tt> domain
4739  * is split into several parts (or classes) at the given points.
4740  * <p>
4741  * Each dimension that is bound to the 
4742  * <tt>range</tt> role
4743  * splits the 
4744  * <tt>value</tt> domain at a certain point.
4745  * <p>
4746  * By default, each part is painted with a successively brighter gray color.
4747  * <p>
4748  * The 
4749  * <tt>range</tt> visual role automatically binds to
4750  * all numeric dimensions whose name has the 
4751  * <tt>range</tt> prefix.
4752  * <p>
4753  * See {@link pvc.options.VisualRole}
4754  * for more information on supported data types.
4755  * 
4756  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
4757  * @category Visual Roles
4758  */
4759 pvc.options.visualRoles.BulletPlotVisualRoles.prototype.range = undefined;
4760 /**
4761  * The 
4762  * <tt>subTitle</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
4763  * represents the sub-title of each bullet.
4764  * <p>
4765  * The 
4766  * <tt>subTitle</tt> visual role automatically binds to
4767  * all dimensions whose name has the 
4768  * <tt>subTitle</tt> prefix.
4769  * <p>
4770  * See {@link pvc.options.VisualRole}
4771  * for more information on supported data types.
4772  * 
4773  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
4774  * @category Visual Roles
4775  */
4776 pvc.options.visualRoles.BulletPlotVisualRoles.prototype.subTitle = undefined;
4777 /**
4778  * The 
4779  * <tt>title</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
4780  * represents the title of each bullet.
4781  * <p>
4782  * The 
4783  * <tt>title</tt> visual role automatically binds to
4784  * all dimensions whose name has the 
4785  * <tt>title</tt> prefix.
4786  * <p>
4787  * See {@link pvc.options.VisualRole}
4788  * for more information on supported data types.
4789  * 
4790  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
4791  * @category Visual Roles
4792  */
4793 pvc.options.visualRoles.BulletPlotVisualRoles.prototype.title = undefined;
4794 /**
4795  * The 
4796  * <tt>value</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
4797  * represents the main measure under analysis, for a given
4798  * title and sub-title categories,
4799  * and is visually encoded by the length of a bar visual element.
4800  * <p>
4801  * The values, one for each dimension bound to the 
4802  * <tt>value</tt> role,
4803  * are represented by overlapping bars,
4804  * each painted with a successively brighter blue color.
4805  * The length of each bar is proportional to the corresponding value.
4806  * Negative values are considered 
4807  * <tt>0</tt>.
4808  * <p>
4809  * The 
4810  * <tt>value</tt> visual role automatically binds to
4811  * all numeric dimensions whose name has the 
4812  * <tt>value</tt> prefix.
4813  * <p>
4814  * See {@link pvc.options.VisualRole}
4815  * for more information on supported data types.
4816  * 
4817  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
4818  * @category Visual Roles
4819  */
4820 pvc.options.visualRoles.BulletPlotVisualRoles.prototype.value = undefined;
4821 /**
4822  * The options documentation class of the 
4823  * <b>Sunburst</b> chart.
4824  * <p>
4825  * Sunburst charts display hierarchical data using series of rings.
4826  * They are great to quickly drill down trough a deep hierarchy, while still maintaining the notion
4827  * of its dimension.
4828  * 
4829  * <p>
4830  * Each ring represents the children of the ring it
4831  * encloses and the area of each slice corresponds to its 
4832  * <i>value</i>.
4833  * </p>
4834  * 
4835  * <h3>Default Data Format</h3>
4836  * For general information on the supported 
4837  * <b>data formats</b>
4838  * see {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart}.
4839  * <p>
4840  * The sunburst chart employs a non-default 
4841  * <i>logical row</i> to dimensions mapping:
4842  * 
4843  * <ol>
4844  * 
4845  * <li>
4846  * All of the free 
4847  * <i>discrete</i> columns of the 
4848  * <i>logical table</i>
4849  * generate and load free dimensions of the "category" 
4850  * <i>dimension group</i>:
4851  * "category", "category2", "category4", ...
4852  * </li>
4853  * 
4854  * <li>The first free 
4855  * <i>continuous</i> column of the 
4856  * <i>logical table</i>
4857  * generates and loads the "size" dimension, if free.
4858  * </li>
4859  * </ol>
4860  * 
4861  * <style>
4862  * .dataformat {
4863  * border-spacing: 0;
4864  * margin: 1em 0;
4865  * }
4866  * .dataformat td {
4867  * border:  solid 1px;
4868  * padding: 3px;
4869  * width:   80px;
4870  * }
4871  * </style>
4872  * <p>
4873  * The following is a possible default layout and dimension assignment:
4874  * 
4875  * <table class='dataformat'>
4876  * 
4877  * <tr>
4878  * <td>
4879  * <b>Index</b></td>
4880  * <td>0</td>
4881  * <td>1</td>
4882  * <td>2</td>
4883  * <td>3</td></tr>
4884  * 
4885  * <tr>
4886  * <td>
4887  * <b>Dimension</b></td>
4888  * <td>category</td>
4889  * <td>category2</td>
4890  * <td>category4</td>
4891  * <td>size</td></tr>
4892  * 
4893  * <tr>
4894  * <td>
4895  * <b>DataType</b></td>
4896  * <td>string</td>
4897  * <td>string</td>
4898  * <td>string</td>
4899  * <td>number</td></tr>
4900  * </table>
4901  * <p>
4902  * Note that the dimension "category3" was not assigned to index 3, hypothetically because it was not free (was explicitly bound to some index, using a reader).
4903  * 
4904  * <h3>How To Bind The Color Visual Role</h3>
4905  * The Sunburst's 
4906  * <tt>color</tt> visual role can only be bound to discrete dimensions.
4907  * <p>
4908  * By default, the 
4909  * <tt>color</tt> role is bound to the
4910  * dimensions of the 
4911  * <tt>category</tt> role — its default 
4912  * <i>source role</i>.
4913  * <p>
4914  * The 
4915  * <tt>color</tt> role can also be bound to other discrete dimension(s), explicitly.
4916  * 
4917  * <h4>Solution 1</h4>
4918  * One possibility is to 
4919  * <i>switch</i> one of the automatically fed "category" dimensions
4920  * to the 
4921  * <tt>color</tt> visual role.
4922  * For example:
4923  * 
4924  * <pre>
4925  * categoryRole: "category", // steal one here
4926  * colorRole:    "category2" // and assign it here
4927  * 
4928  * </pre>
4929  * 
4930  * <h4>Solution 2</h4>
4931  * Another possibility is to configure the {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart#readers}
4932  * with the actual layout, using the default dimension names of
4933  * the desired visual roles.
4934  * For example:
4935  * 
4936  * <pre>
4937  * readers: "color, category, category2, size"
4938  * 
4939  * </pre>
4940  * 
4941  * <h4>Solution 3</h4>
4942  * Of course, you can (and probably should) use actual business names for the names of dimensions.
4943  * To that end, both the readers and the visual roles' mappings need to be specified:
4944  * 
4945  * <pre>
4946  * readers:      "orderType, productFamily, productType, sales"
4947  * categoryRole: "productFamily, productType",
4948  * colorRole:    "orderType",
4949  * sizeRole:     "sales"
4950  * 
4951  * </pre>
4952  * 
4953  * @class
4954  * @extends pvc.options.charts.Chart
4955  */
4956 pvc.options.charts.SunburstChart = function(){};
4957         
4958         
4959         
4960         
4961 /**
4962  * The maximum number of 
4963  * <i>small</i> charts that should
4964  * be displayed in a row.
4965  * <p>
4966  * This property can receive a value of 
4967  * <tt>Infinity</tt>
4968  * to indicate that all charts should be laid out in a single row.
4969  * 
4970  * @type number
4971  * @default 3
4972  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
4973  */
4974 pvc.options.charts.SunburstChart.prototype.multiChartColumnsMax = undefined;
4975 /**
4976  * The maximum number of 
4977  * <i>small</i> charts that should
4978  * be displayed.
4979  * <p>
4980  * The first 
4981  * <i>small</i> charts are chosen.
4982  * 
4983  * @type number
4984  * @default Infinity
4985  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
4986  */
4987 pvc.options.charts.SunburstChart.prototype.multiChartMax = undefined;
4988 /**
4989  * The strategy to follow when the resulting multi-chart layout
4990  * does not fit entirely in the initial chart size.
4991  * 
4992  * @type pvc.options.varia.MultiChartOverflow
4993  * @default 'grow'
4994  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
4995  */
4996 pvc.options.charts.SunburstChart.prototype.multiChartOverflow = undefined;
4997 /**
4998  * Indicates that,
4999  * when the layout results in a single column
5000  * and the value of {@link #smallHeight}
5001  * is still to be determined,
5002  * it should be set to all the initially available content height,
5003  * instead of determining the height from the
5004  * {@link #smallAspectRatio} and the {@link #smallWidth}.
5005  * 
5006  * @type boolean
5007  * @default true
5008  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
5009  */
5010 pvc.options.charts.SunburstChart.prototype.multiChartSingleColFillsHeight = undefined;
5011 /**
5012  * Indicates that,
5013  * when the layout results in a single row
5014  * and the value of {@link #smallHeight}
5015  * is still to be determined,
5016  * it should be set to all the initially available content height,
5017  * instead of determining the height from the
5018  * {@link #smallAspectRatio} and the {@link #smallWidth}.
5019  * 
5020  * @type boolean
5021  * @default true
5022  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
5023  */
5024 pvc.options.charts.SunburstChart.prototype.multiChartSingleRowFillsHeight = undefined;
5025 /**
5026  * The ratio of the width over the height of a 
5027  * <i>small</i> chart.
5028  * <p>
5029  * It is used when the set of properties
5030  * {@link #smallWidth},
5031  * {@link #smallHeight},
5032  * {@link #multiChartColumnsMax},
5033  * {@link #multiChartSingleRowFillsHeight} and
5034  * {@link #multiChartSingleColFillsHeight},
5035  * is under-specified and
5036  * is not enough to determine the value of both
5037  * {@link #smallWidth} and
