5038  * {@link #smallHeight}.
5039  * <p>
5040  * The default value of the aspect ratio depends on the chart type,
5041  * but is something around 
5042  * <tt>4/3</tt>.
5043  * 
5044  * @type number
5045  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
5046  */
5047 pvc.options.charts.SunburstChart.prototype.smallAspectRatio = undefined;
5048 /**
5049  * The margins of the 
5050  * <i>content panel</i> of a 
5051  * <i>small</i> chart.
5052  * <p>
5053  * See {@link pvc.options.varia.Sides} for information about
5054  * the different supported data types.
5055  * 
5056  * @type number|string|pvc.options.varia.Sides
5057  * @default 0
5058  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
5059  */
5060 pvc.options.charts.SunburstChart.prototype.smallContentMargins = undefined;
5061 /**
5062  * The paddings of the 
5063  * <i>content panel</i> of a 
5064  * <i>small</i> chart.
5065  * <p>
5066  * See {@link pvc.options.varia.Sides} for information about
5067  * the different supported data types.
5068  * 
5069  * @type number|string|pvc.options.varia.Sides
5070  * @default 0
5071  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
5072  */
5073 pvc.options.charts.SunburstChart.prototype.smallContentPaddings = undefined;
5074 /**
5075  * Fixates the height of each 
5076  * <i>small</i> chart, in pixel units or as a percentage.
5077  * <p>
5078  * A value of type 
5079  * <tt>number</tt>,
5080  * or of type 
5081  * <tt>string</tt>, but with numeric content,
5082  * is interpreted as being in pixel units.
5083  * <p>
5084  * A value of type 
5085  * <tt>string</tt>,
5086  * with numeric content that is suffixed by a "%" character,
5087  * is interpreted as a percentage of the initially available content height.
5088  * <p>
5089  * This property may cause the 
5090  * <i>small multiples</i> chart
5091  * to take up a greater width than the one specified in {@link #height}.
5092  * <p>
5093  * When this property is unspecified,
5094  * its value depends on the evaluation of the
5095  * {@link #smallWidth} property,
5096  * which may impose it a value.
5097  * If after the evaluation of {@link #smallWidth}
5098  * this property remains unspecified,
5099  * it is determined as follows.
5100  * <p>
5101  * If the layout will have a single column
5102  * and the property {@link #multiChartSingleColFillsHeight}
5103  * is 
5104  * <tt>true</tt> (it is by default)
5105  * then the height will be the initially available content height.
5106  * <p>
5107  * If the layout will have a single row
5108  * and the property {@link #multiChartSingleRowFillsHeight}
5109  * is 
5110  * <tt>true</tt> (it is by default)
5111  * then the height will be the initially available content height.
5112  * <p>
5113  * Otherwise, the property {@link #smallAspectRatio} is
5114  * used to determine the height of the small chart from its determined width.
5115  * <p>
5116  * The aspect ratio is defaulted to a value that depends on the chart type,
5117  * but is something around 
5118  * <tt>4/3</tt>.
5119  * 
5120  * @type number|string
5121  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
5122  */
5123 pvc.options.charts.SunburstChart.prototype.smallHeight = undefined;
5124 /**
5125  * The margins of a 
5126  * <i>small</i> chart.
5127  * <p>
5128  * See {@link pvc.options.varia.Sides} for information about
5129  * the different supported data types.
5130  * 
5131  * @type number|string|pvc.options.varia.Sides
5132  * @default '2%'
5133  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
5134  */
5135 pvc.options.charts.SunburstChart.prototype.smallMargins = undefined;
5136 /**
5137  * The paddings of a 
5138  * <i>small</i> chart.
5139  * <p>
5140  * See {@link pvc.options.varia.Sides} for information about
5141  * the different supported data types.
5142  * 
5143  * @type number|string|pvc.options.varia.Sides
5144  * @default 0
5145  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
5146  */
5147 pvc.options.charts.SunburstChart.prototype.smallPaddings = undefined;
5148 /**
5149  * Fixates the width of each 
5150  * <i>small</i> chart, in pixel units or as a percentage.
5151  * <p>
5152  * A value of type 
5153  * <tt>number</tt>,
5154  * or of type 
5155  * <tt>string</tt>, but with numeric content,
5156  * is interpreted as being in pixel units.
5157  * <p>
5158  * A value of type 
5159  * <tt>string</tt>,
5160  * with numeric content that is suffixed by a "%" character,
5161  * is interpreted as a percentage of the initially available content width.
5162  * <p>
5163  * This property may cause the 
5164  * <i>small multiples</i> chart
5165  * to take up a greater width than the one specified in {@link #width}.
5166  * <p>
5167  * When this property is unspecified,
5168  * a specified finite value, or a defaulted value, of the property {@link #multiChartColumnsMax} is
5169  * used to determine it:
5170  * by dividing the initially available content width
5171  * by the maximum number of charts in a row that 
5172  * <i>actually</i> occur
5173  * (so that if there are less small charts than
5174  * the maximum that can be placed in a row,
5175  * these, nevertheless, take up the whole width).
5176  * <p>
5177  * When an infinite value is specified for
5178  * {@link #multiChartColumnsMax},
5179  * the small charts are laid out in a single row,
5180  * and so the width is calculated from the height {@link #smallHeight},
5181  * using the aspect ratio {@link #smallAspectRatio}.
5182  * The height is defaulted to the initially available content height.
5183  * The aspect ratio is defaulted to a value that depends on the chart type,
5184  * but is something around 
5185  * <tt>4/3</tt>.
5186  * The width is then calculated.
5187  * 
5188  * @type number|string
5189  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
5190  */
5191 pvc.options.charts.SunburstChart.prototype.smallWidth = undefined;
5192 /**
5193  * The indexes of columns of the 
5194  * <i>logical table</i> that are to feed the
5195  * default
5196  * 
5197  * <tt>multiChart</tt>,
5198  * 
5199  * <tt>multiChart2</tt>, ...
5200  * dimensions.
5201  * <p>
5202  * See {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart#readers} for related information.
5203  * 
5204  * @type number|string|list(number|string)
5205  * @category Chart > Data Source
5206  */
5207 pvc.options.charts.SunburstChart.prototype.multiChartIndexes = undefined;
5208 /**
5209  * The 
5210  * <tt>multiChart</tt> visual role is a chart-level visual role that
5211  * allows turning a chart into a 
5212  * <i>small multiples</i> chart,
5213  * {@link http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Small_multiple}.
5214  * <p>
5215  * Almost all main chart types support being shown
5216  * as a small multiples chart.
5217  * Currently, the exceptions are the charts:
5218  * 
5219  * <i>Heat Grid</i>,
5220  * 
5221  * <i>Bullet</i>,
5222  * 
5223  * <i>Data Tree</i> and
5224  * 
5225  * <i>Parallel Coordinates</i>.
5226  * <p>
5227  * The 
5228  * <tt>multiChart</tt> visual role
5229  * can be bound to any number of dimensions,
5230  * that are, or will be turned into, discrete.
5231  * <p>
5232  * The 
5233  * <tt>multiChart</tt> visual role automatically binds to
5234  * every dimension whose name has the 
5235  * <tt>multiChart</tt> prefix.
5236  * <p>
5237  * One 
5238  * <i>small</i> chart is generated per
5239  * unique combination of the values of the bound dimensions
5240  * that is present in the source data.
5241  * Each small chart then receives as its data
5242  * the partition of the source data that shares its
5243  * unique combination of values.
5244  * <p>
5245  * See {@link pvc.options.VisualRole}
5246  * for more information on supported data types.
5247  * 
5248  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
5249  * @category Chart > Visual Roles
5250  */
5251 pvc.options.charts.SunburstChart.prototype.multiChartRole = undefined;
5252 /**
5253  * The title panel of the 
5254  * <i>small</i> chart.
5255  * <p>
5256  * The text of the title of small charts is the
5257  * compound label of the data bound to the 
5258  * <tt>multiChart</tt> visual role.
5259  * 
5260  * @type pvc.options.panels.ChartTitlePanel
5261  * @category Panels - Multi
5262  */
5263 pvc.options.charts.SunburstChart.prototype.smallTitle = undefined;
5264 /**
5265  * The first color axis' options.
5266  * <p>
5267  * See {@link pvc.options.axes.ColorAxis}
5268  * for more information on the way that
5269  * the color axes' properties may be accessed.
5270  * 
5271  * @type pvc.options.axes.SunburstColorAxis
5272  * @category Axes
5273  */
5274 pvc.options.charts.SunburstChart.prototype.color = undefined;
5275 /**
5276  * The size axis' options.
5277  * 
5278  * @type pvc.options.axes.SizeAxis
5279  * @category Axes
5280  */
5281 pvc.options.charts.SunburstChart.prototype.sizeAxis = undefined;
5282 /**
5283  * The extension points object contains style definitions for the marks of the plot.
5284  * 
5285  * @type pvc.options.ext.SunburstChartExtensionPoints
5286  * @category Chart
5287  */
5288 pvc.options.charts.SunburstChart.prototype.extensionPoints = undefined;
5289 /**
5290  * This chart type does not support this property.
5291  * 
5292  * @type boolean
5293  * @category Chart > Data
5294  * @constant
5295  */
5296 pvc.options.charts.SunburstChart.prototype.timeSeries = false;
5297 /**
5298  * This chart type does not support this property.
5299  * 
5300  * @type string
5301  * @category Chart > Data
5302  * @constant
5303  */
5304 pvc.options.charts.SunburstChart.prototype.timeSeriesFormat = null;
5305 /**
5306  * The 
5307  * <tt>category</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
5308  * allows grouping data points to form a hierarchy.
5309  * <p>
5310  * This is a shortcut property for the main plot's
5311  * {@link pvc.options.visualRoles.SunburstPlotVisualRoles#category}.
5312  * 
5313  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
5314  * @category Chart > Visual Roles
5315  */
5316 pvc.options.charts.SunburstChart.prototype.categoryRole = undefined;
5317 /**
5318  * The 
5319  * <tt>color</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
5320  * is visually encoded by the color of visual elements.
5321  * <p>
5322  * This is a shortcut property for the main plot's
5323  * {@link pvc.options.visualRoles.SunburstPlotVisualRoles#color}.
5324  * 
5325  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
5326  * @category Chart > Visual Roles
5327  */
5328 pvc.options.charts.SunburstChart.prototype.colorRole = undefined;
5329 /**
5330  * The 
5331  * <tt>size</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
5332  * is visually encoded by the relative angle span amongst sibling slices.
5333  * <p>
5334  * This is a shortcut property for the main plot's
5335  * {@link pvc.options.visualRoles.SunburstPlotVisualRoles#size}.
5336  * 
5337  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
5338  * @category Chart > Visual Roles
5339  */
5340 pvc.options.charts.SunburstChart.prototype.sizeRole = undefined;
5341 /**
5342  * The chart's visual roles map.
5343  * <p>
5344  * See {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart#visualRoles} for more information.
5345  * 
5346  * @type map(string : pvc.options.VisualRole)|pvc.options.visualRoles.SunburstChartVisualRoles
5347  * @category Chart > Visual Roles
5348  */
5349 pvc.options.charts.SunburstChart.prototype.visualRoles = undefined;
5350 /**
5351  * The legend is not supported by this chart type chart.
5352  * 
5353  * @type boolean|pvc.options.panels.LegendPanel
5354  * @category Panels
5355  * @constant
5356  */
5357 pvc.options.charts.SunburstChart.prototype.legend = false;
5358 /**
5359  * The sunburst plot is the 
5360  * <b>main plot</b> of the sunburst chart,
5361  * which means that
5362  * its properties may be used 
5363  * <i>without</i> the "sunburst" property suffix.
5364  * 
5365  * @type pvc.options.plots.SunburstPlot
5366  * @category Plots
5367  */
5368 pvc.options.charts.SunburstChart.prototype.sunburst = undefined;
5369 /**
5370  * The extension points of the sunburst chart type.
5371  * <p>
5372  * Chart extension points can also be specified directly at the chart options level.
5373  * <p>
5374  * To use an extension point you must find its full name, by joining:
5375  * 
5376  * <ol>
5377  * 
5378  * <li>extension property (ex: 
5379  * <tt>smallBase</tt>)</li>
5380  * 
5381  * <li>the "_" character</li>
5382  * 
5383  * <li>extension sub-property (ex: 
5384  * <tt>strokeStyle</tt>)</li>
5385  * </ol>
5386  * and obtaining, for the examples, the camel-cased name: 
5387  * <tt>smallBase_strokeStyle</tt>
5388  * (see {@link http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CamelCase}).
5389  * 
5390  * @class
5391  * @extends pvc.options.ext.ChartExtensionPoints
5392  */
5393 pvc.options.ext.SunburstChartExtensionPoints = function(){};
5394         
5395         
5396         
5397         
5398 /**
5399  * The extension point of the multi-chart overflow/clip marker.
5400  * 
5401  * @type pvc.options.marks.DotExtensionPoint
5402  * @category Chart - Multi
5403  */
5404 pvc.options.ext.SunburstChartExtensionPoints.prototype.multiChartOverflowMarker = undefined;
5405 /**
5406  * The extension point of the base (root) panel of the 
5407  * <i>small</i> charts.
5408  * 
5409  * @type pvc.options.marks.PanelExtensionPoint
5410  * @category Chart - Multi
5411  */
5412 pvc.options.ext.SunburstChartExtensionPoints.prototype.smallBase = undefined;
5413 /**
5414  * The extension point of the content panel of the 
5415  * <i>small</i> charts.
5416  * <p>
5417  * The content panel is a child of the base panel.
5418  * 
5419  * @type pvc.options.marks.PanelExtensionPoint
5420  * @category Chart - Multi
5421  */
5422 pvc.options.ext.SunburstChartExtensionPoints.prototype.smallContent = undefined;
5423 /**
5424  * The visual roles options class of the sunburst chart type.
5425  * 
5426  * @class
5427  * @extends pvc.options.visualRoles.BasicChartVisualRoles
5428  */
5429 pvc.options.visualRoles.SunburstChartVisualRoles = function(){};
5430         
5431         
5432         
5433         
5434 /**
5435  * The 
5436  * <tt>multiChart</tt> visual role is a chart-level visual role that
5437  * allows turning a chart into a 
5438  * <i>small multiples</i> chart,
5439  * {@link http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Small_multiple}.
5440  * <p>
5441  * Almost all main chart types support being shown
5442  * as a small multiples chart.
5443  * Currently, the exceptions are the charts:
5444  * 
5445  * <i>Heat Grid</i>,
5446  * 
5447  * <i>Bullet</i>,
5448  * 
5449  * <i>Data Tree</i> and
5450  * 
5451  * <i>Parallel Coordinates</i>.
5452  * <p>
5453  * The 
5454  * <tt>multiChart</tt> visual role
5455  * can be bound to any number of dimensions,
5456  * that are, or will be turned into, discrete.
5457  * <p>
5458  * The 
5459  * <tt>multiChart</tt> visual role automatically binds to
5460  * every dimension whose name has the 
5461  * <tt>multiChart</tt> prefix.
5462  * <p>
5463  * One 
5464  * <i>small</i> chart is generated per
5465  * unique combination of the values of the bound dimensions
5466  * that is present in the source data.
5467  * Each small chart then receives as its data
5468  * the partition of the source data that shares its
5469  * unique combination of values.
5470  * <p>
5471  * See {@link pvc.options.VisualRole}
5472  * for more information on supported data types.
5473  * 
5474  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
5475  * @category Chart > Visual Roles
5476  */
5477 pvc.options.visualRoles.SunburstChartVisualRoles.prototype.multiChart = undefined;
5478 /**
5479  * The options documentation class of the 
5480  * <b>Sunburst</b> plot.
5481  * 
5482  * @class
5483  * @extends pvc.options.plots.Plot
5484  */
5485 pvc.options.plots.SunburstPlot = function(){};
5486         
5487         
5488         
5489         
5490 /**
5491  * The index of the color axis to use for the plot.
5492  * 
5493  * @type number
5494  * @category Axes
5495  * @constant
5496  */
5497 pvc.options.plots.SunburstPlot.prototype.colorAxis = 1;
5498 /**
5499  * Controls how colors are drawn from the color scale to paint visual elements.
5500  * 
5501  * @type pvc.options.varia.SunburstColorMode
5502  * @default 'fan'
5503  * @category Style
5504  */
5505 pvc.options.plots.SunburstPlot.prototype.colorMode = undefined;
5506 /**
5507  * Defines a label to use for empty slices.
5508  * Only applicable if {@link pvc.options.plots.SunburstPlot#emptySlicesVisible} is 
5509  * <tt>true</tt>.
5510  * 
5511  * @type string
5512  * @category Style
5513  */
5514 pvc.options.plots.SunburstPlot.prototype.emptySlicesLabel = undefined;
5515 /**
5516  * Indicates if empty slices should be shown.
5517  * Shown empty slices will have the same color as their parent slice.
5518  * 
5519  * @type boolean
5520  * @default false
5521  * @category Style
5522  */
5523 pvc.options.plots.SunburstPlot.prototype.emptySlicesVisible = undefined;
5524 /**
5525  * The extension points object
5526  * contains style definitions for
5527  * various visual elements of the chart.
5528  * 
5529  * @type pvc.options.ext.SunburstPlotExtensionPoints
5530  * @category Style
5531  */
5532 pvc.options.plots.SunburstPlot.prototype.extensionPoints = undefined;
5533 /**
5534  * The slices' layout order.
5535  * 
5536  * @type pvc.options.varia.SliceOrder
5537  * @category Style
5538  */
5539 pvc.options.plots.SunburstPlot.prototype.sliceOrder = undefined;
5540 /**
5541  * The sunburst's value label is always anchored to the center of the associated slice.
5542  * 
5543  * @type pvc.options.varia.MarkAnchor
5544  * @category Style
5545  * @constant
5546  */
5547 pvc.options.plots.SunburstPlot.prototype.valuesAnchor = 'center';
5548 /**
5549  * Indicates if legibility of value labels should be optimized.
5550  * <p>
5551  * The current algorithm varies the text color so that it has enough contrast
5552  * for the known background color.
5553  * <p>
5554  * It is applied only when a value label is considered to be 
5555  * <i>inside</i> its
5556  * associated slice. Presently, it is considered to be inside, if the center point
5557  * of the label is within the bounds of the slice.
5558  * 
5559  * @type boolean
5560  * @default true
5561  * @category Style
5562  */
5563 pvc.options.plots.SunburstPlot.prototype.valuesOptimizeLegibility = undefined;
5564 /**
5565  * The behavior to apply when the text of a value label does not fit within the bounds of its associated slice.
5566  * <p>
5567  * This option applies only when {@link pvc.options.plots.Plot#valuesVisible} is true.
5568  * <p>
5569  * Moreover, it also applies only for certain configurations of value label placement,
5570  * relative to the associated slice. Presently, the supported placements are:
5571  * 
5572  * <ul>
5573  * 
5574  * <li>
5575  * <b>non-negative text margin</b>,
5576  * {@link pvc.options.marks.LabelExtensionPoint#textMargin}.
5577  * </li>
5578  * 
5579  * <li>
5580  * <b>text align is center</b> —
5581  * {@link pvc.options.marks.LabelExtensionPoint#textAlign}
5582  * is
5583  * {@link pvc.options.varia.TextAlignment#Center},
5584  * </li>
5585  * 
5586  * <li>
5587  * <b>text is aligned with the middle angle of the slice</b> —
5588  * the label has a
5589  * {@link pvc.options.marks.LabelExtensionPoint#textAngle}
5590  * (modulo) equal to the middle angle of the slice.
5591  * </li>
5592  * </ul>
5593  * <p>
5594  * When an unsupported placement occurs, the label is shown.
5595  * <p>
5596  * Note that for the purposes of hiding and trimming,
5597  * the value of {@link pvc.options.marks.LabelExtensionPoint#textMargin}
5598  * is used for more that the distance between the anchor points of the label and the slice.
5599  * It is also included as a required margin at the opposite side of the
5600  * configured text alignment.
5601  * Also, half of the text margin is included on the bottom and top sides.
5602  * 
5603  * @type pvc.options.varia.ValuesOverflow
5604  * @default 'hide'
5605  * @category Style
5606  */
5607 pvc.options.plots.SunburstPlot.prototype.valuesOverflow = undefined;
5608 /**
5609  * Indicates if value labels are shown next to the visual elements.
5610  * 
5611  * @type boolean
5612  * @default true
5613  * @category Style
5614  */
5615 pvc.options.plots.SunburstPlot.prototype.valuesVisible = undefined;
5616 /**
5617  * The plot's visual roles map.
5618  * <p>
5619  * See {@link pvc.options.plots.BasicPlot#visualRoles} for more information.
5620  * 
5621  * @type map(string : pvc.options.VisualRole)|pvc.options.visualRoles.SunburstPlotVisualRoles
5622  * @category Visual Roles
5623  */
5624 pvc.options.plots.SunburstPlot.prototype.visualRoles = undefined;
5625 /**
5626  * The extension points of the sunburst plot type.
5627  * <p>
5628  * Plot extension points can be specified:
5629  * 
5630  * <ul>
5631  * 
5632  * <li>at the plot level, in the 
5633  * <i>extensionPoints</i> property,
5634  * without need to prefix the extension point with the
5635  * plot id or name.
5636  * </li>
5637  * 
5638  * <li>at the plot options level, directly,
5639  * without need to prefix the extension point with the
5640  * plot id or name.
5641  * </li>
5642  * 
5643  * <li>
5644  * if it is an internal plot (
5645  * <i>main</i>, 
5646  * <i>plot2</i> or 
5647  * <i>trend</i>),
5648  * at the chart options level, directly.
5649  * </li>
5650  * </ul>
5651  * <p>
5652  * To use an extension point you must find its full name, by joining:
5653  * 
5654  * <ol>
5655  * 
5656  * <li>plot property name (ex: 
5657  * <tt>sunburst</tt>)</li>
5658  * 
5659  * <li>extension property (ex: 
5660  * <tt>leaf</tt>)</li>
5661  * 
5662  * <li>the "_" character</li>
5663  * 
5664  * <li>extension sub-property (ex: 
5665  * <tt>strokeStyle</tt>)</li>
5666  * </ol>
5667  * and obtaining, for the examples, the camel-cased name: 
5668  * <tt>sunburstLeaf_strokeStyle</tt>
5669  * (see {@link http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CamelCase}).
5670  * <p>
5671  * The extension points of the 
5672  * <i>main plot</i> of a chart
5673  * may be used without the plot property name prefix.
5674  * In the example, when the 
5675  * <tt>sunburst</tt> plot is the main plot,
5676  * the extension point can be written as 
5677  * <tt>leaf_strokeStyle</tt>.
5678  * 
5679  * @class
5680  */
5681 pvc.options.ext.SunburstPlotExtensionPoints = function(){};
5682         
5683         
5684         
5685         
5686 /**
5687  * The extension point of the value label mark.
5688  * 
5689  * @type pvc.options.marks.LabelExtensionPoint
5690  */
5691 pvc.options.ext.SunburstPlotExtensionPoints.prototype.label = undefined;
5692 /**
5693  * The extension point of the plot panel.
5694  * 
5695  * @type pvc.options.marks.PanelExtensionPoint
5696  */
5697 pvc.options.ext.SunburstPlotExtensionPoints.prototype.panel = undefined;
5698 /**
5699  * The extension point of the slices.
5700  * 
5701  * @type pvc.options.marks.WedgeExtensionPoint
5702  */
5703 pvc.options.ext.SunburstPlotExtensionPoints.prototype.slice = undefined;
5704 /**
5705  * The visual roles options class of the sunburst plot type.
5706  * 
5707  * @class
5708  * @extends pvc.options.visualRoles.BasicPlotVisualRoles
5709  */
5710 pvc.options.visualRoles.SunburstPlotVisualRoles = function(){};
5711         
5712         
5713         
5714         
5715 /**
5716  * The 
5717  * <tt>category</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
5718  * allows grouping data points to form a hierarchy.
5719  * <p>
5720  * In the sunburst plot, each 
5721  * <tt>category</tt> dimension is represented as a ring of slices.
5722  * <p>
5723  * The 
5724  * <tt>category</tt> visual role automatically binds to
5725  * every dimension whose name has the 
5726  * <tt>category</tt> prefix.
5727  * <p>
5728  * The visual role is required and discrete.
5729  * <p>
5730  * See {@link pvc.options.VisualRole}
5731  * for more information on supported data types.
5732  * 
5733  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
5734  * @category Visual Roles
5735  */
5736 pvc.options.visualRoles.SunburstPlotVisualRoles.prototype.category = undefined;
5737 /**
5738  * The 
5739  * <tt>color</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
5740  * is visually encoded by the color of visual elements.
5741  * <p>
5742  * The 
5743  * <tt>color</tt> visual role automatically binds to
5744  * every dimension whose name has the 
5745  * <tt>color</tt> prefix
5746  * or, if none exists,
5747  * the dimensions of the "category" role.
5748  * <p>
5749  * The 
5750  * <tt>color</tt> visual role is optional and discrete.
5751  * <p>
5752  * See {@link pvc.options.VisualRole}
5753  * for more information on supported data types.
5754  * 
5755  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
5756  * @category Visual Roles
5757  */
5758 pvc.options.visualRoles.SunburstPlotVisualRoles.prototype.color = undefined;
5759 /**
5760  * The 
5761  * <tt>size</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
5762  * is visually encoded by the relative angle span amongst sibling slices.
5763  * <p>
5764  * The 
5765  * <tt>size</tt> visual role automatically binds to
5766  * a single dimension whose name has the 
5767  * <tt>size</tt> prefix.
5768  * <p>
5769  * The 
5770  * <tt>size</tt> visual role is optional and numeric.
5771  * <p>
5772  * See {@link pvc.options.VisualRole}
5773  * for more information on supported data types.
5774  * 
5775  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
5776  * @category Visual Roles
5777  */
5778 pvc.options.visualRoles.SunburstPlotVisualRoles.prototype.size = undefined;
5779 /**
5780  * The common options documentation class for the 
5781  * <b>Cartesian</b> charts.
5782  * <p>
5783  * For information on the supported 
5784  * <b>data formats</b>
5785  * see {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart}.
5786  * 
5787  * @class
5788  * @extends pvc.options.charts.Chart
5789  * @abstract
5790  */
5791 pvc.options.charts.CartesianChart = function(){};
5792         
5793         
5794         
5795         
5796 /**
5797  * The base cartesian axis panel options.
5798  * <p>
5799  * When the chart {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart#orientation}
5800  * is 
5801  * <tt>vertical</tt> the base axis is laid out horizontally.
5802  * <p>
5803  * See {@link pvc.options.axes.CartesianAxis}
5804  * to know the additional names by which a cartesian axis can be referred to.
5805  * 
5806  * @type pvc.options.axes.CartesianAxis
5807  * @category Axes
5808  */
5809 pvc.options.charts.CartesianChart.prototype.baseAxis = undefined;
5810 /**
5811  * The orthogonal cartesian axis panel options.
5812  * <p>
5813  * When the chart {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart#orientation}
5814  * is 
5815  * <tt>vertical</tt> the orthogonal axis is laid out vertically.
5816  * <p>
5817  * See {@link pvc.options.axes.CartesianAxis}
5818  * to know the additional names by which a cartesian axis can be referred to.
5819  * 
5820  * @type pvc.options.axes.CartesianAxis
5821  * @category Axes
5822  */
5823 pvc.options.charts.CartesianChart.prototype.orthoAxis = undefined;
5824 /**
5825  * 
5826  * Indicates whether the 
5827  * <tt>x</tt> axis panel is shown.
5828  * 
5829  * @deprecated 
5830  * Use {@link pvc.options.axes.CartesianAxis#visible},
5831  * of the 
5832  * <tt>x</tt> axis, instead.
5833  * 
5834  * @type boolean
5835  * @default true
5836  * @category Axes
5837  */
5838 pvc.options.charts.CartesianChart.prototype.showXScale = undefined;
5839 /**
5840  * 
5841  * Indicates whether the 
5842  * <tt>y</tt> axis panel is shown.
5843  * 
5844  * @deprecated 
5845  * Use {@link pvc.options.axes.CartesianAxis#visible},
5846  * of the 
5847  * <tt>y</tt> axis, instead.
5848  * 
5849  * @type boolean
5850  * @default true
5851  * @category Axes
5852  */
5853 pvc.options.charts.CartesianChart.prototype.showYScale = undefined;
5854 /**
5855  * The extension points object contains style definitions for
5856  * the marks of the chart.
5857  * 
5858  * @type pvc.options.ext.CartesianChartExtensionPoints
5859  * @category Chart
5860  */
5861 pvc.options.charts.CartesianChart.prototype.extensionPoints = undefined;
5862 /**
5863  * Indicates what is to be done with content that overflows in leaf charts.
5864  * 
5865  * @type pvc.options.varia.ContentOverflow
5866  * @default 'auto'
5867  * @category Chart > Layout
5868  */
5869 pvc.options.charts.CartesianChart.prototype.leafContentOverflow = undefined;
5870 /**
5871  * Indicates whether the plot frame is drawn
5872  * in leaf charts.
5873  * <p>
5874  * The plot frame covers the plot panel but stays
5875  * aligned with and below the axes' rules.
5876  * <p>
5877  * The root of a small multiples chart does not have a plot frame.
5878  * 
5879  * @type boolean
5880  * @default true
5881  * @category Chart > Style
5882  */
5883 pvc.options.charts.CartesianChart.prototype.plotFrameVisible = undefined;
5884 /**
5885  * The 
5886  * <tt>color</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
5887  * is visually encoded by the color of visual elements.
5888  * <p>
5889  * This is a shortcut property for the main plot's
5890  * {@link pvc.options.visualRoles.CartesianPlotVisualRoles#color}.
5891  * 
5892  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
5893  * @category Chart > Visual Roles
5894  */
5895 pvc.options.charts.CartesianChart.prototype.colorRole = undefined;
5896 /**
5897  * The 
5898  * <tt>series</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that represents a
5899  * 
5900  * <i>series</i> of connected data points.
5901  * <p>
5902  * This is a shortcut property for the main plot's
5903  * {@link pvc.options.visualRoles.CartesianPlotVisualRoles#series}.
5904  * 
5905  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
5906  * @category Chart > Visual Roles
5907  */
5908 pvc.options.charts.CartesianChart.prototype.seriesRole = undefined;
5909 /**
5910  * An array of cartesian plots.
5911  * <p>
5912  * All the cartesian plots can be used together,
5913  * from within a cartesian 
5914  * <i>chart</i> class,
5915  * as long as their axes, notably 
5916  * <i>base</i> and 
5917  * <i>ortho</i>,
5918  * are encoding compatible visual roles.
5919  * <p>
5920  * See  {@link pvc.options.charts.Chart} for additional information.
5921  * 
5922  * @type list(pvc.options.plots.CartesianPlot)
5923  * @category Plots
5924  */
5925 pvc.options.charts.CartesianChart.prototype.plots = undefined;
5926 /**
5927  * The extension points common to all cartesian chart types.
5928  * <p>
5929  * Chart extension points can also be specified directly at the chart options level.
5930  * 
5931  * @class
5932  * @extends pvc.options.ext.ChartExtensionPoints
5933  */
5934 pvc.options.ext.CartesianChartExtensionPoints = function(){};
5935         
5936         
5937         
5938         
5939 /**
5940  * The extension point of the 
5941  * <i>plot area background</i> of cartesian charts.
5942  * <p>
5943  * The plot background is placed below the plot panel(s)
5944  * and below the axis grid-lines.
5945  * <p>
5946  * This extension point is intended, primarily, to be able to change the
5947  * background color below multiple plots,
5948  * without hiding the axes grid-lines.
5949  * <p>
5950  * The root of a small multiples chart does not have a 
5951  * <i>plot area background</i>.
5952  * 
5953  * @type pvc.options.marks.PanelExtensionPoint
5954  */
5955 pvc.options.ext.CartesianChartExtensionPoints.prototype.plotBg = undefined;
5956 /**
5957  * The extension point of the plot frame of the charts.
5958  * <p>
5959  * The plot frame covers the plot panel(s) but stays
5960  * aligned with and below the axes' rules.
5961  * <p>
5962  * The root of a small multiples chart does not have a plot frame.
5963  * 
5964  * @type pvc.options.marks.PanelExtensionPoint
5965  */
5966 pvc.options.ext.CartesianChartExtensionPoints.prototype.plotFrame = undefined;
5967 /**
5968  * The common options documentation class of 
5969  * <b>cartesian</b> plot types.
5970  * 
5971  * @class
5972  * @extends pvc.options.plots.Plot
5973  * @abstract
5974  */
5975 pvc.options.plots.CartesianPlot = function(){};
5976         
5977         
5978         
5979         
5980 /**
5981  * The plot's visual roles map.
5982  * <p>
5983  * See {@link pvc.options.plots.BasicPlot#visualRoles} for more information.
5984  * 
5985  * @type map(string : pvc.options.VisualRole)|pvc.options.visualRoles.CartesianPlotVisualRoles
5986  * @category Visual Roles
5987  */
5988 pvc.options.plots.CartesianPlot.prototype.visualRoles = undefined;
5989 /**
5990  * The visual roles options class of cartesian plot types.
5991  * 
5992  * @class
5993  * @extends pvc.options.visualRoles.BasicPlotVisualRoles
5994  */
5995 pvc.options.visualRoles.CartesianPlotVisualRoles = function(){};
5996         
5997         
5998         
5999         
6000 /**
6001  * The 
6002  * <tt>color</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
6003  * is visually encoded by the color of visual elements.
6004  * <p>
6005  * The 
6006  * <tt>color</tt> visual role automatically binds to
6007  * every dimension whose name has the 
6008  * <tt>color</tt> prefix
6009  * or, if none exists,
6010  * the dimensions of the "series" visual role.
6011  * <p>
6012  * The 
6013  * <tt>color</tt> visual role is discrete.
6014  * <p>
6015  * See {@link pvc.options.VisualRole}
6016  * for more information on supported data types.
6017  * 
6018  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
6019  * @category Visual Roles
6020  */
6021 pvc.options.visualRoles.CartesianPlotVisualRoles.prototype.color = undefined;
6022 /**
6023  * The 
6024  * <tt>series</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that represents a
6025  * 
6026  * <i>series</i> of connected data points.
6027  * <p>
6028  * Most cartesian charts represent graphically
6029  * the connectedness of data points of a given series in some way,
6030  * by connecting points with a line,
6031  * by giving them all the same color,
6032  * or, simply,
6033  * by the order in which they are drawn,
6034  * and when overlapped, some stay on top of others.
6035  * <p>
6036  * The 
6037  * <tt>series</tt> visual role automatically binds to
6038  * every dimension whose name has the 
6039  * <tt>series</tt> prefix.
6040  * <p>
6041  * The visual role itself is optional,
6042  * yet, when unbound,
6043  * a dimension with a "series" prefix
6044  * is automatically created for it,
6045  * and all datums will have the value 
6046  * <tt>null</tt>
6047  * in that dimension.
6048  * <p>
6049  * See {@link pvc.options.VisualRole}
6050  * for more information on supported data types.
6051  * 
6052  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
6053  * @category Visual Roles
6054  */
6055 pvc.options.visualRoles.CartesianPlotVisualRoles.prototype.series = undefined;
6056 /**
6057  * The common options documentation class of 
6058  * <b>Categorical</b> charts.
6059  * <p>
6060  * For information on the supported 
6061  * <b>data formats</b>
6062  * see {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart}.
6063  * 
6064  * @class
6065  * @extends pvc.options.charts.CartesianChart
6066  * @abstract
6067  */
6068 pvc.options.charts.CategoricalChart = function(){};
6069         
6070         
6071         
6072         
6073 /**
6074  * The 
6075  * <tt>category</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
6076  * represents a generic 
6077  * <i>logical grouping</i> of the data points.
6078  * <p>
6079  * This is a shortcut property for the main plot's
6080  * {@link pvc.options.visualRoles.CategoricalPlotVisualRoles#category}.
6081  * 
6082  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
6083  * @category Chart > Visual Roles
6084  */
6085 pvc.options.charts.CategoricalChart.prototype.categoryRole = undefined;
6086 /**
6087  * The common options documentation class of 
6088  * <b>categorical</b> plot types.
6089  * 
6090  * @class
6091  * @extends pvc.options.plots.CartesianPlot
6092  * @abstract
6093  */
6094 pvc.options.plots.CategoricalPlot = function(){};
6095         
6096         
6097         
6098         
6099 /**
6100  * The plot's visual roles map.
6101  * <p>
6102  * See {@link pvc.options.plots.BasicPlot#visualRoles} for more information.
6103  * 
6104  * @type map(string : pvc.options.VisualRole)|pvc.options.visualRoles.CategoricalPlotVisualRoles
6105  * @category Visual Roles
6106  */
6107 pvc.options.plots.CategoricalPlot.prototype.visualRoles = undefined;
6108 /**
6109  * The visual roles options class of categorical plot types.
6110  * 
6111  * @class
6112  * @extends pvc.options.visualRoles.CartesianPlotVisualRoles
6113  */
6114 pvc.options.visualRoles.CategoricalPlotVisualRoles = function(){};
6115         
6116         
6117         
6118         
6119 /**
6120  * The 
6121  * <tt>category</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
6122  * represents a generic 
6123  * <i>logical grouping</i> of the data points.
6124  * <p>
6125  * Category data may be discrete or continuous.
6126  * The relevant characteristic is that
6127  * data with equal category values is grouped and
6128  * summarized in some way.
6129  * <p>
6130  * So,
6131  * if more that one data point exists for a given
6132  * series and category values combination,
6133  * nevertheless,
6134  * only one visual element is generated for the whole group.
6135  * <p>
6136  * Some chart types support
6137  * showing continuous category types, in a continuous scale.
6138  * Others,
6139  * turn continuous dimension types bound to the 
6140  * <tt>category</tt>
6141  * visual role into discrete dimension types,
6142  * and then show the continuous categories in a discrete scale.
6143  * <p>
6144  * The 
6145  * <tt>category</tt> visual role automatically binds to
6146  * every dimension whose name has the 
6147  * <tt>category</tt> prefix.
6148  * <p>
6149  * The visual role itself is optional,
6150  * yet, when unbound,
6151  * a dimension with a "category" prefix
6152  * is automatically created for it,
6153  * and all datums will have the value 
6154  * <tt>null</tt>
6155  * in that dimension.
6156  * <p>
6157  * See {@link pvc.options.VisualRole}
6158  * for more information on supported data types.
6159  * 
6160  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
6161  * @category Visual Roles
6162  */
6163 pvc.options.visualRoles.CategoricalPlotVisualRoles.prototype.category = undefined;
6164 /**
6165  * The common options documentation class of 
6166  * <b>Categorical</b> charts with a 
6167  * <i>continuous-numeric orthogonal axis</i>.
6168  * <p>
6169  * For information on the supported 
6170  * <b>data formats</b>
6171  * see {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart}.
6172  * 
6173  * @class
6174  * @extends pvc.options.charts.CategoricalChart
6175  * @abstract
6176  */
6177 pvc.options.charts.CategoricalNumericChart = function(){};
6178         
6179         
6180         
6181         
6182 /**
6183  * The maximum number of 
6184  * <i>small</i> charts that should
6185  * be displayed in a row.
6186  * <p>
6187  * This property can receive a value of 
6188  * <tt>Infinity</tt>
6189  * to indicate that all charts should be laid out in a single row.
6190  * 
6191  * @type number
6192  * @default 3
6193  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
6194  */
6195 pvc.options.charts.CategoricalNumericChart.prototype.multiChartColumnsMax = undefined;
6196 /**
6197  * The maximum number of 
6198  * <i>small</i> charts that should
6199  * be displayed.
6200  * <p>
6201  * The first 
6202  * <i>small</i> charts are chosen.
6203  * 
6204  * @type number
6205  * @default Infinity
6206  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
6207  */
6208 pvc.options.charts.CategoricalNumericChart.prototype.multiChartMax = undefined;
6209 /**
6210  * The strategy to follow when the resulting multi-chart layout
6211  * does not fit entirely in the initial chart size.
6212  * 
6213  * @type pvc.options.varia.MultiChartOverflow
6214  * @default 'grow'
6215  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
6216  */
6217 pvc.options.charts.CategoricalNumericChart.prototype.multiChartOverflow = undefined;
6218 /**
6219  * Indicates that,
6220  * when the layout results in a single column
6221  * and the value of {@link #smallHeight}
6222  * is still to be determined,
6223  * it should be set to all the initially available content height,
6224  * instead of determining the height from the
6225  * {@link #smallAspectRatio} and the {@link #smallWidth}.
6226  * 
6227  * @type boolean
6228  * @default true
6229  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
6230  */
6231 pvc.options.charts.CategoricalNumericChart.prototype.multiChartSingleColFillsHeight = undefined;
6232 /**
6233  * Indicates that,
6234  * when the layout results in a single row
6235  * and the value of {@link #smallHeight}
6236  * is still to be determined,
6237  * it should be set to all the initially available content height,
6238  * instead of determining the height from the
6239  * {@link #smallAspectRatio} and the {@link #smallWidth}.
6240  * 
6241  * @type boolean
6242  * @default true
6243  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
6244  */
6245 pvc.options.charts.CategoricalNumericChart.prototype.multiChartSingleRowFillsHeight = undefined;
6246 /**
6247  * The ratio of the width over the height of a 
6248  * <i>small</i> chart.
6249  * <p>
6250  * It is used when the set of properties
6251  * {@link #smallWidth},
6252  * {@link #smallHeight},
6253  * {@link #multiChartColumnsMax},
6254  * {@link #multiChartSingleRowFillsHeight} and
6255  * {@link #multiChartSingleColFillsHeight},
6256  * is under-specified and
6257  * is not enough to determine the value of both
6258  * {@link #smallWidth} and
6259  * {@link #smallHeight}.
6260  * <p>
6261  * The default value of the aspect ratio depends on the chart type,
6262  * but is something around 
6263  * <tt>4/3</tt>.
6264  * 
6265  * @type number
6266  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
6267  */
6268 pvc.options.charts.CategoricalNumericChart.prototype.smallAspectRatio = undefined;
6269 /**
6270  * The margins of the 
6271  * <i>content panel</i> of a 
6272  * <i>small</i> chart.
6273  * <p>
6274  * See {@link pvc.options.varia.Sides} for information about
6275  * the different supported data types.
6276  * 
6277  * @type number|string|pvc.options.varia.Sides
6278  * @default 0
6279  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
6280  */
6281 pvc.options.charts.CategoricalNumericChart.prototype.smallContentMargins = undefined;
6282 /**
6283  * The paddings of the 
6284  * <i>content panel</i> of a 
6285  * <i>small</i> chart.
6286  * <p>
6287  * See {@link pvc.options.varia.Sides} for information about
6288  * the different supported data types.
6289  * 
6290  * @type number|string|pvc.options.varia.Sides
6291  * @default 0
6292  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
6293  */
6294 pvc.options.charts.CategoricalNumericChart.prototype.smallContentPaddings = undefined;
6295 /**
6296  * Fixates the height of each 
6297  * <i>small</i> chart, in pixel units or as a percentage.
6298  * <p>
6299  * A value of type 
6300  * <tt>number</tt>,
6301  * or of type 
6302  * <tt>string</tt>, but with numeric content,
6303  * is interpreted as being in pixel units.
6304  * <p>
6305  * A value of type 
6306  * <tt>string</tt>,
6307  * with numeric content that is suffixed by a "%" character,
6308  * is interpreted as a percentage of the initially available content height.
6309  * <p>
6310  * This property may cause the 
6311  * <i>small multiples</i> chart
6312  * to take up a greater width than the one specified in {@link #height}.
6313  * <p>
6314  * When this property is unspecified,
6315  * its value depends on the evaluation of the
6316  * {@link #smallWidth} property,
6317  * which may impose it a value.
6318  * If after the evaluation of {@link #smallWidth}
6319  * this property remains unspecified,
6320  * it is determined as follows.
6321  * <p>
6322  * If the layout will have a single column
6323  * and the property {@link #multiChartSingleColFillsHeight}
6324  * is 
6325  * <tt>true</tt> (it is by default)
6326  * then the height will be the initially available content height.
6327  * <p>
6328  * If the layout will have a single row
6329  * and the property {@link #multiChartSingleRowFillsHeight}
6330  * is 
6331  * <tt>true</tt> (it is by default)
6332  * then the height will be the initially available content height.
6333  * <p>
6334  * Otherwise, the property {@link #smallAspectRatio} is
6335  * used to determine the height of the small chart from its determined width.
6336  * <p>
6337  * The aspect ratio is defaulted to a value that depends on the chart type,
6338  * but is something around 
6339  * <tt>4/3</tt>.
6340  * 
6341  * @type number|string
6342  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
6343  */
6344 pvc.options.charts.CategoricalNumericChart.prototype.smallHeight = undefined;
6345 /**
6346  * The margins of a 
6347  * <i>small</i> chart.
6348  * <p>
6349  * See {@link pvc.options.varia.Sides} for information about
6350  * the different supported data types.
6351  * 
6352  * @type number|string|pvc.options.varia.Sides
6353  * @default '2%'
6354  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
6355  */
6356 pvc.options.charts.CategoricalNumericChart.prototype.smallMargins = undefined;
6357 /**
6358  * The paddings of a 
6359  * <i>small</i> chart.
6360  * <p>
6361  * See {@link pvc.options.varia.Sides} for information about
6362  * the different supported data types.
6363  * 
6364  * @type number|string|pvc.options.varia.Sides
6365  * @default 0
6366  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
6367  */
6368 pvc.options.charts.CategoricalNumericChart.prototype.smallPaddings = undefined;
6369 /**
6370  * Fixates the width of each 
6371  * <i>small</i> chart, in pixel units or as a percentage.
6372  * <p>
6373  * A value of type 
6374  * <tt>number</tt>,
6375  * or of type 
6376  * <tt>string</tt>, but with numeric content,
6377  * is interpreted as being in pixel units.
6378  * <p>
6379  * A value of type 
6380  * <tt>string</tt>,
6381  * with numeric content that is suffixed by a "%" character,
6382  * is interpreted as a percentage of the initially available content width.
6383  * <p>
6384  * This property may cause the 
6385  * <i>small multiples</i> chart
6386  * to take up a greater width than the one specified in {@link #width}.
6387  * <p>
6388  * When this property is unspecified,
6389  * a specified finite value, or a defaulted value, of the property {@link #multiChartColumnsMax} is
6390  * used to determine it:
6391  * by dividing the initially available content width
6392  * by the maximum number of charts in a row that 
6393  * <i>actually</i> occur
6394  * (so that if there are less small charts than
6395  * the maximum that can be placed in a row,
6396  * these, nevertheless, take up the whole width).
6397  * <p>
6398  * When an infinite value is specified for
6399  * {@link #multiChartColumnsMax},
6400  * the small charts are laid out in a single row,
6401  * and so the width is calculated from the height {@link #smallHeight},
6402  * using the aspect ratio {@link #smallAspectRatio}.
6403  * The height is defaulted to the initially available content height.
6404  * The aspect ratio is defaulted to a value that depends on the chart type,
6405  * but is something around 
6406  * <tt>4/3</tt>.
6407  * The width is then calculated.
6408  * 
6409  * @type number|string
6410  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
6411  */
6412 pvc.options.charts.CategoricalNumericChart.prototype.smallWidth = undefined;
6413 /**
6414  * The indexes of columns of the 
6415  * <i>logical table</i> that are to feed the
6416  * default
6417  * 
6418  * <tt>multiChart</tt>,
6419  * 
6420  * <tt>multiChart2</tt>, ...
6421  * dimensions.
6422  * <p>
6423  * See {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart#readers} for related information.
6424  * 
6425  * @type number|string|list(number|string)
6426  * @category Chart > Data Source
6427  */
6428 pvc.options.charts.CategoricalNumericChart.prototype.multiChartIndexes = undefined;
6429 /**
6430  * The 
6431  * <tt>multiChart</tt> visual role is a chart-level visual role that
6432  * allows turning a chart into a 
6433  * <i>small multiples</i> chart,
6434  * {@link http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Small_multiple}.
6435  * <p>
6436  * Almost all main chart types support being shown
6437  * as a small multiples chart.
6438  * Currently, the exceptions are the charts:
6439  * 
6440  * <i>Heat Grid</i>,
6441  * 
6442  * <i>Bullet</i>,
6443  * 
6444  * <i>Data Tree</i> and
6445  * 
6446  * <i>Parallel Coordinates</i>.
6447  * <p>
6448  * The 
6449  * <tt>multiChart</tt> visual role
6450  * can be bound to any number of dimensions,
6451  * that are, or will be turned into, discrete.
6452  * <p>
6453  * The 
6454  * <tt>multiChart</tt> visual role automatically binds to
6455  * every dimension whose name has the 
6456  * <tt>multiChart</tt> prefix.
6457  * <p>
6458  * One 
6459  * <i>small</i> chart is generated per
6460  * unique combination of the values of the bound dimensions
6461  * that is present in the source data.
6462  * Each small chart then receives as its data
6463  * the partition of the source data that shares its
6464  * unique combination of values.
6465  * <p>
6466  * See {@link pvc.options.VisualRole}
6467  * for more information on supported data types.
6468  * 
6469  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
6470  * @category Chart > Visual Roles
6471  */
6472 pvc.options.charts.CategoricalNumericChart.prototype.multiChartRole = undefined;
6473 /**
6474  * The title panel of the 
6475  * <i>small</i> chart.
6476  * <p>
6477  * The text of the title of small charts is the
6478  * compound label of the data bound to the 
6479  * <tt>multiChart</tt> visual role.
6480  * 
6481  * @type pvc.options.panels.ChartTitlePanel
6482  * @category Panels - Multi
6483  */
6484 pvc.options.charts.CategoricalNumericChart.prototype.smallTitle = undefined;
6485 /**
6486  * The first color axis options.
6487  * <p>
6488  * This axis can also be accessed by the property name 
6489  * <tt>color</tt>.
6490  * <p>
6491  * See {@link pvc.options.axes.ColorAxis}
6492  * for more information on the way that
6493  * the color axes' properties may be accessed.
6494  * 
6495  * @type pvc.options.axes.DiscreteColorAxis
6496  * @category Axes
6497  */
6498 pvc.options.charts.CategoricalNumericChart.prototype.color = undefined;
6499 /**
6500  * The orthogonal cartesian axis panel options.
6501  * <p>
6502  * When the chart {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart#orientation}
6503  * is 
6504  * <tt>vertical</tt> the orthogonal axis is laid out vertically.
6505  * <p>
6506  * See {@link pvc.options.axes.CartesianAxis}
6507  * to know the additional names by which a cartesian axis can be referred to.
6508  * 
6509  * @type pvc.options.axes.NumericCartesianAxis
6510  * @category Axes
6511  */
6512 pvc.options.charts.CategoricalNumericChart.prototype.orthoAxis = undefined;
6513 /**
6514  * The extension points object contains style definitions for
6515  * the marks of the chart.
6516  * 
6517  * @type pvc.options.ext.CategoricalNumericChartExtensionPoints
6518  * @category Chart
6519  */
6520 pvc.options.charts.CategoricalNumericChart.prototype.extensionPoints = undefined;
6521 /**
6522  * The chart's visual roles map.
6523  * <p>
6524  * See {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart#visualRoles} for more information.
6525  * 
6526  * @type map(string : pvc.options.VisualRole)|pvc.options.visualRoles.CategoricalNumericChartVisualRoles
6527  * @category Chart > Visual Roles
6528  */
6529 pvc.options.charts.CategoricalNumericChart.prototype.visualRoles = undefined;
6530 /**
6531  * The visual roles options class of
6532  * the 
6533  * <b>categorical</b> chart types with a 
6534  * <i>continuous-numeric orthogonal axis</i>.
6535  * 
6536  * @class
6537  * @extends pvc.options.visualRoles.BasicChartVisualRoles
6538  */
6539 pvc.options.visualRoles.CategoricalNumericChartVisualRoles = function(){};
6540         
6541         
6542         
6543         
6544 /**
6545  * The 
6546  * <tt>multiChart</tt> visual role is a chart-level visual role that
6547  * allows turning a chart into a 
6548  * <i>small multiples</i> chart,
6549  * {@link http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Small_multiple}.
6550  * <p>
6551  * Almost all main chart types support being shown
6552  * as a small multiples chart.
6553  * Currently, the exceptions are the charts:
6554  * 
6555  * <i>Heat Grid</i>,
6556  * 
6557  * <i>Bullet</i>,
6558  * 
6559  * <i>Data Tree</i> and
6560  * 
6561  * <i>Parallel Coordinates</i>.
6562  * <p>
6563  * The 
6564  * <tt>multiChart</tt> visual role
6565  * can be bound to any number of dimensions,
6566  * that are, or will be turned into, discrete.
6567  * <p>
6568  * The 
6569  * <tt>multiChart</tt> visual role automatically binds to
6570  * every dimension whose name has the 
6571  * <tt>multiChart</tt> prefix.
6572  * <p>
6573  * One 
6574  * <i>small</i> chart is generated per
6575  * unique combination of the values of the bound dimensions
6576  * that is present in the source data.
6577  * Each small chart then receives as its data
6578  * the partition of the source data that shares its
6579  * unique combination of values.
6580  * <p>
6581  * See {@link pvc.options.VisualRole}
6582  * for more information on supported data types.
6583  * 
6584  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
6585  * @category Chart > Visual Roles
6586  */
6587 pvc.options.visualRoles.CategoricalNumericChartVisualRoles.prototype.multiChart = undefined;
6588 /**
6589  * The extension points of the 
6590  * <b>categorical</b> chart types with a 
6591  * <i>continuous-numeric orthogonal axis</i>.
6592  * <p>
6593  * Chart extension points can also be specified directly at the chart options level.
6594  * <p>
6595  * To use an extension point you must find its full name, by joining:
6596  * 
6597  * <ol>
6598  * 
6599  * <li>extension property (ex: 
6600  * <tt>smallBase</tt>)</li>
6601  * 
6602  * <li>the "_" character</li>
6603  * 
6604  * <li>extension sub-property (ex: 
6605  * <tt>strokeStyle</tt>)</li>
6606  * </ol>
6607  * and obtaining, for the examples, the camel-cased name: 
6608  * <tt>smallBase_strokeStyle</tt>
6609  * (see {@link http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CamelCase}).
6610  * 
6611  * @class
6612  * @extends pvc.options.ext.CartesianChartExtensionPoints
6613  */
6614 pvc.options.ext.CategoricalNumericChartExtensionPoints = function(){};
6615         
6616         
6617         
6618         
6619 /**
6620  * The extension point of the multi-chart overflow/clip marker.
6621  * 
6622  * @type pvc.options.marks.DotExtensionPoint
6623  * @category Chart - Multi
6624  */
6625 pvc.options.ext.CategoricalNumericChartExtensionPoints.prototype.multiChartOverflowMarker = undefined;
6626 /**
6627  * The extension point of the base (root) panel of the 
6628  * <i>small</i> charts.
6629  * 
6630  * @type pvc.options.marks.PanelExtensionPoint
6631  * @category Chart - Multi
6632  */
6633 pvc.options.ext.CategoricalNumericChartExtensionPoints.prototype.smallBase = undefined;
6634 /**
6635  * The extension point of the content panel of the 
6636  * <i>small</i> charts.
6637  * <p>
6638  * The content panel is a child of the base panel.
6639  * 
6640  * @type pvc.options.marks.PanelExtensionPoint
6641  * @category Chart - Multi
6642  */
6643 pvc.options.ext.CategoricalNumericChartExtensionPoints.prototype.smallContent = undefined;
6644 /**
6645  * The common options documentation class of 
6646  * <b>categorical</b> plot types with a 
6647  * <i>continuous-numeric orthogonal axis</i>.
6648  * 
6649  * @class
6650  * @extends pvc.options.plots.CategoricalPlot
6651  * @abstract
6652  */
6653 pvc.options.plots.CategoricalNumericPlot = function(){};
6654         
6655         
6656         
6657         
6658 /**
6659  * The index of the orthogonal cartesian axis to use for the plot.
6660  * <p>
6661  * The possible values are 
6662  * <tt>1</tt>, 
6663  * <tt>2</tt> and 
6664  * <tt>3</tt>.
6665  * <p>
6666  * The main plot of a chart always uses the axis 
6667  * <tt>1</tt>.
6668  * 
6669  * @type number
6670  * @default 1
6671  * @category Axes
6672  */
6673 pvc.options.plots.CategoricalNumericPlot.prototype.orthoAxis = undefined;
6674 /**
6675  * The interpolation mode used to
6676  * fill-in null or missing values.
6677  * <p>
6678  * The interpolation is applied to
6679  * the measure roles of the plot that
6680  * are represented in the orthogonal cartesian axis.
6681  * <p>
6682  * With the exception of the box plot,
6683  * this role is the 
6684  * <tt>value</tt> role.
6685  * All of the box plot measure roles:
6686  * 
6687  * <tt>median</tt>, 
6688  * <tt>lowerQuartil</tt>, 
6689  * <tt>upperQuartil</tt>, 
6690  * <tt>minimum</tt>, and 
6691  * <tt>maximum</tt>,
6692  * are interpolated using the specified mode.
6693  * 
6694  * @type pvc.options.varia.NullInterpolationMode
6695  * @default 'none'
6696  * @category Data
6697  */
6698 pvc.options.plots.CategoricalNumericPlot.prototype.nullInterpolationMode = undefined;
6699 /**
6700  * Indicates that visual elements having
6701  * identical category, but different series,
6702  * are displayed on top of each other,
6703  * along the plot's orthogonal direction,
6704  * instead of side-by-side,
6705  * along the base direction.
6706  * 
6707  * @type boolean
6708  * @default false
6709  * @category Style
6710  */
6711 pvc.options.plots.CategoricalNumericPlot.prototype.stacked = undefined;
6712 /**
6713  * The options documentation class of the 
6714  * <b>Box plot</b> chart.
6715  * 
6716  * <h3>Default Data Format</h3>
6717  * For general information on the supported 
6718  * <b>data formats</b>
6719  * see {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart}.
6720  * <p>
6721  * The boxplot chart employs a non-default 
6722  * <i>logical row</i> to dimensions mapping:
6723  * 
6724  * <ol>
6725  * 
6726  * <li>All of the free columns of the "series" 
6727  * <i>physical group</i>
6728  * generate and load free dimensions of the "series" 
6729  * <i>dimension group</i>:
6730  * "series", "series2", ...
6731  * </li>
6732  * 
6733  * <li>All of the free columns of the "categories" 
6734  * <i>physical group</i>
6735  * generate and load free dimensions of the "category" 
6736  * <i>dimension group</i>:
6737  * "category", "category2", ...
6738  * </li>
6739  * 
6740  * <li>Free columns of the "measures" 
6741  * <i>physical group</i> generate and load,
6742  * in order, skipping the dimension when not-free,
6743  * the following numeric 
6744  * <i>dimensions</i>:
6745  * 
6746  * <ol>
6747  * 
6748  * <li>median</li>
6749  * 
6750  * <li>lowerQuartil</li>
6751  * 
6752  * <li>upperQuartil</li>
6753  * 
6754  * <li>minimum</li>
6755  * 
6756  * <li>maximum</li>
6757  * </ol>
6758  * </li>
6759  * </ol>
6760  * 
6761  * <style>
6762  * .dataformat {
6763  * border-spacing: 0;
6764  * margin: 1em 0;
6765  * }
6766  * .dataformat td {
6767  * border:  solid 1px;
6768  * padding: 3px;
6769  * width:   80px;
6770  * }
6771  * </style>
6772  * <p>
6773  * All the following are possible 
6774  * <i>default layouts</i> and dimension assignments:
6775  * 
6776  * <table class='dataformat'>
6777  * 
6778  * <tr>
6779  * <td>
6780  * <b>Index</b></td>
6781  * <td>0</td>
6782  * <td>1</td>
6783  * <td>2</td>
6784  * <td>3</td>
6785  * <td>4</td>
6786  * <td>5</td></tr>
6787  * 
6788  * <tr>
6789  * <td>
6790  * <b>Dimension</b></td>
6791  * <td>category</td>
6792  * <td>median</td>
6793  * <td>lowerQuartil</td>
6794  * <td>upperQuartil</td>
6795  * <td>minimum</td>
6796  * <td>maximum</td></tr>
6797  * 
6798  * <tr>
6799  * <td>
6800  * <b>DataType</b></td>
6801  * <td>string</td>
6802  * <td>number</td>
6803  * <td>number</td>
6804  * <td>number</td>
6805  * <td>number</td>
6806  * <td>number</td></tr>
6807  * </table>
6808  * 
6809  * <table class='dataformat'>
6810  * 
6811  * <tr>
6812  * <td>
6813  * <b>Index</b></td>
6814  * <td>0</td>
6815  * <td>1</td>
6816  * <td>2</td>
6817  * <td>3</td>
6818  * <td>4</td></tr>
6819  * 
6820  * <tr>
6821  * <td>
6822  * <b>Dimension</b></td>
6823  * <td>series</td>
6824  * <td>category</td>
6825  * <td>median</td>
6826  * <td>lowerQuartil</td>
6827  * <td>upperQuartil</td></tr>
6828  * 
6829  * <tr>
6830  * <td>
6831  * <b>DataType</b></td>
6832  * <td>string</td>
6833  * <td>string</td>
6834  * <td>number</td>
6835  * <td>number</td>
6836  * <td>number</td></tr>
6837  * </table>
6838  * 
6839  * @class
6840  * @extends pvc.options.charts.CategoricalNumericChart
6841  */
6842 pvc.options.charts.BoxplotChart = function(){};
6843         
6844         
6845         
6846         
6847 /**
6848  * The base cartesian axis panel options.
6849  * <p>
6850  * When the chart {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart#orientation}
6851  * is 
6852  * <tt>vertical</tt> the base axis is laid out horizontally.
6853  * <p>
6854  * See {@link pvc.options.axes.CartesianAxis}
6855  * to know the additional names by which a cartesian axis can be referred to.
6856  * 
6857  * @type pvc.options.axes.FlattenedDiscreteCartesianAxis
6858  * @category Axes
6859  */
6860 pvc.options.charts.BoxplotChart.prototype.baseAxis = undefined;
6861 /**
6862  * The second color axis options.
6863  * <p>
6864  * By default, the second plot uses the second color axis.
6865  * <p>
6866  * See {@link pvc.options.axes.ColorAxis}
6867  * for more information on the way that
6868  * the color axes' properties may be accessed.
6869  * 
6870  * @type pvc.options.axes.DiscreteColorAxis
6871  * @category Axes
6872  */
6873 pvc.options.charts.BoxplotChart.prototype.color2Axis = undefined;
6874 /**
6875  * Percentage of occupied space over total space
6876  * in a discrete axis band.
6877  * <p>
6878  * The default value is 
6879  * <i>1/3</i>.
6880  * <p>
6881  * See {@link pvc.options.axes.DiscreteCartesianAxis#bandSizeRatio} for more information.
6882  * 
6883  * @type number
6884  * @category Chart > Layout
6885  */
6886 pvc.options.charts.BoxplotChart.prototype.panelSizeRatio = undefined;
6887 /**
6888  * The 
6889  * <tt>lowerQuartil</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
6890  * is visually encoded by the bottom position of the box visual element,
6891  * along the orthogonal axis.
6892  * <p>
6893  * This is a shortcut property for the main plot's
6894  * {@link pvc.options.visualRoles.BoxplotPlotVisualRoles#lowerQuartil}.
6895  * 
6896  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
6897  * @category Chart > Visual Roles
6898  */
6899 pvc.options.charts.BoxplotChart.prototype.lowerQuartilRole = undefined;
6900 /**
6901  * The 
6902  * <tt>maximum</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
6903  * is visually encoded by the position of the rule that crosses
6904  * the bottom whisker of the box visual element,
6905  * along the orthogonal axis.
6906  * <p>
6907  * This is a shortcut property for the main plot's
6908  * {@link pvc.options.visualRoles.BoxplotPlotVisualRoles#maximum}.
6909  * 
6910  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
6911  * @category Chart > Visual Roles
6912  */
6913 pvc.options.charts.BoxplotChart.prototype.maximumRole = undefined;
6914 /**
6915  * The 
6916  * <tt>median</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
6917  * is visually encoded by the position of the middle rule of the box visual element,
6918  * along the orthogonal axis.
6919  * <p>
6920  * This is a shortcut property for the main plot's
6921  * {@link pvc.options.visualRoles.BoxplotPlotVisualRoles#median}.
6922  * 
6923  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
6924  * @category Chart > Visual Roles
6925  */
6926 pvc.options.charts.BoxplotChart.prototype.medianRole = undefined;
6927 /**
6928  * The 
6929  * <tt>minimum</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
6930  * is visually encoded by the position of the rule that crosses
6931  * the top whisker of the box visual element,
6932  * along the orthogonal axis.
6933  * <p>
6934  * This is a shortcut property for the main plot's
6935  * {@link pvc.options.visualRoles.BoxplotPlotVisualRoles#minimum}.
6936  * 
6937  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
6938  * @category Chart > Visual Roles
6939  */
6940 pvc.options.charts.BoxplotChart.prototype.minimumRole = undefined;
6941 /**
6942  * The 
6943  * <tt>upperQuartil</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
6944  * is visually encoded by the top position of the box visual element,
6945  * along the orthogonal axis.
6946  * <p>
6947  * This is a shortcut property for the main plot's
6948  * {@link pvc.options.visualRoles.BoxplotPlotVisualRoles#upperQuartil}.
6949  * 
6950  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
6951  * @category Chart > Visual Roles
6952  */
6953 pvc.options.charts.BoxplotChart.prototype.upperQuartilRole = undefined;
6954 /**
6955  * The box plot is the 
6956  * <b>main plot</b> of the box plot chart,
6957  * which means that
6958  * its properties may be used 
6959  * <i>without</i> the "box" property suffix.
6960  * 
6961  * @type pvc.options.plots.BoxplotPlot
6962  * @category Plots
6963  */
6964 pvc.options.charts.BoxplotChart.prototype.box = undefined;
6965 /**
6966  * Activates the second plot.
6967  * <p>
6968  * The second plot shows the values of the 
6969  * <tt>median</tt> role,
6970  * in the first orthogonal cartesian axis.
6971  * <p>
6972  * It is a 
6973  * <i>generic</i> point plot,
6974  * which means that
6975  * its properties
6976  * {@link pvc.options.plots.PointPlot#linesVisible},
6977  * {@link pvc.options.plots.PointPlot#dotsVisible},
6978  * and
6979  * {@link pvc.options.plots.PointPlot#areasVisible}
6980  * can be set freely.
6981  * <p>
6982  * By default, the second plot shows lines and dots/markers.
6983  * <p>
6984  * By default, the second plot uses the second color axis.
6985  * 
6986  * @type boolean|pvc.options.plots.BoxplotPointPlot
6987  * @default false
6988  * @category Plots
6989  */
6990 pvc.options.charts.BoxplotChart.prototype.plot2 = undefined;
6991 /**
6992  * The options documentation class of the 
6993  * <b>Box</b> plot.
6994  * 
6995  * @class
6996  * @extends pvc.options.plots.CategoricalNumericPlot
6997  */
6998 pvc.options.plots.BoxplotPlot = function(){};
6999         
7000         
7001         
7002         
7003 /**
7004  * The index of the color axis to use for the plot.
7005  * 
7006  * @type number
7007  * @category Axes
7008  * @constant
7009  */
7010 pvc.options.plots.BoxplotPlot.prototype.colorAxis = 1;
7011 /**
7012  * The index of the orthogonal cartesian axis to use for the plot.
7013  * 
7014  * @type number
7015  * @category Axes
7016  * @constant
7017  */
7018 pvc.options.plots.BoxplotPlot.prototype.orthoAxis = 1;
7019 /**
7020  * The placement of boxes within the same category band.
7021  * 
7022  * @type pvc.options.varia.BoxLayoutMode
7023  * @default 'grouped'
7024  */
7025 pvc.options.plots.BoxplotPlot.prototype.layoutMode = undefined;
7026 /**
7027  * The box plot only shows a single series of data
7028  * and, as such, this property is meaningless.
7029  * 
7030  * @type boolean
7031  * @constant
7032  */
7033 pvc.options.plots.BoxplotPlot.prototype.stacked = false;
7034 /**
7035  * This plot type does not have value labels.
7036  * 
7037  * @type string
7038  * @category Layout
7039  * @constant
7040  */
7041 pvc.options.plots.BoxplotPlot.prototype.valuesMask = null;
7042 /**
7043  * The maximum width of a box plot bar, in pixel units.
7044  * <p>
7045  * A number not less than 
7046  * <tt>1</tt>, possibly infinity.
7047  * 
7048  * @type number
7049  * @default Infinity
7050  * @category Style
7051  */
7052 pvc.options.plots.BoxplotPlot.prototype.boxSizeMax = undefined;
7053 /**
7054  * The percentage of box space over total space
7055  * in a category band and with a 
7056  * <i>grouped</i> layout.
7057  * <p>
7058  * Only relevant when there are multiple series and
7059  * {@link pvc.options.plots.BoxplotPlot#layoutMode} is 
7060  * <i>grouped</i>.
7061  * <p>
7062  * The empty space is uniformly distributed 
7063  * <i>between</i> boxes.
7064  * <p>
7065  * Bands may have space between them,
7066  * depending on the base axis'
7067  * {@link pvc.options.axes.DiscreteCartesianAxis#bandSizeRatio}.
7068  * <p>
7069  * A number between 
7070  * <tt>0.05</tt> and 
7071  * <tt>1</tt>.
7072  * <p>
7073  * The default value is 
7074  * <tt>0.9</tt>.
7075  * 
7076  * @type number
7077  * @default 0.333
7078  * @category Style
7079  */
7080 pvc.options.plots.BoxplotPlot.prototype.boxSizeRatio = undefined;
7081 /**
7082  * The extension points object contains style definitions for
7083  * the marks of the plot.
7084  * 
7085  * @type pvc.options.ext.BoxplotPlotExtensionPoints
7086  * @category Style
7087  */
7088 pvc.options.plots.BoxplotPlot.prototype.extensionPoints = undefined;
7089 /**
7090  * 
7091  * The maximum width of a box plot bar, in pixel units.
7092  * 
7093  * @deprecated Use {@link #boxSizeMax} instead.
7094  * @type number
7095  * @default Infinity
7096  * @category Style
7097  */
7098 pvc.options.plots.BoxplotPlot.prototype.maxBoxSize = undefined;
7099 /**
7100  * This plot type does not have value labels.
7101  * 
7102  * @type pvc.options.varia.MarkAnchor
7103  * @category Style
7104  * @constant
7105  */
7106 pvc.options.plots.BoxplotPlot.prototype.valuesAnchor = null;
7107 /**
7108  * This plot type does not have value labels.
7109  * 
7110  * @type string
7111  * @category Style
7112  * @constant
7113  */
7114 pvc.options.plots.BoxplotPlot.prototype.valuesFont = null;
7115 /**
7116  * This plot type does not have value labels.
7117  * 
7118  * @type boolean
7119  * @category Style
7120  * @constant
7121  */
7122 pvc.options.plots.BoxplotPlot.prototype.valuesVisible = false;
7123 /**
7124  * The plot's visual roles map.
7125  * <p>
7126  * See {@link pvc.options.plots.BasicPlot#visualRoles} for more information.
7127  * 
7128  * @type map(string : pvc.options.VisualRole)|pvc.options.visualRoles.BoxplotPlotVisualRoles
7129  * @category Visual Roles
7130  */
7131 pvc.options.plots.BoxplotPlot.prototype.visualRoles = undefined;
7132 /**
7133  * The options documentation class of the 
7134  * <b>point</b> plot
7135  * used by the box plot when the second plot is active.
7136  * 
7137  * @class
7138  * @extends pvc.options.plots.PointPlot
7139  */
7140 pvc.options.plots.BoxplotPointPlot = function(){};
7141         
7142         
7143         
7144         
7145 /**
7146  * The point plot of the box plot
7147  * only shows a single series of data
7148  * and, as such, this property is meaningless.
7149  * 
7150  * @type boolean
7151  * @constant
7152  */
7153 pvc.options.plots.BoxplotPointPlot.prototype.stacked = false;
7154 /**
7155  * The index of the color axis to use for the plot.
7156  * 
7157  * @type number
7158  * @default 2
7159  * @category Axes
7160  */
7161 pvc.options.plots.BoxplotPointPlot.prototype.colorAxis = undefined;
7162 /**
7163  * The index of the orthogonal cartesian axis to use for the plot.
7164  * 
7165  * @type number
7166  * @category Axes
7167  * @constant
7168  */
7169 pvc.options.plots.BoxplotPointPlot.prototype.orthoAxis = 1;
7170 /**
7171  * Trends are not supported by this plot type.
7172  * 
7173  * @type pvc.options.varia.PlotTrending
7174  * @category Data
7175  * @constant
7176  */
7177 pvc.options.plots.BoxplotPointPlot.prototype.trend = null;
7178 /**
7179  * Indicates if the visual elements show dots/markers
7180  * in each point's position.
7181  * 
7182  * @type boolean
7183  * @default true
7184  * @category Style
7185  */
7186 pvc.options.plots.BoxplotPointPlot.prototype.dotsVisible = undefined;
7187 /**
7188  * Indicates if the visual elements are connected
7189  * with lines.
7190  * 
7191  * @type boolean
7192  * @default true
7193  * @category Style
7194  */
7195 pvc.options.plots.BoxplotPointPlot.prototype.linesVisible = undefined;
7196 /**
7197  * The extension points of the box plot type.
7198  * <p>
7199  * Plot extension points can be specified:
7200  * 
7201  * <ul>
7202  * 
7203  * <li>at the plot level, in the 
7204  * <i>extensionPoints</i> property,
7205  * without need to prefix the extension point with the
7206  * plot id or name.
7207  * </li>
7208  * 
7209  * <li>at the plot options level, directly,
7210  * without need to prefix the extension point with the
7211  * plot id or name.
7212  * </li>
7213  * 
7214  * <li>
7215  * if it is an internal plot (
7216  * <i>main</i>, 
7217  * <i>plot2</i> or 
7218  * <i>trend</i>),
7219  * at the chart options level, directly.
7220  * </li>
7221  * </ul>
7222  * <p>
7223  * To use an extension point you must find its full name, by joining:
7224  * 
7225  * <ol>
7226  * 
7227  * <li>plot property name (ex: 
7228  * <tt>box</tt>)</li>
7229  * 
7230  * <li>extension property (ex: 
7231  * <tt>panel</tt>)</li>
7232  * 
7233  * <li>the "_" character</li>
7234  * 
7235  * <li>extension sub-property (ex: 
7236  * <tt>strokeStyle</tt>)</li>
7237  * </ol>
7238  * and obtaining, for the examples, the camel-cased name: 
7239  * <tt>boxPanel_strokeStyle</tt>
7240  * (see {@link http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CamelCase}).
7241  * <p>
7242  * The extension points of the 
7243  * <i>main plot</i> of a chart
7244  * may be used without the plot property name prefix.
7245  * In the example, when the 
7246  * <tt>box</tt> plot is the main plot,
7247  * the extension point can be written as 
7248  * <tt>panel_strokeStyle</tt>.
7249  * 
7250  * @class
7251  */
7252 pvc.options.ext.BoxplotPlotExtensionPoints = function(){};
7253         
7254         
7255         
7256         
7257 /**
7258  * The extension point of the box mark.
7259  * <p>
7260  * The box mark is a bar that extends from the
7261  * orthogonal position of the
7262  * 
7263  * <tt>lowerQuartil</tt> to the position of the 
7264  * <tt>upperQuartil</tt>.
7265  * 
7266  * @type pvc.options.marks.BarExtensionPoint
7267  */
7268 pvc.options.ext.BoxplotPlotExtensionPoints.prototype.bar = undefined;
7269 /**
7270  * The extension point of the category panel of the box plot.
7271  * 
7272  * @type pvc.options.marks.PanelExtensionPoint
7273  */
7274 pvc.options.ext.BoxplotPlotExtensionPoints.prototype.panel = undefined;
7275 /**
7276  * The extension point of the rule that crosses the
7277  * top whisker of the box plot visual element.
7278  * 
7279  * @type pvc.options.marks.RuleExtensionPoint
7280  */
7281 pvc.options.ext.BoxplotPlotExtensionPoints.prototype.ruleMax = undefined;
7282 /**
7283  * The extension point of the rule that
7284  * cuts in two the box bar of the box plot visual element.
7285  * 
7286  * @type pvc.options.marks.RuleExtensionPoint
7287  */
7288 pvc.options.ext.BoxplotPlotExtensionPoints.prototype.ruleMedian = undefined;
7289 /**
7290  * The extension point of the rule that crosses the
7291  * bottom whisker of the box plot visual element.
7292  * 
7293  * @type pvc.options.marks.RuleExtensionPoint
7294  */
7295 pvc.options.ext.BoxplotPlotExtensionPoints.prototype.ruleMin = undefined;
7296 /**
7297  * The extension point of the top and bottom whiskers of
7298  * the box plot visual element.
7299  * 
7300  * @type pvc.options.marks.RuleExtensionPoint
7301  */
7302 pvc.options.ext.BoxplotPlotExtensionPoints.prototype.ruleWhisker = undefined;
7303 /**
7304  * The visual roles options class of the box plot type.
7305  * 
7306  * @class
7307  * @extends pvc.options.visualRoles.CategoricalPlotVisualRoles
7308  */
7309 pvc.options.visualRoles.BoxplotPlotVisualRoles = function(){};
7310         
7311         
7312         
7313         
7314 /**
7315  * The 
7316  * <tt>lowerQuartil</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
7317  * is visually encoded by the bottom position of the box visual element,
7318  * along the orthogonal axis.
7319  * <p>
7320  * The 
7321  * <tt>lowerQuartil</tt> visual role automatically binds to
7322  * a single numeric dimension whose name has the 
7323  * <tt>lowerQuartil</tt> prefix.
7324  * <p>
7325  * The 
7326  * <tt>lowerQuartil</tt> visual role is optional.
7327  * <p>
7328  * See {@link pvc.options.VisualRole}
7329  * for more information on supported data types.
7330  * 
7331  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
7332  * @category Visual Roles
7333  */
7334 pvc.options.visualRoles.BoxplotPlotVisualRoles.prototype.lowerQuartil = undefined;
7335 /**
7336  * The 
7337  * <tt>maximum</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
7338  * is visually encoded by the position of the rule that crosses
7339  * the bottom whisker of the box visual element,
7340  * along the orthogonal axis.
7341  * <p>
7342  * The 
7343  * <tt>maximum</tt> visual role automatically binds to
7344  * a single numeric dimension whose name has the 
7345  * <tt>maximum</tt> prefix.
7346  * <p>
7347  * The 
7348  * <tt>maximum</tt> visual role is optional.
7349  * <p>
7350  * See {@link pvc.options.VisualRole}
7351  * for more information on supported data types.
7352  * 
7353  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
7354  * @category Visual Roles
7355  */
7356 pvc.options.visualRoles.BoxplotPlotVisualRoles.prototype.maximum = undefined;
7357 /**
7358  * The 
7359  * <tt>median</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
7360  * is visually encoded by the position of the middle rule of the box visual element,
7361  * along the orthogonal axis.
7362  * <p>
7363  * The 
7364  * <tt>median</tt> visual role automatically binds to
7365  * a single numeric dimension whose name has the 
7366  * <tt>median</tt> prefix.
7367  * <p>
7368  * The 
7369  * <tt>median</tt> visual role is required.
7370  * <p>
7371  * See {@link pvc.options.VisualRole}
7372  * for more information on supported data types.
7373  * 
7374  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
7375  * @category Visual Roles
7376  */
7377 pvc.options.visualRoles.BoxplotPlotVisualRoles.prototype.median = undefined;
7378 /**
7379  * The 
7380  * <tt>minimum</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
7381  * is visually encoded by the position of the rule that crosses
7382  * the top whisker of the box visual element,
7383  * along the orthogonal axis.
7384  * <p>
7385  * The 
7386  * <tt>minimum</tt> visual role automatically binds to
7387  * a single numeric dimension whose name has the 
7388  * <tt>minimum</tt> prefix.
7389  * <p>
7390  * The 
7391  * <tt>minimum</tt> visual role is optional.
7392  * <p>
7393  * See {@link pvc.options.VisualRole}
7394  * for more information on supported data types.
7395  * 
7396  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
7397  * @category Visual Roles
7398  */
7399 pvc.options.visualRoles.BoxplotPlotVisualRoles.prototype.minimum = undefined;
7400 /**
7401  * The 
7402  * <tt>upperQuartil</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
7403  * is visually encoded by the top position of the box visual element,
7404  * along the orthogonal axis.
7405  * <p>
7406  * The 
7407  * <tt>upperQuartil</tt> visual role automatically binds to
7408  * a single numeric dimension whose name has the 
7409  * <tt>upperQuartil</tt> prefix.

7412  * <tt>upperQuartil</tt> visual role is optional.

7420 pvc.options.visualRoles.BoxplotPlotVisualRoles.prototype.upperQuartil = undefined;

7437 /**

7439  * <p>
7440  * When the chart {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart#orientation}
7441  * is 
7442  * <tt>vertical</tt> the base axis is laid out horizontally.
7443  * <p>
7444  * See {@link pvc.options.axes.CartesianAxis}
7445  * to know the additional names by which a cartesian axis can be referred to.
7446  *

7448  * @category Axes
7449  */
7450 pvc.options.charts.HeatGridChart.prototype.baseAxis = undefined;

7452  * The first color axis options.
7453  * <p>
7454  * This axis can also be accessed by the property name 
7455  * <tt>color</tt>.
7456  * <p>
7457  * See {@link pvc.options.axes.ColorAxis}
7458  * for more information on the way that
7459  * the color axes' properties may be accessed.

7470  * <tt>vertical</tt> the orthogonal axis is laid out vertically.
7471  * <p>
7472  * See {@link pvc.options.axes.CartesianAxis}
7473  * to know the additional names by which a cartesian axis can be referred to.
7474  *

7496 pvc.options.charts.HeatGridChart.prototype.useCompositeAxis = undefined;
7497 /**

7499  * <tt>category</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
