7501  * <i>logical grouping</i> of the data points,
7502  * and is visually encoded by the column in a matrix in that a visual element is placed.

7505  * {@link pvc.options.visualRoles.HeatGridPlotVisualRoles#category}.

7517  * {@link pvc.options.visualRoles.HeatGridPlotVisualRoles#color}.
7518  *

7520  * @category Chart > Visual Roles
7521  */
7522 pvc.options.charts.HeatGridChart.prototype.colorRole = undefined;
7523 /**

7525  * <tt>series</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that represents a
7526  * 
7527  * <i>series</i> of connected data points,
7528  * and is visually encoded by the row in a matrix in that a visual element is placed.
7529  * <p>
7530  * This is a shortcut property for the main plot's
7531  * {@link pvc.options.visualRoles.HeatGridPlotVisualRoles#series}.

7543  * {@link pvc.options.visualRoles.HeatGridPlotVisualRoles#size}.

7549 /**

7553  * @category Panels
7554  * @constant

7556 pvc.options.charts.HeatGridChart.prototype.legend = false;
7557 /**
7558  * The heat grid plot is the 
7559  * <b>main plot</b> of the heat grid chart,
7560  * which means that
7561  * its properties may be used 
7562  * <i>without</i> the "heatGrid" property suffix.
7563  * 
7564  * @type pvc.options.plots.HeatGridPlot
7565  * @category Plots
7566  */
7567 pvc.options.charts.HeatGridChart.prototype.heatGrid = undefined;
7568 /**
7569  * The options documentation class of the 
7570  * <b>Heat grid</b> plot.
7571  * 
7572  * @class
7573  * @extends pvc.options.plots.CategoricalPlot
7574  */
7575 pvc.options.plots.HeatGridPlot = function(){};
7576         
7577         
7578         
7579         
7580 /**
7581  * The index of the color axis to use for the plot.
7582  * 
7583  * @type number
7584  * @category Axes
7585  * @constant
7586  */
7587 pvc.options.plots.HeatGridPlot.prototype.colorAxis = 1;
7588 /**
7589  * The index of the orthogonal cartesian axis to use for the plot.
7590  * 
7591  * @type number
7592  * @category Axes
7593  * @constant
7594  */
7595 pvc.options.plots.HeatGridPlot.prototype.orthoAxis = 1;
7596 /**
7597  * The values mask used to build the text of value labels.
7598  * <p>
7599  * The mask may contain scene variable names and/or scene atom names,
7600  * like in the examples:
7601  * 
7602  * <ul>
7603  * 
7604  * <li>scene variables: 
7605  * <tt>{category}: {value} EUR</tt>, could yield 
7606  * <tt>Drinks: 3.45 EUR</tt></li>
7607  * 
7608  * <li>atom variables:  
7609  * <tt>{#family} - {#product}</tt>, could yield 
7610  * <tt>Plains - Boeing 747</tt></li>
7611  * </ul>
7612  * <p>
7613  * The default of this property varies depending on whether
7614  * the 
7615  * <tt>size</tt> and 
7616  * <tt>color</tt> visual roles are bound.
7617  * 
7618  * <ol>
7619  * 
7620  * <li>if the 
7621  * <tt>color</tt> visual role is bound,
7622  * the default mask is 
7623  * <tt>'{color}'</tt>
7624  * </li>
7625  * 
7626  * <li>else, if the 
7627  * <tt>size</tt> visual role is bound,
7628  * the default mask is 
7629  * <tt>'{size}'</tt></li>
7630  * 
7631  * <li>else, no default value exists; the value label is not shown</li>
7632  * </ol>
7633  * 
7634  * @type string
7635  * @category Layout
7636  */
7637 pvc.options.plots.HeatGridPlot.prototype.valuesMask = undefined;
7638 /**
7639  * The extension points object contains style definitions for
7640  * the marks of the plot.
7641  * 
7642  * @type pvc.options.ext.HeatGridPlotExtensionPoints
7643  * @category Style
7644  */
7645 pvc.options.plots.HeatGridPlot.prototype.extensionPoints = undefined;
7646 /**
7647  * The shape to use when the value of the 
7648  * <i>size</i> role is 
7649  * <tt>null</tt>.
7650  * <p>
7651  * When the value of {@link #nullShape} is 
7652  * <tt>null</tt>,
7653  * visual elements with null size value are not shown.
7654  * <p>
7655  * See {@link #useShapes}.
7656  * 
7657  * @type pvc.options.varia.DotShapeType
7658  * @default 'cross'
7659  * @category Style
7660  */
7661 pvc.options.plots.HeatGridPlot.prototype.nullShape = undefined;
7662 /**
7663  * The shape to use in the dot mark (applies when using shapes).
7664  * <p>
7665  * See {@link #useShapes}.
7666  * 
7667  * @type pvc.options.varia.DotShapeType
7668  * @default 'square'
7669  * @category Style
7670  */
7671 pvc.options.plots.HeatGridPlot.prototype.shape = undefined;
7672 /**
7673  * Indicates if the heat-grid uses as visual elements
7674  * dot-shapes, within each grid cell.
7675  * <p>
7676  * When 
7677  * <tt>false</tt> the visual elements are the grid cells
7678  * themselves.
7679  * <p>
7680  * When shapes are used the
7681  * {@link pvc.options.visualRoles.HeatGridPlotVisualRoles#size}
7682  * visual role can be used.
7683  * 
7684  * @type boolean
7685  * @default false
7686  * @category Style
7687  */
7688 pvc.options.plots.HeatGridPlot.prototype.useShapes = undefined;
7689 /**
7690  * Indicates if value labels are shown next to the visual elements.
7691  * <p>
7692  * The heat-grid shows as values
7693  * the color role value, if bound,
7694  * or, otherwise,
7695  * the size role value, if bound.
7696  * <p>
7697  * By default, values are visible when {@link #useShapes} is 
7698  * <tt>false</tt>
7699  * and not visible otherwise.
7700  * 
7701  * @type boolean
7702  * @category Style
7703  */
7704 pvc.options.plots.HeatGridPlot.prototype.valuesVisible = undefined;
7705 /**
7706  * The plot's visual roles map.
7707  * <p>
7708  * See {@link pvc.options.plots.BasicPlot#visualRoles} for more information.
7709  * 
7710  * @type map(string : pvc.options.VisualRole)|pvc.options.visualRoles.HeatGridPlotVisualRoles
7711  * @category Visual Roles
7712  */
7713 pvc.options.plots.HeatGridPlot.prototype.visualRoles = undefined;
7714 /**
7715  * The extension points of the 
7716  * <i>Heat grid</i> plot types.
7717  * <p>
7718  * Plot extension points can be specified:
7719  * 
7720  * <ul>
7721  * 
7722  * <li>at the plot level, in the 
7723  * <i>extensionPoints</i> property,
7724  * without need to prefix the extension point with the
7725  * plot id or name.
7726  * </li>
7727  * 
7728  * <li>at the plot options level, directly,
7729  * without need to prefix the extension point with the
7730  * plot id or name.
7731  * </li>
7732  * 
7733  * <li>
7734  * if it is an internal plot (
7735  * <i>main</i>, 
7736  * <i>plot2</i> or 
7737  * <i>trend</i>),
7738  * at the chart options level, directly.
7739  * </li>
7740  * </ul>
7741  * <p>
7742  * To use an extension point you must find its full name, by joining:
7743  * 
7744  * <ol>
7745  * 
7746  * <li>plot property name (ex: 
7747  * <tt>heatGrid</tt>)</li>
7748  * 
7749  * <li>extension property (ex: 
7750  * <tt>panel</tt>)</li>
7751  * 
7752  * <li>the "_" character</li>
7753  * 
7754  * <li>extension sub-property (ex: 
7755  * <tt>strokeStyle</tt>)</li>
7756  * </ol>
7757  * and obtaining, for the examples, the camel-cased name: 
7758  * <tt>heatGridPanel_strokeStyle</tt>
7759  * (see {@link http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CamelCase}).
7760  * <p>
7761  * The extension points of the 
7762  * <i>main plot</i> of a chart
7763  * may be used without the plot property name prefix.
7764  * In the example, when the 
7765  * <tt>heatGrid</tt> plot is the main plot,
7766  * the extension point can be written as 
7767  * <tt>panel_strokeStyle</tt>.
7768  * 
7769  * @class
7770  */
7771 pvc.options.ext.HeatGridPlotExtensionPoints = function(){};
7772         
7773         
7774         
7775         
7776 /**
7777  * The extension point of the dot mark,
7778  * existent in the "shapes" mode.
7779  * 
7780  * @type pvc.options.marks.DotExtensionPoint
7781  */
7782 pvc.options.ext.HeatGridPlotExtensionPoints.prototype.dot = undefined;
7783 /**
7784  * The extension point of the value label mark.
7785  * 
7786  * @type pvc.options.marks.LabelExtensionPoint
7787  */
7788 pvc.options.ext.HeatGridPlotExtensionPoints.prototype.label = undefined;
7789 /**
7790  * The extension point of the "cell" panel of the heat grid plot.
7791  * 
7792  * @type pvc.options.marks.PanelExtensionPoint
7793  */
7794 pvc.options.ext.HeatGridPlotExtensionPoints.prototype.panel = undefined;
7795 /**
7796  * The visual roles options class of cartesian plot types.
7797  * 
7798  * @class
7799  * @extends pvc.options.visualRoles.CategoricalPlotVisualRoles
7800  */
7801 pvc.options.visualRoles.HeatGridPlotVisualRoles = function(){};
7802         
7803         
7804         
7805         
7806 /**
7807  * The 
7808  * <tt>size</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
7809  * is visually encoded by the size of visual elements.
7810  * <p>
7811  * Specifically, when in "shapes" mode",
7812  * controls the size of the dot mark.
7813  * <p>
7814  * The 
7815  * <tt>size</tt> visual role automatically binds to
7816  * a single numeric dimension whose name is 
7817  * <tt>value2</tt>.
7818  * <p>
7819  * The 
7820  * <tt>size</tt> visual role is optional and numeric.
7821  * <p>
7822  * When unbound, all the dot visual elements are
7823  * sized to the grid cell size.
7824  * <p>
7825  * See {@link pvc.options.VisualRole}
7826  * for more information on supported data types.
7827  * 
7828  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
7829  * @category Chart
7830  */
7831 pvc.options.visualRoles.HeatGridPlotVisualRoles.prototype.size = undefined;
7832 /**
7833  * The 
7834  * <tt>category</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
7835  * represents a generic 
7836  * <i>logical grouping</i> of the data points,
7837  * and is visually encoded by the column in a matrix in that a visual element is placed.
7838  * <p>
7839  * The base axis organizes visual elements according to its category.
7840  * The orthogonal axis organizes visual elements according to its series.
7841  * <p>
7842  * For additional information,
7843  * see the base version of this property:
7844  * {@link pvc.options.visualRoles.CategoricalPlotVisualRoles#category}.
7845  * 
7846  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
7847  * @category Visual Roles
7848  */
7849 pvc.options.visualRoles.HeatGridPlotVisualRoles.prototype.category = undefined;
7850 /**
7851  * The 
7852  * <tt>color</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
7853  * is visually encoded by the color of visual elements.
7854  * <p>
7855  * The 
7856  * <tt>color</tt> visual role automatically binds to
7857  * a single numeric dimension,
7858  * whose name is 
7859  * <tt>value</tt>.
7860  * <p>
7861  * The 
7862  * <tt>color</tt> visual role is optional and numeric.
7863  * <p>
7864  * When unbound, the visual elements all show the same color.
7865  * <p>
7866  * See {@link pvc.options.VisualRole}
7867  * for more information on supported data types.
7868  * 
7869  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
7870  * @category Visual Roles
7871  */
7872 pvc.options.visualRoles.HeatGridPlotVisualRoles.prototype.color = undefined;
7873 /**
7874  * The 
7875  * <tt>series</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that represents a
7876  * 
7877  * <i>series</i> of connected data points,
7878  * and is visually encoded by the row in a matrix in that a visual element is placed.
7879  * <p>
7880  * The base axis organizes visual elements according to their category.
7881  * The orthogonal axis organizes visual elements according to their series.
7882  * <p>
7883  * For additional information,
7884  * see the base version of this property:
7885  * {@link pvc.options.visualRoles.CartesianPlotVisualRoles#series}.
7886  * 
7887  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
7888  * @category Visual Roles
7889  */
7890 pvc.options.visualRoles.HeatGridPlotVisualRoles.prototype.series = undefined;
7891 /**
7892  * The common options documentation class of the 
7893  * <b>Bar family</b> charts.
7894  * <p>
7895  * For information on the supported 
7896  * <b>data formats</b>
7897  * see {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart}.
7898  * 
7899  * @class
7900  * @extends pvc.options.charts.CategoricalNumericChart
7901  * @abstract
7902  */
7903 pvc.options.charts.BarChartCommon = function(){};
7904         
7905         
7906         
7907         
7908 /**
7909  * The base cartesian axis panel options.
7910  * <p>
7911  * When the chart {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart#orientation}
7912  * is 
7913  * <tt>vertical</tt> the base axis is laid out horizontally.
7914  * <p>
7915  * See {@link pvc.options.axes.CartesianAxis}
7916  * to know the additional names by which a cartesian axis can be referred to.
7917  * 
7918  * @type pvc.options.axes.FlattenedDiscreteCartesianAxis
7919  * @category Axes
7920  */
7921 pvc.options.charts.BarChartCommon.prototype.baseAxis = undefined;
7922 /**
7923  * Percentage of occupied space over total space
7924  * in a discrete axis band.
7925  * <p>
7926  * See {@link pvc.options.axes.DiscreteCartesianAxis#bandSizeRatio} for more information.
7927  * 
7928  * @type number
7929  * @default 0.9
7930  * @category Chart > Layout
7931  */
7932 pvc.options.charts.BarChartCommon.prototype.panelSizeRatio = undefined;
7933 /**
7934  * The 
7935  * <tt>category</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
7936  * represents a generic 
7937  * <i>logical grouping</i> of the data points
7938  * and is visually encoded by grouping bars in
7939  * separate bands along the 
7940  * <i>base</i> axis.
7941  * <p>
7942  * This is a shortcut property for the main plot's
7943  * {@link pvc.options.visualRoles.BarPlotCommonVisualRoles#category}.
7944  * 
7945  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
7946  * @category Chart > Visual Roles
7947  */
7948 pvc.options.charts.BarChartCommon.prototype.categoryRole = undefined;
7949 /**
7950  * The 
7951  * <tt>value</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
7952  * represents its main measure, specifically,
7953  * it is visually encoded by the 
7954  * <i>orthogonal</i> height of bars.
7955  * <p>
7956  * This is a shortcut property for the main plot's
7957  * {@link pvc.options.visualRoles.BarPlotCommonVisualRoles#value}.
7958  * 
7959  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
7960  * @category Chart > Visual Roles
7961  */
7962 pvc.options.charts.BarChartCommon.prototype.valueRole = undefined;
7963 /**
7964  * The common options documentation class of the 
7965  * <b>Bar family</b> plots.
7966  * 
7967  * @class
7968  * @extends pvc.options.plots.CategoricalNumericPlot
7969  * @abstract
7970  */
7971 pvc.options.plots.BarPlotCommon = function(){};
7972         
7973         
7974         
7975         
7976 /**
7977  * The values mask used to build the text of value labels.
7978  * <p>
7979  * The mask may contain scene variable names and/or scene atom names,
7980  * like in the examples:
7981  * 
7982  * <ul>
7983  * 
7984  * <li>scene variables: 
7985  * <tt>{category}: {value} EUR</tt>, could yield 
7986  * <tt>Drinks: 3.45 EUR</tt></li>
7987  * 
7988  * <li>atom variables:  
7989  * <tt>{#family} - {#product}</tt>, could yield 
7990  * <tt>Plains - Boeing 747</tt></li>
7991  * </ul>
7992  * 
7993  * @type string
7994  * @default '{value}'
7995  * @category Layout
7996  */
7997 pvc.options.plots.BarPlotCommon.prototype.valuesMask = undefined;
7998 /**
7999  * The minimum height of a non-null valued bar, in pixel units.
8000  * <p>
8001  * If you want that null-valued bars also show up, as zero bars do,
8002  * consider using a
8003  * {@link pvc.options.varia.NullInterpolationMode#Zero}
8004  * {@link #nullInterpolationMode}.
8005  * <p>
8006  * If you do not want to show zero-valued bars, then set this option to zero.
8007  * <p>
8008  * A finite number, not less than 
8009  * <tt>0</tt>.
8010  * 
8011  * @type number
8012  * @default 1.5
8013  * @category Style
8014  */
8015 pvc.options.plots.BarPlotCommon.prototype.barOrthoSizeMin = undefined;
8016 /**
8017  * The maximum width of a bar, in pixel units.
8018  * <p>
8019  * A number not less than 
8020  * <tt>1</tt>, possibly infinity.
8021  * 
8022  * @type number
8023  * @default 2000
8024  * @category Style
8025  */
8026 pvc.options.plots.BarPlotCommon.prototype.barSizeMax = undefined;
8027 /**
8028  * The percentage of the grouped bar width
8029  * versus the space between grouped bars (does not apply to stacked bars).
8030  * <p>
8031  * A number between 
8032  * <tt>0.05</tt> and 
8033  * <tt>1</tt>.
8034  * 
8035  * @type number
8036  * @default 0.9
8037  * @category Style
8038  */
8039 pvc.options.plots.BarPlotCommon.prototype.barSizeRatio = undefined;
8040 /**
8041  * The space between bars of a given stack, in pixel units
8042  * (applies to stacked bars).
8043  * <p>
8044  * A non-negative number.
8045  * 
8046  * @type number
8047  * @default 0
8048  * @category Style
8049  */
8050 pvc.options.plots.BarPlotCommon.prototype.barStackedMargin = undefined;
8051 /**
8052  * The extension points object contains style definitions for
8053  * the marks of the plot.
8054  * 
8055  * @type pvc.options.ext.BarPlotCommonExtensionPoints
8056  * @category Style
8057  */
8058 pvc.options.plots.BarPlotCommon.prototype.extensionPoints = undefined;
8059 /**
8060  * 
8061  * The maximum width of a bar, in pixel units.
8062  * 
8063  * @deprecated Use {@link #barSizeMax} instead.
8064  * @type number
8065  * @default 2000
8066  * @category Style
8067  */
8068 pvc.options.plots.BarPlotCommon.prototype.maxBarSize = undefined;
8069 /**
8070  * Indicates if overflow and underflow markers are shown
8071  * when the bars are drawn off the plot area.
8072  * <p>
8073  * Bars can be drawn off the plot area by use of the
8074  * continuous axis properties 
8075  * <tt>fixedMin</tt> and 
8076  * <tt>fixedMax</tt>.
8077  * 
8078  * @type boolean
8079  * @default true
8080  * @category Style
8081  */
8082 pvc.options.plots.BarPlotCommon.prototype.overflowMarkersVisible = undefined;
8083 /**
8084  * The alignment of a value label
8085  * relative to its corresponding visual element position.
8086  * 
8087  * @type pvc.options.varia.MarkAnchor
8088  * @default 'center'
8089  * @category Style
8090  */
8091 pvc.options.plots.BarPlotCommon.prototype.valuesAnchor = undefined;
8092 /**
8093  * Normalize the domain of bars' values by category.
8094  * 
8095  * @type boolean
8096  * @default false
8097  * @category Style
8098  */
8099 pvc.options.plots.BarPlotCommon.prototype.valuesNormalized = undefined;
8100 /**
8101  * Indicates if legibility of value labels should be optimized.
8102  * <p>
8103  * The current algorithm varies the text color so that it has enough contrast
8104  * for the fill color of the associated bar.
8105  * <p>
8106  * It is applied only when a value label is considered to be 
8107  * <i>inside</i> its
8108  * associated bar. Presently, it is considered to be inside, if the center point
8109  * of the label is within the bounds of the bar.
8110  * 
8111  * @type boolean
8112  * @default false
8113  * @category Style
8114  */
8115 pvc.options.plots.BarPlotCommon.prototype.valuesOptimizeLegibility = undefined;
8116 /**
8117  * The behavior to apply when the text of a value label does not fit within the bounds of its associated bar.
8118  * <p>
8119  * This option applies only when {@link pvc.options.plots.Plot#valuesVisible} is true.
8120  * <p>
8121  * Moreover, it also applies only for certain configurations of value label placement,
8122  * relative to the associated bar. Presently, the supported placements are:
8123  * 
8124  * <ul>
8125  * 
8126  * <li>
8127  * <b>non-negative text margin</b>,
8128  * {@link pvc.options.marks.LabelExtensionPoint#textMargin}.
8129  * </li>
8130  * 
8131  * <li>
8132  * <b>horizontal text</b> — on horizontal or vertical bars;
8133  * on vertical bars, text is allowed to overflow, without trimming.
8134  * Text is horizontal when
8135  * {@link pvc.options.marks.LabelExtensionPoint#textAngle}
8136  * is such that 
8137  * <tt>sin(textAngle) = 0</tt> (example: 
8138  * <tt>0</tt>).
8139  * </li>
8140  * 
8141  * <li>
8142  * <b>vertical text on vertical bars</b> —
8143  * text is vertical when
8144  * {@link pvc.options.marks.LabelExtensionPoint#textAngle}
8145  * is such that 
8146  * <tt>cos(textAngle) = 0</tt> (example: 
8147  * <tt>Math.PI/2</tt>, 
8148  * <tt>-Math.PI/2</tt>, 
8149  * <tt>3*Math.PI/2</tt>, ...).
8150  * </li>
8151  * 
8152  * <li>
8153  * <b>text that is intensionally inside the bar</b> —
8154  * this would be too painful to enumerate;
8155  * generally, it depends on the values of
8156  * {@link pvc.options.plots.Plot#valuesAnchor},
8157  * {@link pvc.options.marks.LabelExtensionPoint#textAngle},
8158  * {@link pvc.options.marks.LabelExtensionPoint#textAlign} and
8159  * {@link pvc.options.marks.LabelExtensionPoint#textBaseline}.
8160  * </li>
8161  * </ul>
8162  * <p>
8163  * When an unsupported placement occurs, the label is shown.
8164  * <p>
8165  * Note that for the purposes of hiding and trimming,
8166  * the value of {@link pvc.options.marks.LabelExtensionPoint#textMargin}
8167  * is used for more that the distance between the anchor points of the label and the bar.
8168  * <p>
8169  * It is also included as a required margin at the side opposite to the label's anchor.
8170  * For example, if a label is anchored with a 
8171  * <tt>bottom</tt> 
8172  * <i>textBaseline</i>,
8173  * the text margin must also be available on the top side of the label.
8174  * <p>
8175  * Also, the same margin is respected on the horizontal sides of the label (left and right),
8176  * whether or not they are anchor sides.
8177  * 
8178  * @type pvc.options.varia.ValuesOverflow
8179  * @default 'hide'
8180  * @category Style
8181  */
8182 pvc.options.plots.BarPlotCommon.prototype.valuesOverflow = undefined;
8183 /**
8184  * The plot's visual roles map.
8185  * <p>
8186  * See {@link pvc.options.plots.BasicPlot#visualRoles} for more information.
8187  * 
8188  * @type map(string : pvc.options.VisualRole)|pvc.options.visualRoles.BarPlotCommonVisualRoles
8189  * @category Visual Roles
8190  */
8191 pvc.options.plots.BarPlotCommon.prototype.visualRoles = undefined;
8192 /**
8193  * The extension points of the 
8194  * <i>bar family</i> plot types.
8195  * <p>
8196  * Plot extension points can be specified:
8197  * 
8198  * <ul>
8199  * 
8200  * <li>at the plot level, in the 
8201  * <i>extensionPoints</i> property,
8202  * without need to prefix the extension point with the
8203  * plot id or name.
8204  * </li>
8205  * 
8206  * <li>at the plot options level, directly,
8207  * without need to prefix the extension point with the
8208  * plot id or name.
8209  * </li>
8210  * 
8211  * <li>
8212  * if it is an internal plot (
8213  * <i>main</i>, 
8214  * <i>plot2</i> or 
8215  * <i>trend</i>),
8216  * at the chart options level, directly.
8217  * </li>
8218  * </ul>
8219  * <p>
8220  * To use an extension point you must find its full name, by joining:
8221  * 
8222  * <ol>
8223  * 
8224  * <li>plot property name (ex: 
8225  * <tt>bar</tt>)</li>
8226  * 
8227  * <li>extension property (ex: 
8228  * <tt>panel</tt>)</li>
8229  * 
8230  * <li>the "_" character</li>
8231  * 
8232  * <li>extension sub-property (ex: 
8233  * <tt>strokeStyle</tt>)</li>
8234  * </ol>
8235  * and obtaining, for the examples, the camel-cased name: 
8236  * <tt>barPanel_strokeStyle</tt>
8237  * (see {@link http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CamelCase}).
8238  * <p>
8239  * The extension points of the 
8240  * <i>main plot</i> of a chart
8241  * may be used without the plot property name prefix.
8242  * In the example, when the 
8243  * <tt>bar</tt> plot is the main plot,
8244  * the extension point can be written as 
8245  * <tt>panel_strokeStyle</tt>.
8246  * 
8247  * @class
8248  */
8249 pvc.options.ext.BarPlotCommonExtensionPoints = function(){};
8250         
8251         
8252         
8253         
8254 /**
8255  * The extension point of the bar mark.
8256  * <p>
8257  * This extension point can only be used by prefixing it
8258  * with the property name of the plot.
8259  * <p>
8260  * So, supposing this plot is under a property named 
8261  * <tt>bar</tt>,
8262  * and it is desired to access the 
8263  * <tt>strokeStyle</tt> property of the bar mark,
8264  * the full name of the extension property
8265  * would be 
8266  * <tt>bar_strokeStyle</tt>.
8267  * 
8268  * @type pvc.options.marks.BarExtensionPoint
8269  */
8270 pvc.options.ext.BarPlotCommonExtensionPoints.prototype._ = undefined;
8271 /**
8272  * The extension point of the value label mark.
8273  * 
8274  * @type pvc.options.marks.LabelExtensionPoint
8275  */
8276 pvc.options.ext.BarPlotCommonExtensionPoints.prototype.label = undefined;
8277 /**
8278  * The extension point of the overflow marker.
8279  * 
8280  * @type pvc.options.marks.DotExtensionPoint
8281  */
8282 pvc.options.ext.BarPlotCommonExtensionPoints.prototype.overflowMarker = undefined;
8283 /**
8284  * The extension point of the series panel of the bar plot.
8285  * 
8286  * @type pvc.options.marks.PanelExtensionPoint
8287  */
8288 pvc.options.ext.BarPlotCommonExtensionPoints.prototype.panel = undefined;
8289 /**
8290  * The extension point of the underflow marker.
8291  * 
8292  * @type pvc.options.marks.DotExtensionPoint
8293  */
8294 pvc.options.ext.BarPlotCommonExtensionPoints.prototype.underflowMarker = undefined;
8295 /**
8296  * The visual roles options class of the 
8297  * <i>bar family</i> plot types.
8298  * 
8299  * @class
8300  * @extends pvc.options.visualRoles.CategoricalPlotVisualRoles
8301  */
8302 pvc.options.visualRoles.BarPlotCommonVisualRoles = function(){};
8303         
8304         
8305         
8306         
8307 /**
8308  * The 
8309  * <tt>category</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
8310  * represents a generic 
8311  * <i>logical grouping</i> of the data points
8312  * and is visually encoded by grouping bars in
8313  * separate bands along the 
8314  * <i>base</i> axis.
8315  * <p>
8316  * On the bar family charts it is restricted to be discrete.
8317  * <p>
8318  * For additional information,
8319  * see the base version of this property:
8320  * {@link pvc.options.visualRoles.CategoricalPlotVisualRoles#category}.
8321  * 
8322  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
8323  * @category Visual Roles
8324  */
8325 pvc.options.visualRoles.BarPlotCommonVisualRoles.prototype.category = undefined;
8326 /**
8327  * The 
8328  * <tt>value</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
8329  * represents its main measure, specifically,
8330  * it is visually encoded by the 
8331  * <i>orthogonal</i> height of bars.
8332  * <p>
8333  * The 
8334  * <tt>value</tt> visual role automatically binds to
8335  * a single numeric dimension whose name has the 
8336  * <tt>value</tt> prefix.
8337  * <p>
8338  * The 
8339  * <tt>value</tt> visual role is required.
8340  * <p>
8341  * See {@link pvc.options.VisualRole}
8342  * for more information on supported data types.
8343  * 
8344  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
8345  * @category Visual Roles
8346  */
8347 pvc.options.visualRoles.BarPlotCommonVisualRoles.prototype.value = undefined;
8348 /**
8349  * The options documentation class of the 
8350  * <b>Bar</b> chart.
8351  * <p>
8352  * For information on the supported 
8353  * <b>data formats</b>
8354  * see {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart}.
8355  * 
8356  * @class
8357  * @extends pvc.options.charts.BarChartCommon
8358  */
8359 pvc.options.charts.BarChart = function(){};
8360         
8361         
8362         
8363         
8364 /**
8365  * Activates the second plot.
8366  * <p>
8367  * The series identified in {@link #plot2Series}
8368  * are plotted in the second plot.
8369  * <p>
8370  * The second plot is a 
8371  * <i>generic</i> point plot, 
8372  * which means that 
8373  * its properties 
8374  * {@link pvc.options.plots.CategoricalNumericPlot#stacked},
8375  * {@link pvc.options.plots.Plot2PointPlot#linesVisible},
8376  * {@link pvc.options.plots.Plot2PointPlot#dotsVisible}, 
8377  * and
8378  * {@link pvc.options.plots.PointPlot#areasVisible}
8379  * can be set freely.
8380  * 
8381  * @type boolean|pvc.options.plots.Plot2PointPlot
8382  * @default false
8383  * @category Plots
8384  */
8385 pvc.options.charts.BarChart.prototype.plot2 = undefined;
8386 /**
8387  * The 
8388  * <i>key values</i> of the series visual role, 
8389  * that are to be shown in the second plot.
8390  * <p>
8391  * If the series visual role has more than one dimension, 
8392  * the specified keys should be 
8393  * the result of joining the key of each dimension with a "~" character.
8394  * <p>
8395  * This option is only relevant when the property
8396  * {@link #plot2} has the value 
8397  * <tt>true</tt>.
8398  * <p>
8399  * If both this and the option {@link #plot2SeriesIndexes} are 
8400  * specified this one prevails.
8401  * 
8402  * @type string|list(string)
8403  * @category Plots > Plot2 > Data
8404  */
8405 pvc.options.charts.BarChart.prototype.plot2Series = undefined;
8406 /**
8407  * The 0-based indexes of the series visual role values 
8408  * that are to be shown in the second plot.
8409  * <p>
8410  * The supplied index or indexes must be convertible to an integer number, positive or negative.
8411  * A negative index designates an index from the last series.
8412  * So 
8413  * <tt>-1</tt> is the last series, 
8414  * 
8415  * <tt>-2</tt> is the next-to-last series, 
8416  * etc.
8417  * 
8418  * <p>
8419  * This option is only relevant when the property
8420  * {@link #plot2} has the value 
8421  * <tt>true</tt>.
8422  * </p>
8423  * 
8424  * <p>
8425  * If both this and the option {@link #plot2Series} are 
8426  * specified this one is ignored.
8427  * </p>
8428  * 
8429  * <p>
8430  * This option upgrades the legacy 
8431  * <i>secondAxisIdx</i>.
8432  * </p>
8433  * 
8434  * @type number|string|list(number|string)
8435  * @default -1
8436  * @category Plots > Plot2 > Data Source
8437  */
8438 pvc.options.charts.BarChart.prototype.plot2SeriesIndexes = undefined;
8439 /**
8440  * The second orthogonal cartesian axis panel options.
8441  * <p>
8442  * By default, 
8443  * the second plot,
8444  * and the trend plot, 
8445  * use the first orthogonal axis.
8446  * <p>
8447  * To use a separate orthogonal axis,
8448  * the property 
8449  * <tt>orthoAxis</tt> of the corresponding plot 
8450  * can be set to 
8451  * <tt>2</tt>.
8452  * <p>
8453  * When the chart {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart#orientation}
8454  * is 
8455  * <tt>vertical</tt> the orthogonal axis is laid out vertically.
8456  * <p>
8457  * See {@link pvc.options.axes.CartesianAxis}
8458  * to know the additional names by which a cartesian axis can be referred to.
8459  * 
8460  * @type pvc.options.axes.NumericCartesianAxis
8461  * @category Axes
8462  */
8463 pvc.options.charts.BarChart.prototype.ortho2Axis = undefined;
8464 /**
8465  * The second color axis options.
8466  * <p>
8467  * By default, 
8468  * the second plot,
8469  * and the trend plot, 
8470  * use the second color axis.
8471  * <p>
8472  * See {@link pvc.options.axes.ColorAxis}
8473  * for more information on the way that 
8474  * the color axes' properties may be accessed. 
8475  * 
8476  * @type pvc.options.axes.DiscreteColorAxis
8477  * @category Axes
8478  */
8479 pvc.options.charts.BarChart.prototype.color2Axis = undefined;
8480 /**
8481  * The trend plot is activated when 
8482  * the 
8483  * <i>other</i> chart plots indicate that their 
8484  * data should be trended.
8485  * <p>
8486  * To activate trending for a plot specify 
8487  * its 
8488  * <tt>trend type</tt> option.
8489  * 
8490  * @type pvc.options.plots.TrendPointPlot
8491  * @category Plots
8492  */
8493 pvc.options.charts.BarChart.prototype.trend = undefined;
8494 /**
8495  * 
8496  * Indicates whether the second orthogonal axis panel is shown.
8497  * 
8498  * @deprecated 
8499  * Use {@link pvc.options.axes.CartesianAxis#visible}, 
8500  * of the 
8501  * <tt>ortho2</tt> axis, instead.
8502  * 
8503  * @type boolean
8504  * @default true
8505  * @category Axes
8506  */
8507 pvc.options.charts.BarChart.prototype.showSecondScale = undefined;
8508 /**
8509  * 
8510  * Indicates whether selected series  
8511  * are plotted in a separate plot.
8512  * 
8513  * @deprecated Use {@link #plot2} instead.
8514  * @type boolean
8515  * @default false
8516  * @category Plots
8517  */
8518 pvc.options.charts.BarChart.prototype.secondAxis = undefined;
8519 /**
8520  * 
8521  * Indicates whether the secondary axis should be 
8522  * shown and with an independent range.
8523  * 
8524  * @deprecated 
8525  * Use
8526  * {@link pvc.options.plots.CategoricalNumericPlot#orthoAxis}
8527  * of the 
8528  * <tt>plot2</tt> plot, instead, 
8529  * to specify an alternate orthogonal axis.
8530  * @type boolean
8531  * @default false
8532  * @category Plots > Plot2 > Axes
8533  */
8534 pvc.options.charts.BarChart.prototype.secondAxisIndependentScale = undefined;
8535 /**
8536  * 
8537  * The zero-based indexes of the series, 
8538  * in 
8539  * <i>the order of appearance in the data source</i>, 
8540  * that are to be shown in the second axis, 
8541  * on chart types that support it.
8542  * <p>
8543  * A negative index designates an index from the last series.
8544  * So 
8545  * <tt>-1</tt> is the last series, 
8546  * 
8547  * <tt>-2</tt> is the next-to-last series, 
8548  * etc.
8549  * 
8550  * @deprecated Use {@link #plot2Series} or {@link #plot2SeriesIndexes} instead.
8551  * @type number|string|list(number|string)
8552  * @category Plots > Plot2 > Data Source
8553  */
8554 pvc.options.charts.BarChart.prototype.secondAxisIdx = undefined;
8555 /**
8556  * 
8557  * The discrete colors scheme to use to distinguish visual elements
8558  * that are colored using the 
8559  * <i>second</i> color axis. 
8560  * 
8561  * @deprecated Use {@link pvc.options.axes.ColorAxis#colors} of the 
8562  * <tt>color2Axis</tt> instead.
8563  * @type list(pvc.options.varia.ColorString)
8564  * @category Plots > Plot2 > Style
8565  */
8566 pvc.options.charts.BarChart.prototype.secondAxisColor = undefined;
8567 /**
8568  * The bar plot is the 
8569  * <b>main plot</b> of the bar chart,
8570  * which means that
8571  * its properties may be used 
8572  * <i>without</i> the "bar" property suffix.
8573  * 
8574  * @type pvc.options.plots.BarPlot
8575  * @category Plots
8576  */
8577 pvc.options.charts.BarChart.prototype.bar = undefined;
8578 /**
8579  * The options documentation class of the 
8580  * <b>Bar</b> plot.
8581  * 
8582  * @class
8583  * @extends pvc.options.plots.BarPlotCommon
8584  */
8585 pvc.options.plots.BarPlot = function(){};
8586         
8587         
8588         
8589         
8590 /**
8591  * The index of the color axis to use for the plot.
8592  * 
8593  * @type number
8594  * @category Axes
8595  * @constant
8596  */
8597 pvc.options.plots.BarPlot.prototype.colorAxis = 1;
8598 /**
8599  * The index of the orthogonal cartesian axis to use for the plot.
8600  * 
8601  * @type number
8602  * @category Axes
8603  * @constant
8604  */
8605 pvc.options.plots.BarPlot.prototype.orthoAxis = 1;
8606 /**
8607  * Contains the plot's trending options.
8608  * <p>
8609  * Besides the property concatenation way of specifying this
8610  * property and its sub-properties,
8611  * this option may also be specified as a plain JSON object.
8612  * 
8613  * @type pvc.options.varia.PlotTrending
8614  * @category Data
8615  */
8616 pvc.options.plots.BarPlot.prototype.trend = undefined;
8617 /**
8618  * The options documentation class of the 
8619  * <b>Normalized Bar</b> chart.
8620  * <p>
8621  * For information on the supported 
8622  * <b>data formats</b>
8623  * see {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart}.
8624  * 
8625  * @class
8626  * @extends pvc.options.charts.BarChart
8627  */
8628 pvc.options.charts.NormalizedBarChart = function(){};
8629         
8630         
8631         
8632         
8633 /**
8634  * The normalized bar plot is the 
8635  * <b>main plot</b> of the normalized area chart,
8636  * which means that
8637  * its properties may be used 
8638  * <i>without</i> the "bar" property suffix.
8639  * 
8640  * <br></br>
8641  * <b>Note:</b> until CCC stable release 14.10.15 this property was called "nbar".
8642  * 
8643  * @type pvc.options.plots.NormalizedBarPlot
8644  * @category Plots
8645  */
8646 pvc.options.charts.NormalizedBarChart.prototype.bar = undefined;
8647 /**
8648  * The options documentation class of the 
8649  * <b>Normalized Bar</b> plot.
8650  * 
8651  * @class
8652  * @extends pvc.options.plots.BarPlot
8653  */
8654 pvc.options.plots.NormalizedBarPlot = function(){};

8662  * @type number
8663  * @category Axes
8664  * @constant
8665  */
8666 pvc.options.plots.NormalizedBarPlot.prototype.colorAxis = 1;

8670  * @type number
8671  * @category Axes
8672  * @constant
8673  */
8674 pvc.options.plots.NormalizedBarPlot.prototype.orthoAxis = 1;
8675 /**
8676  * This plot type is necessarily stacked.
8677  * 
8678  * @type boolean
8679  * @constant
8680  */
8681 pvc.options.plots.NormalizedBarPlot.prototype.stacked = true;
8682 /**
8683  * This plot's values are necessarily normalized.
8684  * 
8685  * @type boolean
8686  * @constant
8687  */
8688 pvc.options.plots.NormalizedBarPlot.prototype.valuesNormalized = true;
8689 /**
8690  * The options documentation class of the 
8691  * <b>Waterfall</b> chart.
8692  * <p>
8693  * For information on the supported 
8694  * <b>data formats</b>
8695  * see {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart}.
8696  * 
8697  * @class
8698  * @extends pvc.options.charts.BarChartCommon
8699  */
8700 pvc.options.charts.WaterfallChart = function(){};

8702         
8703         
8704         
8705 /**
8706  * The waterfall plot is the 
8707  * <b>main plot</b> of the waterfall chart,
8708  * which means that
8709  * its properties may be used 
8710  * <i>without</i> the "water" property suffix.
8711  * 
8712  * @type pvc.options.plots.WaterfallPlot
8713  * @category Plots
8714  */
8715 pvc.options.charts.WaterfallChart.prototype.water = undefined;
8716 /**
8717  * The options documentation class of the 
8718  * <b>Bar</b> plot.
8719  * 
8720  * @class
8721  * @extends pvc.options.plots.BarPlotCommon
8722  */
8723 pvc.options.plots.WaterfallPlot = function(){};
8724         
8725         
8726         
8727         
8728 /**
8729  * The index of the color axis to use for the plot.
8730  * 
8731  * @type number
8732  * @category Axes
8733  * @constant
8734  */
8735 pvc.options.plots.WaterfallPlot.prototype.colorAxis = 1;
8736 /**
8737  * The index of the orthogonal cartesian axis to use for the plot.
8738  * 
8739  * @type number
8740  * @category Axes
8741  * @constant
8742  */
8743 pvc.options.plots.WaterfallPlot.prototype.orthoAxis = 1;
8744 /**
8745  * The description of the fictitious root category
8746  * that aggregates all other categories.
8747  * 
8748  * @type string
8749  * @default 'All'
8750  * @category Style
8751  */
8752 pvc.options.plots.WaterfallPlot.prototype.allCategoryLabel = undefined;
8753 /**
8754  * Indicates if shaded areas are shown in the plot.
8755  * <p>
8756  * Specifically,
8757  * indicates if areas are shown surrounding the bars of each
8758  * category group.
8759  * 
8760  * @type boolean
8761  * @default true
8762  * @category Style
8763  */
8764 pvc.options.plots.WaterfallPlot.prototype.areasVisible = undefined;
8765 /**
8766  * The direction of the waterfall.
8767  * 
8768  * @type pvc.options.varia.WaterDirection
8769  * @default 'down'
8770  * @category Style
8771  */
8772 pvc.options.plots.WaterfallPlot.prototype.direction = undefined;
8773 /**
8774  * The extension points object contains style definitions for
8775  * the marks of the plot.
8776  * 
8777  * @type pvc.options.ext.WaterfallPlotExtensionPoints
8778  * @category Style
8779  */
8780 pvc.options.plots.WaterfallPlot.prototype.extensionPoints = undefined;
8781 /**
8782  * This plot type is necessarily stacked.
8783  * 
8784  * @type boolean

8786  * @constant
8787  */
8788 pvc.options.plots.WaterfallPlot.prototype.stacked = true;

8791  * the water line.
8792  * 
8793  * @type string
8794  * @default 'Accumulated'
8795  * @category Style
8796  */
8797 pvc.options.plots.WaterfallPlot.prototype.totalLineLabel = undefined;
8798 /**
8799  * Indicates if value labels are shown above or below
8800  * the water line showing the accumulated value.
8801  * <p>
8802  * The default value is
8803  * the value of the property
8804  * {@link pvc.options.plots.Plot#valuesVisible}.
8805  * 
8806  * @type boolean
8807  * @category Style
8808  */
8809 pvc.options.plots.WaterfallPlot.prototype.totalValuesVisible = undefined;
8810 /**
8811  * This plot type is necessarily not normalized.
8812  * 
8813  * @type boolean
8814  * @category Style
8815  * @constant
8816  */
8817 pvc.options.plots.WaterfallPlot.prototype.valuesNormalized = false;
8818 /**
8819  * The extension points of the waterfall plot type.
8820  * <p>
8821  * Plot extension points can be specified:
8822  * 
8823  * <ul>
8824  * 
8825  * <li>at the plot level, in the 
8826  * <i>extensionPoints</i> property,
8827  * without need to prefix the extension point with the
8828  * plot id or name.
8829  * </li>
8830  * 
8831  * <li>at the plot options level, directly,
8832  * without need to prefix the extension point with the
8833  * plot id or name.
8834  * </li>
8835  * 
8836  * <li>
8837  * if it is an internal plot (
8838  * <i>main</i>, 
8839  * <i>plot2</i> or 
8840  * <i>trend</i>),
8841  * at the chart options level, directly.
8842  * </li>
8843  * </ul>
8844  * <p>
8845  * To use an extension point you must find its full name, by joining:
8846  * 
8847  * <ol>
8848  * 
8849  * <li>plot property name (ex: 
8850  * <tt>water</tt>)</li>
8851  * 
8852  * <li>extension property (ex: 
8853  * <tt>line</tt>)</li>
8854  * 
8855  * <li>the "_" character</li>
8856  * 
8857  * <li>extension sub-property (ex: 
8858  * <tt>strokeStyle</tt>)</li>
8859  * </ol>
8860  * and obtaining, for the examples, the camel-cased name: 
8861  * <tt>waterLine_strokeStyle</tt>
8862  * (see {@link http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CamelCase}).
8863  * <p>
8864  * The extension points of the 
8865  * <i>main plot</i> of a chart
8866  * may be used without the plot property name prefix.
8867  * In the example, when the 
8868  * <tt>water</tt> plot is the main plot,
8869  * the extension point can be written as 
8870  * <tt>line_strokeStyle</tt>.
8871  * 
8872  * @class
8873  * @extends pvc.options.ext.BarPlotCommonExtensionPoints
8874  */
8875 pvc.options.ext.WaterfallPlotExtensionPoints = function(){};
8876         
8877         
8878         
8879         
8880 /**
8881  * The extension point of the group panel mark.
8882  * <p>
8883  * The group panel visually contains all bars that
8884  * belong to the same group.
8885  * 
8886  * @type pvc.options.marks.PanelExtensionPoint
8887  */
8888 pvc.options.ext.WaterfallPlotExtensionPoints.prototype.group = undefined;
8889 /**
8890  * The extension point of the top water line mark.
8891  * 
8892  * @type pvc.options.marks.LineExtensionPoint
8893  */
8894 pvc.options.ext.WaterfallPlotExtensionPoints.prototype.line = undefined;
8895 /**
8896  * The extension point of the category total label mark,
8897  * that is placed near the water line.
8898  * 
8899  * @type pvc.options.marks.LabelExtensionPoint
8900  */
8901 pvc.options.ext.WaterfallPlotExtensionPoints.prototype.lineLabel = undefined;
8902 /**
8903  * The common options documentation class for the 
8904  * <b>Line/Dot/Area family</b> charts.
8905  * <p>
8906  * For information on the supported 
8907  * <b>data formats</b>
8908  * see {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart}.
8909  * 
8910  * @class
8911  * @extends pvc.options.charts.CategoricalNumericChart
8912  * @abstract
8913  */
8914 pvc.options.charts.PointChart = function(){};
8915         
8916         
8917         
8918         
8919 /**
8920  * Activates the second plot.
8921  * <p>
8922  * The series identified in {@link #plot2Series}
8923  * are plotted in the second plot.
8924  * <p>
8925  * The second plot is a 
8926  * <i>generic</i> point plot, 
8927  * which means that 
8928  * its properties 
8929  * {@link pvc.options.plots.CategoricalNumericPlot#stacked},
8930  * {@link pvc.options.plots.Plot2PointPlot#linesVisible},
8931  * {@link pvc.options.plots.Plot2PointPlot#dotsVisible}, 
8932  * and
8933  * {@link pvc.options.plots.PointPlot#areasVisible}
8934  * can be set freely.
8935  * 
8936  * @type boolean|pvc.options.plots.Plot2PointPlot
8937  * @default false
8938  * @category Plots
8939  */
8940 pvc.options.charts.PointChart.prototype.plot2 = undefined;
8941 /**
8942  * The 
8943  * <i>key values</i> of the series visual role, 
8944  * that are to be shown in the second plot.
8945  * <p>
8946  * If the series visual role has more than one dimension, 
8947  * the specified keys should be 
8948  * the result of joining the key of each dimension with a "~" character.
8949  * <p>
8950  * This option is only relevant when the property
8951  * {@link #plot2} has the value 
8952  * <tt>true</tt>.
8953  * <p>
8954  * If both this and the option {@link #plot2SeriesIndexes} are 
8955  * specified this one prevails.
8956  * 
8957  * @type string|list(string)
8958  * @category Plots > Plot2 > Data
8959  */
8960 pvc.options.charts.PointChart.prototype.plot2Series = undefined;
8961 /**
8962  * The 0-based indexes of the series visual role values 
8963  * that are to be shown in the second plot.
8964  * <p>
8965  * The supplied index or indexes must be convertible to an integer number, positive or negative.
8966  * A negative index designates an index from the last series.
8967  * So 
8968  * <tt>-1</tt> is the last series, 
8969  * 
8970  * <tt>-2</tt> is the next-to-last series, 
8971  * etc.
8972  * 
8973  * <p>
8974  * This option is only relevant when the property
8975  * {@link #plot2} has the value 
8976  * <tt>true</tt>.
8977  * </p>
8978  * 
8979  * <p>
8980  * If both this and the option {@link #plot2Series} are 
8981  * specified this one is ignored.
8982  * </p>
8983  * 
8984  * <p>
8985  * This option upgrades the legacy 
8986  * <i>secondAxisIdx</i>.
8987  * </p>
8988  * 
8989  * @type number|string|list(number|string)
8990  * @default -1
8991  * @category Plots > Plot2 > Data Source
8992  */
8993 pvc.options.charts.PointChart.prototype.plot2SeriesIndexes = undefined;
8994 /**
8995  * The second orthogonal cartesian axis panel options.
8996  * <p>
8997  * By default, 
8998  * the second plot,
8999  * and the trend plot, 
9000  * use the first orthogonal axis.
9001  * <p>
9002  * To use a separate orthogonal axis,
9003  * the property 
9004  * <tt>orthoAxis</tt> of the corresponding plot 
9005  * can be set to 
9006  * <tt>2</tt>.
9007  * <p>
9008  * When the chart {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart#orientation}
9009  * is 
9010  * <tt>vertical</tt> the orthogonal axis is laid out vertically.
9011  * <p>
9012  * See {@link pvc.options.axes.CartesianAxis}
9013  * to know the additional names by which a cartesian axis can be referred to.
9014  * 
9015  * @type pvc.options.axes.NumericCartesianAxis
9016  * @category Axes
9017  */
9018 pvc.options.charts.PointChart.prototype.ortho2Axis = undefined;
9019 /**
9020  * The second color axis options.
9021  * <p>
9022  * By default, 
9023  * the second plot,
9024  * and the trend plot, 
9025  * use the second color axis.
9026  * <p>
9027  * See {@link pvc.options.axes.ColorAxis}
9028  * for more information on the way that 
9029  * the color axes' properties may be accessed. 
9030  * 
9031  * @type pvc.options.axes.DiscreteColorAxis
9032  * @category Axes
9033  */
9034 pvc.options.charts.PointChart.prototype.color2Axis = undefined;
9035 /**
9036  * The trend plot is activated when 
9037  * the 
9038  * <i>other</i> chart plots indicate that their 
9039  * data should be trended.
9040  * <p>
9041  * To activate trending for a plot specify 
9042  * its 
9043  * <tt>trend type</tt> option.
9044  * 
9045  * @type pvc.options.plots.TrendPointPlot
9046  * @category Plots
9047  */
9048 pvc.options.charts.PointChart.prototype.trend = undefined;
9049 /**
9050  * The base cartesian axis panel options.
9051  * <p>
9052  * When the chart {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart#orientation}
9053  * is 
9054  * <tt>vertical</tt> the base axis is laid out horizontally.
9055  * <p>
9056  * See {@link pvc.options.axes.CartesianAxis}
9057  * to know the additional names by which a cartesian axis can be referred to.
9058  * 
9059  * @type pvc.options.axes.AnyNonHierarchicalCartesianAxis
9060  * @category Axes
9061  */
9062 pvc.options.charts.PointChart.prototype.baseAxis = undefined;
9063 /**
9064  * The 
9065  * <tt>value</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
9066  * represents its main measure under analysis, specifically,
9067  * it is visually encoded by the 
9068  * <i>orthogonal</i> position of points.
9069  * <p>
9070  * This is a shortcut property for the main plot's
9071  * {@link pvc.options.visualRoles.PointPlotVisualRoles#value}.
9072  * 
9073  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
9074  * @category Chart > Visual Roles
9075  */
9076 pvc.options.charts.PointChart.prototype.valueRole = undefined;
9077 /**
9078  * The common options documentation class of the 
9079  * <b>point</b> plots.
9080  * 
9081  * @class
9082  * @extends pvc.options.plots.CategoricalNumericPlot
9083  */
9084 pvc.options.plots.PointPlot = function(){};
9085         
9086         
9087         
9088         
9089 /**
9090  * Indicates if the visual elements show dots/markers
9091  * in each point's position.

9093  * @type boolean
9094  * @default false
9095  * @category Style
9096  */
9097 pvc.options.plots.PointPlot.prototype.dotsVisible = undefined;

9100  * with lines.

9105  */
9106 pvc.options.plots.PointPlot.prototype.linesVisible = undefined;
9107 /**
9108  * 
9109  * Indicates if the visual elements show dots/markers
9110  * in each point's position.
9111  * 
9112  * @deprecated Use {@link #dotsVisible} instead.
9113  * @type boolean
9114  * @category Style
9115  */
9116 pvc.options.plots.PointPlot.prototype.showDots = undefined;
9117 /**
9118  * 
9119  * Indicates if the visual elements are connected
9120  * with lines.
9121  * 
9122  * @deprecated Use {@link #linesVisible} instead.
9123  * @type boolean
9124  * @category Style
9125  */
9126 pvc.options.plots.PointPlot.prototype.showLines = undefined;
9127 /**
9128  * Contains the plot's trending options.
9129  * <p>
9130  * Besides the property concatenation way of specifying this
9131  * property and its sub-properties,
9132  * this option may also be specified as a plain JSON object.
9133  * 
9134  * @type pvc.options.varia.PlotTrending
9135  * @category Data
9136  */
9137 pvc.options.plots.PointPlot.prototype.trend = undefined;
9138 /**
9139  * The values mask used to build the text of value labels.
9140  * <p>
9141  * The mask may contain scene variable names and/or scene atom names,
9142  * like in the examples:
9143  * 
9144  * <ul>
9145  * 
9146  * <li>scene variables: 
9147  * <tt>{category}: {value} EUR</tt>, could yield 
9148  * <tt>Drinks: 3.45 EUR</tt></li>
9149  * 
9150  * <li>atom variables:  
9151  * <tt>{#family} - {#product}</tt>, could yield 
9152  * <tt>Plains - Boeing 747</tt></li>
9153  * </ul>
9154  * 
9155  * @type string
9156  * @default '{value}'
9157  * @category Layout
9158  */
9159 pvc.options.plots.PointPlot.prototype.valuesMask = undefined;
9160 /**
9161  * A value that is multiplied by the opacity value of the area's base color.
9162  * <p>
9163  * A non-negative number, possibly 
9164  * <tt>Infinity</tt>.
9165  * <p>
9166  * This option is ignored unless {@link #areasVisible} is 
9167  * <tt>true</tt>
9168  * and the plot is 
9169  * <i>not</i> stacked.
9170  * 
9171  * @type number
9172  * @default 0.5
9173  * @category Style
9174  */
9175 pvc.options.plots.PointPlot.prototype.areasFillOpacity = undefined;
9176 /**
9177  * Indicates if shaded areas are shown in the plot.
9178  * <p>
9179  * Specifically,
9180  * indicates if the visual elements are
9181  * connected with shaded areas extending
9182  * from the visual elements to the zero line.
9183  * 
9184  * @type boolean
9185  * @default false
9186  * @category Style
9187  */
9188 pvc.options.plots.PointPlot.prototype.areasVisible = undefined;
9189 /**
9190  * The extension points object contains style definitions for
9191  * the marks of the plot.
9192  * 
9193  * @type pvc.options.ext.PointPlotExtensionPoints
9194  * @category Style
9195  */
9196 pvc.options.plots.PointPlot.prototype.extensionPoints = undefined;
9197 /**
9198  * 
9199  * Indicates if the visual elements are
9200  * connected with shaded areas extending
9201  * from the visual elements to the zero line.
9202  * 
9203  * @deprecated Use {@link #areasVisible} instead.
9204  * @type boolean
9205  * @category Style
9206  */
9207 pvc.options.plots.PointPlot.prototype.showAreas = undefined;
9208 /**
9209  * The alignment of a value label
9210  * relative to its corresponding visual element position.
9211  * 
9212  * @type pvc.options.varia.MarkAnchor
9213  * @default 'right'
9214  * @category Style
9215  */
9216 pvc.options.plots.PointPlot.prototype.valuesAnchor = undefined;
9217 /**
9218  * The plot's visual roles map.
9219  * <p>
9220  * See {@link pvc.options.plots.BasicPlot#visualRoles} for more information.
9221  * 
9222  * @type map(string : pvc.options.VisualRole)|pvc.options.visualRoles.PointPlotVisualRoles
9223  * @category Visual Roles
9224  */
9225 pvc.options.plots.PointPlot.prototype.visualRoles = undefined;
9226 /**
9227  * The extension points common to the 
9228  * <b>point</b> plot types.
9229  * <p>
9230  * Plot extension points can be specified:
9231  * 
9232  * <ul>
9233  * 
9234  * <li>at the plot level, in the 
9235  * <i>extensionPoints</i> property,
9236  * without need to prefix the extension point with the
9237  * plot id or name.
9238  * </li>
9239  * 
9240  * <li>at the plot options level, directly,
9241  * without need to prefix the extension point with the
9242  * plot id or name.
9243  * </li>
9244  * 
9245  * <li>
9246  * if it is an internal plot (
9247  * <i>main</i>, 
9248  * <i>plot2</i> or 
9249  * <i>trend</i>),
9250  * at the chart options level, directly.
9251  * </li>
9252  * </ul>
9253  * <p>
9254  * To use an extension point you must find its full name, by joining:
9255  * 
9256  * <ol>
9257  * 
9258  * <li>plot property name (ex: 
9259  * <tt>point</tt>)</li>
9260  * 
9261  * <li>extension property (ex: 
9262  * <tt>area</tt>)</li>
9263  * 
9264  * <li>the "_" character</li>
9265  * 
9266  * <li>extension sub-property (ex: 
9267  * <tt>fillStyle</tt>)</li>
9268  * </ol>
9269  * and obtaining, for the examples, the camel-cased name: 
9270  * <tt>pointArea_fillStyle</tt>
9271  * (see {@link http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CamelCase}).
9272  * <p>
9273  * The extension points of the 
9274  * <i>main plot</i> of a chart
9275  * may be used without the plot property name prefix.
9276  * In the example, when the 
9277  * <tt>point</tt> plot is the main plot,
9278  * the extension point can be written as 
9279  * <tt>area_fillStyle</tt>.
9280  * 
9281  * @class
9282  */
9283 pvc.options.ext.PointPlotExtensionPoints = function(){};
9284         
9285         
9286         
9287         
9288 /**
9289  * The extension point of the area mark.
9290  * 
9291  * @type pvc.options.marks.AreaExtensionPoint
9292  */
9293 pvc.options.ext.PointPlotExtensionPoints.prototype.area = undefined;
9294 /**
9295  * The extension point of the dot mark.
9296  * 
9297  * @type pvc.options.marks.DotExtensionPoint
9298  */
9299 pvc.options.ext.PointPlotExtensionPoints.prototype.dot = undefined;
9300 /**
9301  * The extension point of the value label mark.
9302  * 
9303  * @type pvc.options.marks.LabelExtensionPoint
9304  */
9305 pvc.options.ext.PointPlotExtensionPoints.prototype.label = undefined;
9306 /**
9307  * The extension point of the line mark.
9308  * 
9309  * @type pvc.options.marks.LineExtensionPoint
9310  */
9311 pvc.options.ext.PointPlotExtensionPoints.prototype.line = undefined;
9312 /**
9313  * The extension point of the series panel mark.
9314  * 
9315  * @type pvc.options.marks.PanelExtensionPoint
9316  */
9317 pvc.options.ext.PointPlotExtensionPoints.prototype.panel = undefined;
9318 /**
9319  * The visual roles options class of the point plot type.
9320  * 
9321  * @class
9322  * @extends pvc.options.visualRoles.CategoricalPlotVisualRoles
9323  */
9324 pvc.options.visualRoles.PointPlotVisualRoles = function(){};

9326         
9327         
9328         
9329 /**
9330  * The 
9331  * <tt>value</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
9332  * represents its main measure under analysis, specifically,
9333  * it is visually encoded by the 
9334  * <i>orthogonal</i> position of points.
9335  * <p>
9336  * The 
9337  * <tt>value</tt> visual role automatically binds to
9338  * a single numeric dimension whose name has the 
9339  * <tt>value</tt> prefix.
9340  * <p>
9341  * The 
9342  * <tt>value</tt> visual role is required.
9343  * <p>
9344  * See {@link pvc.options.VisualRole}
9345  * for more information on supported data types.
9346  * 
9347  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
9348  * @category Visual Roles
9349  */
9350 pvc.options.visualRoles.PointPlotVisualRoles.prototype.value = undefined;
