9771  */
9772 pvc.options.plots.StackedAreaPlot.prototype.stacked = true;
9773 /**
9774  * The common options documentation class for the 
9775  * <b>Metric Line/Dot family</b> charts.
9776  * 
9777  * <h3>Default Data Format</h3>
9778  * For general information on the supported 
9779  * <b>data formats</b>
9780  * see {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart}.
9781  * <p>
9782  * The metric-point chart family employs a non-default 
9783  * <i>logical row</i> to dimensions mapping:
9784  * 
9785  * <ol>
9786  * 
9787  * <li>
9788  * All of the free 
9789  * <i>discrete</i> columns of the 
9790  * <i>logical table</i>
9791  * generate and load free dimensions of the "series" 
9792  * <i>dimension group</i>:
9793  * "series", "series2", "series4", ...
9794  * </li>
9795  * 
9796  * <li>Free 
9797  * <i>continuous</i> columns of the 
9798  * <i>logical table</i> generate and load,
9799  * in order, skipping the dimension when not-free,
9800  * the following numeric 
9801  * <i>dimensions</i>:
9802  * 
9803  * <ol>
9804  * 
9805  * <li>x</li>
9806  * 
9807  * <li>y</li>
9808  * 
9809  * <li>color</li>
9810  * 
9811  * <li>size</li>
9812  * </ol>
9813  * </li>
9814  * </ol>
9815  * 
9816  * <style>
9817  * .dataformat {
9818  * border-spacing: 0;
9819  * margin: 1em 0;
9820  * }
9821  * .dataformat td {
9822  * border:  solid 1px;
9823  * padding: 3px;
9824  * width:   80px;
9825  * }
9826  * </style>
9827  * <p>
9828  * All the following are possible 
9829  * <i>default layouts</i> and dimension assignments:
9830  * 
9831  * <table class='dataformat'>
9832  * 
9833  * <tr>
9834  * <td>
9835  * <b>Index</b></td>
9836  * <td>0</td>
9837  * <td>1</td>
9838  * <td>2</td></tr>
9839  * 
9840  * <tr>
9841  * <td>
9842  * <b>Dimension</b></td>
9843  * <td>series</td>
9844  * <td>x</td>
9845  * <td>y</td></tr>
9846  * 
9847  * <tr>
9848  * <td>
9849  * <b>DataType</b></td>
9850  * <td>string</td>
9851  * <td>number</td>
9852  * <td>number</td></tr>
9853  * </table>
9854  * 
9855  * <table class='dataformat'>
9856  * 
9857  * <tr>
9858  * <td>
9859  * <b>Index</b></td>
9860  * <td>0</td>
9861  * <td>1</td>
9862  * <td>2</td>
9863  * <td>3</td>
9864  * <td>4</td></tr>
9865  * 
9866  * <tr>
9867  * <td>
9868  * <b>Dimension</b></td>
9869  * <td>series</td>
9870  * <td>series2</td>
9871  * <td>x</td>
9872  * <td>y</td>
9873  * <td>color</td></tr>
9874  * 
9875  * <tr>
9876  * <td>
9877  * <b>DataType</b></td>
9878  * <td>string</td>
9879  * <td>string</td>
9880  * <td>number</td>
9881  * <td>number</td>
9882  * <td>number</td></tr>
9883  * </table>
9884  * 
9885  * <table class='dataformat'>
9886  * 
9887  * <tr>
9888  * <td>
9889  * <b>Index</b></td>
9890  * <td>0</td>
9891  * <td>1</td>
9892  * <td>2</td>
9893  * <td>3</td>
9894  * <td>4</td></tr>
9895  * 
9896  * <tr>
9897  * <td>
9898  * <b>Dimension</b></td>
9899  * <td>series</td>
9900  * <td>x</td>
9901  * <td>y</td>
9902  * <td>color</td>
9903  * <td>size</td></tr>
9904  * 
9905  * <tr>
9906  * <td>
9907  * <b>DataType</b></td>
9908  * <td>string</td>
9909  * <td>number</td>
9910  * <td>number</td>
9911  * <td>number</td>
9912  * <td>number</td></tr>
9913  * </table>
9914  * 
9915  * <h3>How To Bind The Color Visual Role</h3>
9916  * The Metric Point's 
9917  * <tt>color</tt> visual role can be
9918  * bound to either continuous or discrete dimensions.
9919  * <p>
9920  * In the default table layout,
9921  * when enough free 
9922  * <i>continuous</i> columns exist,
9923  * a dimension named "color" is generated and loaded
9924  * — the name of the 
9925  * <tt>color</tt> role's default dimension —,
9926  * resulting in a 
9927  * <i>continuous</i> color scale.
9928  * <p>
9929  * Otherwise, by default,
9930  * the 
9931  * <tt>color</tt> visual role ends up being bound the
9932  * dimensions of the series role — its default 
9933  * <i>source role</i> —,
9934  * resulting in a 
9935  * <i>discrete</i> color scale.
9936  * <p>
9937  * The 
9938  * <tt>color</tt> role can also be bound to other discrete dimension(s), explicitly.
9939  * 
9940  * <h4>Solution 1</h4>
9941  * One possibility is to 
9942  * <i>switch</i> one of the automatically fed "series" dimensions
9943  * to the 
9944  * <tt>color</tt> visual role.
9945  * For example:
9946  * 
9947  * <pre>
9948  * seriesRole: "series", // steal one here
9949  * colorRole:  "series2" // and assign it here
9950  * 
9951  * </pre>
9952  * 
9953  * <h4>Solution 2</h4>
9954  * A second possibility is to simply match colors to "series":
9955  * 
9956  * <pre>
9957  * seriesRole: {from: "series"} // same dimensions as the series visual role
9958  * 
9959  * </pre>
9960  * 
9961  * <h4>Solution 3</h4>
9962  * Another possibility is to configure the {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart#readers}
9963  * with the actual layout, using the default dimension names of
9964  * the desired visual roles.
9965  * For example:
9966  * 
9967  * <pre>
9968  * readers: "color, series, x, y, size"
9969  * 
9970  * </pre>
9971  * 
9972  * <h4>Solution 4</h4>
9973  * Of course, you can (and probably should) use actual business names for the names of dimensions.
9974  * To that end, both the readers and the visual roles' mappings need to be specified:
9975  * 
9976  * <pre>
9977  * readers:      "orderType, productFamily, productType, expectedSales, actualSales, profit"
9978  * colorRole:    "orderType",
9979  * seriesRole:   "orderType", // controls drawing layer only
9980  * xRole:        "expectedSales",
9981  * yRole:        "actualSales",
9982  * sizeRole:     "profit"
9983  * 
9984  * </pre>
9985  * Note that in this plot type, the series visual role only controls the layer
9986  * of the dot cloud.
9987  * Also, the dimensions "productFamily" and "productType"
9988  * were not mapped to any visual role,
9989  * and will only be presented in the tooltip.
9990  * 
9991  * @class
9992  * @extends pvc.options.charts.CartesianChart
9993  * @abstract
9994  */
9995 pvc.options.charts.MetricPointChart = function(){};
9996         
9997         
9998         
9999         
10000 /**
10001  * The trend plot is activated when 
10002  * the 
10003  * <i>other</i> chart plots indicate that their 
10004  * data should be trended.
10005  * <p>
10006  * To activate trending for a plot specify 
10007  * its 
10008  * <tt>trend type</tt> option.
10009  * 
10010  * @type pvc.options.plots.TrendMetricPointPlot
10011  * @category Plots
10012  */
10013 pvc.options.charts.MetricPointChart.prototype.trend = undefined;
10014 /**
10015  * The second color axis options.
10016  * <p>
10017  * By default, 
10018  * the second plot,
10019  * and the trend plot, 
10020  * use the second color axis.
10021  * <p>
10022  * See {@link pvc.options.axes.ColorAxis}
10023  * for more information on the way that 
10024  * the color axes' properties may be accessed. 
10025  * 
10026  * @type pvc.options.axes.DiscreteColorAxis
10027  * @category Axes
10028  */
10029 pvc.options.charts.MetricPointChart.prototype.color2Axis = undefined;
10030 /**
10031  * The maximum number of 
10032  * <i>small</i> charts that should
10033  * be displayed in a row.
10034  * <p>
10035  * This property can receive a value of 
10036  * <tt>Infinity</tt>
10037  * to indicate that all charts should be laid out in a single row.
10038  * 
10039  * @type number
10040  * @default 3
10041  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
10042  */
10043 pvc.options.charts.MetricPointChart.prototype.multiChartColumnsMax = undefined;
10044 /**
10045  * The maximum number of 
10046  * <i>small</i> charts that should
10047  * be displayed.
10048  * <p>
10049  * The first 
10050  * <i>small</i> charts are chosen.
10051  * 
10052  * @type number
10053  * @default Infinity
10054  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
10055  */
10056 pvc.options.charts.MetricPointChart.prototype.multiChartMax = undefined;
10057 /**
10058  * The strategy to follow when the resulting multi-chart layout
10059  * does not fit entirely in the initial chart size.
10060  * 
10061  * @type pvc.options.varia.MultiChartOverflow
10062  * @default 'grow'
10063  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
10064  */
10065 pvc.options.charts.MetricPointChart.prototype.multiChartOverflow = undefined;
10066 /**
10067  * Indicates that,
10068  * when the layout results in a single column
10069  * and the value of {@link #smallHeight}
10070  * is still to be determined,
10071  * it should be set to all the initially available content height,
10072  * instead of determining the height from the
10073  * {@link #smallAspectRatio} and the {@link #smallWidth}.
10074  * 
10075  * @type boolean
10076  * @default true
10077  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
10078  */
10079 pvc.options.charts.MetricPointChart.prototype.multiChartSingleColFillsHeight = undefined;
10080 /**
10081  * Indicates that,
10082  * when the layout results in a single row
10083  * and the value of {@link #smallHeight}
10084  * is still to be determined,
10085  * it should be set to all the initially available content height,
10086  * instead of determining the height from the
10087  * {@link #smallAspectRatio} and the {@link #smallWidth}.
10088  * 
10089  * @type boolean
10090  * @default true
10091  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
10092  */
10093 pvc.options.charts.MetricPointChart.prototype.multiChartSingleRowFillsHeight = undefined;
10094 /**
10095  * The ratio of the width over the height of a 
10096  * <i>small</i> chart.
10097  * <p>
10098  * It is used when the set of properties
10099  * {@link #smallWidth},
10100  * {@link #smallHeight},
10101  * {@link #multiChartColumnsMax},
10102  * {@link #multiChartSingleRowFillsHeight} and
10103  * {@link #multiChartSingleColFillsHeight},
10104  * is under-specified and
10105  * is not enough to determine the value of both
10106  * {@link #smallWidth} and
10107  * {@link #smallHeight}.
10108  * <p>
10109  * The default value of the aspect ratio depends on the chart type,
10110  * but is something around 
10111  * <tt>4/3</tt>.
10112  * 
10113  * @type number
10114  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
10115  */
10116 pvc.options.charts.MetricPointChart.prototype.smallAspectRatio = undefined;
10117 /**
10118  * The margins of the 
10119  * <i>content panel</i> of a 
10120  * <i>small</i> chart.
10121  * <p>
10122  * See {@link pvc.options.varia.Sides} for information about
10123  * the different supported data types.
10124  * 
10125  * @type number|string|pvc.options.varia.Sides
10126  * @default 0
10127  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
10128  */
10129 pvc.options.charts.MetricPointChart.prototype.smallContentMargins = undefined;
10130 /**
10131  * The paddings of the 
10132  * <i>content panel</i> of a 
10133  * <i>small</i> chart.
10134  * <p>
10135  * See {@link pvc.options.varia.Sides} for information about
10136  * the different supported data types.
10137  * 
10138  * @type number|string|pvc.options.varia.Sides
10139  * @default 0
10140  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
10141  */
10142 pvc.options.charts.MetricPointChart.prototype.smallContentPaddings = undefined;
10143 /**
10144  * Fixates the height of each 
10145  * <i>small</i> chart, in pixel units or as a percentage.
10146  * <p>
10147  * A value of type 
10148  * <tt>number</tt>,
10149  * or of type 
10150  * <tt>string</tt>, but with numeric content,
10151  * is interpreted as being in pixel units.
10152  * <p>
10153  * A value of type 
10154  * <tt>string</tt>,
10155  * with numeric content that is suffixed by a "%" character,
10156  * is interpreted as a percentage of the initially available content height.
10157  * <p>
10158  * This property may cause the 
10159  * <i>small multiples</i> chart
10160  * to take up a greater width than the one specified in {@link #height}.
10161  * <p>
10162  * When this property is unspecified,
10163  * its value depends on the evaluation of the
10164  * {@link #smallWidth} property,
10165  * which may impose it a value.
10166  * If after the evaluation of {@link #smallWidth}
10167  * this property remains unspecified,
10168  * it is determined as follows.
10169  * <p>
10170  * If the layout will have a single column
10171  * and the property {@link #multiChartSingleColFillsHeight}
10172  * is 
10173  * <tt>true</tt> (it is by default)
10174  * then the height will be the initially available content height.
10175  * <p>
10176  * If the layout will have a single row
10177  * and the property {@link #multiChartSingleRowFillsHeight}
10178  * is 
10179  * <tt>true</tt> (it is by default)
10180  * then the height will be the initially available content height.
10181  * <p>
10182  * Otherwise, the property {@link #smallAspectRatio} is
10183  * used to determine the height of the small chart from its determined width.
10184  * <p>
10185  * The aspect ratio is defaulted to a value that depends on the chart type,
10186  * but is something around 
10187  * <tt>4/3</tt>.
10188  * 
10189  * @type number|string
10190  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
10191  */
10192 pvc.options.charts.MetricPointChart.prototype.smallHeight = undefined;
10193 /**
10194  * The margins of a 
10195  * <i>small</i> chart.
10196  * <p>
10197  * See {@link pvc.options.varia.Sides} for information about
10198  * the different supported data types.
10199  * 
10200  * @type number|string|pvc.options.varia.Sides
10201  * @default '2%'
10202  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
10203  */
10204 pvc.options.charts.MetricPointChart.prototype.smallMargins = undefined;
10205 /**
10206  * The paddings of a 
10207  * <i>small</i> chart.
10208  * <p>
10209  * See {@link pvc.options.varia.Sides} for information about
10210  * the different supported data types.
10211  * 
10212  * @type number|string|pvc.options.varia.Sides
10213  * @default 0
10214  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
10215  */
10216 pvc.options.charts.MetricPointChart.prototype.smallPaddings = undefined;
10217 /**
10218  * Fixates the width of each 
10219  * <i>small</i> chart, in pixel units or as a percentage.
10220  * <p>
10221  * A value of type 
10222  * <tt>number</tt>,
10223  * or of type 
10224  * <tt>string</tt>, but with numeric content,
10225  * is interpreted as being in pixel units.
10226  * <p>
10227  * A value of type 
10228  * <tt>string</tt>,
10229  * with numeric content that is suffixed by a "%" character,
10230  * is interpreted as a percentage of the initially available content width.
10231  * <p>
10232  * This property may cause the 
10233  * <i>small multiples</i> chart
10234  * to take up a greater width than the one specified in {@link #width}.
10235  * <p>
10236  * When this property is unspecified,
10237  * a specified finite value, or a defaulted value, of the property {@link #multiChartColumnsMax} is
10238  * used to determine it:
10239  * by dividing the initially available content width
10240  * by the maximum number of charts in a row that 
10241  * <i>actually</i> occur
10242  * (so that if there are less small charts than
10243  * the maximum that can be placed in a row,
10244  * these, nevertheless, take up the whole width).
10245  * <p>
10246  * When an infinite value is specified for
10247  * {@link #multiChartColumnsMax},
10248  * the small charts are laid out in a single row,
10249  * and so the width is calculated from the height {@link #smallHeight},
10250  * using the aspect ratio {@link #smallAspectRatio}.
10251  * The height is defaulted to the initially available content height.
10252  * The aspect ratio is defaulted to a value that depends on the chart type,
10253  * but is something around 
10254  * <tt>4/3</tt>.
10255  * The width is then calculated.
10256  * 
10257  * @type number|string
10258  * @category Chart - Multi > Layout
10259  */
10260 pvc.options.charts.MetricPointChart.prototype.smallWidth = undefined;
10261 /**
10262  * The indexes of columns of the 
10263  * <i>logical table</i> that are to feed the
10264  * default
10265  * 
10266  * <tt>multiChart</tt>,
10267  * 
10268  * <tt>multiChart2</tt>, ...
10269  * dimensions.
10270  * <p>
10271  * See {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart#readers} for related information.
10272  * 
10273  * @type number|string|list(number|string)
10274  * @category Chart > Data Source
10275  */
10276 pvc.options.charts.MetricPointChart.prototype.multiChartIndexes = undefined;
10277 /**
10278  * The 
10279  * <tt>multiChart</tt> visual role is a chart-level visual role that
10280  * allows turning a chart into a 
10281  * <i>small multiples</i> chart,
10282  * {@link http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Small_multiple}.
10283  * <p>
10284  * Almost all main chart types support being shown
10285  * as a small multiples chart.
10286  * Currently, the exceptions are the charts:
10287  * 
10288  * <i>Heat Grid</i>,
10289  * 
10290  * <i>Bullet</i>,
10291  * 
10292  * <i>Data Tree</i> and
10293  * 
10294  * <i>Parallel Coordinates</i>.
10295  * <p>
10296  * The 
10297  * <tt>multiChart</tt> visual role
10298  * can be bound to any number of dimensions,
10299  * that are, or will be turned into, discrete.
10300  * <p>
10301  * The 
10302  * <tt>multiChart</tt> visual role automatically binds to
10303  * every dimension whose name has the 
10304  * <tt>multiChart</tt> prefix.
10305  * <p>
10306  * One 
10307  * <i>small</i> chart is generated per
10308  * unique combination of the values of the bound dimensions
10309  * that is present in the source data.
10310  * Each small chart then receives as its data
10311  * the partition of the source data that shares its
10312  * unique combination of values.
10313  * <p>
10314  * See {@link pvc.options.VisualRole}
10315  * for more information on supported data types.
10316  * 
10317  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
10318  * @category Chart > Visual Roles
10319  */
10320 pvc.options.charts.MetricPointChart.prototype.multiChartRole = undefined;
10321 /**
10322  * The title panel of the 
10323  * <i>small</i> chart.
10324  * <p>
10325  * The text of the title of small charts is the
10326  * compound label of the data bound to the 
10327  * <tt>multiChart</tt> visual role.
10328  * 
10329  * @type pvc.options.panels.ChartTitlePanel
10330  * @category Panels - Multi
10331  */
10332 pvc.options.charts.MetricPointChart.prototype.smallTitle = undefined;
10333 /**
10334  * The base cartesian axis panel options.
10335  * <p>
10336  * When the chart {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart#orientation}
10337  * is 
10338  * <tt>vertical</tt> the base axis is laid out horizontally.
10339  * <p>
10340  * See {@link pvc.options.axes.CartesianAxis}
10341  * to know the additional names by which a cartesian axis can be referred to.
10342  * 
10343  * @type pvc.options.axes.AnyContinuousCartesianAxis
10344  * @category Axes
10345  */
10346 pvc.options.charts.MetricPointChart.prototype.baseAxis = undefined;
10347 /**
10348  * The first color axis options.
10349  * <p>
10350  * This axis can also be accessed by the property name 
10351  * <tt>color</tt>.
10352  * <p>
10353  * See {@link pvc.options.axes.ColorAxis}
10354  * for more information on the way that
10355  * the color axes' properties may be accessed.
10356  * 
10357  * @type pvc.options.axes.AnyColorAxis
10358  * @category Axes
10359  */
10360 pvc.options.charts.MetricPointChart.prototype.color = undefined;
10361 /**
10362  * The orthogonal cartesian axis panel options.
10363  * <p>
10364  * When the chart {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart#orientation}
10365  * is 
10366  * <tt>vertical</tt> the orthogonal axis is laid out vertically.
10367  * <p>
10368  * See {@link pvc.options.axes.CartesianAxis}
10369  * to know the additional names by which a cartesian axis can be referred to.
10370  * 
10371  * @type pvc.options.axes.AnyContinuousCartesianAxis
10372  * @category Axes
10373  */
10374 pvc.options.charts.MetricPointChart.prototype.orthoAxis = undefined;
10375 /**
10376  * The size axis options.
10377  * 
10378  * @type pvc.options.axes.SizeAxis
10379  * @category Axes
10380  */
10381 pvc.options.charts.MetricPointChart.prototype.sizeAxis = undefined;
10382 /**
10383  * The extension points object contains style definitions for
10384  * the marks of the chart.
10385  * 
10386  * @type pvc.options.ext.MetricPointChartExtensionPoints
10387  * @category Chart
10388  */
10389 pvc.options.charts.MetricPointChart.prototype.extensionPoints = undefined;
10390 /**
10391  * The 
10392  * <tt>color</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
10393  * is visually encoded by the color of visual elements.
10394  * <p>
10395  * This is a shortcut property for the main plot's
10396  * {@link pvc.options.visualRoles.MetricPointPlotVisualRoles#color}.
10397  * 
10398  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
10399  * @category Chart > Visual Roles
10400  */
10401 pvc.options.charts.MetricPointChart.prototype.colorRole = undefined;
10402 /**
10403  * The 
10404  * <tt>size</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
10405  * is visually encoded by the size of visual elements.
10406  * <p>
10407  * This is a shortcut property for the main plot's
10408  * {@link pvc.options.visualRoles.MetricPointPlotVisualRoles#color}.
10409  * 
10410  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
10411  * @category Chart > Visual Roles
10412  */
10413 pvc.options.charts.MetricPointChart.prototype.sizeRole = undefined;
10414 /**
10415  * The chart's visual roles map.
10416  * <p>
10417  * See {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart#visualRoles} for more information.
10418  * 
10419  * @type map(string : pvc.options.VisualRole)|pvc.options.visualRoles.MetricPointChartVisualRoles
10420  * @category Chart > Visual Roles
10421  */
10422 pvc.options.charts.MetricPointChart.prototype.visualRoles = undefined;
10423 /**
10424  * The 
10425  * <tt>x</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
10426  * is visually encoded by the 
10427  * <i>base</i> position of the "point" visual element.
10428  * <p>
10429  * This is a shortcut property for the main plot's
10430  * {@link pvc.options.visualRoles.MetricPointPlotVisualRoles#color}.
10431  * 
10432  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
10433  * @category Chart > Visual Roles
10434  */
10435 pvc.options.charts.MetricPointChart.prototype.xRole = undefined;
10436 /**
10437  * The 
10438  * <tt>y</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
10439  * is visually encoded by the 
10440  * <i>orthogonal</i> position of the "point" visual element.
10441  * <p>
10442  * This is a shortcut property for the main plot's
10443  * {@link pvc.options.visualRoles.MetricPointPlotVisualRoles#color}.
10444  * 
10445  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
10446  * @category Chart > Visual Roles
10447  */
10448 pvc.options.charts.MetricPointChart.prototype.yRole = undefined;
10449 /**
10450  * The extension points of the 
10451  * <i>metric line/dot/area family</i> chart types.
10452  * <p>
10453  * Chart extension points can also be specified directly at the chart options level.
10454  * <p>
10455  * To use an extension point you must find its full name, by joining:
10456  * 
10457  * <ol>
10458  * 
10459  * <li>extension property (ex: 
10460  * <tt>smallBase</tt>)</li>
10461  * 
10462  * <li>the "_" character</li>
10463  * 
10464  * <li>extension sub-property (ex: 
10465  * <tt>strokeStyle</tt>)</li>
10466  * </ol>
10467  * and obtaining, for the examples, the camel-cased name: 
10468  * <tt>smallBase_strokeStyle</tt>
10469  * (see {@link http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CamelCase}).
10470  * 
10471  * @class
10472  * @extends pvc.options.ext.CartesianChartExtensionPoints
10473  */
10474 pvc.options.ext.MetricPointChartExtensionPoints = function(){};
10475         
10476         
10477         
10478         
10479 /**
10480  * The extension point of the multi-chart overflow/clip marker.
10481  * 
10482  * @type pvc.options.marks.DotExtensionPoint
10483  * @category Chart - Multi
10484  */
10485 pvc.options.ext.MetricPointChartExtensionPoints.prototype.multiChartOverflowMarker = undefined;
10486 /**
10487  * The extension point of the base (root) panel of the 
10488  * <i>small</i> charts.
10489  * 
10490  * @type pvc.options.marks.PanelExtensionPoint
10491  * @category Chart - Multi
10492  */
10493 pvc.options.ext.MetricPointChartExtensionPoints.prototype.smallBase = undefined;
10494 /**
10495  * The extension point of the content panel of the 
10496  * <i>small</i> charts.
10497  * <p>
10498  * The content panel is a child of the base panel.
10499  * 
10500  * @type pvc.options.marks.PanelExtensionPoint
10501  * @category Chart - Multi
10502  */
10503 pvc.options.ext.MetricPointChartExtensionPoints.prototype.smallContent = undefined;
10504 /**
10505  * The visual roles options class of the metric point chart type.
10506  * 
10507  * @class
10508  * @extends pvc.options.visualRoles.BasicChartVisualRoles
10509  */
10510 pvc.options.visualRoles.MetricPointChartVisualRoles = function(){};
10511         
10512         
10513         
10514         
10515 /**
10516  * The 
10517  * <tt>multiChart</tt> visual role is a chart-level visual role that
10518  * allows turning a chart into a 
10519  * <i>small multiples</i> chart,
10520  * {@link http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Small_multiple}.
10521  * <p>
10522  * Almost all main chart types support being shown
10523  * as a small multiples chart.
10524  * Currently, the exceptions are the charts:
10525  * 
10526  * <i>Heat Grid</i>,
10527  * 
10528  * <i>Bullet</i>,
10529  * 
10530  * <i>Data Tree</i> and
10531  * 
10532  * <i>Parallel Coordinates</i>.
10533  * <p>
10534  * The 
10535  * <tt>multiChart</tt> visual role
10536  * can be bound to any number of dimensions,
10537  * that are, or will be turned into, discrete.
10538  * <p>
10539  * The 
10540  * <tt>multiChart</tt> visual role automatically binds to
10541  * every dimension whose name has the 
10542  * <tt>multiChart</tt> prefix.
10543  * <p>
10544  * One 
10545  * <i>small</i> chart is generated per
10546  * unique combination of the values of the bound dimensions
10547  * that is present in the source data.
10548  * Each small chart then receives as its data
10549  * the partition of the source data that shares its
10550  * unique combination of values.
10551  * <p>
10552  * See {@link pvc.options.VisualRole}
10553  * for more information on supported data types.
10554  * 
10555  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
10556  * @category Chart > Visual Roles
10557  */
10558 pvc.options.visualRoles.MetricPointChartVisualRoles.prototype.multiChart = undefined;
10559 /**
10560  * The extension points common to the 
10561  * <b>metric point</b> plot types.
10562  * <p>
10563  * Plot extension points can be specified:
10564  * 
10565  * <ul>
10566  * 
10567  * <li>at the plot level, in the 
10568  * <i>extensionPoints</i> property,
10569  * without need to prefix the extension point with the
10570  * plot id or name.
10571  * </li>
10572  * 
10573  * <li>at the plot options level, directly,
10574  * without need to prefix the extension point with the
10575  * plot id or name.
10576  * </li>
10577  * 
10578  * <li>
10579  * if it is an internal plot (
10580  * <i>main</i>, 
10581  * <i>plot2</i> or 
10582  * <i>trend</i>),
10583  * at the chart options level, directly.
10584  * </li>
10585  * </ul>
10586  * <p>
10587  * To use an extension point you must find its full name, by joining:
10588  * 
10589  * <ol>
10590  * 
10591  * <li>plot property name (ex: 
10592  * <tt>point</tt>)</li>
10593  * 
10594  * <li>extension property (ex: 
10595  * <tt>line</tt>)</li>
10596  * 
10597  * <li>the "_" character</li>
10598  * 
10599  * <li>extension sub-property (ex: 
10600  * <tt>strokeStyle</tt>)</li>
10601  * </ol>
10602  * and obtaining, for the examples, the camel-cased name: 
10603  * <tt>pointLine_strokeStyle</tt>
10604  * (see {@link http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CamelCase}).
10605  * <p>
10606  * The extension points of the 
10607  * <i>main plot</i> of a chart
10608  * may be used without the plot property name prefix.
10609  * In the example, when the 
10610  * <tt>point</tt> plot is the main plot,
10611  * the extension point can be written as 
10612  * <tt>line_strokeStyle</tt>.
10613  * 
10614  * @class
10615  */
10616 pvc.options.ext.MetricPointPlotExtensionPoints = function(){};
10617         
10618         
10619         
10620         
10621 /**
10622  * The extension point of the dot mark.
10623  * 
10624  * @type pvc.options.marks.DotExtensionPoint
10625  */
10626 pvc.options.ext.MetricPointPlotExtensionPoints.prototype.dot = undefined;
10627 /**
10628  * The extension point of the value label mark.
10629  * 
10630  * @type pvc.options.marks.LabelExtensionPoint
10631  */
10632 pvc.options.ext.MetricPointPlotExtensionPoints.prototype.label = undefined;
10633 /**
10634  * The extension point of the line mark.
10635  * 
10636  * @type pvc.options.marks.LineExtensionPoint
10637  */
10638 pvc.options.ext.MetricPointPlotExtensionPoints.prototype.line = undefined;
10639 /**
10640  * The extension point of the series panel mark.
10641  * 
10642  * @type pvc.options.marks.PanelExtensionPoint
10643  */
10644 pvc.options.ext.MetricPointPlotExtensionPoints.prototype.panel = undefined;
10645 /**
10646  * The common options documentation class of the 
10647  * <b>metric point</b> plots.
10648  * 
10649  * @class
10650  * @extends pvc.options.plots.CartesianPlot
10651  */
10652 pvc.options.plots.MetricPointPlot = function(){};
10653         
10654         
10655         
10656         
10657 /**
10658  * Indicates if the visual elements show dots/markers
10659  * in each point's position.
10660  * 
10661  * @type boolean
10662  * @default false
10663  * @category Style
10664  */
10665 pvc.options.plots.MetricPointPlot.prototype.dotsVisible = undefined;
10666 /**
10667  * Indicates if the visual elements are connected
10668  * with lines.
10669  * 
10670  * @type boolean
10671  * @default false
10672  * @category Style
10673  */
10674 pvc.options.plots.MetricPointPlot.prototype.linesVisible = undefined;
10675 /**
10676  * 
10677  * Indicates if the visual elements show dots/markers
10678  * in each point's position.
10679  * 
10680  * @deprecated Use {@link #dotsVisible} instead.
10681  * @type boolean
10682  * @category Style
10683  */
10684 pvc.options.plots.MetricPointPlot.prototype.showDots = undefined;
10685 /**
10686  * 
10687  * Indicates if the visual elements are connected
10688  * with lines.
10689  * 
10690  * @deprecated Use {@link #linesVisible} instead.
10691  * @type boolean
10692  * @category Style
10693  */
10694 pvc.options.plots.MetricPointPlot.prototype.showLines = undefined;
10695 /**
10696  * Contains the plot's trending options.
10697  * <p>
10698  * Besides the property concatenation way of specifying this
10699  * property and its sub-properties,
10700  * this option may also be specified as a plain JSON object.
10701  * 
10702  * @type pvc.options.varia.PlotTrending
10703  * @category Data
10704  */
10705 pvc.options.plots.MetricPointPlot.prototype.trend = undefined;
10706 /**
10707  * The values mask used to build the text of value labels.
10708  * <p>
10709  * The mask may contain scene variable names and/or scene atom names,
10710  * like in the examples:
10711  * 
10712  * <ul>
10713  * 
10714  * <li>scene variables: 
10715  * <tt>{category}: {value} EUR</tt>, could yield 
10716  * <tt>Drinks: 3.45 EUR</tt></li>
10717  * 
10718  * <li>atom variables:  
10719  * <tt>{#family} - {#product}</tt>, could yield 
10720  * <tt>Plains - Boeing 747</tt></li>
10721  * </ul>
10722  * 
10723  * @type string
10724  * @default '{x},{y}'
10725  * @category Layout
10726  */
10727 pvc.options.plots.MetricPointPlot.prototype.valuesMask = undefined;
10728 /**
10729  * The extension points object contains style definitions for
10730  * the marks of the plot.
10731  * 
10732  * @type pvc.options.ext.MetricPointPlotExtensionPoints
10733  * @category Style
10734  */
10735 pvc.options.plots.MetricPointPlot.prototype.extensionPoints = undefined;
10736 /**
10737  * The shape to use when the value of the 
10738  * <i>size</i> role is 
10739  * <tt>null</tt>.
10740  * <p>
10741  * When the value of {@link #nullShape} is 
10742  * <tt>null</tt>,
10743  * visual elements with null size value are not shown.
10744  * 
10745  * @type pvc.options.varia.DotShapeType
10746  * @default 'cross'
10747  * @category Style
10748  */
10749 pvc.options.plots.MetricPointPlot.prototype.nullShape = undefined;
10750 /**
10751  * Forces a given shape to be used in the dot mark.
10752  * 
10753  * @type pvc.options.varia.DotShapeType
10754  * @default 'circle'
10755  * @category Style
10756  */
10757 pvc.options.plots.MetricPointPlot.prototype.shape = undefined;
10758 /**
10759  * The alignment of a value label
10760  * relative to its corresponding visual element position.
10761  * 
10762  * @type pvc.options.varia.MarkAnchor
10763  * @default 'right'
10764  * @category Style
10765  */
10766 pvc.options.plots.MetricPointPlot.prototype.valuesAnchor = undefined;
10767 /**
10768  * The plot's visual roles map.
10769  * <p>
10770  * See {@link pvc.options.plots.BasicPlot#visualRoles} for more information.
10771  * 
10772  * @type map(string : pvc.options.VisualRole)|pvc.options.visualRoles.MetricPointPlotVisualRoles
10773  * @category Visual Roles
10774  */
10775 pvc.options.plots.MetricPointPlot.prototype.visualRoles = undefined;
10776 /**
10777  * The visual roles options class of the metric point plot type.
10778  * 
10779  * @class
10780  * @extends pvc.options.visualRoles.CartesianPlotVisualRoles
10781  */
10782 pvc.options.visualRoles.MetricPointPlotVisualRoles = function(){};
10783         
10784         
10785         
10786         
10787 /**
10788  * The 
10789  * <tt>color</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
10790  * is visually encoded by the color of visual elements.
10791  * <p>
10792  * Specifically,
10793  * it is the color of the dots and lines of the visual elements
10794  * that is changed according to the color of the corresponding
10795  * color role value.
10796  * <p>
10797  * The 
10798  * <tt>color</tt> visual role automatically binds to
10799  * every discrete dimension, or a single continuous dimension,
10800  * whose name has the 
10801  * <tt>color</tt> prefix
10802  * or, if none exists,
10803  * the dimensions of the "series" role.
10804  * <p>
10805  * The 
10806  * <tt>color</tt> visual role is discrete or continuous.
10807  * <p>
10808  * The default value type of dimensions bound to it is 
10809  * <tt>Number</tt>.
10810  * <p>
10811  * See {@link pvc.options.VisualRole}
10812  * for more information on supported data types.
10813  * 
10814  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
10815  * @category Visual Roles
10816  */
10817 pvc.options.visualRoles.MetricPointPlotVisualRoles.prototype.color = undefined;
10818 /**
10819  * The 
10820  * <tt>size</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
10821  * is visually encoded by the size of visual elements.
10822  * <p>
10823  * Specifically, when dots are visible,
10824  * controls the size of the dot mark.
10825  * <p>
10826  * The 
10827  * <tt>size</tt> visual role automatically binds to
10828  * every dimension whose name has the 
10829  * <tt>size</tt> prefix.
10830  * <p>
10831  * The 
10832  * <tt>size</tt> visual role is continuous and optional.
10833  * <p>
10834  * The default value type of the dimension bound to it is 
10835  * <tt>Number</tt>.
10836  * <p>
10837  * See {@link pvc.options.VisualRole}
10838  * for more information on supported data types.
10839  * 
10840  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
10841  * @category Visual Roles
10842  */
10843 pvc.options.visualRoles.MetricPointPlotVisualRoles.prototype.size = undefined;
10844 /**
10845  * The 
10846  * <tt>x</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
10847  * is visually encoded by the 
10848  * <i>base</i> position of the "point" visual element.
10849  * <p>
10850  * The 
10851  * <tt>x</tt> visual role automatically binds to
10852  * a single dimension whose name has the 
10853  * <tt>x</tt> prefix.
10854  * <p>
10855  * The 
10856  * <tt>x</tt> visual role is continuous and required.
10857  * <p>
10858  * The default value type of the dimension bound to it
10859  * depends on the value of the chart option
10860  * {@link pvc.options.charts.Chart#timeSeries}.
10861  * If it is 
10862  * <tt>true</tt>
10863  * it is 
10864  * <tt>Date</tt>, otherwise,
10865  * it is 
10866  * <tt>Number</tt>.
10867  * <p>
10868  * See {@link pvc.options.VisualRole}
10869  * for more information on supported data types.
10870  * 
10871  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
10872  * @category Visual Roles
10873  */
10874 pvc.options.visualRoles.MetricPointPlotVisualRoles.prototype.x = undefined;
10875 /**
10876  * The 
10877  * <tt>y</tt> visual role is a plot-level visual role that
10878  * is visually encoded by the 
10879  * <i>orthogonal</i> position of the "point" visual element.
10880  * <p>
10881  * The 
10882  * <tt>y</tt> visual role automatically binds to
10883  * a single dimension whose name has the 
10884  * <tt>y</tt> prefix.
10885  * <p>
10886  * The 
10887  * <tt>y</tt> visual role is continuous and required.
10888  * <p>
10889  * The default value type of the dimension bound to it is 
10890  * <tt>Number</tt>.
10891  * <p>
10892  * See {@link pvc.options.VisualRole}
10893  * for more information on supported data types.
10894  * 
10895  * @type string|pvc.options.VisualRole
10896  * @category Visual Roles
10897  */
10898 pvc.options.visualRoles.MetricPointPlotVisualRoles.prototype.y = undefined;
10899 /**
10900  * The options documentation class of the 
10901  * <b>Metric Line</b> chart.
10902  * <p>
10903  * For information on the supported 
10904  * <b>data formats</b>
10905  * see {@link pvc.options.charts.MetricPointChart}.
10906  * 
10907  * @class
10908  * @extends pvc.options.charts.MetricPointChart
10909  */
10910 pvc.options.charts.MetricLineChart = function(){};

10916  * The metric point plot is the 
10917  * <b>main plot</b> of the metric line chart,
10918  * which means that
10919  * its properties may be used 
10920  * <i>without</i> the "scatter" property suffix.
10921  * 
10922  * @type pvc.options.plots.MetricLinePlot
10923  * @category Plots
10924  */
10925 pvc.options.charts.MetricLineChart.prototype.scatter = undefined;

10929  * 
10930  * @class
10931  * @extends pvc.options.plots.MetricPointPlot
10932  */
10933 pvc.options.plots.MetricLinePlot = function(){};

10942  * @category Axes
10943  * @constant
10944  */
10945 pvc.options.plots.MetricLinePlot.prototype.colorAxis = 1;

10948  * 
10949  * @type number
10950  * @category Axes
10951  * @constant
10952  */
10953 pvc.options.plots.MetricLinePlot.prototype.orthoAxis = 1;

10956  * visual elements.
10957  * 
10958  * @type boolean
10959  * @constant
10960  */
10961 pvc.options.plots.MetricLinePlot.prototype.linesVisible = true;
10962 /**
10963  * The options documentation class of the 
10964  * <b>Metric Dot (XY Scatter)</b> chart.
10965  * <p>
10966  * For information on the supported 
10967  * <b>data formats</b>
10968  * see {@link pvc.options.charts.MetricPointChart}.
10969  * 
10970  * @class
10971  * @extends pvc.options.charts.MetricPointChart

10973 pvc.options.charts.MetricDotChart = function(){};
10974

10976         
10977         
10978 /**
10979  * The metric point plot is the 
10980  * <b>main plot</b> of the metric dot chart,
10981  * which means that
10982  * its properties may be used 
10983  * <i>without</i> the "scatter" property suffix.
10984  * 
10985  * @type pvc.options.plots.MetricDotPlot
10986  * @category Plots
10987  */
10988 pvc.options.charts.MetricDotChart.prototype.scatter = undefined;
10989 /**
10990  * The options documentation class of the 
10991  * <b>metric dot</b> plot.
10992  * 
10993  * @class
10994  * @extends pvc.options.plots.MetricPointPlot
10995  */
10996 pvc.options.plots.MetricDotPlot = function(){};
10997         
10998         
10999         
11000         
11001 /**
11002  * The index of the color axis to use for the plot.
11003  * 
11004  * @type number
11005  * @category Axes
11006  * @constant
11007  */
11008 pvc.options.plots.MetricDotPlot.prototype.colorAxis = 1;
11009 /**
11010  * The index of the orthogonal cartesian axis to use for the plot.
11011  * 
11012  * @type number
11013  * @category Axes
11014  * @constant
11015  */
11016 pvc.options.plots.MetricDotPlot.prototype.orthoAxis = 1;
11017 /**
11018  * This plot type necessarily shows dots/markers.
11019  * 
11020  * @type boolean
11021  * @constant
11022  */
11023 pvc.options.plots.MetricDotPlot.prototype.dotsVisible = true;
11024 /**
11025  * The namespace of the options of 
11026  * extension points of 
11027  * <i>protovis</i> marks. 
11028  * 
11029  * @namespace
11030  */
11031 pvc.options.marks = {};
11032 
11033 /**
11034  * The base class of protovis extension points.
11035  * <p>
11036  * See the associated protovis documentation at
11037  * {@link http://mbostock.github.com/protovis/jsdoc/symbols/pv.Mark.html}.
11038  * 
11039  * @class
11040  * @abstract
11041  */
11042 pvc.options.marks.MarkExtensionPoint = function(){};
11043         
11044         
11045         
11046         
11047 /**
11048  * Use this extension point to add
11049  * a new protovis mark to another mark.
11050  * <p>
11051  * If the extension point refers to a panel mark,
11052  * the parent of the new mark will be that panel.
11053  * Otherwise, its parent will
11054  * be the parent panel of the mark of the extension point.
11055  * 
11056  * <p>
11057  * The following example shows how to add an image to
11058  * an axis tick:
11059  * 
11060  * <pre>
11061  * function yAxisTick(){
11062  *     return new pv.Image()
11063  *             .url('res/images/arrowYy.png')
11064  *             .lineWidth(0)
11065  *             .height(7)
11066  *             .width(5);
11067  * }
11068  *                 
11069  * </pre>
11070  * 
11071  * <p>
11072  * 
11073  * @type function
11074  */
11075 pvc.options.marks.MarkExtensionPoint.prototype.add = undefined;
11076 /**
11077  * Indicates the distance between
11078  * this mark's bottom side and
11079  * its parent's bottom side.
11080  * <p>
11081  * See the associated protovis documentation at
11082  * {@link http://mbostock.github.com/protovis/jsdoc/symbols/pv.Mark.html#bottom}.
11083  * 
11084  * @type number
11085  */
11086 pvc.options.marks.MarkExtensionPoint.prototype.bottom = undefined;
11087 /**
11088  * The mouse cursor to show when the mouse is over.
11089  * The value is a CSS2 cursor: {@link http://www.w3.org/TR/CSS2/ui.html#propdef-cursor}.
11090  * <p>
11091  * See the associated protovis documentation at
11092  * {@link http://mbostock.github.com/protovis/jsdoc/symbols/pv.Mark.html#cursor}.
11093  * 
11094  * @type string
11095  */
11096 pvc.options.marks.MarkExtensionPoint.prototype.cursor = undefined;
11097 /**
11098  * The mouse events that the mark can receive.
11099  * <p>
11100  * The possible values are:
11101  * 
11102  * <tt>'none'</tt>, 
11103  * <tt>'painted'</tt> and 
11104  * <tt>'all'</tt>.
11105  * <p>
11106  * See the associated protovis documentation at
11107  * {@link http://mbostock.github.com/protovis/jsdoc/symbols/pv.Mark.html#events}.
11108  * 
11109  * @type string
11110  */
11111 pvc.options.marks.MarkExtensionPoint.prototype.events = undefined;
11112 /**
11113  * Flags that affect the interactivity of the mark.
11114  * <p>
11115  * The default value, 
11116  * <tt>-1</tt> has all bits with the value "1".
11117  * <p>
11118  * Only the bits for which {@link #imask} is "1" are considered.
11119  * <p>
11120  * Bits can be combined by using a "|" character, for example:
11121  * 
11122  * <code>"Selectable|Hoverable"</code>
11123  * <p>
11124  * The following are the supported bit values:
11125  * 
11126  * <style>
11127  * .bitstable {
11128  * border-spacing: 0;
11129  * margin: 1em 0;
11130  * }
11131  * .bitstable th {
11132  * font-weight: bold;
11133  * }
11134  * .bitstable td, .bitstable th {
11135  * border:  solid 1px;
11136  * padding: 5px;
11137  * }
11138  * </style>
11139  * 
11140  * <table class='bitstable'>
11141  * 
11142  * <tr>
11143  * 
11144  * <th>bit</th>
11145  * 
11146  * <th>description</th>
11147  * </tr>
11148  * 
11149  * <tr>
11150  * 
11151  * <td>Interactive</td>
11152  * 
11153  * <td>
11154  * The mark can trigger and display interaction.
11155  * </td>
11156  * </tr>
11157  * 
11158  * <tr>
11159  * 
11160  * <td>ShowsActivity</td>
11161  * 
11162  * <td>The mark's style can change based on the active scene.</td>
11163  * </tr>
11164  * 
11165  * <tr>
11166  * 
11167  * <td>ShowsSelection</td>
11168  * 
11169  * <td>The mark's style can change based on whether the datums in its scene are selected.</td>
11170  * </tr>
11171  * 
11172  * <tr>
11173  * 
11174  * <td>ShowsTooltip</td>
11175  * 
11176  * <td>The mark displays a tooltip when pointed to.</td>
11177  * </tr>
11178  * 
11179  * <tr>
11180  * 
11181  * <td>Selectable</td>
11182  * 
11183  * <td>
11184  * The mark can be selected by one of the possible means.
11185  * Use this to disable this mark from affecting selection,
11186  * by whatever means.
11187  * </td>
11188  * </tr>
11189  * 
11190  * <tr>
11191  * 
11192  * <td>SelectableByClick</td>
11193  * 
11194  * <td>
11195  * The mark can be selected by clicking on it.
11196  * Requires the 
11197  * <i>Selectable</i> bit as well.
11198  * </td>
11199  * </tr>
11200  * 
11201  * <tr>
11202  * 
11203  * <td>SelectableByRubberband</td>
11204  * 
11205  * <td>
11206  * The mark can be selected by using the rubber-band.
11207  * </td>
11208  * </tr>
11209  * 
11210  * <tr>
11211  * 
11212  * <td>SelectableByFocusWindow</td>
11213  * 
11214  * <td>
11215  * The mark can be selected when the focus window reveals it.
11216  * </td>
11217  * </tr>
11218  * 
11219  * <tr>
11220  * 
11221  * <td>Hoverable</td>
11222  * 
11223  * <td>
11224  * The mark can be hovered-over and affect its scene's active state.
11225  * </td>
11226  * </tr>
11227  * 
11228  * <tr>
11229  * 
11230  * <td>Clickable</td>
11231  * 
11232  * <td>
11233  * The mark can be clicked and trigger the 
11234  * <i>clickAction</i> handler.
11235  * </td>
11236  * </tr>
11237  * 
11238  * <tr>
11239  * 
11240  * <td>DoubleClickable</td>
11241  * 
11242  * <td>
11243  * The mark can be double-clicked and trigger the 
11244  * <i>doubleClickAction</i> handler.
11245  * </td>
11246  * </tr>
11247  * </table>
11248  * 
11249  * @type number|string
11250  * @default -1
11251  */
11252 pvc.options.marks.MarkExtensionPoint.prototype.ibits = undefined;
11253 /**
11254  * Bit mask which controls the bits of 
11255  * <i>ibits</i> that should be considered.
11256  * <p>
11257  * The default value, 
11258  * <tt>0</tt> has all bits with the value "0".
11259  * <p>
11260  * See  {@link #ibits} for more information.
11261  * 
11262  * @type number|string
11263  * @default 0
11264  */
11265 pvc.options.marks.MarkExtensionPoint.prototype.imask = undefined;
11266 /**
11267  * Indicates the distance between
11268  * this mark's left side and
11269  * its parent's left side.
11270  * <p>
11271  * See the associated protovis documentation at
11272  * {@link http://mbostock.github.com/protovis/jsdoc/symbols/pv.Mark.html#left}.
11273  * 
11274  * @type number
11275  */
11276 pvc.options.marks.MarkExtensionPoint.prototype.left = undefined;
11277 /**
11278  * Indicates the distance between
11279  * this mark's right side and
11280  * its parent's right side.
11281  * <p>
11282  * See the associated protovis documentation at
11283  * {@link http://mbostock.github.com/protovis/jsdoc/symbols/pv.Mark.html#right}.
11284  * 
11285  * @type number
11286  */
11287 pvc.options.marks.MarkExtensionPoint.prototype.right = undefined;
11288 /**
11289  * Indicates the distance between
11290  * this mark's top side and
11291  * its parent's top side.
11292  * <p>
11293  * See the associated protovis documentation at
11294  * {@link http://mbostock.github.com/protovis/jsdoc/symbols/pv.Mark.html#top}.
11295  * 
11296  * @type number
11297  */
11298 pvc.options.marks.MarkExtensionPoint.prototype.top = undefined;
11299 /**
11300  * Indicates if a mark is visible.
11301  * <p>
11302  * When a mark is not visible,
11303  * all its other properties are not evaluated.
11304  * <p>
11305  * When a mark is not visible,
11306  * its children are not evaluated.
11307  * <p>
11308  * See the associated protovis documentation at
11309  * {@link http://mbostock.github.com/protovis/jsdoc/symbols/pv.Mark.html#visible}.
11310  * 
11311  * @type boolean
11312  */
11313 pvc.options.marks.MarkExtensionPoint.prototype.visible = undefined;
11314 /**
11315  * The class of protovis Area extension points.
11316  * <p>
11317  * See the associated protovis documentation at
11318  * {@link http://mbostock.github.com/protovis/jsdoc/symbols/pv.Area.html}.
11319  * 
11320  * @class
11321  * @extends pvc.options.marks.MarkExtensionPoint
11322  */
11323 pvc.options.marks.AreaExtensionPoint = function(){};
11324         
11325         
11326         
11327         
11328 /**
11329  * The possible ways to draw the ends of a line or line pattern.
11330  * 
11331  * @type pvc.options.varia.StrokeLineCap
11332  * @default 'butt'
11333  */
11334 pvc.options.marks.AreaExtensionPoint.prototype.lineCap = undefined;
11335 /**
11336  * The line width.
11337  * 
11338  * @type number
11339  */
11340 pvc.options.marks.AreaExtensionPoint.prototype.lineWidth = undefined;
11341 /**
11342  * The possible stroke patterns.
11343  * 
11344  * @type pvc.options.varia.StrokeDasharray
11345  * @default 'butt'
11346  */
11347 pvc.options.marks.AreaExtensionPoint.prototype.strokeDasharray = undefined;
11348 /**
11349  * The line color.
11350  * 
11351  * @type pvc.options.varia.ColorString
11352  */
11353 pvc.options.marks.AreaExtensionPoint.prototype.strokeStyle = undefined;
11354 /**
11355  * The fill color.
11356  * 
11357  * @type pvc.options.varia.ColorString
11358  */
11359 pvc.options.marks.AreaExtensionPoint.prototype.fillStyle = undefined;
11360 /**
11361  * The possible ways to join the segments of a line.
11362  * <p>
11363  * Use in combination with the property {@link #strokeMiterLimit}.
11364  * 
11365  * @type pvc.options.varia.StrokeLineJoin
11366  * @default 'miter'
11367  */
11368 pvc.options.marks.AreaExtensionPoint.prototype.lineJoin = undefined;
11369 /**
11370  * The maximum ratio of 
11371  * the miter-join length to the line width.
11372  * <p>
11373  * When {@link #lineJoin} is 
11374  * <tt>miter</tt>,
11375  * and the angle between consecutive segments
11376  * becomes small, 
11377  * the sharp angle corner — the miter — becomes long.
11378  * <p>
11379  * When a miter join exceeds the miter limit, 
11380  * it is automatically converted to a bevel join.
11381  * 
11382  * @type number
11383  * @default 8
11384  */
11385 pvc.options.marks.AreaExtensionPoint.prototype.strokeMiterLimit = undefined;
11386 /**
11387  * How to interpolate the area between values. 
11388  * 
11389  * @type pvc.options.varia.LineAreaInterpolation
11390  */
11391 pvc.options.marks.AreaExtensionPoint.prototype.interpolate = undefined;
11392 /**
11393  * The tension of cardinal splines.
11394  * 
11395  * @type number
11396  */
11397 pvc.options.marks.AreaExtensionPoint.prototype.tension = undefined;
11398 /**
11399  * The height of the area (use for vertical orientation). 
11400  * 
11401  * @type number
11402  */
11403 pvc.options.marks.AreaExtensionPoint.prototype.height = undefined;
11404 /**
11405  * The width of the area (use for horizontal orientation).
11406  * 
11407  * @type number
11408  */
11409 pvc.options.marks.AreaExtensionPoint.prototype.width = undefined;

11414  * {@link http://mbostock.github.com/protovis/jsdoc/symbols/pv.Bar.html}.
11415  * 
11416  * @class
11417  * @extends pvc.options.marks.MarkExtensionPoint
11418  */
11419 pvc.options.marks.BarExtensionPoint = function(){};

11430 pvc.options.marks.BarExtensionPoint.prototype.lineCap = undefined;

11467 pvc.options.marks.BarExtensionPoint.prototype.width = undefined;

11476  */
11477 pvc.options.marks.DotExtensionPoint = function(){};

11513 pvc.options.marks.DotExtensionPoint.prototype.fillStyle = undefined;
11514 /**
11515  * The aspect ratio of the shape.
11516  * A positive number which is the ratio of width to height.
11517  * <p>
11518  * The actual width and height are chosen
11519  * so that the shape has the same area of
11520  * when it has a unit aspect ratio.
11521  * 
11522  * @type number
11523  * @default 1
11524  */
11525 pvc.options.marks.DotExtensionPoint.prototype.aspectRatio = undefined;

11527  * The name of the shape that the dot assumes.
11528  * 
11529  * @type pvc.options.varia.DotShapeType
11530  */
11531 pvc.options.marks.DotExtensionPoint.prototype.shape = undefined;
11532 /**

11534  * <i>radian</i> units.
11535  * <p>
11536  * Some shapes, 
11537  * like the {@link pvc.options.varia.DotShapeType#Cross}
11538  * are sensitive to rotation.
11539  * 
11540  * @type number
11541  * @default 0
11542  */
11543 pvc.options.marks.DotExtensionPoint.prototype.shapeAngle = undefined;

11545  * The radius of the dot, in 
11546  * <i>pixel</i> units.
11547  * 
11548  * @type number
11549  */
11550 pvc.options.marks.DotExtensionPoint.prototype.shapeRadius = undefined;
11551 /**
11552  * The size of the dot, in 
11553  * <i>square pixel</i> units.
11554  * <p>
11555  * The size is proportional to the area of the shape
11556  * and is better suited than the {@link #shapeRadius} 
11557  * for representing measures.
11558  * <p>
11559  * For the record: 
11560  * <tt>size = radius * radius</tt>.
11561  * 
11562  * @type number
11563  */
11564 pvc.options.marks.DotExtensionPoint.prototype.shapeSize = undefined;
11565 /**

11569  * {@link http://mbostock.github.com/protovis/jsdoc/symbols/pv.Label.html}.
11570  *

11572  * @extends pvc.options.marks.MarkExtensionPoint
11573  */
11574 pvc.options.marks.LabelExtensionPoint = function(){};

11577         
11578         
11579 /**
11580  * The font used by the label.
11581  * <p>
11582  * See the supported font format in 
11583  * {@link http://www.w3.org/TR/CSS2/fonts.html#font-shorthand}
11584  * 
11585  * @type string

11587 pvc.options.marks.LabelExtensionPoint.prototype.font = undefined;

11590  * 
11591  * @type string
11592  */

11594 /**

11596  * 
11597  * @type pvc.options.varia.TextAlignment
11598  */
11599 pvc.options.marks.LabelExtensionPoint.prototype.textAlign = undefined;
11600 /**
11601  * The angle of the text, in 
11602  * <i>radian</i> units.
11603  * <p>
11604  * The text angle is 0 at horizontal direction 
11605  * and grows clock-wise. 
11606  * 
11607  * @type number
11608  * @default 0
11609  */
11610 pvc.options.marks.LabelExtensionPoint.prototype.textAngle = undefined;
11611 /**
11612  * The vertical text alignment.
11613  * 
11614  * @type pvc.options.varia.TextBaseline
11615  */
11616 pvc.options.marks.LabelExtensionPoint.prototype.textBaseline = undefined;
11617 /**
11618  * A CSS3 text decoration.
11619  * <p>
11620  * See the syntax of this string at:
11621  * {@link http://www.w3.org/TR/2012/WD-css-text-decor-3-20121113/#text-decoration}.
11622  * 
11623  * @type string
11624  */
11625 pvc.options.marks.LabelExtensionPoint.prototype.textDecoration = undefined;
11626 /**
11627  * The vertical and horizontal distance that separates the label's 
11628  * <i>anchor point</i>
11629  * from its associated visual element's anchor point 
11630  * (usually configurable by the {@link pvc.options.plots.Plot#valuesAnchor} option).
11631  * <p>
11632  * The margin is only applied vertically if 
11633  * {@link #textBaseline} is not {@link pvc.options.varia.TextBaseline#Middle}.
11634  * Likewise, the margin is only applied horizontally if 
11635  * {@link #textAlign} is not {@link pvc.options.varia.TextAlignment#Center}.
11636  * Together, the previous two properties define the label's anchor point.
11637  * 
11638  * @type number
11639  */
11640 pvc.options.marks.LabelExtensionPoint.prototype.textMargin = undefined;
11641 /**
11642  * A CSS3 text shadow.
11643  * <p>
11644  * See the syntax of this string at:
11645  * {@link http://www.w3.org/TR/2012/WD-css-text-decor-3-20121113/#text-shadow-property}.
11646  * 
11647  * @type string
11648  */
11649 pvc.options.marks.LabelExtensionPoint.prototype.textShadow = undefined;
11650 /**
11651  * The text color.
11652  * <p>
11653  * Note that gradients are not supported in the text style.
11654  * 
11655  * @type pvc.options.varia.ColorString
11656  */
11657 pvc.options.marks.LabelExtensionPoint.prototype.textStyle = undefined;

11704 /**

11706  * <p>
11707  * Use in combination with the property {@link #strokeMiterLimit}.
11708  * 
11709  * @type pvc.options.varia.StrokeLineJoin
11710  * @default 'miter'
11711  */
11712 pvc.options.marks.LineExtensionPoint.prototype.lineJoin = undefined;
11713 /**
11714  * The maximum ratio of 
11715  * the miter-join length to the line width.
11716  * <p>
11717  * When {@link #lineJoin} is 
11718  * <tt>miter</tt>,
11719  * and the angle between consecutive segments
11720  * becomes small, 
11721  * the sharp angle corner — the miter — becomes long.
11722  * <p>
11723  * When a miter join exceeds the miter limit, 
11724  * it is automatically converted to a bevel join.
11725  * 
11726  * @type number
11727  * @default 8
11728  */
11729 pvc.options.marks.LineExtensionPoint.prototype.strokeMiterLimit = undefined;
11730 /**
11731  * How to interpolate the area between values. 
11732  * 
11733  * @type pvc.options.varia.LineAreaInterpolation
11734  */

11740  */
11741 pvc.options.marks.LineExtensionPoint.prototype.tension = undefined;

11760  * The most used values are 
11761  * <tt>'visible'</tt>, 
11762  * <tt>'hidden'</tt>.
11763  * See all possible values in in {@link http://www.w3.org/TR/CSS2/visufx.html#overflow}.

11868 pvc.options.marks.WedgeExtensionPoint.prototype.fillStyle = undefined;
11869 /**
11870  * The angular span of each slice, in 
11871  * <i>radian</i> units.
11872  * 
11873  * @type number
11874  * @default 0
11875  */
11876 pvc.options.marks.WedgeExtensionPoint.prototype.angle = undefined;
11877 /**
11878  * The end angle of each slice, in 
11879  * <i>radian</i> units.
11880  * <p>
11881  * When unspecified, 
11882  * the end angle is the start angle plus the angular span.
11883  * 
11884  * @type number
11885  * @default 0
11886  */
11887 pvc.options.marks.WedgeExtensionPoint.prototype.endAngle = undefined;
11888 /**
11889  * The inner radius of each slice, in 
11890  * <i>pixel</i> units.
11891  * 
11892  * @type number
11893  */
11894 pvc.options.marks.WedgeExtensionPoint.prototype.innerRadius = undefined;
11895 /**
11896  * The outer radius of each slice, in 
11897  * <i>pixel</i> units.
11898  * 
11899  * @type number
11900  */
11901 pvc.options.marks.WedgeExtensionPoint.prototype.outerRadius = undefined;
11902 /**
11903  * The start angle of each slice, in 
11904  * <i>radian</i> units.
11905  * <p>
11906  * When unspecified, 
11907  * the start angle assumes the end angle of the previous slice.
11908  * 
11909  * @type number
11910  * @default 0
11911  */
11912 pvc.options.marks.WedgeExtensionPoint.prototype.startAngle = undefined;
11913 /**
11914  * The class of protovis quantitative scales' extension points.
11915  * <p>
11916  * See the associated protovis documentation at
11917  * {@link http://mbostock.github.io/protovis/jsdoc/symbols/pv.Scale.quantitative.html}.
11918  * 
11919  * @class
11920  */
11921 pvc.options.marks.QuantitativeScaleExtensionPoint = function(){};
11922         
11923         
11924         
11925         
11926 /**
11927  * A fixed protovis date format mask to use to format date tick values.
11928  * <p>
11929  * By default,
11930  * the tick format is determined dynamically
11931  * to match the range of the data.
11932  * Specify this extension point if the automatically
11933  * determined format does not suit your needs.
11934  * <p>
11935  * See the date format protovis documentation at
11936  * {@link http://mbostock.github.io/protovis/jsdoc/symbols/pv.Format.date.html}.
11937  * <p>
11938  * If you need to adapt the format based on the chosen precision,
11939  * you should use the axis option,
11940  * {@link pvc.options.axes.CartesianAxis#tickFormatter},
11941  * instead.
11942  * 
11943  * @type string
11944  */
11945 pvc.options.marks.QuantitativeScaleExtensionPoint.prototype.dateTickFormat = undefined;
11946 /**
11947  * A fixed precision to generate date tick values, in milliseconds, or the name of a standard precision multiple.
11948  * 
11949  * <p>
11950  * For more information, see {@link pvc.options.axes.AnyContinuousCartesianAxis#tickUnit}.
11951  * <p>
11952  * The precision measures the distance between tick values.
11953  * By default,
11954  * the tick precision is determined dynamically
11955  * to match the range of the data.
11956  * Specify this extension point if the automatically
11957  * determined precision does not suit your needs.
11958  * <p>
11959  * You can use the 
11960  * <i>pvc.time.intervals</i> enumeration to specify standard time intervals.
11961  * For more information see {@link pvc.options.axes.CartesianAxis#tickFormatter}.
11962  * 
11963  * @deprecated Use {@link pvc.options.axes.AnyContinuousCartesianAxis#tickUnit} instead.
11964  * @type number|string
11965  */
11966 pvc.options.marks.QuantitativeScaleExtensionPoint.prototype.dateTickPrecision = undefined;
11967 /**
11968  * The start day of the week for date ticks of 
11969  * <i>week</i> precision.
11970  * <p>
11971  * The possible values are:
11972  * 
11973  * <ul>
11974  * 
11975  * <li>0, or 'sunday'</li>
11976  * 
11977  * <li>1, or 'monday'</li>
11978  * 
11979  * <li>2, or 'tuesday'</li>
11980  * 
11981  * <li>3, or 'wednesday'</li>
11982  * 
11983  * <li>4, or 'thursday'</li>
11984  * 
11985  * <li>5, or 'friday'</li>
11986  * 
11987  * <li>6, or 'saturday'</li>
11988  * </ul>
11989  * 
11990  * @type number|string
11991  * @default 0
11992  */
11993 pvc.options.marks.QuantitativeScaleExtensionPoint.prototype.dateTickWeekStart = undefined;
11994 /**
11995  * The namespace of CCC axes options classes. 
11996  * 
11997  * @namespace
11998  */
11999 pvc.options.axes = {};
12000 
12001 /**
12002  * The options documentation class of the color axis.
12003  * <p>
12004  * A color axis panel and its properties
12005  * can be referred to in several ways,
12006  * in order of precedence:
12007  * 
12008  * <dl>
12009  * 
12010  * <dt>By 
12011  * <b>full id</b></dt>
12012  * 
12013  * <dd>
12014  * the id of the axis is the word 
12015  * <tt>color</tt>,
12016  * followed by it's index (when >= 2),
12017  * and terminated by the word 
12018  * <tt>Axis</tt>.
12019  * </dd>
12020  * 
12021  * <dd>(ex: 
12022  * <tt>colorAxis</tt>, 
12023  * <tt>color2Axis</tt>, 
12024  * <tt>color3Axis</tt>, ...)</dd>
12025  * 
12026  * <dt>By the single word 
12027  * <tt>color</tt>, when it is the first one</dt>
12028  * 
12029  * <dd>
12030  * to make it easier to specify the properties of
12031  * the most used color axis - the first one -
12032  * it can be referred to without the suffix 
12033  * <tt>Axis</tt>,
12034  * resulting in the name 
12035  * <tt>color</tt>.
12036  * </dd>
12037  * 
12038  * <dt>Without id, when it is the first one, for legend properties and the 
12039  * <tt>colors</tt> property</dt>
12040  * 
12041  * <dd>
12042  * Legend related properties of the first axis
12043  * can be referred to directly, without the axis id.
12044  * The same applies to the property 
12045  * <tt>colors</tt>.
12046  * <p>
12047  * As an example,
12048  * the name of the property 
12049  * <tt>legendDrawLine</tt>
12050  * can be used directly, instead of its full name:
12051  * 
12052  * <tt>colorLegendDrawLine</tt>.
12053  * <p>
12054  * For color axes other than the first,
12055  * the legend properties still need to be referred to
12056  * with its full name, like in:
12057  * 
12058  * <tt>color2AxisLegendDrawLine</tt>.
12059  * </dd>
12060  * </dl>
12061  * <p>
12062  * The domain of color axes
12063  * is evaluated at the root chart level.
12064  * When in a 
12065  * <i>small multiples</i> chart,
12066  * colors are shared among 
12067  * <i>small</i> charts.
12068  * <p>
12069  * Color axes map values of the "color" visual role.
12070  * <p>
12071  * For more information on options
12072  * that are specific to only certain color axis types,
12073  * please see one of the following concrete sub-classes:
12074  * 
12075  * <ul>
12076  * 
12077  * <li>
12078  * Numeric or discrete domain color axes: {@link pvc.options.axes.AnyColorAxis}
12079  * </li>
12080  * 
12081  * <li>
12082  * Discrete domain color axes: {@link pvc.options.axes.DiscreteColorAxis}
12083  * </li>
12084  * 
12085  * <li>
12086  * Heat-grid - numeric domain color axis: {@link pvc.options.axes.HeatGridColorAxis}
12087  * </li>
12088  * </ul>
12089  * 
12090  * @class
12091  * @abstract
12092  */
12093 pvc.options.axes.ColorAxis = function(){};
12094         
12095         
12096         
12097         
12098 /**
12099  * The colors of a color axis.
12100  * <p>
12101  * It can be a single color as documented in
12102  * {@link pvc.options.varia.ColorString} or
12103  * a single 
12104  * <i>protovis</i> color object
12105  * (like: 
12106  * <tt>pv.color('red')</tt> or 
12107  * <tt>pv.Color.names.blueviolet</tt>).
12108  * <p>
12109  * Additionally, an array of color strings or
12110  * 
12111  * <i>protovis</i> colors can be specified.
12112  * <p>
12113  * If a function is specified, it can be:
12114  * 
12115  * <ul>
12116  * 
12117  * <li>
12118  * 
12119  * <b>a protovis scale</b>,
12120  * like the one obtained by:
12121  * 
12122  * <tt>pv.colors('red', 'blueviolet')</tt>
12123  * </li>
12124  * 
12125  * <li>
12126  * 
12127  * <b>a scale factory</b> - a function that
12128  * given the domain values as arguments
12129  * return a protovis color scale
12130  * </li>
12131  * </ul>
12132  * <p>
12133  * The default color scheme depends on the
12134  * axis domain being discrete or numeric.
12135  * <p>
12136  * For 
12137  * <b>discrete domains</b>, the default value is the 
12138  * <i>protovis</i>
12139  * 
12140  * <tt>category10</tt> color scheme:
12141  * 
12142  * <ol style='font-weight:bold'>
12143  * 
12144  * <li style='color:#1f77b4'>value</li>
12145  * 
12146  * <li style='color:#ff7f0e'>value</li>
12147  * 
12148  * <li style='color:#2ca02c'>value</li>
12149  * 
12150  * <li style='color:#d62728'>value</li>
12151  * 
12152  * <li style='color:#9467bd'>value</li>
12153  * 
12154  * <li style='color:#8c564b'>value</li>
12155  * 
12156  * <li style='color:#e377c2'>value</li>
12157  * 
12158  * <li style='color:#7f7f7f'>value</li>
12159  * 
12160  * <li style='color:#bcbd22'>value</li>
12161  * 
12162  * <li style='color:#17becf'>value</li>
12163  * </ol>
12164  * <p>
12165  * For 
12166  * <b>numeric domains</b>, the default value is the
12167  * color scheme:
12168  * 
12169  * <ol style='font-weight:bold'>
12170  * 
12171  * <li style='color:red'>value</li>
12172  * 
12173  * <li style='color:yellow'>value</li>
12174  * 
12175  * <li style='color:green'>value</li>
12176  * </ol>
12177  * 
12178  * @type pvc.options.varia.ColorString|pv.Color|list(pvc.options.varia.ColorString|pv.Color)|function
12179  * @category Scale
12180  */
12181 pvc.options.axes.ColorAxis.prototype.colors = undefined;
12182 /**
12183  * The color transform function.
12184  * <p>
12185  * Allows applying an effect to the colors that an axis outputs.
12186  * <p>
12187  * The default value is 
12188  * <tt>null</tt>
12189  * except for color axes that are used only by one of
12190  * the 
12191  * <tt>trend</tt> or 
12192  * <tt>plot2</tt> plots,
12193  * and whose 
12194  * <tt>colors</tt> property was not specified.
12195  * In these cases, the default value is
12196  * 
12197  * <tt>pvc.brighterColorTransform</tt>.
12198  * 
12199  * @returns {pv.Color}
12200  * The transformed color.
12201  * 
12202  * @method
12203  * @this null
12204  * @param {pv.Color} color
12205  * The color to transform.
12206  * 
12207  * @category Scale
12208  */
12209 pvc.options.axes.ColorAxis.prototype.transform = function(){};
12210 /**
12211  * The color to use when an optional color role is unbound.
12212  * <p>
12213  * When a color role is optional and was not specified,
12214  * but color is still required to show visual elements,
12215  * this property allows specifying the color with which
12216  * all visual elements' color attributes will be based on.
12217  * <p>
12218  * The default value is the first color in {@link #colors}.
12219  * <p>
12220  * Contrast this option with
12221  * {@link pvc.options.axes.AnyColorAxis#missing}
12222  * and
12223  * {@link pvc.options.axes.HeatGridColorAxis#missing}.
12224  * 
12225  * @type pvc.options.varia.ColorString|pv.Color
12226  * @category Scale
12227  */
12228 pvc.options.axes.ColorAxis.prototype.unbound = undefined;
12229 /**
12230  * The options documentation class of a color axis
12231  * that can have either a discrete or numeric domain.
12232  * <p>
12233  * See {@link pvc.options.axes.ColorAxis}
12234  * for additional information.
12235  * 
12236  * @class
12237  * @extends pvc.options.axes.ColorAxis
12238  */
12239 pvc.options.axes.AnyColorAxis = function(){};
12240         
12241         
12242         
12243         
12244 /**
12245  * Indicates if the color map used in the first render is to be preserved,
12246  * regardless of having been explicitly specified through {@link #map}
12247  * or inferred from {@link #colors}.
12248  * 
12249  * @type boolean
12250  * @default false
12251  */
12252 pvc.options.axes.AnyColorAxis.prototype.preserveMap = undefined;
12253 /**
12254  * Allows reserving colors to certain color scale keys.
12255  * <p>
12256  * Color scale keys are the values of the color role.
12257  * By default, the color role is bound to the dimensions of the series role.
12258  * Color scale keys that are not mapped,
12259  * receive colors taken from {@link #colors}.
12260  * Colors in {@link #colors} that are also present in the color map are ignored.
12261  * 
12262  * <p>
12263  * Assuming the color role is bound to the grouping 
12264  * <tt>"territory, country"</tt>,
12265  * the following map would reserve the colors 
12266  * <i>red</i> and 
12267  * <i>green</i> to
12268  * Canada and Portugal, respectively:
12269  * 
12270  * <pre>
12271  * chartOptions.colorMap = {
12272  *     "NA~Canada":     "red",
12273  *     "EMEA~Portugal": "green"
12274  * };
12275  *                 
12276  * </pre>
12277  * <p>
12278  * Assumes that the default {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart#dataSeparator} is used.
12279  * 
12280  * <p>
12281  * 
12282  * @type map(string : pvc.options.varia.ColorString|pv.Color)
12283  * @category Discrete > Scale
12284  */
12285 pvc.options.axes.AnyColorAxis.prototype.map = undefined;
12286 /**
12287  * What happens when the user clicks a legend item
12288  * (applies to color axes of discrete domain).
12289  * <p>
12290  * Note that when
12291  * {@link pvc.options.charts.Chart#hoverable}
12292  * is 
12293  * <tt>true</tt>,
12294  * the legend item marker will be hoverable.
12295  * <p>
12296  * When {@link pvc.options.charts.Chart#selectable}
12297  * is 
12298  * <tt>true</tt>,
12299  * the legend item marker will be selectable,
12300  * whatever the value of this property is.
12301  * In that case, only the label part of the legend marker,
12302  * will respect this property.
12303  * 
12304  * @type pvc.options.varia.LegendClickMode
12305  * @default 'toggleVisible'
12306  * @category Discrete > Style
12307  */
12308 pvc.options.axes.AnyColorAxis.prototype.legendClickMode = undefined;
12309 /**
12310  * Forces a rule to be shown or not in the marker zone
12311  * (applies to color axes of discrete domain).
12312  * <p>
12313  * The default value depends on the chart type.
12314  * 
12315  * @type boolean
12316  * @category Discrete > Style
12317  */
12318 pvc.options.axes.AnyColorAxis.prototype.legendDrawLine = undefined;
12319 /**
12320  * Forces a shape to be shown or not in the marker zone
12321  * (applies to color axes of discrete domain).
12322  * <p>
12323  * The default value depends on the chart type.
12324  * 
12325  * @type boolean
12326  * @category Discrete > Style
12327  */
12328 pvc.options.axes.AnyColorAxis.prototype.legendDrawMarker = undefined;
12329 /**
12330  * Forces a given shape to be used in the marker zone
12331  * (applies to color axes of discrete domain).
12332  * <p>
12333  * The default value depends on the chart type.
12334  * 
12335  * @type pvc.options.varia.DotShapeType
12336  * @category Discrete > Style
12337  */
12338 pvc.options.axes.AnyColorAxis.prototype.legendShape = undefined;
12339 /**
12340  * Indicates if the legend items of the color axis should be visible
12341  * (applies to color axes of discrete domain).
12342  * 
12343  * @type boolean
12344  * @default true
12345  * @category Discrete > Style
12346  */
12347 pvc.options.axes.AnyColorAxis.prototype.legendVisible = undefined;
12348 /**
12349  * The domain values
12350  * (applies to numeric domain axes).
12351  * <p>
12352  * This option is ignored when option 
12353  * <i>normByCategory</i> is specified.
12354  * In that case,
12355  * an automatically determined domain is used
12356  * per existing category.
12357  * 
12358  * @type list(pvc.options.varia.ColorString)
12359  * @category Numeric > Scale
12360  */
12361 pvc.options.axes.AnyColorAxis.prototype.domain = undefined;
12362 /**
12363  * The maximum color
12364  * (applies to numeric domain axes).
12365  * 
12366  * @type pvc.options.varia.ColorString|pv.Color
12367  * @category Numeric > Scale
12368  */
12369 pvc.options.axes.AnyColorAxis.prototype.max = undefined;
12370 /**
12371  * The minimum color
12372  * (applies to numeric domain axes).
12373  * 
12374  * @type pvc.options.varia.ColorString|pv.Color
12375  * @category Numeric > Scale
12376  */
12377 pvc.options.axes.AnyColorAxis.prototype.min = undefined;
12378 /**
12379  * The color used for a null domain value
12380  * (applies to numeric domain axes).
12381  * <p>
12382  * The default value is
12383  * 
12384  * <span style='color:lightgray;font-weight:bold'>this color</span>.
12385  * 
12386  * @type pvc.options.varia.ColorString|pv.Color
12387  * @default 'lightgray'
12388  * @category Numeric > Scale
12389  */
12390 pvc.options.axes.AnyColorAxis.prototype.missing = undefined;
12391 /**
12392  * The type of scale to use,
12393  * in what concerns the range of the scale
12394  * (applies to numeric domain axes).
12395  * 
12396  * @type pvc.options.varia.ColorScaleType
12397  * @default 'linear'
12398  * @category Numeric > Scale
12399  */
12400 pvc.options.axes.AnyColorAxis.prototype.scaleType = undefined;
12401 /**
12402  * Indicates if the axis scale is
12403  * applied over the absolute value of the domain values
12404  * (applies to numeric domain axes).
12405  * 
12406  * @type boolean
12407  * @default false
12408  * @category Numeric > Scale
12409  */
12410 pvc.options.axes.AnyColorAxis.prototype.useAbs = undefined;
12411 /**
12412  * The options documentation class of a discrete domain color axis.
12413  * <p>
12414  * See {@link pvc.options.axes.ColorAxis}
12415  * for additional information.
12416  * 
12417  * @class
12418  * @extends pvc.options.axes.ColorAxis
12419  */
12420 pvc.options.axes.DiscreteColorAxis = function(){};
12421         
12422         
12423         
12424         
12425 /**
12426  * Indicates if the color map used in the first render is to be preserved,
12427  * regardless of having been explicitly specified through {@link #map}
12428  * or inferred from {@link #colors}.
12429  * 
12430  * @type boolean
12431  * @default false
12432  */
12433 pvc.options.axes.DiscreteColorAxis.prototype.preserveMap = undefined;
12434 /**
12435  * Allows reserving colors to certain color scale keys.
12436  * <p>
12437  * Color scale keys are the values of the color role.
12438  * By default, the color role is bound to the dimensions of the series role.
12439  * Color scale keys that are not mapped,
12440  * receive colors taken from {@link #colors}.
12441  * Colors in {@link #colors} that are also present in the color map are ignored.
12442  * 
12443  * <p>
12444  * Assuming the color role is bound to the grouping 
12445  * <tt>"territory, country"</tt>,
12446  * the following map would reserve the colors 
12447  * <i>red</i> and 
12448  * <i>green</i> to
12449  * Canada and Portugal, respectively:
12450  * 
12451  * <pre>
12452  * chartOptions.colorMap = {
12453  *     "NA~Canada":     "red",
12454  *     "EMEA~Portugal": "green"
12455  * };
12456  *                 
12457  * </pre>
12458  * <p>
12459  * Assumes that the default {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart#dataSeparator} is used.
12460  * 
12461  * <p>
12462  * 
12463  * @type map(string : pvc.options.varia.ColorString|pv.Color)
12464  * @category Discrete > Scale
12465  */
12466 pvc.options.axes.DiscreteColorAxis.prototype.map = undefined;
12467 /**
12468  * What happens when the user clicks a legend item
12469  * (applies to color axes of discrete domain).
12470  * <p>
12471  * Note that when
12472  * {@link pvc.options.charts.Chart#hoverable}
12473  * is 
12474  * <tt>true</tt>,
12475  * the legend item marker will be hoverable.
12476  * <p>
12477  * When {@link pvc.options.charts.Chart#selectable}
12478  * is 
12479  * <tt>true</tt>,
12480  * the legend item marker will be selectable,
12481  * whatever the value of this property is.
12482  * In that case, only the label part of the legend marker,
12483  * will respect this property.
12484  * 
12485  * @type pvc.options.varia.LegendClickMode
12486  * @default 'toggleVisible'
12487  * @category Discrete > Style
12488  */
12489 pvc.options.axes.DiscreteColorAxis.prototype.legendClickMode = undefined;
12490 /**
12491  * Forces a rule to be shown or not in the marker zone
12492  * (applies to color axes of discrete domain).
12493  * <p>
12494  * The default value depends on the chart type.
12495  * 
12496  * @type boolean
12497  * @category Discrete > Style
12498  */
12499 pvc.options.axes.DiscreteColorAxis.prototype.legendDrawLine = undefined;
12500 /**
12501  * Forces a shape to be shown or not in the marker zone
12502  * (applies to color axes of discrete domain).
12503  * <p>
12504  * The default value depends on the chart type.
12505  * 
12506  * @type boolean
12507  * @category Discrete > Style
12508  */
12509 pvc.options.axes.DiscreteColorAxis.prototype.legendDrawMarker = undefined;
12510 /**
12511  * Forces a given shape to be used in the marker zone
12512  * (applies to color axes of discrete domain).
12513  * <p>
12514  * The default value depends on the chart type.
12515  * 
12516  * @type pvc.options.varia.DotShapeType
12517  * @category Discrete > Style
12518  */
12519 pvc.options.axes.DiscreteColorAxis.prototype.legendShape = undefined;
12520 /**
12521  * Indicates if the legend items of the color axis should be visible
12522  * (applies to color axes of discrete domain).
12523  * 
12524  * @type boolean
12525  * @default true
12526  * @category Discrete > Style
12527  */
12528 pvc.options.axes.DiscreteColorAxis.prototype.legendVisible = undefined;
12529 /**
12530  * The options documentation class of the
12531  * HeatGrid numeric color axis.
12532  * <p>
12533  * See {@link pvc.options.axes.ColorAxis}
12534  * for additional information.
12535  * 
12536  * @class
12537  * @extends pvc.options.axes.ColorAxis
12538  */
12539 pvc.options.axes.HeatGridColorAxis = function(){};
12540         
12541         
12542         
12543         
12544 /**
12545  * The domain values
12546  * (applies to numeric domain axes).
12547  * <p>
12548  * This option is ignored when option 
12549  * <i>normByCategory</i> is specified.
12550  * In that case,
