12551  * an automatically determined domain is used
12552  * per existing category.
12553  * 
12554  * @type list(pvc.options.varia.ColorString)
12555  * @category Numeric > Scale
12556  */
12557 pvc.options.axes.HeatGridColorAxis.prototype.domain = undefined;
12558 /**
12559  * The maximum color
12560  * (applies to numeric domain axes).
12561  * 
12562  * @type pvc.options.varia.ColorString|pv.Color
12563  * @category Numeric > Scale
12564  */
12565 pvc.options.axes.HeatGridColorAxis.prototype.max = undefined;
12566 /**
12567  * The minimum color
12568  * (applies to numeric domain axes).
12569  * 
12570  * @type pvc.options.varia.ColorString|pv.Color
12571  * @category Numeric > Scale
12572  */
12573 pvc.options.axes.HeatGridColorAxis.prototype.min = undefined;
12574 /**
12575  * The color used for a null domain value
12576  * (applies to numeric domain axes).
12577  * <p>
12578  * The default value is
12579  * 
12580  * <span style='color:lightgray;font-weight:bold'>this color</span>.
12581  * 
12582  * @type pvc.options.varia.ColorString|pv.Color
12583  * @default 'lightgray'
12584  * @category Numeric > Scale
12585  */
12586 pvc.options.axes.HeatGridColorAxis.prototype.missing = undefined;
12587 /**
12588  * The type of scale to use,
12589  * in what concerns the range of the scale
12590  * (applies to numeric domain axes).
12591  * 
12592  * @type pvc.options.varia.ColorScaleType
12593  * @default 'linear'
12594  * @category Numeric > Scale
12595  */
12596 pvc.options.axes.HeatGridColorAxis.prototype.scaleType = undefined;
12597 /**
12598  * Indicates if the axis scale is
12599  * applied over the absolute value of the domain values
12600  * (applies to numeric domain axes).
12601  * 
12602  * @type boolean
12603  * @default false
12604  * @category Numeric > Scale
12605  */
12606 pvc.options.axes.HeatGridColorAxis.prototype.useAbs = undefined;
12607 /**
12608  * A separate scale is used for each category.
12609  * <p>
12610  * This property is currently only supported
12611  * by the {@link pvc.options.charts.HeatGridChart}.
12612  * <p>
12613  * When this option is specified,
12614  * the option 
12615  * <i>domain</i> is ignored.
12616  * An automatically determined domain is used
12617  * per existing category.
12618  * 
12619  * @type boolean
12620  * @default false
12621  * @category Numeric > Scale
12622  */
12623 pvc.options.axes.HeatGridColorAxis.prototype.normByCategory = undefined;
12624 /**
12625  * The options documentation class of the
12626  * Sunburst discrete color axis.
12627  * <p>
12628  * See {@link pvc.options.axes.ColorAxis}
12629  * for additional information.
12630  * 
12631  * @class
12632  * @extends pvc.options.axes.ColorAxis
12633  */
12634 pvc.options.axes.SunburstColorAxis = function(){};
12635         
12636         
12637         
12638         
12639 /**
12640  * Indicates if the color map used in the first render is to be preserved,
12641  * regardless of having been explicitly specified through {@link #map}
12642  * or inferred from {@link #colors}.
12643  * 
12644  * @type boolean
12645  * @default false
12646  */
12647 pvc.options.axes.SunburstColorAxis.prototype.preserveMap = undefined;
12648 /**
12649  * Allows reserving colors to certain color scale keys.
12650  * <p>
12651  * Color scale keys are the values of the color role.
12652  * By default, the color role is bound to the dimensions of the series role.
12653  * Color scale keys that are not mapped,
12654  * receive colors taken from {@link #colors}.
12655  * Colors in {@link #colors} that are also present in the color map are ignored.
12656  * 
12657  * <p>
12658  * Assuming the color role is bound to the grouping 
12659  * <tt>"territory, country"</tt>,
12660  * the following map would reserve the colors 
12661  * <i>red</i> and 
12662  * <i>green</i> to
12663  * Canada and Portugal, respectively:
12664  * 
12665  * <pre>
12666  * chartOptions.colorMap = {
12667  *     "NA~Canada":     "red",
12668  *     "EMEA~Portugal": "green"
12669  * };
12670  *                 
12671  * </pre>
12672  * <p>
12673  * Assumes that the default {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart#dataSeparator} is used.
12674  * 
12675  * <p>
12676  * 
12677  * @type map(string : pvc.options.varia.ColorString|pv.Color)
12678  * @category Discrete > Scale
12679  */
12680 pvc.options.axes.SunburstColorAxis.prototype.map = undefined;
12681 /**
12682  * How much a last sibling slice will be brighter than a first sibling slice.
12683  * <p>
12684  * Applies only to when {@link pvc.options.plots.SunburstPlot#colorMode}
12685  * is {@link pvc.options.varia.SunburstColorMode#Fan}.
12686  * <p>
12687  * A non-negative number.
12688  * <p>
12689  * Specify 
12690  * <tt>0</tt> for siblings to have the same color.
12691  * 
12692  * @type number
12693  * @default 1
12694  * @category Discrete > Scale
12695  */
12696 pvc.options.axes.SunburstColorAxis.prototype.sliceBrightnessFactor = undefined;
12697 /**
12698  * The options documentation class of the size axis.
12699  * <p>
12700  * A size axis panel and its properties 
12701  * can be referred to by using its 
12702  * <b>full id</b>,
12703  * which is the word 
12704  * <tt>size</tt>, 
12705  * followed by it's index (when >= 2),
12706  * and terminated by the word 
12707  * <tt>Axis</tt>
12708  * (ex: 
12709  * <tt>sizeAxis</tt>, 
12710  * <tt>size2Axis</tt>, 
12711  * <tt>size3Axis</tt>, ...).
12712  * <p>
12713  * The domain of size axes 
12714  * is evaluated at the leaf chart level. 
12715  * When in a 
12716  * <i>small multiples</i> chart, 
12717  * sizes are local to each 
12718  * <i>small</i> chart.
12719  * <p>
12720  * Currently, size axes only support 
12721  * <i>numeric</i> domain values.
12722  * 
12723  * @class
12724  */
12725 pvc.options.axes.SizeAxis = function(){};
12726         
12727         
12728         
12729         
12730 /**
12731  * The domain alignment to use when the domain has a fixed or implied length
12732  * (applies to continuous axes).
12733  * <p>
12734  * For more information, see: {@link #fixedLength}.
12735  * 
12736  * @type pvc.options.varia.AxisDomainAlign
12737  * @default 'center'
12738  * @category Numeric > Scale
12739  */
12740 pvc.options.axes.SizeAxis.prototype.domainAlign = undefined;
12741 /**
12742  * The fixed domain length that the axis will show
12743  * (applies to continuous axes).
12744  * <p>
12745  * A string value is converted to a number.
12746  * <p>
12747  * The value may be bigger or smaller than the actual
12748  * length of the data.
12749  * <p>
12750  * This property takes precedence over the property 
12751  * <tt>originIsZero</tt>, if specified either with 
12752  * 
12753  * <tt>fixedMin</tt>, 
12754  * <tt>fixedMax</tt> or 
12755  * <tt>domainAlign</tt>.
12756  * <p>
12757  * This property can be specified with several options to define the initial domain,
12758  * so that its length corresponds to the defined value.
12759  * They take the following precedence order:
12760  * 
12761  * <ol>
12762  * 
12763  * <li>
12764  * If 
12765  * <tt>fixedLength</tt> is not specified:
12766  * 
12767  * <ol>
12768  * 
12769  * <li>
12770  * If neither 
12771  * <tt>fixedMin</tt> and 
12772  * <tt>fixedMax</tt> are specified,
12773  * the axis domain is the data domain;
12774  * option 
12775  * <tt>originIsZero</tt> may augment the axis domain, on one of its sides;
12776  * </li>
12777  * 
12778  * <li>
12779  * If both 
12780  * <tt>fixedMin</tt> and 
12781  * <tt>fixedMax</tt> are specified,
12782  * the axis domain is fully determined; it's length is implied;
12783  * option 
12784  * <tt>originIsZero</tt> is ignored;
12785  * </li>
12786  * 
12787  * <li>
12788  * If 
12789  * <tt>fixedMin</tt> is specified (and 
12790  * <tt>fixedMax</tt> is not)
12791  * the axis domain minimum is 
12792  * <tt>fixedMin</tt> and
12793  * the axis domain maximum is the data domain maximum, possibly corrected by
12794  * option 
12795  * <tt>originIsZero</tt>;
12796  * </li>
12797  * 
12798  * <li>
12799  * Else, (if 
12800  * <tt>fixedMax</tt> is specified and 
12801  * <tt>fixedMin</tt> is not,)
12802  * the axis domain maximum is 
12803  * <tt>fixedMax</tt> and
12804  * the axis domain minimum is the data domain minimum, possibly corrected by
12805  * option 
12806  * <tt>originIsZero</tt>;
12807  * </li>
12808  * </ol>
12809  * </li>
12810  * 
12811  * <li>
12812  * If 
12813  * <tt>fixedLength</tt> is specified, option 
12814  * <tt>originIsZero</tt> is ignored.
12815  * <p>
12816  * The limits of the axis domain are determined as follows:
12817  * 
12818  * <ol>
12819  * 
12820  * <li>
12821  * If 
12822  * <tt>fixedMin</tt> is specified, the axis domain maximum is implied:
12823  * <br></br>
12824  * 
12825  * <tt>max = fixedMin + fixedLength</tt>;
12826  * <br></br>
12827  * options 
12828  * <tt>originIsZero</tt>, 
12829  * <tt>fixedMax</tt> are ignored;
12830  * option 
12831  * <tt>domainAlign</tt> is ignored in this phase;
12832  * </li>
12833  * 
12834  * <li>
12835  * If 
12836  * <tt>fixedMax</tt> is specified, the axis domain minimum is implied:
12837  * <br></br>
12838  * 
12839  * <tt>min = fixedMax - fixedLength</tt>;
12840  * <br></br>
12841  * option 
12842  * <tt>originIsZero</tt> is ignored;
12843  * option 
12844  * <tt>domainAlign</tt> is ignored in this phase;
12845  * </li>
12846  * 
12847  * <li>
12848  * Else, 
12849  * <tt>domainAlign</tt> is either specified or defaults to 
12850  * <tt>center</tt>.
12851  * The axis domain is aligned to either the minimum, maximum or center of the data domain
12852  * and then taken to have the specified fixed length.
12853  * <p>
12854  * It is determined as follows:
12855  * 
12856  * <ul>
12857  * 
12858  * <li>
12859  * If 
12860  * <tt>domainAlign</tt> is 
12861  * <tt>min</tt>, the axis domain minimum is that of
12862  * the actual data and the axis domain maximum is implied:
12863  * <br></br>
12864  * 
12865  * <tt>max = min(data) + fixedLength</tt>;
12866  * </li>
12867  * 
12868  * <li>
12869  * If 
12870  * <tt>domainAlign</tt> is 
12871  * <tt>max</tt>, the axis domain maximum is that of
12872  * the actual data and the axis domain minimum is implied:
12873  * <br></br>
12874  * 
12875  * <tt>min = max(data) - fixedLength</tt>;
12876  * </li>
12877  * 
12878  * <li>
12879  * Else, 
12880  * <tt>domainAlign</tt> is 
12881  * <tt>center</tt>, or defaults to it,
12882  * and both axis domain limits are determined from the actual data domain,
12883  * as follows:
12884  * 
12885  * <ul>
12886  * 
12887  * <li>
12888  * <tt>min = center(data) - fixedLength / 2</tt></li>
12889  * 
12890  * <li>
12891  * <tt>max = center(data) + fixedLength / 2</tt></li>
12892  * </ul>
12893  * where 
12894  * <tt>center(data)</tt> is determined as:
12895  * <br></br>
12896  * 
12897  * <tt>center(data) = (max(data) - min(data)) / 2</tt>.
12898  * </li>
12899  * </ul>
12900  * </li>
12901  * </ol>
12902  * </li>
12903  * </ol>
12904  * <p>
12905  * For more information, see:
12906  * {@link #fixedMin},
12907  * {@link #fixedMax},
12908  * {@link #domainAlign} and
12909  * {@link #originIsZero}.
12910  * 
12911  * @type number|string
12912  * @category Numeric > Scale
12913  */
12914 pvc.options.axes.SizeAxis.prototype.fixedLength = undefined;
12915 /**
12916  * The fixed maximum domain value that the axis will show
12917  * (applies to continuous axes).
12918  * <p>
12919  * A string value is converted to a number.
12920  * <p>
12921  * The value may be bigger or smaller than the actual maximum value of the data.
12922  * <p>
12923  * This property takes precedence over the property 
12924  * <tt>originIsZero</tt>.
12925  * <p>
12926  * This property is ignored if 
12927  * <tt>fixedMin</tt> and 
12928  * <tt>fixedLength</tt> are both specified.
12929  * The behavior is described as follows:
12930  * 
12931  * <ul>
12932  * 
12933  * <li>
12934  * 
12935  * <tt>fixedMin</tt>, 
12936  * <tt>fixedLength</tt> specified:
12937  * a fixed maximum is implied from the min and length values;
12938  * 
12939  * <tt>fixedMin</tt> is ignored
12940  * </li>
12941  * 
12942  * <li>
12943  * 
12944  * <tt>fixedMax</tt>, 
12945  * <tt>fixedLength</tt> specified, without 
12946  * <tt>fixedMin</tt>:
12947  * a fixed minimum is implied from the max and length values
12948  * </li>
12949  * 
12950  * <li>
12951  * 
12952  * <tt>fixedMin</tt>, 
12953  * <tt>fixedMax</tt> specified, without 
12954  * <tt>fixedLength</tt>:
12955  * the fixed maximum and minimum are set directly
12956  * </li>
12957  * </ul>
12958  * <p>
12959  * For more information, see:
12960  * {@link #fixedMin} and
12961  * {@link #fixedLength}.
12962  * 
12963  * @type number|string
12964  * @category Numeric > Scale
12965  */
12966 pvc.options.axes.SizeAxis.prototype.fixedMax = undefined;
12967 /**
12968  * The fixed minimum domain value that the axis will show
12969  * (applies to continuous axes).
12970  * <p>
12971  * A string value is converted to a number.
12972  * <p>
12973  * The value may be bigger or smaller than the actual
12974  * minimum value of the data.
12975  * <p>
12976  * This property can be specified with the following options, in order of precedence:
12977  * 
12978  * <ul>
12979  * 
12980  * <li>
12981  * 
12982  * <tt>fixedLength</tt> -
12983  * The fixed minimum is set and a fixed maximum is calculated,
12984  * so that the length shown corresponds to the defined fixed length
12985  * </li>
12986  * 
12987  * <li>
12988  * 
12989  * <tt>fixedMax</tt> -
12990  * The fixed minimum and maximum are set
12991  * </li>
12992  * </ul>
12993  * <p>
12994  * This property takes precedence over the property 
12995  * <tt>originIsZero</tt>.
12996  * <p>
12997  * For more information, see:
12998  * {@link #fixedLength} and
12999  * {@link #fixedMax}.
13000  * 
13001  * @type number|string
13002  * @category Numeric > Scale
13003  */
13004 pvc.options.axes.SizeAxis.prototype.fixedMin = undefined;
13005 /**
13006  * Indicates if it should be ensured that zero domain value is shown (applies to numeric axes).
13007  * <p>
13008  * The properties 
13009  * 
13010  * <tt>fixedMin</tt> and 
13011  * 
13012  * <tt>fixedMax</tt> have precedence over this one.
13013  * If this property is 
13014  * <tt>true</tt>
13015  * and respecting it would require changing 
13016  * the minimum value, 
13017  * but the option 
13018  * <tt>fixedMin</tt> is also specified,
13019  * then this property is ignored.
13020  * The same would apply if 
13021  * it were required to change 
13022  * the maximum value,
13023  * but the property 
13024  * <tt>fixedMax</tt> was also specified.
13025  * <p>
13026  * For more information, see: {@link #fixedLength}.
13027  * 
13028  * @type boolean
13029  * @category Numeric > Scale
13030  */
13031 pvc.options.axes.SizeAxis.prototype.originIsZero = undefined;
13032 /**
13033  * Indicates if the axis scale is 
13034  * applied over the absolute value of the domain values
13035  * (applies to numeric domain axes).
13036  * 
13037  * @type boolean
13038  * @default false
13039  * @category Numeric > Scale
13040  */
13041 pvc.options.axes.SizeAxis.prototype.useAbs = undefined;
13042 /**
13043  * The options documentation class of 
13044  * the cartesian axis 
13045  * and cartesian axis panel.
13046  * <p>
13047  * A cartesian axis (and its panel) can be referred to in several ways,
13048  * in order of precedence:
13049  * 
13050  * <dl>
13051  * 
13052  * <dt>By 
13053  * <b>id</b></dt>
13054  * 
13055  * <dd>the id of the axis is its type followed by it's index (when >= 2)</dd>
13056  * 
13057  * <dd>(ex: 
13058  * <tt>base</tt>, 
13059  * <tt>ortho</tt>, 
13060  * <tt>base2</tt>, 
13061  * <tt>ortho2</tt>, ...)</dd>
13062  * 
13063  * <dt>By 
13064  * <b>oriented id</b></dt>
13065  * 
13066  * <dd>the oriented id of the axis is its orientation followed by it's index (when >= 2)</dd>
13067  * 
13068  * <dd>(ex: 
13069  * <tt>x</tt>, 
13070  * <tt>y</tt>, 
13071  * <tt>x2</tt>, 
13072  * <tt>y2</tt>, ...)</dd>
13073  * 
13074  * <dt>By 
13075  * <b>legacy name</b></dt>
13076  * 
13077  * <dd>
13078  * for the special case of the bar chart, 
13079  * the second axes:
13080  * 
13081  * <ul>
13082  * 
13083  * <li>
13084  * 
13085  * <b>normal properties</b> —
13086  * may be referred to by the name 
13087  * <tt>second</tt> 
13088  * </li>
13089  * 
13090  * <li>
13091  * 
13092  * <b>extension points</b> —
13093  * may be referred to by the names 
13094  * <tt>secondX</tt> and 
13095  * <tt>secondY</tt>
13096  * </li>
13097  * </ul>
13098  * <p>
13099  * In any case, those names are now deprecated.
13100  * </dd>
13101  * 
13102  * <dt>By 
13103  * <b>scale type</b></dt>
13104  * 
13105  * <dd>
13106  * the scale type can be 
13107  * <tt>discrete</tt> or 
13108  * <tt>continuous</tt> and, 
13109  * in the later case, with lower precedence, 
13110  * 
13111  * <tt>numeric</tt> and 
13112  * <tt>timeSeries</tt> are also possible
13113  * </dd>
13114  * 
13115  * <dt>By 
13116  * <b>catch all name</b></dt>
13117  * 
13118  * <dd>the name 
13119  * <tt>axis</tt> matches any cartesian axis</dd>
13120  * </dl>
13121  * <p>
13122  * These names apply equally to the prefixes used to 
13123  * build extension point names.
13124  * <p>
13125  * Which of the names is used depends on 
13126  * which better selects the axes for the properties being specified.
13127  * If a property should only be applied to vertical axes, 
13128  * independently of the chart's orientation, the 
13129  * <i>oriented id</i>
13130  * should be used. 
13131  * If, otherwise, a property should only be applied to the base axis,
13132  * whether or not it is horizontally aligned, 
13133  * then the normal 
13134  * <i>id</i> should be used.
13135  * If, a property should only apply to continuous axes,
13136  * the 
13137  * <i>scale type</i> should be used.
13138  * <p>
13139  * For more information on options
13140  * that are specific to only certain axis types,
13141  * please see one of the following concrete sub-classes:
13142  * 
13143  * <ul>
13144  * 
13145  * <li>
13146  * Numeric-only axes: {@link pvc.options.axes.NumericCartesianAxis}
13147  * </li>
13148  * 
13149  * <li>
13150  * Normal discrete: {@link pvc.options.axes.FlattenedDiscreteCartesianAxis}
13151  * </li>
13152  * 
13153  * <li>
13154  * Numeric or time-series: {@link pvc.options.axes.AnyContinuousCartesianAxis}
13155  * </li>
13156  * 
13157  * <li>
13158  * Normal or hierarchical discrete:: {@link pvc.options.axes.AnyDiscreteCartesianAxis}
13159  * </li>
13160  * 
13161  * <li>
13162  * Numeric, time-series or normal discrete: {@link pvc.options.axes.AnyNonHierarchicalCartesianAxis}
13163  * </li>
13164  * </ul>
13165  * 
13166  * @class
13167  * @extends pvc.options.panels.Panel
13168  * @abstract
13169  */
13170 pvc.options.axes.CartesianAxis = function(){};
13171         
13172         
13173         
13174         
13175 /**
13176  * The percentage padding, 
13177  * on each of the sides of the plot panel
13178  * that are orthogonal to the axis orientation.
13179  * <p>
13180  * The percentage is a number 
13181  * greater than or equal to 
13182  * <tt>0</tt> and less than 
13183  * <tt>1</tt>. 
13184  * It is relative to length of the plot's side that 
13185  * has the same direction as the axis.
13186  * <p>
13187  * The padded area is useful to leave enough free space 
13188  * between the plot's visual elements and the axes panels.
13189  * <p>
13190  * If an axis is horizontal, 
13191  * the padding affects the left and right sides,
13192  * and if it is vertical, 
13193  * affects the top and bottom sides.
13194  * <p>
13195  * If more than one axis of a given orientation specifies an offset, 
13196  * the maximum specified offset is used.
13197  * 
13198  * @type number
13199  * @default 0
13200  * @category Layout
13201  */
13202 pvc.options.axes.CartesianAxis.prototype.offset = undefined;
13203 /**
13204  * The position of the axis panel.
13205  * <p>
13206  * The default value depends on the orientation and index
13207  * of the axis. 
13208  * For an horizontal axis, it is 
13209  * <tt>bottom</tt>.
13210  * For an vertical axis, it is 
13211  * <tt>left</tt>.
13212  * For axes other than the first, 
13213  * the default side is the opposite of that of the first axis: 
13214  * 
13215  * <tt>top</tt> for the horizontal axes and 
13216  * 
13217  * <tt>right</tt> for the vertical axes.
13218  * 
13219  * @type pvc.options.varia.PanelPosition
13220  * @category Layout
13221  */
13222 pvc.options.axes.CartesianAxis.prototype.position = undefined;
13223 /**
13224  * The fixed size of the panel, in pixel units or as a percentage.
13225  * <p>
13226  * If a size object is specified, 
13227  * only the component orthogonal to the axis orientation is considered.
13228  * <p>
13229  * See {@link pvc.options.varia.Size} for information about 
13230  * the different supported data types.
13231  * 
13232  * @type number|string|pvc.options.varia.Size
13233  * @category Layout
13234  */
13235 pvc.options.axes.CartesianAxis.prototype.size = undefined;
13236 /**
13237  * The maximum size of the panel, in pixel units or as a percentage.
13238  * <p>
13239  * If a size object is specified, 
13240  * only the component orthogonal to the axis orientation is considered.
13241  * <p>
13242  * See {@link pvc.options.varia.Size} for information about 
13243  * the different supported data types.
13244  * 
13245  * @type number|string|pvc.options.varia.Size
13246  * @category Layout
13247  */
13248 pvc.options.axes.CartesianAxis.prototype.sizeMax = undefined;
13249 /**
13250  * Indicates if the axis panel is shown.
13251  * <p>
13252  * This property replaces the following 
13253  * (now deprecated) chart properties:
13254  * 
13255  * <ul>
13256  * 
13257  * <li>
13258  * <tt>showXScale</tt></li>
13259  * 
13260  * <li>
13261  * <tt>showYScale</tt></li>
13262  * 
13263  * <li>
13264  * <tt>showSecondScale</tt></li>
13265  * </ul>
13266  * 
13267  * @type boolean
13268  * @default true
13269  * @category Layout
13270  */
13271 pvc.options.axes.CartesianAxis.prototype.visible = undefined;
13272 /**
13273  * The extension points object contains style definitions for 
13274  * the marks of the panel.
13275  * 
13276  * @type pvc.options.ext.CartesianAxisExtensionPoints
13277  * @category Style
13278  */
13279 pvc.options.axes.CartesianAxis.prototype.extensionPoints = undefined;
13280 /**
13281  * The font used by the panel.
13282  * <p>
13283  * See the supported font format in
13284  * {@link http://www.w3.org/TR/CSS2/fonts.html#font-shorthand}
13285  * 
13286  * @type string
13287  * @category Style
13288  */
13289 pvc.options.axes.CartesianAxis.prototype.font = undefined;
13290 /**
13291  * 
13292  * Indicates if grid rules are drawn.
13293  * 
13294  * @deprecated Use {@link #grid} instead.
13295  * @type boolean
13296  * @default false
13297  * @category Style
13298  */
13299 pvc.options.axes.CartesianAxis.prototype.fullGrid = undefined;
13300 /**
13301  * Indicates if grid rules are drawn 
13302  * separating discrete values or
13303  * at each major continuous tick.
13304  * 
13305  * @type boolean
13306  * @default false
13307  * @category Style
13308  */
13309 pvc.options.axes.CartesianAxis.prototype.grid = undefined;
13310 /**
13311  * A tick formatter function.
13312  * <p>
13313  * This function has two arguments variants:
13314  * 
13315  * <dl>
13316  * 
13317  * <dt>continuous</dt> 
13318  * <dd>tickFormatter(value, precision, index)</dd>
13319  * 
13320  * <dt>discrete</dt>   
13321  * <dd>tickFormatter(value, label)</dd>
13322  * </dl>
13323  * <p>
13324  * Generally,
13325  * a continuous axis uses the 
13326  * <i>continuous</i> variant and
13327  * a discrete axis uses the 
13328  * <i>discrete</i> variant.
13329  * <p>
13330  * But, there is one exception to this rule:
13331  * a discrete axis having a single date dimension,
13332  * uses the 
13333  * <i>continuous</i> variant.
13334  * This makes it easier to format date categories,
13335  * by automatically choosing an adequate precision,
13336  * that takes the actual data range into account.
13337  * It's also legacy, version 1, behavior.
13338  * Use the compatibility flag
13339  * {@link pvc.options.varia.CompatibilityFlags#discreteTimeSeriesTickFormat}
13340  * to disable this formatting mode.
13341  * <p>
13342  * Summing up:
13343  * 
13344  * <ul>
13345  * 
13346  * <li>a continuous axis uses the 
13347  * <i>continuous</i> arguments variant,</li>
13348  * 
13349  * <li>a discrete axis can use both arguments variant,</li>
13350  * 
13351  * <li>an axis with a single date dimension, uses the 
13352  * <i>continuous</i> arguments variant
13353  * (if {@link pvc.options.varia.CompatibilityFlags#discreteTimeSeriesTickFormat} is
13354  * 
13355  * <tt>true</tt>).</li>
13356  * </ul>
13357  * 
13358  * <p>
13359  * <b>Context object</b></p>
13360  * <p>
13361  * The function is called having as 
13362  * <tt>this</tt> the ticks array,
13363  * whose tick values are being formatted.
13364  * <p>
13365  * Together with the 
13366  * <i>index</i> argument,
13367  * it is possible to use the value of the previous and/or following ticks
13368  * to format the current tick.
13369  * <p>
13370  * The ticks array provides the following useful properties:
13371  * 
13372  * <ul>
13373  * 
13374  * <li>step — the used precision</li>
13375  * 
13376  * <li>base — the base precision from which step is derived</li>
13377  * 
13378  * <li>mult — the multiple of base precision that yields step (step = base * mult)</li>
13379  * 
13380  * <li>format(v) - the default formatting function</li>
13381  * 
13382  * <li>length — the number of ticks</li>
13383  * </ul>
13384  * 
13385  * @returns {string}
13386  * The string that is the formatted value.
13387  * 
13388  * @method
13389  * @this Array
13390  * @param {string|number|Date} value
13391  * The value to format.
13392  * 
13393  * <dl>
13394  * 
13395  * <dt>
13396  * <i>continuous</i> arguments variant</dt>
13397  * 
13398  * <dd>
13399  * The type of argument 
13400  * <i>value</i> can be 
13401  * <i>number</i> or 
13402  * <i>Date</i>.
13403  * </dd>
13404  * 
13405  * <dt>
13406  * <i>discrete</i> arguments variant</dt>
13407  * 
13408  * <dd>
13409  * The type of argument 
13410  * <i>value</i> can be 
13411  * <i>string</i> or 
13412  * <i>number</i>.
13413  * <p>
13414  * When the axis has a single dimension,
13415  * argument 
13416  * <i>value</i> is the 
13417  * <b>value</b> of that dimension.
13418  * <p>
13419  * When the axis has more than one dimension, and is flattened,
13420  * argument 
13421  * <i>value</i> is the junction of the 
13422  * <b>key</b> values of all dimensions,
13423  * separated by {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart#dataSeparator}.
13424  * <p>
13425  * When the axis is hierarchical (composite),
13426  * argument 
13427  * <i>value</i> is the 
13428  * <b>key</b> value of the dimension at a certain level.
13429  * </dd>
13430  * </dl>
13431  * 
13432  * @param {number} [precision]
13433  * The precision in which the 
13434  * <i>value</i> argument should be formatted.
13435  * 
13436  * <p>
13437  * <b>ATTENTION:</b> only present in the 
13438  * <i>continuous</i> arguments variant!</p>
13439  * <p>
13440  * When the axis has a 
13441  * <b>date</b> scale type,
13442  * the argument is the chosen 
13443  * 
13444  * <i>number of milliseconds</i> between tick values.
13445  * <p>
13446  * The standard time precisions are defined in:
13447  * {@link pvc.options.varia.TimeInterval}.
13448  * <p>
13449  * In general, the given precision is an integer multiple of one the standard precisions.
13450  * It is many times more useful to use the base standard precision on which the final precision is based on
13451  * (the value of the context property 
13452  * <tt>this.base</tt>).
13453  * <p>
13454  * When the axis has a 
13455  * <b>numeric</b> scale type,
13456  * the argument is the 
13457  * <i>number of decimal places</i> of
13458  * the chosen step value.
13459  * 
13460  * @param {number} [index]
13461  * The index of the tick being formatted.
13462  * 
13463  * <p>
13464  * <b>ATTENTION:</b> only present in the 
13465  * <i>continuous</i> arguments variant!</p>
13466  * <p>
13467  * You may use the index to access neighbouring ticks from the 
13468  * <tt>this</tt> ticks array
13469  * (e..g. 
13470  * <tt>this[index + 1]</tt>).
13471  * 
13472  * @param {string} [label]
13473  * The default label.
13474  * 
13475  * <p>
13476  * <b>ATTENTION:</b> only present in the 
13477  * <i>discrete</i> arguments variant!</p>
13478  * <p>
13479  * The default label is the label that would be displayed
13480  * if the tick formatter had not been specified.
13481  * <p>
13482  * When the axis has a single dimension,
13483  * argument 
13484  * <i>label</i> is the 
13485  * <b>label</b> as formatted by that dimension.
13486  * <p>
13487  * When the axis has more than one dimension, and is flattened,
13488  * argument 
13489  * <i>label</i> is the junction of the 
13490  * <b>label</b> values of all dimensions,
13491  * separated by {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart#groupedLabelSep}.
13492  * <p>
13493  * When the axis is hierarchical (composite),
13494  * argument 
13495  * <i>label</i> is the 
13496  * <b>label</b> as formatted by the dimension at a certain level.
13497  * 
13498  * @category Style
13499  */
13500 pvc.options.axes.CartesianAxis.prototype.tickFormatter = function(){};
13501 /**
13502  * The axis title and title options.
13503  * 
13504  * @type string|pvc.options.panels.CartesianAxisTitlePanel
13505  * @category Style
13506  */
13507 pvc.options.axes.CartesianAxis.prototype.title = undefined;
13508 /**
13509  * The extension points of the cartesian axis panel.
13510  * <p>
13511  * Axes extension points can also be specified directly at the chart options level.
13512  * <p>
13513  * To use an extension point you must find its full name, by joining:
13514  * 
13515  * <ol>
13516  * 
13517  * <li>panel property name (ex: 
13518  * <tt>xAxis</tt>)</li>
13519  * 
13520  * <li>extension property (ex: 
13521  * <tt>label</tt>)</li>
13522  * 
13523  * <li>the "_" character</li>
13524  * 
13525  * <li>extension sub-property (ex: 
13526  * <tt>textStyle</tt>)</li>
13527  * </ol>
13528  * and obtaining, for the examples, the camel-cased name: 
13529  * <tt>xAxisLabel_textStyle</tt>
13530  * (see {@link http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CamelCase}).
13531  * 
13532  * @class
13533  */
13534 pvc.options.ext.CartesianAxisExtensionPoints = function(){};
13535         
13536         
13537         
13538         
13539 /**
13540  * The extension point of the grid line rules.
13541  * 
13542  * @type pvc.options.marks.RuleExtensionPoint
13543  * @category Style
13544  */
13545 pvc.options.ext.CartesianAxisExtensionPoints.prototype.grid = undefined;
13546 /**
13547  * The extension point of the tick label mark.
13548  * 
13549  * @type pvc.options.marks.LabelExtensionPoint
13550  * @category Style
13551  */
13552 pvc.options.ext.CartesianAxisExtensionPoints.prototype.label = undefined;
13553 /**
13554  * The extension point of the axis rule.
13555  * 
13556  * @type pvc.options.marks.RuleExtensionPoint
13557  * @category Style
13558  */
13559 pvc.options.ext.CartesianAxisExtensionPoints.prototype.rule = undefined;
13560 /**
13561  * The options documentation class of the cartesian axis panel
13562  * that cannot be discrete-hierarchical.
13563  * 
13564  * @class
13565  * @extends pvc.options.axes.CartesianAxis
13566  */
13567 pvc.options.axes.AnyNonHierarchicalCartesianAxis = function(){};
13568         
13569         
13570         
13571         
13572 /**
13573  * A callback function that is called
13574  * when the user clicks on a tick label
13575  * (applies to discrete axes).
13576  * 
13577  * @returns {undefined}
13578  * @method
13579  * @this pvc.visual.Context
13580  * @param {pvc.visual.Scene} scene
13581  * The scene associated with the visual item.
13582  * 
13583  * @category Discrete > Actions
13584  */
13585 pvc.options.axes.AnyNonHierarchicalCartesianAxis.prototype.clickAction = function(){};
13586 /**
13587  * A callback function that is called
13588  * when the user double-clicks on a tick label
13589  * (applies to discrete axes).
13590  * 
13591  * @returns {undefined}
13592  * @method
13593  * @this pvc.visual.Context
13594  * @param {pvc.visual.Scene} scene
13595  * The scene associated with the visual item.
13596  * 
13597  * @category Discrete > Actions
13598  */
13599 pvc.options.axes.AnyNonHierarchicalCartesianAxis.prototype.doubleClickAction = function(){};
13600 /**
13601  * Indicates the type of automatic content generated for the tooltip of axis' labels (applies to discrete axes).
13602  * 
13603  * @type pvc.options.varia.TooltipAutoContent
13604  * @default 'value'
13605  * @category Discrete > General
13606  */
13607 pvc.options.axes.AnyNonHierarchicalCartesianAxis.prototype.tooltipAutoContent = undefined;
13608 /**
13609  * Indicates if the axis' labels show tooltips (applies to discrete axes).
13610  * 
13611  * @type boolean
13612  * @default true
13613  * @category Discrete > General
13614  */
13615 pvc.options.axes.AnyNonHierarchicalCartesianAxis.prototype.tooltipEnabled = undefined;
13616 /**
13617  * A callback function that is called to build the tooltip of an axis' labels (applies to discrete axes).
13618  * <p>
13619  * If the chart's {@link pvc.options.Tooltip#html} is 
13620  * <tt>true</tt>,
13621  * the resulting text must be valid HTML,
13622  * otherwise,
13623  * it is considered plain text.
13624  * <p>
13625  * When unspecified
13626  * and {@link #tooltipEnabled} is 
13627  * <tt>true</tt>
13628  * a tooltip is automatically generated according to the value of
13629  * {@link #tooltipAutoContent}.
13630  * 
13631  * @returns {string}
13632  * The tooltip text.
13633  * 
13634  * @method
13635  * @this pvc.visual.Context
13636  * @param {pvc.visual.Scene} scene
13637  * The scene whose tooltip is to be built.
13638  * <p>
13639  * Use the data contained in the scene object to 
13640  * build the tooltip.
13641  * 
13642  * @category Discrete > General
13643  */
13644 pvc.options.axes.AnyNonHierarchicalCartesianAxis.prototype.tooltipFormat = function(){};
13645 /**
13646  * The size, in pixels, of the bands used to represent the discrete domain values (applies to discrete axes).
13647  * <p>
13648  * A non-negative number.
13649  * 
13650  * <p>
13651  * 
13652  * <b>In multi-charts</b>
13653  * <p>
13654  * The current layout algorithm used by multi-charts does not support
13655  * minimum, fixed or maximum sizes in small charts.
13656  * As such, the simples band size ratio model always needs to be used.
13657  * <p>
13658  * The minimum, fixed and maximum sizes and spacings are used to determine an
13659  * equivalent or best-possible band size ratio.
13660  * </p>
13661  * 
13662  * <p>
13663  * 
13664  * <b>Band Size, Spacing, Ratio and Step</b>
13665  * <p>
13666  * The band layout arranges bands and space in the following way.
13667  * Taking 
13668  * <i>B</i> to represent 
13669  * <i>bandSize</i>,
13670  * 
13671  * <i>E</i> to represent {@link #bandSpacing} and
13672  * 
13673  * <i>e</i> to be 
13674  * <tt>E/2</tt>,
13675  * bands and space will follow the pattern:
13676  * 
13677  * <tt>eBe</tt>, 
13678  * <tt>eBEBe</tt>, 
13679  * <tt>eBEBEBe</tt>, ...
13680  * <p>
13681  * For a given pair of 
13682  * <i>B</i> and 
13683  * <i>E</i>, each discrete category will occupy a space given by
13684  * the 
13685  * <i>step</i>, 
13686  * <i>S</i>:
13687  * <br></br>
13688  * 
13689  * <i>S = B + E</i>.
13690  * <p>
13691  * Given the number of discrete categories, a cartesian panel (axis or plot) will have
13692  * corresponding fixed or minimum and maximum sizes.
13693  * <p>
13694  * The option {@link #bandSizeRatio}, R, is used, in under-constrained cases,
13695  * to relate 
13696  * <i>B</i> and 
13697  * <i>E</i>:
13698  * <br></br>
13699  * 
13700  * <i>B = R * S</i>
13701  * </p>
13702  * 
13703  * <p>
13704  * 
13705  * <b>Impact on chart size</b>
13706  * <p>
13707  * If the chart size along the axis' dimension
13708  * is such that the available space is less than the
13709  * determined fixed or minimum size,
13710  * then the chart will grow as much as needed to accommodate the fixed or minimum size,
13711  * along that dimension.
13712  * <p>
13713  * If, on the contrary, the chart size along the axis' dimension
13714  * is greater than the determined fixed or maximum size,
13715  * the plot and axis content will be centered in the available space.
13716  * </p>
13717  * 
13718  * <p>
13719  * 
13720  * <b>Option values harmonization</b>
13721  * <p>
13722  * When both {@link #bandSizeMax} and {@link #bandSizeMin} are specified,
13723  * and {@link #bandSizeMax} is less than or equal to 
13724  * <i>bandSizeMin</i>,
13725  * then {@link #bandSize} is set to the the minimum value.
13726  * <p>
13727  * When both 
13728  * <i>bandSize</i> and {@link #bandSizeMin} are specified,
13729  * and 
13730  * <i>bandSize</i> is less than 
13731  * <i>bandSizeMin</i>,
13732  * then the minimum value is used instead.
13733  * <p>
13734  * When both 
13735  * <i>bandSpacing</i> and {@link #bandSpacingMin} are specified,
13736  * and 
13737  * <i>bandSpacing</i> is less than 
13738  * <i>bandSpacingMin</i>,
13739  * then the minimum value is used instead.
13740  * <p>
13741  * When both {@link #bandSpacingMax} and {@link #bandSpacingMin} are specified,
13742  * and {@link #bandSpacingMax} is less than or equal to 
13743  * <i>bandSpacingMin</i>,
13744  * then {@link #bandSpacing} is set to the the minimum value.
13745  * </p>
13746  * 
13747  * <p>
13748  * 
13749  * <b>The algorithm</b>
13750  * <p>
13751  * The options you specify should just behave as you'd expected them to.
13752  * At least, after thinking about them for a while.
13753  * <p>
13754  * If doubts remain on which options and values should be specified,
13755  * or on why the specified options are behaving in a certain way,
13756  * you can follow this explanation of the band layout algorithm.
13757  * </p>
13758  * 
13759  * <ul>
13760  * 
13761  * <li>
13762  * When both 
13763  * <i>bandSize</i> and {@link #bandSpacing} are specified, the layout is 
13764  * <b>fixed</b>.
13765  * <p>
13766  * When they both have the value 
13767  * <tt>0</tt>, then the layout is reevaluated as if they had not been specified.
13768  * <p>
13769  * The option {@link #bandSizeRatio} is ignored.
13770  * </li>
13771  * 
13772  * <li>
13773  * When one and only one of 
13774  * <i>bandSize</i> or {@link #bandSpacing} is specified,
13775  * the layout is 
13776  * <b>partially fixed</b>.
13777  * <p>
13778  * For the variable option, size or spacing,
13779  * any specified minimum and/or maximum options are still considered.
13780  * <p>
13781  * This configuration does not define a fixed step size,
13782  * but instead constrains the range of step size values.
13783  * <p>
13784  * The option {@link #bandSizeRatio} is ignored.
13785  * </li>
13786  * 
13787  * <li>
13788  * When neither 
13789  * <i>bandSize</i> nor {@link #bandSpacing} are specified,
13790  * the layout is 
13791  * <b>strictly variable</b>.
13792  * <p>
13793  * There are several cases:
13794  * 
13795  * <ul>
13796  * 
13797  * <li>
13798  * When none of the minimum and maximum values, of both size and spacing, are specified,
13799  * the size and spacing are governed solely by the {@link #bandSizeRatio}, 
13800  * <i>R</i>.
13801  * <p>
13802  * This is the way the band layout used to behave,
13803  * before the existence of the fixed, minimum and maximum options.
13804  * <p>
13805  * Small-charts continue to behave this way,
13806  * although with a band size ratio that is determined from the
13807  * the other specified options.
13808  * <p>
13809  * The half-line 
13810  * <i>(E,B)</i> departs from 
13811  * <i>(0,0)</i>
13812  * and goes on indefinitely with a slope given by 
13813  * <i>R</i>: 
13814  * <i>E = (1/R - 1) * B</i>.
13815  * </li>
13816  * 
13817  * <li>
13818  * 
13819  * <p>
13820  * When minimum and maximum values, of both size and spacing, are specified,
13821  * the size and spacing are constrained to belong to the
13822  * line segment 
13823  * <i>(E,B)</i>, that goes from point 
13824  * <i>(Emin,Bmin)</i> to point 
13825  * <i>(Emax,Bmax)</i>.
13826  * </p>
13827  * </li>
13828  * 
13829  * <li>
13830  * 
13831  * <p>
13832  * When only the minimum size and spacing values are specified,
13833  * the size and spacing are constrained to belong to the
13834  * line segment 
13835  * <i>(E,B)</i>, that goes from point 
13836  * <i>(0,0)</i> to point 
13837  * <i>(Emin,Bmin)</i>.
13838  * </p>
13839  * </li>
13840  * 
13841  * <li>
13842  * 
13843  * <p>
13844  * When only the maximum size and spacing values are specified,
13845  * the size and spacing are constrained to belong to the
13846  * line segment 
13847  * <i>(E,B)</i>, that goes from point 
13848  * <i>(0,0)</i> to point 
13849  * <i>(Emax,Bmax)</i>.
13850  * </p>
13851  * </li>
13852  * 
13853  * <li>
13854  * In all the following mixed and under-constrained cases,
13855  * option {@link #bandSizeRatio}, 
13856  * <i>R</i>, is taken into account.
13857  * <p>
13858  * The size and spacing are constrained to belong to the the line 
13859  * <i>(E,B)</i> that
13860  * passes through 
13861  * <i>(0,0)</i> and has a slope
13862  * given by 
13863  * <i>R</i>: 
13864  * <i>E = (1/R - 1) * B</i>.
13865  * <p>
13866  * Again, a few more cases:
13867  * 
13868  * <ul>
13869  * 
13870  * <li>
13871  * 
13872  * <p>
13873  * When only the minimum and maximum size values are specified,
13874  * the corresponding spacing values are implied.
13875  * </p>
13876  * </li>
13877  * 
13878  * <li>
13879  * 
13880  * <p>
13881  * When only the minimum and maximum spacing values are specified,
13882  * the corresponding size values are implied.
13883  * </p>
13884  * </li>
13885  * 
13886  * <li>
13887  * When only the minimum size and the maximum spacing values are specified,
13888  * the specified minimum size implies a minimum spacing and
13889  * the specified maximum spacing implies a maximum size.
13890  * <p>
13891  * If the implied minimum spacing is greater than or equal to the specified
13892  * maximum spacing, the algorithm is reevaluated using a fixed spacing
13893  * equal to the implied minimum spacing.
13894  * </li>
13895  * 
13896  * <li>
13897  * When only the maximum size and the minimum spacing values are specified,
13898  * the specified maximum size implies a maximum spacing and
13899  * the specified minimum spacing implies a minimum size.
13900  * <p>
13901  * If the implied minimum size is greater than or equal to the specified
13902  * maximum size, the algorithm is reevaluated using a fixed size
13903  * equal to the implied minimum size.
13904  * </li>
13905  * </ul>
13906  * </li>
13907  * </ul>
13908  * </li>
13909  * </ul>
13910  * <p>
13911  * See other band-control options:
13912  * {@link #bandSpacing},
13913  * {@link #bandSizeMin},
13914  * {@link #bandSizeMax},
13915  * {@link #bandSpacingMin},
13916  * {@link #bandSpacingMax} and,
13917  * for charts that give it representation,
13918  * {@link #bandSizeRatio}.
13919  * 
13920  * @type number
13921  * @category Discrete > Layout
13922  */
13923 pvc.options.axes.AnyNonHierarchicalCartesianAxis.prototype.bandSize = undefined;
13924 /**
13925  * The maximum size, in pixels, of the bands used to represent the discrete domain values (applies to discrete axes).
13926  * <p>
13927  * A non-negative number.
13928  * <p>
13929  * See {@link #bandSize} for information on the band layout algorithm.
13930  * 
13931  * @type number
13932  * @category Discrete > Layout
13933  */
13934 pvc.options.axes.AnyNonHierarchicalCartesianAxis.prototype.bandSizeMax = undefined;
13935 /**
13936  * The minimum size, in pixels, of the bands used to represent the discrete domain values (applies to discrete axes).
13937  * <p>
13938  * A non-negative number.
13939  * <p>
13940  * See {@link #bandSize} for information on the band layout algorithm.
13941  * 
13942  * @type number
13943  * @category Discrete > Layout
13944  */
13945 pvc.options.axes.AnyNonHierarchicalCartesianAxis.prototype.bandSizeMin = undefined;
13946 /**
13947  * The ratio of the band size over the
13948  * total size (band + spacing),
13949  * in a discrete axis band (applies to discrete axes).
13950  * <p>
13951  * A number between 
13952  * <tt>0</tt> and 
13953  * <tt>1</tt>.
13954  * <p>
13955  * The default value of this property is that of the legacy option 
13956  * <i>panelSizeRatio</i>,
13957  * defined for the Bar-family, Box-Plot and the Heat-Grid charts.
13958  * <p>
13959  * This option is only used when
13960  * the band model is under-constrained
13961  * by the fixed, minimum, and maximum size and spacing options.
13962  * <p>
13963  * See {@link #bandSize} for information on the band layout algorithm.
13964  * 
13965  * @type number
13966  * @category Discrete > Layout
13967  */
13968 pvc.options.axes.AnyNonHierarchicalCartesianAxis.prototype.bandSizeRatio = undefined;
13969 /**
13970  * The space, in pixels, separating/surrounding bands (applies to discrete axes).
13971  * <p>
13972  * A non-negative number.
13973  * <p>
13974  * See {@link #bandSize} for information on the band layout algorithm.
13975  * 
13976  * @type number
13977  * @category Discrete > Layout
13978  */
13979 pvc.options.axes.AnyNonHierarchicalCartesianAxis.prototype.bandSpacing = undefined;
13980 /**
13981  * The maximum space, in pixels, separating/surrounding bands (applies to discrete axes).
13982  * <p>
13983  * A non-negative number.
13984  * <p>
13985  * See {@link #bandSize} for information on the band layout algorithm.
13986  * 
13987  * @type number
13988  * @category Discrete > Layout
13989  */
13990 pvc.options.axes.AnyNonHierarchicalCartesianAxis.prototype.bandSpacingMax = undefined;
13991 /**
13992  * The minimum space, in pixels, separating/surrounding bands (applies to discrete axes).
13993  * <p>
13994  * A non-negative number.
13995  * <p>
13996  * See {@link #bandSize} for information on the band layout algorithm.
13997  * 
13998  * @type number
13999  * @category Discrete > Layout
14000  */
14001 pvc.options.axes.AnyNonHierarchicalCartesianAxis.prototype.bandSpacingMin = undefined;
14002 /**
14003  * The domain alignment to use when the domain has a fixed or implied length (applies to continuous axes).
14004  * <p>
14005  * For more information, see {@link #fixedLength}.
14006  * 
14007  * @type pvc.options.varia.AxisDomainAlign
14008  * @default 'center'
14009  * @category Continuous > Scale
14010  */
14011 pvc.options.axes.AnyNonHierarchicalCartesianAxis.prototype.domainAlign = undefined;
14012 /**
14013  * Controls the type of scale domain coordination that should be performed
14014  * amongst the axes of the same id of each 
14015  * <i>small chart</i> (applies to continuous axes).
14016  * <p>
14017  * The value {@link pvc.options.varia.AxisDomainScope#Row}
14018  * can only be specified if the axis has vertical orientation.
14019  * Conversely,
14020  * the value {@link pvc.options.varia.AxisDomainScope#Column}
14021  * can only be specified if the axis has horizontal orientation.
14022  * 
14023  * @type pvc.options.varia.AxisDomainScope
14024  * @default 'global'
14025  * @category Continuous > Scale
14026  */
14027 pvc.options.axes.AnyNonHierarchicalCartesianAxis.prototype.domainScope = undefined;
14028 /**
14029  * The fixed length of the axis domain (applies to continuous axes).
14030  * <p>
14031  * A string value is converted to a number.
14032  * <p>
14033  * The value may be bigger or smaller than the actual length of the data.
14034  * <p>
14035  * By default, the domain of the axis is determined from the actual domain of the data.
14036  * This and other options allow modifying the axis domain.
14037  * <p>
14038  * When the axis domain gets smaller than the data domain,
14039  * and {@link pvc.options.charts.CartesianChart#leafContentOverflow} is set to 
14040  * <tt>auto</tt>,
14041  * the default value,
14042  * clipping is activated in the related plot panels and any overflown content is hidden.
14043  * 
14044  * <h3>Phase I</h3>
14045  * <p>
14046  * The phase I axis domain is determined by the following procedure:
14047  * 
14048  * <ol>
14049  * 
14050  * <li>
14051  * If 
14052  * <tt>fixedLength</tt> is not specified:
14053  * 
14054  * <ol>
14055  * 
14056  * <li>
14057  * If neither 
14058  * <tt>fixedMin</tt> and 
14059  * <tt>fixedMax</tt> are specified,
14060  * the axis domain is the data domain;
14061  * option 
14062  * <tt>originIsZero</tt> may augment the axis domain, on one of its sides;
14063  * </li>
14064  * 
14065  * <li>
14066  * If both 
14067  * <tt>fixedMin</tt> and 
14068  * <tt>fixedMax</tt> are specified,
14069  * the axis domain is fully determined; it's length is implied;
14070  * option 
14071  * <tt>originIsZero</tt> is ignored;
14072  * </li>
14073  * 
14074  * <li>
14075  * If 
14076  * <tt>fixedMin</tt> is specified (and 
14077  * <tt>fixedMax</tt> is not)
14078  * the axis domain minimum is 
14079  * <tt>fixedMin</tt> and
14080  * the axis domain maximum is the data domain maximum, possibly corrected by
14081  * option 
14082  * <tt>originIsZero</tt>;
14083  * </li>
14084  * 
14085  * <li>
14086  * Else, (if 
14087  * <tt>fixedMax</tt> is specified and 
14088  * <tt>fixedMin</tt> is not,)
14089  * the axis domain maximum is 
14090  * <tt>fixedMax</tt> and
14091  * the axis domain minimum is the data domain minimum, possibly corrected by
14092  * option 
14093  * <tt>originIsZero</tt>;
14094  * </li>
14095  * </ol>
14096  * </li>
14097  * 
14098  * <li>
14099  * If 
14100  * <tt>fixedLength</tt> is specified, option 
14101  * <tt>originIsZero</tt> is ignored.
14102  * <p>
14103  * The limits of the axis domain are determined as follows:
14104  * 
14105  * <ol>
14106  * 
14107  * <li>
14108  * If 
14109  * <tt>fixedMin</tt> is specified, the axis domain maximum is implied:
14110  * <br></br>
14111  * 
14112  * <tt>max = fixedMin + fixedLength</tt>;
14113  * <br></br>
14114  * options 
14115  * <tt>originIsZero</tt>, 
14116  * <tt>fixedMax</tt> are ignored;
14117  * option 
14118  * <tt>domainAlign</tt> is ignored in this phase;
14119  * </li>
14120  * 
14121  * <li>
14122  * If 
14123  * <tt>fixedMax</tt> is specified, the axis domain minimum is implied:
14124  * <br></br>
14125  * 
14126  * <tt>min = fixedMax - fixedLength</tt>;
14127  * <br></br>
14128  * option 
14129  * <tt>originIsZero</tt> is ignored;
14130  * option 
14131  * <tt>domainAlign</tt> is ignored in this phase;
14132  * </li>
14133  * 
14134  * <li>
14135  * Else, 
14136  * <tt>domainAlign</tt> is either specified or defaults to 
14137  * <tt>center</tt>.
14138  * The axis domain is aligned to either the minimum, maximum or center of the data domain
14139  * and then taken to have the specified fixed length.
14140  * <p>
14141  * It is determined as follows:
14142  * 
14143  * <ul>
14144  * 
14145  * <li>
14146  * If 
14147  * <tt>domainAlign</tt> is 
14148  * <tt>min</tt>, the axis domain minimum is that of
14149  * the actual data and the axis domain maximum is implied:
14150  * <br></br>
14151  * 
14152  * <tt>max = min(data) + fixedLength</tt>;
14153  * </li>
14154  * 
14155  * <li>
14156  * If 
14157  * <tt>domainAlign</tt> is 
14158  * <tt>max</tt>, the axis domain maximum is that of
14159  * the actual data and the axis domain minimum is implied:
14160  * <br></br>
14161  * 
14162  * <tt>min = max(data) - fixedLength</tt>;
14163  * </li>
14164  * 
14165  * <li>
14166  * Else, 
14167  * <tt>domainAlign</tt> is 
14168  * <tt>center</tt>, or defaults to it,
14169  * and both axis domain limits are determined from the actual data domain,
14170  * as follows:
14171  * 
14172  * <ul>
14173  * 
14174  * <li>
14175  * <tt>min = center(data) - fixedLength / 2</tt></li>
14176  * 
14177  * <li>
14178  * <tt>max = center(data) + fixedLength / 2</tt></li>
14179  * </ul>
14180  * where 
14181  * <tt>center(data)</tt> is determined as:
14182  * <br></br>
14183  * 
14184  * <tt>center(data) = (max(data) - min(data)) / 2</tt>.
14185  * </li>
14186  * </ul>
14187  * </li>
14188  * </ol>
14189  * </li>
14190  * </ol>
14191  * 
14192  * <h3>Phase II</h3>
14193  * <p>
14194  * In phase II, additional options may modify the phase I axis domain.
14195  * <p>
14196  * If {@link #domainRoundMode} is 
14197  * <tt>nice</tt>, the axis domain is made "nice",
14198  * by making sure that its ends are "nice" numbers.
14199  * <p>
14200  * If {@link #ratio} is specified (or a ratio is imposed due to {@link preserveRatio}),
14201  * the length of the axis domain is imposed by the length of the axis' range (a number of pixels).
14202  * The axis domain is aligned relative to the phase I axis domain, according to the value
14203  * of {@link #domainAlign}.
14204  * <p>
14205  * If {@link #domainRoundMode} is 
14206  * <tt>tick</tt>,
14207  * the phase I axis domain is extended to include the calculated ticks and only then are
14208  * the 
14209  * <tt>ratio</tt> and 
14210  * <tt>domainAlign</tt> options processed, so that the domain aligns to
14211  * the calculated ticks.
14212  * 
14213  * <h3>Default</h3>
14214  * <p>
14215  * If a sliding window exists, it is its length {@link pvc.options.SlidingWindow#length},
14216  * otherwise, 
14217  * <tt>null</tt>.
14218  * <p>
14219  * For more information, see:
14220  * {@link #fixedMin},
14221  * {@link #fixedMax},
14222  * {@link #domainAlign},
14223  * {@link #ratio} and
14224  * {@link #originIsZero}.
14225  * 
14226  * @type number|pvc.options.varia.TimeInterval
14227  * @category Continuous > Scale
14228  */
14229 pvc.options.axes.AnyNonHierarchicalCartesianAxis.prototype.fixedLength = undefined;
14230 /**
14231  * The fixed maximum value of the axis domain (applies to continuous axes).
14232  * <p>
14233  * The value is converted using the {@link pvc.options.DimensionType#converter} of
14234  * the first dimension of the first role bound to the axis.
14235  * <p>
14236  * For example, if the base axis shows the 
14237  * <i>category</i> dimension,
14238  * and the dimension is configured as type 
14239  * <tt>Date</tt>,
14240  * and it uses the default converter, then it accepts:
14241  * 
14242  * <ul>
14243  * 
14244  * <li>
14245  * values of type 
14246  * <tt>number</tt>,
14247  * representing milliseconds as returned by
14248  * the JavaScript's 
14249  * <tt>Date.getTime()</tt> method;
14250  * </li>
14251  * 
14252  * <li>
14253  * values of type 
14254  * <tt>Date</tt>, which are accepted as is;
14255  * </li>
14256  * 
14257  * <li>
14258  * values of type 
14259  * <tt>string</tt>,
14260  * in a format defined by the dimension's
14261  * {@link pvc.options.DimensionType#rawFormat}.
14262  * </li>
14263  * </ul>
14264  * <p>
14265  * The value may be bigger or smaller than the maximum value of the data domain.
14266  * <p>
14267  * For more information, see {@link #fixedLength}.
14268  * 
14269  * @type number|string|Date
14270  * @category Continuous > Scale
14271  */
14272 pvc.options.axes.AnyNonHierarchicalCartesianAxis.prototype.fixedMax = undefined;
14273 /**
14274  * The fixed minimum value of the axis domain (applies to continuous axes).
14275  * <p>
14276  * The value is converted using the
14277  * {@link pvc.options.DimensionType#converter} of
14278  * the first dimension of the first role bound to the axis.
14279  * <p>
14280  * For example, if the base axis shows the 
14281  * <i>category</i> dimension,
14282  * and the dimension is configured as type Date,
14283  * and it uses the default converter, then it accepts:
14284  * 
14285  * <ul>
14286  * 
14287  * <li>values of type 
14288  * <tt>number</tt>,
14289  * representing milliseconds as returned by
14290  * the JavaScript's 
14291  * <tt>Date.getTime()</tt> method
14292  * </li>
14293  * 
14294  * <li>values of type 
14295  * <tt>Date</tt>, which are accepted as is</li>
14296  * 
14297  * <li>values of type 
14298  * <tt>string</tt>,
14299  * in a format defined by the dimension's
14300  * {@link pvc.options.DimensionType#rawFormat}.
14301  * </li>
14302  * </ul>
14303  * <p>
14304  * The value may be bigger or smaller than the minimum value of the data domain.
14305  * <p>
14306  * For more information, see {@link #fixedLength}.
14307  * 
14308  * @type number|string|Date
14309  * @category Continuous > Scale
14310  */
14311 pvc.options.axes.AnyNonHierarchicalCartesianAxis.prototype.fixedMin = undefined;
14312 /**
14313  * Indicates if it should be ensured that the 0 domain value is shown (applies to numeric axes).
14314  * <p>
14315  * The properties
14316  * 
14317  * <tt>fixedMin</tt> and
14318  * 
14319  * <tt>fixedMax</tt> have precedence over this one.
14320  * <p>
14321  * If this property is 
14322  * <tt>true</tt>
14323  * and respecting it would require changing
14324  * the minimum value,
14325  * but the option 
14326  * <tt>fixedMin</tt> is also specified,
14327  * then this property is ignored.
14328  * The same would apply if
14329  * it were required to change
14330  * the maximum value,
14331  * but the property 
14332  * <tt>fixedMax</tt> was also specified.
14333  * <p>
14334  * For more information, see: {@link #fixedLength}.
14335  * 
14336  * @type boolean
14337  * @category Continuous > Scale
14338  */
14339 pvc.options.axes.AnyNonHierarchicalCartesianAxis.prototype.originIsZero = undefined;
14340 /**
14341  * Indicates if the initial proportion between the axis' domain and range lengths should be
14342  * preserved between renders (applies to continuous axes).
14343  * <p>
14344  * When using a sliding window for real time applications,
14345  * the ratio preservation allows for a stable visualization,
14346  * regardless of the data values provided.
14347  * <p>
14348  * When 
14349  * <tt>preserveRatio</tt> is specified,
14350  * following renders will use the 
14351  * <i>effective ratio</i> of the first render,
14352  * whether the ratio was initially fixed using 
14353  * <tt>ratio</tt> or not.
14354  * <p>
14355  * See {@link pvc.options.SlidingWindow}.
14356  * 
14357  * <h3>Default</h3>
14358  * If a sliding window exists: 
14359  * <tt>true</tt>, otherwise, 
14360  * <tt>false</tt>.
14361  * <p>
14362  * See {@link #ratio}.
14363  * 
14364  * @type boolean
14365  * @category Continuous > Scale
14366  */
14367 pvc.options.axes.AnyNonHierarchicalCartesianAxis.prototype.preserveRatio = undefined;
14368 /**
14369  * The fixed ratio value which is the proportion between the axis' range and domain lengths (applies to continuous axes).
14370  * <p>
14371  * This property can be defined as a number or a string.
14372  * <p>
14373  * For example, if the desired correspondence is that 100 pixels (range) represent 25 days (domain),
14374  * the option can be specified with any of the following equivalent forms:
14375  * 
14376  * <ul>
14377  * 
14378  * <li>
14379  * <tt>ratio = "100/25d"</tt>; or</li>
14380  * 
14381  * <li>
14382  * <tt>ratio = "100/216e7"</tt> (
14383  * <tt>"25d" = 216e7</tt> milliseconds); or</li>
14384  * 
14385  * <li>
14386  * <tt>ratio = 4.63e-8</tt>.</li>
14387  * </ul>
14388  * <p>
14389  * For more information,
14390  * see {@link #fixedLength} and {@link #preserveRatio}.
14391  * 
14392  * @type number|pvc.options.varia.TimeRatio
14393  * @category Continuous > Scale
14394  */
14395 pvc.options.axes.AnyNonHierarchicalCartesianAxis.prototype.ratio = undefined;
14396 /**
14397  * The 
14398  * <i>desired</i> number of major ticks.
14399  * <p>
14400  * A positive integer, possibly infinite.
14401  * <p>
14402  * Attention: This option is ignored when {@link #tickUnit} is specified!
14403  * <p>
14404  * Depending on
14405  * the domain values extent,
14406  * the labels' font size,
14407  * the available space,
14408  * the axis' orientation,
14409  * and the minimum label spacing
14410  * (given by {@link pvc.options.axes.AnyNonHierarchicalCartesianAxis#labelSpacingMin}),
14411  * a maximum number of ticks is implied.
14412  * <p>
14413  * The value of 
14414  * <i>desiredTickCount</i> is clamped to this layout imposed maximum.
14415  * <p>
14416  * When specified and finite,
14417  * the tick calculation algorithm chooses,
14418  * amongst possible tick units,
14419  * the one that results in a number of ticks
14420  * that is 
14421  * <b>closest</b> to the specified 
14422  * <b>desired</b> value.
14423  * <p>
14424  * When specified and infinite (
14425  * <tt>Infinity</tt>),
14426  * the layout imposed maximum is used instead.
14427  * 
14428  * <p>
14429  * 
14430  * <b>The minimum tick count</b>
14431  * </p>
14432  * <p>
14433  * This actually depends on the value of {@link #domainRoundMode}.
14434  * 
14435  * <ul>
14436  * 
14437  * <li>
14438  * 
14439  * <p>
14440  * <b>
14441  * <i>domainRoundMode</i> is {@link pvc.options.varia.AxisDomainRoundingMode#Tick}</b></p>
14442  * <p>
14443  * For tick counts greater than two or three, the algorithm strives to satisfy the user's desire!
14444  * <p>
14445  * However,
14446  * the algorithm always generates at least two or three ticks,
14447  * ignoring both 
14448  * <i>desiredTickCount</i> and 
14449  * <i>labelSpacingMin</i>,
14450  * if needed.
14451  * <p>
14452  * At least three ticks are generated for numeric domains having both negative and positive data.
14453  * There are also temporal domain cases where a minimum of three ticks are generated.
14454  * <p>
14455  * When the labels of these ticks really overlap,
14456  * one of the labels is kept visible and the other(s) is hidden.
14457  * <p>
14458  * This behavior ensures that, unless it is really impossible to do so,
14459  * the axis serves one of its main purposes - allowing to translate visual lengths.
14460  * <p>
14461  * When three tick labels overlap,
14462  * the middle label is kept visible and the end labels are hidden.
14463  * <p>
14464  * When two tick labels overlap,
14465  * one of the labels
14466  * — the one with tick value 
14467  * <tt>0</tt>, if any, or the first one, if none —
14468  * is kept visible and the other is hidden.
14469  * </li>
14470  * 
14471  * <li>
14472  * 
14473  * <p>
14474  * <b>
14475  * <i>domainRoundMode</i> is
14476  * {@link pvc.options.varia.AxisDomainRoundingMode#None} or
14477  * {@link pvc.options.varia.AxisDomainRoundingMode#Nice}</b></p>
14478  * <p>
14479  * The algorithm always generates at least one tick.
14480  * </li>
14481  * </ul>
14482  * <p>
14483  * Specifying a value of 
14484  * <tt>1</tt> results in the minimum possible tick count.
14485  * 
14486  * <p>
14487  * 
14488  * <b>Domain type specifics</b>
14489  * </p>
14490  * 
14491  * <ul>
14492  * 
14493  * <li>
14494  * 
14495  * <b>Numeric</b>
14496  * <p>
14497  * When unspecified, the default value is 
14498  * <tt>Infinity</tt>.
14499  * </li>
14500  * 
14501  * <li>
14502  * 
14503  * <b>Temporal</b>
14504  * <p>
14505  * The value must be less than or equal to 
14506  * <tt>10</tt>.
14507  * <p>
14508  * When unspecified, the default value is 
14509  * <tt>5</tt>.
14510  * </li>
14511  * </ul>
14512  * <p>
14513  * See {@link #tickUnit} for more information.
14514  * 
14515  * @type number
14516  * @category Continuous > Style
14517  */
14518 pvc.options.axes.AnyNonHierarchicalCartesianAxis.prototype.desiredTickCount = undefined;
14519 /**
14520  * Indicates if minor ticks are shown between major ticks (applies to continuous axes).
14521  * 
14522  * @type boolean
14523  * @default true
14524  * @category Continuous > Style
14525  */
14526 pvc.options.axes.AnyNonHierarchicalCartesianAxis.prototype.minorTicks = undefined;
14527 /**
14528  * The ticks' major unit (difference in domain value between consecutive ticks).
14529  * <p>
14530  * When a number, it must be a non-negative, finite, integer.
14531  * 
14532  * <ul>
14533  * 
14534  * <li>
14535  * 
14536  * <b>Numeric axis</b>
14537  * <p>
14538  * Specified values are rounded down to one of the standard precisions:
14539  * a number that is an integer power of 10,
14540  * multiplied by 1, 2 or 5 (e.g. 0.1, 0.2, 0.5, 1, 2, 5, 10, 20, 50, ...).
14541  * </li>
14542  * 
14543  * <li>
14544  * 
14545  * <b>Temporal axis</b>
14546  * <p>
14547  * When a number or numeric string is specified,
14548  * it is a the number of milliseconds of a duration.
14549  * <p>
14550  * It is rounded down to an integer and used directly.
14551  * By default, the corresponding tick format will be the one of the
14552  * greatest standard unit that is below the specified value.
14553  * <p>
14554  * When a (non-numeric) string is specified,
14555  * it should be the code of a standard precision,
14556  * optionally immediately preceded by an integer multiple
14557  * (e.g. 
14558  * <tt>'25d'</tt> means twenty five days).
14559  * <p>
14560  * The standard time precision codes are defined in {@link pvc.options.varia.TimeInterval}
14561  * <p>
14562  * This option should be used instead of the now deprecated
14563  * {@link pvc.options.marks.QuantitativeScaleExtensionPoint#dateTickPrecision}
14564  * extension point, via {@link #extensionPoints} and then 
14565  * <i>scale</i>.
14566  * </li>
14567  * </ul>
14568  * 
14569  * <b>Relations with other options</b>
14570  * <p>
14571  * When both {@link #tickUnitMin} and {@link #tickUnitMax} are specified,
14572  * and the former is greater than or equal to the later,
14573  * then it is as if 
14574  * <i>tickUnit</i> had been specified with the value of 
14575  * <i>tickUnitMin</i>.
14576  * <p>
14577  * When both 
14578  * <i>tickUnit</i> and {@link #tickUnitMin} are specified,
14579  * and 
14580  * <i>tickUnit</i> is less than 
14581  * <i>tickUnitMin</i>,
14582  * then the value of 
14583  * <i>tickUnitMin</i> is used instead.
14584  * <p>
14585  * When both 
14586  * <i>tickUnit</i> and {@link #tickUnitMax} are specified,
14587  * and 
14588  * <i>tickUnit</i> is greater than 
14589  * <i>tickUnitMax</i>,
14590  * then the value of 
14591  * <i>tickUnitMax</i> is used instead.
14592  * <p>
14593  * When specified or implied,
14594  * both {@link #desiredTickCount} and 
14595  * <i>labelSpacingMin</i>
14596  * are ignored.
14597  * <p>
14598  * See related axis options:
14599  * {@link #tickUnitMin},
14600  * {@link #tickUnitMax},
14601  * {@link #domainRoundMode},
14602  * {@link #desiredTickCount} and
14603  * {@link pvc.options.axes.AnyNonHierarchicalCartesianAxis#labelSpacingMin}.
14604  * <p>
14605  * For numeric axes, see also
14606  * {@link pvc.options.axes.NumericCartesianAxis#tickExponentMin} and
14607  * {@link pvc.options.axes.NumericCartesianAxis#tickExponentMax}.
14608  * 
14609  * @type number|string|pvc.options.varia.TimeInterval
14610  * @category Continuous > Style
14611  */
14612 pvc.options.axes.AnyNonHierarchicalCartesianAxis.prototype.tickUnit = undefined;
14613 /**
14614  * The maximum ticks' major unit (difference in domain value between consecutive ticks).
14615  * <p>
14616  * Use this option to ensure that ticks are separated by at most a certain value.
14617  * For example,
14618  * a value of 
14619  * <tt>100</tt> ensures that the unit 
14620  * <tt>200</tt> will not be used,
14621  * and of 
14622  * <tt>'3m'</tt> that a year or semester unit will not be used.
14623  * <p>
14624  * As another example,
14625  * to ensure that the tick unit is less than 
14626  * <tt>1000</tt>,
14627  * either
14628  * specify a 
14629  * <i>tickUnitMax</i> of 
14630  * <tt>900</tt>, or, maybe better,
14631  * specify a {@link pvc.options.axes.NumericCartesianAxis#tickExponentMax} of 
14632  * <tt>2</tt>.
14633  * <p>
14634  * When a number, it must be a positive integer.
14635  * <p>
14636  * The same value parsing rules of {@link #tickUnit} apply to this option.
14637  * <p>
14638  * For numeric axes,
14639  * the value of this option is combined with that of
14640  * {@link pvc.options.axes.NumericCartesianAxis#tickExponentMax},
14641  * resulting in the most restrictive one being used.
14642  * <p>
14643  * See {@link #tickUnit} for more information.
14644  * 
14645  * @type number|string
14646  * @default Infinity
14647  * @category Continuous > Style
14648  */
14649 pvc.options.axes.AnyNonHierarchicalCartesianAxis.prototype.tickUnitMax = undefined;
14650 /**
14651  * The minimum ticks' major unit (difference in domain value between consecutive ticks).
14652  * <p>
14653  * Use this option to ensure that ticks are separated by a minimum value.
14654  * For example, a value of 
14655  * <tt>1</tt> ensures ticks are integers,
14656  * and of 
14657  * <tt>'d'</tt>, that hour ticks are not used.
14658  * <p>
14659  * When a number, it must be a non-negative finite integer.
14660  * <p>
14661  * The same value parsing rules of {@link #tickUnit} apply to this option,
14662  * with the exception that rounding to a standard precision is performed 
14663  * <i>up</i>.
14664  * <p>
14665  * For numeric axes,
14666  * the value of this option is combined with that of
14667  * {@link pvc.options.axes.NumericCartesianAxis#tickExponentMin},
14668  * resulting in the most restrictive one being used.
14669  * <p>
14670  * See {@link #tickUnit} for more information.
14671  * 
14672  * @type number|string
14673  * @default 0
14674  * @category Continuous > Style
14675  */
14676 pvc.options.axes.AnyNonHierarchicalCartesianAxis.prototype.tickUnitMin = undefined;
14677 /**
14678  * The axis' domain rounding mode (applies to continuous axes).
14679  * 
14680  * @type pvc.options.varia.AxisDomainRoundingMode
14681  * @default 'tick'
14682  * @category Continuous-Numeric > Style
14683  */
14684 pvc.options.axes.AnyNonHierarchicalCartesianAxis.prototype.domainRoundMode = undefined;
14685 /**
14686  * The maximum exponent of 
14687  * <tt>10</tt> that is used to generate ticks (applies to continuous-numeric axes).
14688  * <p>
14689  * The value of this option is combined with that of {@link #tickUnitMax},
14690  * resulting in the most restrictive one being used.
14691  * <p>
14692  * The generated ticks are separated by a 
14693  * <i>step</i> value.
14694  * A step value is a certain power of 
14695  * <tt>10</tt>,
14696  * possibly multiplied by 
14697  * <tt>2</tt> or 
14698  * <tt>5</tt>.
14699  * <p>
14700  * For example, 
14701  * for a chosen exponent of 
14702  * <tt>4</tt>,
14703  * the corresponding power of 
14704  * <tt>10</tt> is 
14705  * <tt>10^4=10000</tt> and
14706  * the generated ticks could be:
14707  * 
14708  * <tt>0</tt>, 
14709  * <tt>10000</tt>, 
14710  * <tt>20000</tt>, ...
14711  * <p>
14712  * If the multiplier 
14713  * <tt>5</tt> was chosen, 
14714  * those ticks would instead be:
14715  * 
14716  * <tt>0</tt>, 
14717  * <tt>50000</tt>, 
14718  * <tt>100000</tt>, ...
14719  * <p>
14720  * Setting this property allows imposing a limit on 
14721  * the size of numbers chosen to separate ticks,
14722  * which may be seen as imposing a minimum granularity 
14723  * on the generated tick values.
14724  * <p>
14725  * See {@link #tickUnit} for more information.
14726  * 
14727  * @type number
14728  * @category Continuous-Numeric > Style
14729  */
14730 pvc.options.axes.AnyNonHierarchicalCartesianAxis.prototype.tickExponentMax = undefined;
14731 /**
14732  * The minimum exponent of 
14733  * <tt>10</tt> that is used to generate ticks (applies to continuous-numeric axes).
14734  * <p>
14735  * The value of this option is combined with that of {@link #tickUnitMax},
14736  * resulting in the most restrictive one being used.
14737  * <p>
14738  * The generated ticks are separated by a 
14739  * <i>step</i> value.
14740  * A step value is a certain power of 
14741  * <tt>10</tt>,
14742  * possibly multiplied by 
14743  * <tt>2</tt> or 
14744  * <tt>5</tt>.
14745  * <p>
14746  * For example, 
14747  * for a chosen exponent of 
14748  * <tt>2</tt>,
14749  * the corresponding power of 
14750  * <tt>10</tt> is 
14751  * <tt>10^2=100</tt> and
14752  * the generated ticks could be:
14753  * 
14754  * <tt>0</tt>, 
14755  * <tt>100</tt>, 
14756  * <tt>200</tt>, ...
14757  * <p>
14758  * If the multiplier 
14759  * <tt>2</tt> was chosen, 
14760  * those ticks would instead be:
14761  * 
14762  * <tt>0</tt>, 
14763  * <tt>200</tt>, 
14764  * <tt>400</tt>, ...
14765  * <p>
14766  * Setting this property to 
14767  * <tt>2</tt> would ensure 
14768  * that generated ticks would be separated by the step values
14769  * 
14770  * <tt>100</tt>, 
14771  * <tt>200</tt> or 
14772  * <tt>500</tt>,
14773  * or by steps whose corresponding exponent is 
14774  * bigger than 
14775  * <tt>2</tt>, 
14776  * like: 
14777  * <tt>1000</tt>, 
14778  * <tt>2000</tt> or 
14779  * <tt>5000</tt>.
14780  * <p>
14781  * A more typical use case is ensuring that generated ticks are integers.
14782  * A value of 
14783  * <tt>tickExponentMin</tt> of 
14784  * <tt>0</tt> would accomplish that.
14785  * <p>
14786  * Generally, 
14787  * to impose a maximum number of decimal places on the generated ticks, 
14788  * a negative number can be specified.
14789  * For example, the value 
14790  * <tt>-1</tt> could generate the ticks:
14791  * 
14792  * <tt>0.1</tt>, 
14793  * <tt>0.2</tt>, 
14794  * <tt>0.3</tt>, ...
14795  * If the multiplier 
14796  * <tt>5</tt> was chosen, 
14797  * those ticks would instead be:
14798  * 
14799  * <tt>0.5</tt>, 
14800  * <tt>1.0</tt>, 
14801  * <tt>1.5</tt>, ...
14802  * It could not generate ticks 
14803  * with more that one decimal place.
14804  * <p>
14805  * See {@link #tickUnit} for more information.
14806  * 
14807  * @type number
14808  * @category Continuous-Numeric > Style
14809  */
14810 pvc.options.axes.AnyNonHierarchicalCartesianAxis.prototype.tickExponentMin = undefined;
14811 /**
14812  * Indicates if the zero line rule is drawn, 
14813  * on the position of the 0-valued tick, 
14814  * when there is one (applies to continuous-numeric axes).
14815  * <p>
14816  * An horizontal axis has a vertical zero line rule,
14817  * while a a vertical axis has an horizontal zero line rule.
14818  * 
14819  * @type boolean
14820  * @default true
14821  * @category Continuous-Numeric > Style
14822  */
14823 pvc.options.axes.AnyNonHierarchicalCartesianAxis.prototype.zeroLine = undefined;
14824 /**
14825  * The minimum spacing between tick labels, in 
14826  * <i>em</i> units 
14827  * (does not apply to discrete-hierarchical axes).
14828  * <p>
14829  * Attention:
14830  * In continuous axes,
14831  * this option is ignored when {@link pvc.options.axes.AnyContinuousCartesianAxis#tickUnit}
14832  * is specified,
14833  * or when only two or three ticks are used!
14834  * <p>
14835  * See {@link pvc.options.axes.AnyContinuousCartesianAxis#tickUnit} for more information.
14836  * 
14837  * @type number
14838  * @category Non-Hierarchical > Layout
14839  */
14840 pvc.options.axes.AnyNonHierarchicalCartesianAxis.prototype.labelSpacingMin = undefined;
14841 /**
14842  * Indicates if ticks are shown for each tick value 
14843  * (does not apply to discrete-hierarchical axes).
14844  * 
14845  * @type boolean
14846  * @default true
14847  * @category Non-Hierarchical > Style
14848  */
14849 pvc.options.axes.AnyNonHierarchicalCartesianAxis.prototype.ticks = undefined;
14850 /**
14851  * List of angles to try when overlappedLabelsMode is 'rotate' or 'rotatethenhide' (applies to normal discrete axes).
14852  * <p>
14853  * The nearest above the minimum non-overlapping angle is chosen, or just the nearest if none is bigger.
14854  * If no desired angle is provided, it defaults to the minimum non-overlapping angle.
14855  * 
14856  * @type number|string|list(number|string)
14857  * @category Discrete > Layout
14858  */
14859 pvc.options.axes.AnyNonHierarchicalCartesianAxis.prototype.labelDesiredAngles = undefined;
14860 /**
14861  * Controls the rotation direction of the labels (applies to normal discrete axes).
14862  * 
14863  * @type pvc.options.varia.AxisLabelRotationDirection
14864  * @default 'clockwise'
14865  * @category Discrete > Layout
14866  */
14867 pvc.options.axes.AnyNonHierarchicalCartesianAxis.prototype.labelRotationDirection = undefined;
14868 /**
14869  * Controls how labels are laid out when they overlap (applies to normal discrete axes).
14870  * 
14871  * @type pvc.options.varia.AxisOverlappedLabelsMode
14872  * @default 'hide'
14873  * @category Discrete > Layout
14874  */
14875 pvc.options.axes.AnyNonHierarchicalCartesianAxis.prototype.overlappedLabelsMode = undefined;
14876 /**
14877  * The extension points object contains style definitions for 
14878  * the marks of the panel.
14879  * 
14880  * @type pvc.options.ext.AnyNonHierarchicalCartesianAxisExtensionPoints
14881  * @category Style
14882  */
14883 pvc.options.axes.AnyNonHierarchicalCartesianAxis.prototype.extensionPoints = undefined;
14884 /**
14885  * The extension points of the cartesian axis panel 
14886  * that cannot be discrete-hierarchical.
14887  * <p>
14888  * To use an extension point you must find its full name, by joining:
14889  * 
14890  * <ol>
14891  * 
14892  * <li>panel property name (ex: 
14893  * <tt>xAxis</tt>)</li>
14894  * 
14895  * <li>extension property (ex: 
14896  * <tt>zeroLine</tt>)</li>
14897  * 
14898  * <li>the "_" character</li>
14899  * 
14900  * <li>extension sub-property (ex: 
14901  * <tt>lineWidth</tt>)</li>
14902  * </ol>
14903  * and obtaining, for the examples, the camel-cased name: 
14904  * <tt>xAxisZeroLine_lineWidth</tt>
14905  * (see {@link http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CamelCase}).
14906  * 
14907  * @class
14908  * @extends pvc.options.ext.CartesianAxisExtensionPoints
14909  */
14910 pvc.options.ext.AnyNonHierarchicalCartesianAxisExtensionPoints = function(){};
14911         
14912         
14913         
14914         
14915 /**

14922 /**

14937 /**

14939  * or continuous 
14940  * <i>major</i>,
14941  * tick rule mark (does not apply to discrete-hierarchical axes).

14947 /**

14953  * of a tick simultaneously.

14959 /**

14964  *

14969 pvc.options.axes.DiscreteCartesianAxis = function(){};
14970
