14995  * @this pvc.visual.Context
14996  * @param {pvc.visual.Scene} scene
14997  * The scene associated with the visual item.
14998  * 
14999  * @category Discrete > Actions
15000  */
15001 pvc.options.axes.DiscreteCartesianAxis.prototype.doubleClickAction = function(){};
15002 /**
15003  * Indicates the type of automatic content generated for the tooltip of axis' labels (applies to discrete axes).
15004  * 
15005  * @type pvc.options.varia.TooltipAutoContent
15006  * @default 'value'
15007  * @category Discrete > General
15008  */
15009 pvc.options.axes.DiscreteCartesianAxis.prototype.tooltipAutoContent = undefined;
15010 /**
15011  * Indicates if the axis' labels show tooltips (applies to discrete axes).
15012  * 
15013  * @type boolean
15014  * @default true
15015  * @category Discrete > General
15016  */
15017 pvc.options.axes.DiscreteCartesianAxis.prototype.tooltipEnabled = undefined;
15018 /**
15019  * A callback function that is called to build the tooltip of an axis' labels (applies to discrete axes).
15020  * <p>
15021  * If the chart's {@link pvc.options.Tooltip#html} is 
15022  * <tt>true</tt>,
15023  * the resulting text must be valid HTML,
15024  * otherwise,
15025  * it is considered plain text.
15026  * <p>
15027  * When unspecified
15028  * and {@link #tooltipEnabled} is 
15029  * <tt>true</tt>
15030  * a tooltip is automatically generated according to the value of
15031  * {@link #tooltipAutoContent}.
15032  * 
15033  * @returns {string}
15034  * The tooltip text.
15035  * 
15036  * @method
15037  * @this pvc.visual.Context
15038  * @param {pvc.visual.Scene} scene
15039  * The scene whose tooltip is to be built.
15040  * <p>
15041  * Use the data contained in the scene object to 
15042  * build the tooltip.
15043  * 
15044  * @category Discrete > General
15045  */
15046 pvc.options.axes.DiscreteCartesianAxis.prototype.tooltipFormat = function(){};
15047 /**
15048  * The size, in pixels, of the bands used to represent the discrete domain values (applies to discrete axes).
15049  * <p>
15050  * A non-negative number.
15051  * 
15052  * <p>
15053  * 
15054  * <b>In multi-charts</b>
15055  * <p>
15056  * The current layout algorithm used by multi-charts does not support
15057  * minimum, fixed or maximum sizes in small charts.
15058  * As such, the simples band size ratio model always needs to be used.
15059  * <p>
15060  * The minimum, fixed and maximum sizes and spacings are used to determine an
15061  * equivalent or best-possible band size ratio.
15062  * </p>
15063  * 
15064  * <p>
15065  * 
15066  * <b>Band Size, Spacing, Ratio and Step</b>
15067  * <p>
15068  * The band layout arranges bands and space in the following way.
15069  * Taking 
15070  * <i>B</i> to represent 
15071  * <i>bandSize</i>,
15072  * 
15073  * <i>E</i> to represent {@link #bandSpacing} and
15074  * 
15075  * <i>e</i> to be 
15076  * <tt>E/2</tt>,
15077  * bands and space will follow the pattern:
15078  * 
15079  * <tt>eBe</tt>, 
15080  * <tt>eBEBe</tt>, 
15081  * <tt>eBEBEBe</tt>, ...
15082  * <p>
15083  * For a given pair of 
15084  * <i>B</i> and 
15085  * <i>E</i>, each discrete category will occupy a space given by
15086  * the 
15087  * <i>step</i>, 
15088  * <i>S</i>:
15089  * <br></br>
15090  * 
15091  * <i>S = B + E</i>.
15092  * <p>
15093  * Given the number of discrete categories, a cartesian panel (axis or plot) will have
15094  * corresponding fixed or minimum and maximum sizes.
15095  * <p>
15096  * The option {@link #bandSizeRatio}, R, is used, in under-constrained cases,
15097  * to relate 
15098  * <i>B</i> and 
15099  * <i>E</i>:
15100  * <br></br>
15101  * 
15102  * <i>B = R * S</i>
15103  * </p>
15104  * 
15105  * <p>
15106  * 
15107  * <b>Impact on chart size</b>
15108  * <p>
15109  * If the chart size along the axis' dimension
15110  * is such that the available space is less than the
15111  * determined fixed or minimum size,
15112  * then the chart will grow as much as needed to accommodate the fixed or minimum size,
15113  * along that dimension.
15114  * <p>
15115  * If, on the contrary, the chart size along the axis' dimension
15116  * is greater than the determined fixed or maximum size,
15117  * the plot and axis content will be centered in the available space.
15118  * </p>
15119  * 
15120  * <p>
15121  * 
15122  * <b>Option values harmonization</b>
15123  * <p>
15124  * When both {@link #bandSizeMax} and {@link #bandSizeMin} are specified,
15125  * and {@link #bandSizeMax} is less than or equal to 
15126  * <i>bandSizeMin</i>,
15127  * then {@link #bandSize} is set to the the minimum value.
15128  * <p>
15129  * When both 
15130  * <i>bandSize</i> and {@link #bandSizeMin} are specified,
15131  * and 
15132  * <i>bandSize</i> is less than 
15133  * <i>bandSizeMin</i>,
15134  * then the minimum value is used instead.
15135  * <p>
15136  * When both 
15137  * <i>bandSpacing</i> and {@link #bandSpacingMin} are specified,
15138  * and 
15139  * <i>bandSpacing</i> is less than 
15140  * <i>bandSpacingMin</i>,
15141  * then the minimum value is used instead.
15142  * <p>
15143  * When both {@link #bandSpacingMax} and {@link #bandSpacingMin} are specified,
15144  * and {@link #bandSpacingMax} is less than or equal to 
15145  * <i>bandSpacingMin</i>,
15146  * then {@link #bandSpacing} is set to the the minimum value.
15147  * </p>
15148  * 
15149  * <p>
15150  * 
15151  * <b>The algorithm</b>
15152  * <p>
15153  * The options you specify should just behave as you'd expected them to.
15154  * At least, after thinking about them for a while.
15155  * <p>
15156  * If doubts remain on which options and values should be specified,
15157  * or on why the specified options are behaving in a certain way,
15158  * you can follow this explanation of the band layout algorithm.
15159  * </p>
15160  * 
15161  * <ul>
15162  * 
15163  * <li>
15164  * When both 
15165  * <i>bandSize</i> and {@link #bandSpacing} are specified, the layout is 
15166  * <b>fixed</b>.
15167  * <p>
15168  * When they both have the value 
15169  * <tt>0</tt>, then the layout is reevaluated as if they had not been specified.
15170  * <p>
15171  * The option {@link #bandSizeRatio} is ignored.
15172  * </li>
15173  * 
15174  * <li>
15175  * When one and only one of 
15176  * <i>bandSize</i> or {@link #bandSpacing} is specified,
15177  * the layout is 
15178  * <b>partially fixed</b>.
15179  * <p>
15180  * For the variable option, size or spacing,
15181  * any specified minimum and/or maximum options are still considered.
15182  * <p>
15183  * This configuration does not define a fixed step size,
15184  * but instead constrains the range of step size values.
15185  * <p>
15186  * The option {@link #bandSizeRatio} is ignored.
15187  * </li>
15188  * 
15189  * <li>
15190  * When neither 
15191  * <i>bandSize</i> nor {@link #bandSpacing} are specified,
15192  * the layout is 
15193  * <b>strictly variable</b>.
15194  * <p>
15195  * There are several cases:
15196  * 
15197  * <ul>
15198  * 
15199  * <li>
15200  * When none of the minimum and maximum values, of both size and spacing, are specified,
15201  * the size and spacing are governed solely by the {@link #bandSizeRatio}, 
15202  * <i>R</i>.
15203  * <p>
15204  * This is the way the band layout used to behave,
15205  * before the existence of the fixed, minimum and maximum options.
15206  * <p>
15207  * Small-charts continue to behave this way,
15208  * although with a band size ratio that is determined from the
15209  * the other specified options.
15210  * <p>
15211  * The half-line 
15212  * <i>(E,B)</i> departs from 
15213  * <i>(0,0)</i>
15214  * and goes on indefinitely with a slope given by 
15215  * <i>R</i>: 
15216  * <i>E = (1/R - 1) * B</i>.
15217  * </li>
15218  * 
15219  * <li>
15220  * 
15221  * <p>
15222  * When minimum and maximum values, of both size and spacing, are specified,
15223  * the size and spacing are constrained to belong to the
15224  * line segment 
15225  * <i>(E,B)</i>, that goes from point 
15226  * <i>(Emin,Bmin)</i> to point 
15227  * <i>(Emax,Bmax)</i>.
15228  * </p>
15229  * </li>
15230  * 
15231  * <li>
15232  * 
15233  * <p>
15234  * When only the minimum size and spacing values are specified,
15235  * the size and spacing are constrained to belong to the
15236  * line segment 
15237  * <i>(E,B)</i>, that goes from point 
15238  * <i>(0,0)</i> to point 
15239  * <i>(Emin,Bmin)</i>.
15240  * </p>
15241  * </li>
15242  * 
15243  * <li>
15244  * 
15245  * <p>
15246  * When only the maximum size and spacing values are specified,
15247  * the size and spacing are constrained to belong to the
15248  * line segment 
15249  * <i>(E,B)</i>, that goes from point 
15250  * <i>(0,0)</i> to point 
15251  * <i>(Emax,Bmax)</i>.
15252  * </p>
15253  * </li>
15254  * 
15255  * <li>
15256  * In all the following mixed and under-constrained cases,
15257  * option {@link #bandSizeRatio}, 
15258  * <i>R</i>, is taken into account.
15259  * <p>
15260  * The size and spacing are constrained to belong to the the line 
15261  * <i>(E,B)</i> that
15262  * passes through 
15263  * <i>(0,0)</i> and has a slope
15264  * given by 
15265  * <i>R</i>: 
15266  * <i>E = (1/R - 1) * B</i>.
15267  * <p>
15268  * Again, a few more cases:
15269  * 
15270  * <ul>
15271  * 
15272  * <li>
15273  * 
15274  * <p>
15275  * When only the minimum and maximum size values are specified,
15276  * the corresponding spacing values are implied.
15277  * </p>
15278  * </li>
15279  * 
15280  * <li>
15281  * 
15282  * <p>
15283  * When only the minimum and maximum spacing values are specified,
15284  * the corresponding size values are implied.
15285  * </p>
15286  * </li>
15287  * 
15288  * <li>
15289  * When only the minimum size and the maximum spacing values are specified,
15290  * the specified minimum size implies a minimum spacing and
15291  * the specified maximum spacing implies a maximum size.
15292  * <p>
15293  * If the implied minimum spacing is greater than or equal to the specified
15294  * maximum spacing, the algorithm is reevaluated using a fixed spacing
15295  * equal to the implied minimum spacing.
15296  * </li>
15297  * 
15298  * <li>
15299  * When only the maximum size and the minimum spacing values are specified,
15300  * the specified maximum size implies a maximum spacing and
15301  * the specified minimum spacing implies a minimum size.
15302  * <p>
15303  * If the implied minimum size is greater than or equal to the specified
15304  * maximum size, the algorithm is reevaluated using a fixed size
15305  * equal to the implied minimum size.
15306  * </li>
15307  * </ul>
15308  * </li>
15309  * </ul>
15310  * </li>
15311  * </ul>
15312  * <p>
15313  * See other band-control options:
15314  * {@link #bandSpacing},
15315  * {@link #bandSizeMin},
15316  * {@link #bandSizeMax},
15317  * {@link #bandSpacingMin},
15318  * {@link #bandSpacingMax} and,
15319  * for charts that give it representation,
15320  * {@link #bandSizeRatio}.
15321  * 
15322  * @type number
15323  * @category Discrete > Layout
15324  */
15325 pvc.options.axes.DiscreteCartesianAxis.prototype.bandSize = undefined;
15326 /**
15327  * The maximum size, in pixels, of the bands used to represent the discrete domain values (applies to discrete axes).
15328  * <p>
15329  * A non-negative number.
15330  * <p>
15331  * See {@link #bandSize} for information on the band layout algorithm.
15332  * 
15333  * @type number
15334  * @category Discrete > Layout
15335  */
15336 pvc.options.axes.DiscreteCartesianAxis.prototype.bandSizeMax = undefined;
15337 /**
15338  * The minimum size, in pixels, of the bands used to represent the discrete domain values (applies to discrete axes).
15339  * <p>
15340  * A non-negative number.
15341  * <p>
15342  * See {@link #bandSize} for information on the band layout algorithm.
15343  * 
15344  * @type number
15345  * @category Discrete > Layout
15346  */
15347 pvc.options.axes.DiscreteCartesianAxis.prototype.bandSizeMin = undefined;
15348 /**
15349  * The ratio of the band size over the
15350  * total size (band + spacing),
15351  * in a discrete axis band (applies to discrete axes).
15352  * <p>
15353  * A number between 
15354  * <tt>0</tt> and 
15355  * <tt>1</tt>.
15356  * <p>
15357  * The default value of this property is that of the legacy option 
15358  * <i>panelSizeRatio</i>,
15359  * defined for the Bar-family, Box-Plot and the Heat-Grid charts.
15360  * <p>
15361  * This option is only used when
15362  * the band model is under-constrained
15363  * by the fixed, minimum, and maximum size and spacing options.
15364  * <p>
15365  * See {@link #bandSize} for information on the band layout algorithm.
15366  * 
15367  * @type number
15368  * @category Discrete > Layout
15369  */
15370 pvc.options.axes.DiscreteCartesianAxis.prototype.bandSizeRatio = undefined;
15371 /**
15372  * The space, in pixels, separating/surrounding bands (applies to discrete axes).
15373  * <p>
15374  * A non-negative number.
15375  * <p>
15376  * See {@link #bandSize} for information on the band layout algorithm.
15377  * 
15378  * @type number
15379  * @category Discrete > Layout
15380  */
15381 pvc.options.axes.DiscreteCartesianAxis.prototype.bandSpacing = undefined;
15382 /**
15383  * The maximum space, in pixels, separating/surrounding bands (applies to discrete axes).
15384  * <p>
15385  * A non-negative number.
15386  * <p>
15387  * See {@link #bandSize} for information on the band layout algorithm.
15388  * 
15389  * @type number
15390  * @category Discrete > Layout
15391  */
15392 pvc.options.axes.DiscreteCartesianAxis.prototype.bandSpacingMax = undefined;
15393 /**
15394  * The minimum space, in pixels, separating/surrounding bands (applies to discrete axes).
15395  * <p>
15396  * A non-negative number.
15397  * <p>
15398  * See {@link #bandSize} for information on the band layout algorithm.
15399  * 
15400  * @type number
15401  * @category Discrete > Layout
15402  */
15403 pvc.options.axes.DiscreteCartesianAxis.prototype.bandSpacingMin = undefined;
15404 /**
15405  * List of angles to try when overlappedLabelsMode is 'rotate' or 'rotatethenhide' (applies to normal discrete axes).
15406  * <p>
15407  * The nearest above the minimum non-overlapping angle is chosen, or just the nearest if none is bigger.
15408  * If no desired angle is provided, it defaults to the minimum non-overlapping angle.
15409  * 
15410  * @type number|string|list(number|string)
15411  * @category Discrete > Layout
15412  */
15413 pvc.options.axes.DiscreteCartesianAxis.prototype.labelDesiredAngles = undefined;
15414 /**
15415  * Controls the rotation direction of the labels (applies to normal discrete axes).
15416  * 
15417  * @type pvc.options.varia.AxisLabelRotationDirection
15418  * @default 'clockwise'
15419  * @category Discrete > Layout
15420  */
15421 pvc.options.axes.DiscreteCartesianAxis.prototype.labelRotationDirection = undefined;
15422 /**
15423  * Controls how labels are laid out when they overlap (applies to normal discrete axes).
15424  * 
15425  * @type pvc.options.varia.AxisOverlappedLabelsMode
15426  * @default 'hide'
15427  * @category Discrete > Layout
15428  */
15429 pvc.options.axes.DiscreteCartesianAxis.prototype.overlappedLabelsMode = undefined;
15430 /**
15431  * The options documentation class of the cartesian axis panel
15432  * for flattened and discrete scale type.
15433  * <p>
15434  * For additional information, please see {@link pvc.options.axes.CartesianAxis}.
15435  * 
15436  * @class
15437  * @extends pvc.options.axes.DiscreteCartesianAxis
15438  */
15439 pvc.options.axes.FlattenedDiscreteCartesianAxis = function(){};
15440         
15441         
15442         
15443         
15444 /**
15445  * The minimum spacing between tick labels, in 
15446  * <i>em</i> units 
15447  * (does not apply to discrete-hierarchical axes).
15448  * <p>
15449  * Attention:
15450  * In continuous axes,
15451  * this option is ignored when {@link pvc.options.axes.AnyContinuousCartesianAxis#tickUnit}
15452  * is specified,
15453  * or when only two or three ticks are used!
15454  * <p>
15455  * See {@link pvc.options.axes.AnyContinuousCartesianAxis#tickUnit} for more information.
15456  * 
15457  * @type number
15458  * @category Non-Hierarchical > Layout
15459  */
15460 pvc.options.axes.FlattenedDiscreteCartesianAxis.prototype.labelSpacingMin = undefined;
15461 /**
15462  * Indicates if ticks are shown for each tick value 
15463  * (does not apply to discrete-hierarchical axes).
15464  * 
15465  * @type boolean
15466  * @default true
15467  * @category Non-Hierarchical > Style
15468  */
15469 pvc.options.axes.FlattenedDiscreteCartesianAxis.prototype.ticks = undefined;
15470 /**
15471  * The extension points object contains style definitions for
15472  * the marks of the panel.
15473  * 
15474  * @type pvc.options.ext.FlattenedDiscreteCartesianAxisExtensionPoints
15475  * @category Style
15476  */
15477 pvc.options.axes.FlattenedDiscreteCartesianAxis.prototype.extensionPoints = undefined;
15478 /**
15479  * The extension points of the cartesian axis panel
15480  * for flattened and discrete scale type.
15481  * <p>
15482  * Axes extension points can also be specified directly at the chart options level.
15483  * <p>
15484  * To use an extension point you must find its full name, by joining:
15485  * 
15486  * <ol>
15487  * 
15488  * <li>panel property name (ex: 
15489  * <tt>xAxis</tt>)</li>
15490  * 
15491  * <li>extension property (ex: 
15492  * <tt>ticks</tt>)</li>
15493  * 
15494  * <li>the "_" character</li>
15495  * 
15496  * <li>extension sub-property (ex: 
15497  * <tt>lineWidth</tt>)</li>
15498  * </ol>
15499  * and obtaining, for the examples, the camel-cased name: 
15500  * <tt>xAxisTicks_lineWidth</tt>
15501  * (see {@link http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CamelCase}).
15502  * 
15503  * @class
15504  * @extends pvc.options.ext.CartesianAxisExtensionPoints
15505  */
15506 pvc.options.ext.FlattenedDiscreteCartesianAxisExtensionPoints = function(){};
15507         
15508         
15509         
15510         
15511 /**
15512  * The extension point of a discrete,
15513  * or continuous 
15514  * <i>major</i>,
15515  * tick rule mark (does not apply to discrete-hierarchical axes).
15516  * 
15517  * @type pvc.options.marks.RuleExtensionPoint
15518  * @category Non-Hierarchical > Style
15519  */
15520 pvc.options.ext.FlattenedDiscreteCartesianAxisExtensionPoints.prototype.ticks = undefined;
15521 /**
15522  * The extension point of the tick panel 
15523  * (does not apply to discrete-hierarchical axes).
15524  * <p>
15525  * One tick panel contains one tick rule and one label.
15526  * It can be used to conveniently hide all the elements 
15527  * of a tick simultaneously.
15528  * 
15529  * @type pvc.options.marks.PanelExtensionPoint
15530  * @category Non-Hierarchical > Style
15531  */
15532 pvc.options.ext.FlattenedDiscreteCartesianAxisExtensionPoints.prototype.ticksPanel = undefined;
15533 /**

15538  *

15541  */
15542 pvc.options.axes.AnyDiscreteCartesianAxis = function(){};
15543         
15544         
15545         
15546         
15547 /**

15549  * <i>em</i> units

15553  * In continuous axes,

15556  * or when only two or three ticks are used!
15557  * <p>

15563 pvc.options.axes.AnyDiscreteCartesianAxis.prototype.labelSpacingMin = undefined;
15564 /**

15566  * (does not apply to discrete-hierarchical axes).
15567  * 
15568  * @type boolean
15569  * @default true
15570  * @category Non-Hierarchical > Style
15571  */
15572 pvc.options.axes.AnyDiscreteCartesianAxis.prototype.ticks = undefined;
15573 /**

15575  * <p>
15576  * The nearest above the minimum non-overlapping angle is chosen, or just the nearest if none is bigger.
15577  * If no desired angle is provided, it defaults to the minimum non-overlapping angle.
15578  * 
15579  * @type number|string|list(number|string)
15580  * @category Discrete > Layout
15581  */
15582 pvc.options.axes.AnyDiscreteCartesianAxis.prototype.labelDesiredAngles = undefined;
15583 /**
15584  * Controls the rotation direction of the labels (applies to normal discrete axes).
15585  * 
15586  * @type pvc.options.varia.AxisLabelRotationDirection
15587  * @default 'clockwise'
15588  * @category Discrete > Layout

15590 pvc.options.axes.AnyDiscreteCartesianAxis.prototype.labelRotationDirection = undefined;
15591 /**
15592  * Controls how labels are laid out when they overlap (applies to normal discrete axes).
15593  * 
15594  * @type pvc.options.varia.AxisOverlappedLabelsMode
15595  * @default 'hide'
15596  * @category Discrete > Layout
15597  */
15598 pvc.options.axes.AnyDiscreteCartesianAxis.prototype.overlappedLabelsMode = undefined;
15599 /**
15600  * Indicates if the axis should show
15601  * discrete multi-dimensional data in
15602  * a hierarchical form, when 
15603  * <tt>true</tt>,
15604  * or a flattened form, when 
15605  * <tt>false</tt>
15606  * (applies to discrete axes).
15607  * <p>
15608  * Flattened axes,
15609  * present multi-dimensional roles by joining the
15610  * multiple values' labels with the separator character:
15611  * {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart#groupedLabelSep}.
15612  * 
15613  * @type boolean
15614  * @default false
15615  * @category Discrete > General
15616  */
15617 pvc.options.axes.AnyDiscreteCartesianAxis.prototype.composite = undefined;
15618 /**
15619  * The extension points object contains style definitions for
15620  * the marks of the panel.
15621  * 
15622  * @type pvc.options.ext.AnyDiscreteCartesianAxisExtensionPoints
15623  * @category Style
15624  */
15625 pvc.options.axes.AnyDiscreteCartesianAxis.prototype.extensionPoints = undefined;
15626 /**
15627  * The extension points of the cartesian axis panel
15628  * for any discrete scale type.
15629  * <p>
15630  * Axes extension points can also be specified directly at the chart options level.
15631  * <p>
15632  * To use an extension point you must find its full name, by joining:
15633  * 
15634  * <ol>
15635  * 
15636  * <li>panel property name (ex: 
15637  * <tt>xAxis</tt>)</li>
15638  * 
15639  * <li>extension property (ex: 
15640  * <tt>ticks</tt>)</li>
15641  * 
15642  * <li>the "_" character</li>
15643  * 
15644  * <li>extension sub-property (ex: 
15645  * <tt>lineWidth</tt>)</li>
15646  * </ol>
15647  * and obtaining, for the examples, the camel-cased name: 
15648  * <tt>xAxisTicks_lineWidth</tt>
15649  * (see {@link http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CamelCase}).
15650  * 
15651  * @class
15652  * @extends pvc.options.ext.CartesianAxisExtensionPoints
15653  */
15654 pvc.options.ext.AnyDiscreteCartesianAxisExtensionPoints = function(){};
15655         
15656         
15657         
15658         
15659 /**
15660  * The extension point of a discrete,
15661  * or continuous 
15662  * <i>major</i>,
15663  * tick rule mark (does not apply to discrete-hierarchical axes).
15664  * 
15665  * @type pvc.options.marks.RuleExtensionPoint
15666  * @category Non-Hierarchical > Style
15667  */
15668 pvc.options.ext.AnyDiscreteCartesianAxisExtensionPoints.prototype.ticks = undefined;
15669 /**
15670  * The extension point of the tick panel 
15671  * (does not apply to discrete-hierarchical axes).
15672  * <p>
15673  * One tick panel contains one tick rule and one label.
15674  * It can be used to conveniently hide all the elements 
15675  * of a tick simultaneously.
15676  * 
15677  * @type pvc.options.marks.PanelExtensionPoint
15678  * @category Non-Hierarchical > Style
15679  */
15680 pvc.options.ext.AnyDiscreteCartesianAxisExtensionPoints.prototype.ticksPanel = undefined;
15681 /**
15682  * The options documentation class of the cartesian axis panel
15683  * for continuous scale types.
15684  * <p>
15685  * For additional information, please see {@link pvc.options.axes.CartesianAxis}.
15686  * 
15687  * @class
15688  * @extends pvc.options.axes.CartesianAxis
15689  */
15690 pvc.options.axes.AnyContinuousCartesianAxis = function(){};
15691         
15692         
15693         
15694         
15695 /**
15696  * The domain alignment to use when the domain has a fixed or implied length (applies to continuous axes).
15697  * <p>
15698  * For more information, see {@link #fixedLength}.
15699  * 
15700  * @type pvc.options.varia.AxisDomainAlign
15701  * @default 'center'
15702  * @category Continuous > Scale
15703  */
15704 pvc.options.axes.AnyContinuousCartesianAxis.prototype.domainAlign = undefined;
15705 /**
15706  * Controls the type of scale domain coordination that should be performed
15707  * amongst the axes of the same id of each 
15708  * <i>small chart</i> (applies to continuous axes).
15709  * <p>
15710  * The value {@link pvc.options.varia.AxisDomainScope#Row}
15711  * can only be specified if the axis has vertical orientation.
15712  * Conversely,
15713  * the value {@link pvc.options.varia.AxisDomainScope#Column}
15714  * can only be specified if the axis has horizontal orientation.
15715  * 
15716  * @type pvc.options.varia.AxisDomainScope
15717  * @default 'global'
15718  * @category Continuous > Scale
15719  */
15720 pvc.options.axes.AnyContinuousCartesianAxis.prototype.domainScope = undefined;
15721 /**
15722  * The fixed length of the axis domain (applies to continuous axes).
15723  * <p>
15724  * A string value is converted to a number.
15725  * <p>
15726  * The value may be bigger or smaller than the actual length of the data.
15727  * <p>
15728  * By default, the domain of the axis is determined from the actual domain of the data.
15729  * This and other options allow modifying the axis domain.
15730  * <p>
15731  * When the axis domain gets smaller than the data domain,
15732  * and {@link pvc.options.charts.CartesianChart#leafContentOverflow} is set to 
15733  * <tt>auto</tt>,
15734  * the default value,
15735  * clipping is activated in the related plot panels and any overflown content is hidden.
15736  * 
15737  * <h3>Phase I</h3>
15738  * <p>
15739  * The phase I axis domain is determined by the following procedure:
15740  * 
15741  * <ol>
15742  * 
15743  * <li>
15744  * If 
15745  * <tt>fixedLength</tt> is not specified:
15746  * 
15747  * <ol>
15748  * 
15749  * <li>
15750  * If neither 
15751  * <tt>fixedMin</tt> and 
15752  * <tt>fixedMax</tt> are specified,
15753  * the axis domain is the data domain;
15754  * option 
15755  * <tt>originIsZero</tt> may augment the axis domain, on one of its sides;
15756  * </li>
15757  * 
15758  * <li>
15759  * If both 
15760  * <tt>fixedMin</tt> and 
15761  * <tt>fixedMax</tt> are specified,
15762  * the axis domain is fully determined; it's length is implied;
15763  * option 
15764  * <tt>originIsZero</tt> is ignored;
15765  * </li>
15766  * 
15767  * <li>
15768  * If 
15769  * <tt>fixedMin</tt> is specified (and 
15770  * <tt>fixedMax</tt> is not)
15771  * the axis domain minimum is 
15772  * <tt>fixedMin</tt> and
15773  * the axis domain maximum is the data domain maximum, possibly corrected by
15774  * option 
15775  * <tt>originIsZero</tt>;
15776  * </li>
15777  * 
15778  * <li>
15779  * Else, (if 
15780  * <tt>fixedMax</tt> is specified and 
15781  * <tt>fixedMin</tt> is not,)
15782  * the axis domain maximum is 
15783  * <tt>fixedMax</tt> and
15784  * the axis domain minimum is the data domain minimum, possibly corrected by
15785  * option 
15786  * <tt>originIsZero</tt>;
15787  * </li>
15788  * </ol>
15789  * </li>
15790  * 
15791  * <li>
15792  * If 
15793  * <tt>fixedLength</tt> is specified, option 
15794  * <tt>originIsZero</tt> is ignored.
15795  * <p>
15796  * The limits of the axis domain are determined as follows:
15797  * 
15798  * <ol>
15799  * 
15800  * <li>
15801  * If 
15802  * <tt>fixedMin</tt> is specified, the axis domain maximum is implied:
15803  * <br></br>
15804  * 
15805  * <tt>max = fixedMin + fixedLength</tt>;
15806  * <br></br>
15807  * options 
15808  * <tt>originIsZero</tt>, 
15809  * <tt>fixedMax</tt> are ignored;
15810  * option 
15811  * <tt>domainAlign</tt> is ignored in this phase;
15812  * </li>
15813  * 
15814  * <li>
15815  * If 
15816  * <tt>fixedMax</tt> is specified, the axis domain minimum is implied:
15817  * <br></br>
15818  * 
15819  * <tt>min = fixedMax - fixedLength</tt>;
15820  * <br></br>
15821  * option 
15822  * <tt>originIsZero</tt> is ignored;
15823  * option 
15824  * <tt>domainAlign</tt> is ignored in this phase;
15825  * </li>
15826  * 
15827  * <li>
15828  * Else, 
15829  * <tt>domainAlign</tt> is either specified or defaults to 
15830  * <tt>center</tt>.
15831  * The axis domain is aligned to either the minimum, maximum or center of the data domain
15832  * and then taken to have the specified fixed length.
15833  * <p>
15834  * It is determined as follows:
15835  * 
15836  * <ul>
15837  * 
15838  * <li>
15839  * If 
15840  * <tt>domainAlign</tt> is 
15841  * <tt>min</tt>, the axis domain minimum is that of
15842  * the actual data and the axis domain maximum is implied:
15843  * <br></br>
15844  * 
15845  * <tt>max = min(data) + fixedLength</tt>;
15846  * </li>
15847  * 
15848  * <li>
15849  * If 
15850  * <tt>domainAlign</tt> is 
15851  * <tt>max</tt>, the axis domain maximum is that of
15852  * the actual data and the axis domain minimum is implied:
15853  * <br></br>
15854  * 
15855  * <tt>min = max(data) - fixedLength</tt>;
15856  * </li>
15857  * 
15858  * <li>
15859  * Else, 
15860  * <tt>domainAlign</tt> is 
15861  * <tt>center</tt>, or defaults to it,
15862  * and both axis domain limits are determined from the actual data domain,
15863  * as follows:
15864  * 
15865  * <ul>
15866  * 
15867  * <li>
15868  * <tt>min = center(data) - fixedLength / 2</tt></li>
15869  * 
15870  * <li>
15871  * <tt>max = center(data) + fixedLength / 2</tt></li>
15872  * </ul>
15873  * where 
15874  * <tt>center(data)</tt> is determined as:
15875  * <br></br>
15876  * 
15877  * <tt>center(data) = (max(data) - min(data)) / 2</tt>.
15878  * </li>
15879  * </ul>
15880  * </li>
15881  * </ol>
15882  * </li>
15883  * </ol>
15884  * 
15885  * <h3>Phase II</h3>
15886  * <p>
15887  * In phase II, additional options may modify the phase I axis domain.
15888  * <p>
15889  * If {@link #domainRoundMode} is 
15890  * <tt>nice</tt>, the axis domain is made "nice",
15891  * by making sure that its ends are "nice" numbers.
15892  * <p>
15893  * If {@link #ratio} is specified (or a ratio is imposed due to {@link preserveRatio}),
15894  * the length of the axis domain is imposed by the length of the axis' range (a number of pixels).
15895  * The axis domain is aligned relative to the phase I axis domain, according to the value
15896  * of {@link #domainAlign}.
15897  * <p>
15898  * If {@link #domainRoundMode} is 
15899  * <tt>tick</tt>,
15900  * the phase I axis domain is extended to include the calculated ticks and only then are
15901  * the 
15902  * <tt>ratio</tt> and 
15903  * <tt>domainAlign</tt> options processed, so that the domain aligns to
15904  * the calculated ticks.
15905  * 
15906  * <h3>Default</h3>
15907  * <p>
15908  * If a sliding window exists, it is its length {@link pvc.options.SlidingWindow#length},
15909  * otherwise, 
15910  * <tt>null</tt>.
15911  * <p>
15912  * For more information, see:
15913  * {@link #fixedMin},
15914  * {@link #fixedMax},
15915  * {@link #domainAlign},
15916  * {@link #ratio} and
15917  * {@link #originIsZero}.
15918  * 
15919  * @type number|pvc.options.varia.TimeInterval
15920  * @category Continuous > Scale
15921  */
15922 pvc.options.axes.AnyContinuousCartesianAxis.prototype.fixedLength = undefined;
15923 /**
15924  * The fixed maximum value of the axis domain (applies to continuous axes).
15925  * <p>
15926  * The value is converted using the {@link pvc.options.DimensionType#converter} of
15927  * the first dimension of the first role bound to the axis.
15928  * <p>
15929  * For example, if the base axis shows the 
15930  * <i>category</i> dimension,
15931  * and the dimension is configured as type 
15932  * <tt>Date</tt>,
15933  * and it uses the default converter, then it accepts:
15934  * 
15935  * <ul>
15936  * 
15937  * <li>
15938  * values of type 
15939  * <tt>number</tt>,
15940  * representing milliseconds as returned by
15941  * the JavaScript's 
15942  * <tt>Date.getTime()</tt> method;
15943  * </li>
15944  * 
15945  * <li>
15946  * values of type 
15947  * <tt>Date</tt>, which are accepted as is;
15948  * </li>
15949  * 
15950  * <li>
15951  * values of type 
15952  * <tt>string</tt>,
15953  * in a format defined by the dimension's
15954  * {@link pvc.options.DimensionType#rawFormat}.
15955  * </li>
15956  * </ul>
15957  * <p>
15958  * The value may be bigger or smaller than the maximum value of the data domain.
15959  * <p>
15960  * For more information, see {@link #fixedLength}.
15961  * 
15962  * @type number|string|Date
15963  * @category Continuous > Scale
15964  */
15965 pvc.options.axes.AnyContinuousCartesianAxis.prototype.fixedMax = undefined;
15966 /**
15967  * The fixed minimum value of the axis domain (applies to continuous axes).
15968  * <p>
15969  * The value is converted using the
15970  * {@link pvc.options.DimensionType#converter} of
15971  * the first dimension of the first role bound to the axis.
15972  * <p>
15973  * For example, if the base axis shows the 
15974  * <i>category</i> dimension,
15975  * and the dimension is configured as type Date,
15976  * and it uses the default converter, then it accepts:
15977  * 
15978  * <ul>
15979  * 
15980  * <li>values of type 
15981  * <tt>number</tt>,
15982  * representing milliseconds as returned by
15983  * the JavaScript's 
15984  * <tt>Date.getTime()</tt> method
15985  * </li>
15986  * 
15987  * <li>values of type 
15988  * <tt>Date</tt>, which are accepted as is</li>
15989  * 
15990  * <li>values of type 
15991  * <tt>string</tt>,
15992  * in a format defined by the dimension's
15993  * {@link pvc.options.DimensionType#rawFormat}.
15994  * </li>
15995  * </ul>
15996  * <p>
15997  * The value may be bigger or smaller than the minimum value of the data domain.
15998  * <p>
15999  * For more information, see {@link #fixedLength}.
16000  * 
16001  * @type number|string|Date
16002  * @category Continuous > Scale
16003  */
16004 pvc.options.axes.AnyContinuousCartesianAxis.prototype.fixedMin = undefined;
16005 /**
16006  * Indicates if it should be ensured that the 0 domain value is shown (applies to numeric axes).
16007  * <p>
16008  * The properties
16009  * 
16010  * <tt>fixedMin</tt> and
16011  * 
16012  * <tt>fixedMax</tt> have precedence over this one.
16013  * <p>
16014  * If this property is 
16015  * <tt>true</tt>
16016  * and respecting it would require changing
16017  * the minimum value,
16018  * but the option 
16019  * <tt>fixedMin</tt> is also specified,
16020  * then this property is ignored.
16021  * The same would apply if
16022  * it were required to change
16023  * the maximum value,
16024  * but the property 
16025  * <tt>fixedMax</tt> was also specified.
16026  * <p>
16027  * For more information, see: {@link #fixedLength}.
16028  * 
16029  * @type boolean
16030  * @category Continuous > Scale
16031  */
16032 pvc.options.axes.AnyContinuousCartesianAxis.prototype.originIsZero = undefined;
16033 /**
16034  * Indicates if the initial proportion between the axis' domain and range lengths should be
16035  * preserved between renders (applies to continuous axes).
16036  * <p>
16037  * When using a sliding window for real time applications,
16038  * the ratio preservation allows for a stable visualization,
16039  * regardless of the data values provided.
16040  * <p>
16041  * When 
16042  * <tt>preserveRatio</tt> is specified,
16043  * following renders will use the 
16044  * <i>effective ratio</i> of the first render,
16045  * whether the ratio was initially fixed using 
16046  * <tt>ratio</tt> or not.
16047  * <p>
16048  * See {@link pvc.options.SlidingWindow}.
16049  * 
16050  * <h3>Default</h3>
16051  * If a sliding window exists: 
16052  * <tt>true</tt>, otherwise, 
16053  * <tt>false</tt>.
16054  * <p>
16055  * See {@link #ratio}.
16056  * 
16057  * @type boolean
16058  * @category Continuous > Scale
16059  */
16060 pvc.options.axes.AnyContinuousCartesianAxis.prototype.preserveRatio = undefined;
16061 /**
16062  * The fixed ratio value which is the proportion between the axis' range and domain lengths (applies to continuous axes).
16063  * <p>
16064  * This property can be defined as a number or a string.
16065  * <p>
16066  * For example, if the desired correspondence is that 100 pixels (range) represent 25 days (domain),
16067  * the option can be specified with any of the following equivalent forms:
16068  * 
16069  * <ul>
16070  * 
16071  * <li>
16072  * <tt>ratio = "100/25d"</tt>; or</li>
16073  * 
16074  * <li>
16075  * <tt>ratio = "100/216e7"</tt> (
16076  * <tt>"25d" = 216e7</tt> milliseconds); or</li>
16077  * 
16078  * <li>
16079  * <tt>ratio = 4.63e-8</tt>.</li>
16080  * </ul>
16081  * <p>
16082  * For more information,
16083  * see {@link #fixedLength} and {@link #preserveRatio}.
16084  * 
16085  * @type number|pvc.options.varia.TimeRatio
16086  * @category Continuous > Scale
16087  */
16088 pvc.options.axes.AnyContinuousCartesianAxis.prototype.ratio = undefined;
16089 /**
16090  * The 
16091  * <i>desired</i> number of major ticks.
16092  * <p>
16093  * A positive integer, possibly infinite.
16094  * <p>
16095  * Attention: This option is ignored when {@link #tickUnit} is specified!
16096  * <p>
16097  * Depending on
16098  * the domain values extent,
16099  * the labels' font size,
16100  * the available space,
16101  * the axis' orientation,
16102  * and the minimum label spacing
16103  * (given by {@link pvc.options.axes.AnyNonHierarchicalCartesianAxis#labelSpacingMin}),
16104  * a maximum number of ticks is implied.
16105  * <p>
16106  * The value of 
16107  * <i>desiredTickCount</i> is clamped to this layout imposed maximum.
16108  * <p>
16109  * When specified and finite,
16110  * the tick calculation algorithm chooses,
16111  * amongst possible tick units,
16112  * the one that results in a number of ticks
16113  * that is 
16114  * <b>closest</b> to the specified 
16115  * <b>desired</b> value.
16116  * <p>
16117  * When specified and infinite (
16118  * <tt>Infinity</tt>),
16119  * the layout imposed maximum is used instead.
16120  * 
16121  * <p>
16122  * 
16123  * <b>The minimum tick count</b>
16124  * </p>
16125  * <p>
16126  * This actually depends on the value of {@link #domainRoundMode}.
16127  * 
16128  * <ul>
16129  * 
16130  * <li>
16131  * 
16132  * <p>
16133  * <b>
16134  * <i>domainRoundMode</i> is {@link pvc.options.varia.AxisDomainRoundingMode#Tick}</b></p>
16135  * <p>
16136  * For tick counts greater than two or three, the algorithm strives to satisfy the user's desire!
16137  * <p>
16138  * However,
16139  * the algorithm always generates at least two or three ticks,
16140  * ignoring both 
16141  * <i>desiredTickCount</i> and 
16142  * <i>labelSpacingMin</i>,
16143  * if needed.
16144  * <p>
16145  * At least three ticks are generated for numeric domains having both negative and positive data.
16146  * There are also temporal domain cases where a minimum of three ticks are generated.
16147  * <p>
16148  * When the labels of these ticks really overlap,
16149  * one of the labels is kept visible and the other(s) is hidden.
16150  * <p>
16151  * This behavior ensures that, unless it is really impossible to do so,
16152  * the axis serves one of its main purposes - allowing to translate visual lengths.
16153  * <p>
16154  * When three tick labels overlap,
16155  * the middle label is kept visible and the end labels are hidden.
16156  * <p>
16157  * When two tick labels overlap,
16158  * one of the labels
16159  * — the one with tick value 
16160  * <tt>0</tt>, if any, or the first one, if none —
16161  * is kept visible and the other is hidden.
16162  * </li>
16163  * 
16164  * <li>
16165  * 
16166  * <p>
16167  * <b>
16168  * <i>domainRoundMode</i> is
16169  * {@link pvc.options.varia.AxisDomainRoundingMode#None} or
16170  * {@link pvc.options.varia.AxisDomainRoundingMode#Nice}</b></p>
16171  * <p>
16172  * The algorithm always generates at least one tick.
16173  * </li>
16174  * </ul>
16175  * <p>
16176  * Specifying a value of 
16177  * <tt>1</tt> results in the minimum possible tick count.
16178  * 
16179  * <p>
16180  * 
16181  * <b>Domain type specifics</b>
16182  * </p>
16183  * 
16184  * <ul>
16185  * 
16186  * <li>
16187  * 
16188  * <b>Numeric</b>
16189  * <p>
16190  * When unspecified, the default value is 
16191  * <tt>Infinity</tt>.
16192  * </li>
16193  * 
16194  * <li>
16195  * 
16196  * <b>Temporal</b>
16197  * <p>
16198  * The value must be less than or equal to 
16199  * <tt>10</tt>.
16200  * <p>
16201  * When unspecified, the default value is 
16202  * <tt>5</tt>.
16203  * </li>
16204  * </ul>
16205  * <p>
16206  * See {@link #tickUnit} for more information.
16207  * 
16208  * @type number
16209  * @category Continuous > Style
16210  */
16211 pvc.options.axes.AnyContinuousCartesianAxis.prototype.desiredTickCount = undefined;
16212 /**
16213  * Indicates if minor ticks are shown between major ticks (applies to continuous axes).
16214  * 
16215  * @type boolean
16216  * @default true
16217  * @category Continuous > Style
16218  */
16219 pvc.options.axes.AnyContinuousCartesianAxis.prototype.minorTicks = undefined;
16220 /**
16221  * The ticks' major unit (difference in domain value between consecutive ticks).
16222  * <p>
16223  * When a number, it must be a non-negative, finite, integer.
16224  * 
16225  * <ul>
16226  * 
16227  * <li>
16228  * 
16229  * <b>Numeric axis</b>
16230  * <p>
16231  * Specified values are rounded down to one of the standard precisions:
16232  * a number that is an integer power of 10,
16233  * multiplied by 1, 2 or 5 (e.g. 0.1, 0.2, 0.5, 1, 2, 5, 10, 20, 50, ...).
16234  * </li>
16235  * 
16236  * <li>
16237  * 
16238  * <b>Temporal axis</b>
16239  * <p>
16240  * When a number or numeric string is specified,
16241  * it is a the number of milliseconds of a duration.
16242  * <p>
16243  * It is rounded down to an integer and used directly.
16244  * By default, the corresponding tick format will be the one of the
16245  * greatest standard unit that is below the specified value.
16246  * <p>
16247  * When a (non-numeric) string is specified,
16248  * it should be the code of a standard precision,
16249  * optionally immediately preceded by an integer multiple
16250  * (e.g. 
16251  * <tt>'25d'</tt> means twenty five days).
16252  * <p>
16253  * The standard time precision codes are defined in {@link pvc.options.varia.TimeInterval}
16254  * <p>
16255  * This option should be used instead of the now deprecated
16256  * {@link pvc.options.marks.QuantitativeScaleExtensionPoint#dateTickPrecision}
16257  * extension point, via {@link #extensionPoints} and then 
16258  * <i>scale</i>.
16259  * </li>
16260  * </ul>
16261  * 
16262  * <b>Relations with other options</b>
16263  * <p>
16264  * When both {@link #tickUnitMin} and {@link #tickUnitMax} are specified,
16265  * and the former is greater than or equal to the later,
16266  * then it is as if 
16267  * <i>tickUnit</i> had been specified with the value of 
16268  * <i>tickUnitMin</i>.
16269  * <p>
16270  * When both 
16271  * <i>tickUnit</i> and {@link #tickUnitMin} are specified,
16272  * and 
16273  * <i>tickUnit</i> is less than 
16274  * <i>tickUnitMin</i>,
16275  * then the value of 
16276  * <i>tickUnitMin</i> is used instead.
16277  * <p>
16278  * When both 
16279  * <i>tickUnit</i> and {@link #tickUnitMax} are specified,
16280  * and 
16281  * <i>tickUnit</i> is greater than 
16282  * <i>tickUnitMax</i>,
16283  * then the value of 
16284  * <i>tickUnitMax</i> is used instead.
16285  * <p>
16286  * When specified or implied,
16287  * both {@link #desiredTickCount} and 
16288  * <i>labelSpacingMin</i>
16289  * are ignored.
16290  * <p>
16291  * See related axis options:
16292  * {@link #tickUnitMin},
16293  * {@link #tickUnitMax},
16294  * {@link #domainRoundMode},
16295  * {@link #desiredTickCount} and
16296  * {@link pvc.options.axes.AnyNonHierarchicalCartesianAxis#labelSpacingMin}.
16297  * <p>
16298  * For numeric axes, see also
16299  * {@link pvc.options.axes.NumericCartesianAxis#tickExponentMin} and
16300  * {@link pvc.options.axes.NumericCartesianAxis#tickExponentMax}.
16301  * 
16302  * @type number|string|pvc.options.varia.TimeInterval
16303  * @category Continuous > Style
16304  */
16305 pvc.options.axes.AnyContinuousCartesianAxis.prototype.tickUnit = undefined;
16306 /**
16307  * The maximum ticks' major unit (difference in domain value between consecutive ticks).
16308  * <p>
16309  * Use this option to ensure that ticks are separated by at most a certain value.
16310  * For example,
16311  * a value of 
16312  * <tt>100</tt> ensures that the unit 
16313  * <tt>200</tt> will not be used,
16314  * and of 
16315  * <tt>'3m'</tt> that a year or semester unit will not be used.
16316  * <p>
16317  * As another example,
16318  * to ensure that the tick unit is less than 
16319  * <tt>1000</tt>,
16320  * either
16321  * specify a 
16322  * <i>tickUnitMax</i> of 
16323  * <tt>900</tt>, or, maybe better,
16324  * specify a {@link pvc.options.axes.NumericCartesianAxis#tickExponentMax} of 
16325  * <tt>2</tt>.
16326  * <p>
16327  * When a number, it must be a positive integer.
16328  * <p>
16329  * The same value parsing rules of {@link #tickUnit} apply to this option.
16330  * <p>
16331  * For numeric axes,
16332  * the value of this option is combined with that of
16333  * {@link pvc.options.axes.NumericCartesianAxis#tickExponentMax},
16334  * resulting in the most restrictive one being used.
16335  * <p>
16336  * See {@link #tickUnit} for more information.
16337  * 
16338  * @type number|string
16339  * @default Infinity
16340  * @category Continuous > Style
16341  */
16342 pvc.options.axes.AnyContinuousCartesianAxis.prototype.tickUnitMax = undefined;
16343 /**
16344  * The minimum ticks' major unit (difference in domain value between consecutive ticks).
16345  * <p>
16346  * Use this option to ensure that ticks are separated by a minimum value.
16347  * For example, a value of 
16348  * <tt>1</tt> ensures ticks are integers,
16349  * and of 
16350  * <tt>'d'</tt>, that hour ticks are not used.
16351  * <p>
16352  * When a number, it must be a non-negative finite integer.
16353  * <p>
16354  * The same value parsing rules of {@link #tickUnit} apply to this option,
16355  * with the exception that rounding to a standard precision is performed 
16356  * <i>up</i>.
16357  * <p>
16358  * For numeric axes,
16359  * the value of this option is combined with that of
16360  * {@link pvc.options.axes.NumericCartesianAxis#tickExponentMin},
16361  * resulting in the most restrictive one being used.
16362  * <p>
16363  * See {@link #tickUnit} for more information.
16364  * 
16365  * @type number|string
16366  * @default 0
16367  * @category Continuous > Style
16368  */
16369 pvc.options.axes.AnyContinuousCartesianAxis.prototype.tickUnitMin = undefined;
16370 /**
16371  * The axis' domain rounding mode (applies to continuous axes).
16372  * 
16373  * @type pvc.options.varia.AxisDomainRoundingMode
16374  * @default 'tick'
16375  * @category Continuous-Numeric > Style
16376  */
16377 pvc.options.axes.AnyContinuousCartesianAxis.prototype.domainRoundMode = undefined;
16378 /**
16379  * The maximum exponent of 
16380  * <tt>10</tt> that is used to generate ticks (applies to continuous-numeric axes).
16381  * <p>
16382  * The value of this option is combined with that of {@link #tickUnitMax},
16383  * resulting in the most restrictive one being used.
16384  * <p>
16385  * The generated ticks are separated by a 
16386  * <i>step</i> value.
16387  * A step value is a certain power of 
16388  * <tt>10</tt>,
16389  * possibly multiplied by 
16390  * <tt>2</tt> or 
16391  * <tt>5</tt>.
16392  * <p>
16393  * For example, 
16394  * for a chosen exponent of 
16395  * <tt>4</tt>,
16396  * the corresponding power of 
16397  * <tt>10</tt> is 
16398  * <tt>10^4=10000</tt> and
16399  * the generated ticks could be:
16400  * 
16401  * <tt>0</tt>, 
16402  * <tt>10000</tt>, 
16403  * <tt>20000</tt>, ...
16404  * <p>
16405  * If the multiplier 
16406  * <tt>5</tt> was chosen, 
16407  * those ticks would instead be:
16408  * 
16409  * <tt>0</tt>, 
16410  * <tt>50000</tt>, 
16411  * <tt>100000</tt>, ...
16412  * <p>
16413  * Setting this property allows imposing a limit on 
16414  * the size of numbers chosen to separate ticks,
16415  * which may be seen as imposing a minimum granularity 
16416  * on the generated tick values.
16417  * <p>
16418  * See {@link #tickUnit} for more information.
16419  * 
16420  * @type number
16421  * @category Continuous-Numeric > Style
16422  */
16423 pvc.options.axes.AnyContinuousCartesianAxis.prototype.tickExponentMax = undefined;
16424 /**
16425  * The minimum exponent of 
16426  * <tt>10</tt> that is used to generate ticks (applies to continuous-numeric axes).
16427  * <p>
16428  * The value of this option is combined with that of {@link #tickUnitMax},
16429  * resulting in the most restrictive one being used.
16430  * <p>
16431  * The generated ticks are separated by a 
16432  * <i>step</i> value.
16433  * A step value is a certain power of 
16434  * <tt>10</tt>,
16435  * possibly multiplied by 
16436  * <tt>2</tt> or 
16437  * <tt>5</tt>.
16438  * <p>
16439  * For example, 
16440  * for a chosen exponent of 
16441  * <tt>2</tt>,
16442  * the corresponding power of 
16443  * <tt>10</tt> is 
16444  * <tt>10^2=100</tt> and
16445  * the generated ticks could be:
16446  * 
16447  * <tt>0</tt>, 
16448  * <tt>100</tt>, 
16449  * <tt>200</tt>, ...
16450  * <p>
16451  * If the multiplier 
16452  * <tt>2</tt> was chosen, 
16453  * those ticks would instead be:
16454  * 
16455  * <tt>0</tt>, 
16456  * <tt>200</tt>, 
16457  * <tt>400</tt>, ...
16458  * <p>
16459  * Setting this property to 
16460  * <tt>2</tt> would ensure 
16461  * that generated ticks would be separated by the step values
16462  * 
16463  * <tt>100</tt>, 
16464  * <tt>200</tt> or 
16465  * <tt>500</tt>,
16466  * or by steps whose corresponding exponent is 
16467  * bigger than 
16468  * <tt>2</tt>, 
16469  * like: 
16470  * <tt>1000</tt>, 
16471  * <tt>2000</tt> or 
16472  * <tt>5000</tt>.
16473  * <p>
16474  * A more typical use case is ensuring that generated ticks are integers.
16475  * A value of 
16476  * <tt>tickExponentMin</tt> of 
16477  * <tt>0</tt> would accomplish that.
16478  * <p>
16479  * Generally, 
16480  * to impose a maximum number of decimal places on the generated ticks, 
16481  * a negative number can be specified.
16482  * For example, the value 
16483  * <tt>-1</tt> could generate the ticks:
16484  * 
16485  * <tt>0.1</tt>, 
16486  * <tt>0.2</tt>, 
16487  * <tt>0.3</tt>, ...
16488  * If the multiplier 
16489  * <tt>5</tt> was chosen, 
16490  * those ticks would instead be:
16491  * 
16492  * <tt>0.5</tt>, 
16493  * <tt>1.0</tt>, 
16494  * <tt>1.5</tt>, ...
16495  * It could not generate ticks 
16496  * with more that one decimal place.
16497  * <p>
16498  * See {@link #tickUnit} for more information.
16499  * 
16500  * @type number
16501  * @category Continuous-Numeric > Style
16502  */
16503 pvc.options.axes.AnyContinuousCartesianAxis.prototype.tickExponentMin = undefined;
16504 /**
16505  * Indicates if the zero line rule is drawn, 
16506  * on the position of the 0-valued tick, 
16507  * when there is one (applies to continuous-numeric axes).
16508  * <p>
16509  * An horizontal axis has a vertical zero line rule,
16510  * while a a vertical axis has an horizontal zero line rule.
16511  * 
16512  * @type boolean
16513  * @default true
16514  * @category Continuous-Numeric > Style
16515  */
16516 pvc.options.axes.AnyContinuousCartesianAxis.prototype.zeroLine = undefined;
16517 /**
16518  * The minimum spacing between tick labels, in 
16519  * <i>em</i> units 
16520  * (does not apply to discrete-hierarchical axes).
16521  * <p>
16522  * Attention:
16523  * In continuous axes,
16524  * this option is ignored when {@link pvc.options.axes.AnyContinuousCartesianAxis#tickUnit}
16525  * is specified,
16526  * or when only two or three ticks are used!
16527  * <p>
16528  * See {@link pvc.options.axes.AnyContinuousCartesianAxis#tickUnit} for more information.
16529  * 
16530  * @type number
16531  * @category Non-Hierarchical > Layout
16532  */
16533 pvc.options.axes.AnyContinuousCartesianAxis.prototype.labelSpacingMin = undefined;
16534 /**
16535  * Indicates if ticks are shown for each tick value 
16536  * (does not apply to discrete-hierarchical axes).
16537  * 
16538  * @type boolean
16539  * @default true
16540  * @category Non-Hierarchical > Style
16541  */
16542 pvc.options.axes.AnyContinuousCartesianAxis.prototype.ticks = undefined;
16543 /**
16544  * The extension points object contains style definitions for
16545  * the marks of the panel.
16546  * 
16547  * @type pvc.options.ext.AnyContinuousCartesianAxisExtensionPoints
16548  * @category Style
16549  */
16550 pvc.options.axes.AnyContinuousCartesianAxis.prototype.extensionPoints = undefined;
16551 /**
16552  * The extension points of the cartesian axis panel for continuous scale types.
16553  * <p>
16554  * Axes extension points can also be specified directly at the chart options level.
16555  * <p>
16556  * To use an extension point you must find its full name, by joining:
16557  * 
16558  * <ol>
16559  * 
16560  * <li>panel property name (ex: 
16561  * <tt>xAxis</tt>)</li>
16562  * 
16563  * <li>extension property (ex: 
16564  * <tt>zeroLine</tt>)</li>
16565  * 
16566  * <li>the "_" character</li>
16567  * 
16568  * <li>extension sub-property (ex: 
16569  * <tt>lineWidth</tt>)</li>
16570  * </ol>
16571  * and obtaining, for the examples, the camel-cased name: 
16572  * <tt>xAxisZeroLine_lineWidth</tt>
16573  * (see {@link http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CamelCase}).
16574  * 
16575  * @class
16576  * @extends pvc.options.ext.CartesianAxisExtensionPoints
16577  */
16578 pvc.options.ext.AnyContinuousCartesianAxisExtensionPoints = function(){};
16579         
16580         
16581         
16582         
16583 /**
16584  * The extension point of the axis' scale object (applies to continuous axes).
16585  * 
16586  * @type pvc.options.marks.QuantitativeScaleExtensionPoint
16587  * @category Continuous > Scale
16588  */
16589 pvc.options.ext.AnyContinuousCartesianAxisExtensionPoints.prototype.scale = undefined;
16590 /**
16591  * The extension point of a 
16592  * <i>minor</i> tick rule mark (applies to continuous axes).
16593  * 
16594  * @type pvc.options.marks.RuleExtensionPoint
16595  * @category Continuous > Style
16596  */
16597 pvc.options.ext.AnyContinuousCartesianAxisExtensionPoints.prototype.minorTicks = undefined;
16598 /**
16599  * The extension point of the zero line rule (applies to continuous-numeric axes).
16600  * 
16601  * @type pvc.options.marks.RuleExtensionPoint
16602  * @category Continuous-Numeric > Style
16603  */
16604 pvc.options.ext.AnyContinuousCartesianAxisExtensionPoints.prototype.zeroLine = undefined;
16605 /**
16606  * The extension point of a discrete,
16607  * or continuous 
16608  * <i>major</i>,
16609  * tick rule mark (does not apply to discrete-hierarchical axes).
16610  * 
16611  * @type pvc.options.marks.RuleExtensionPoint
16612  * @category Non-Hierarchical > Style
16613  */
16614 pvc.options.ext.AnyContinuousCartesianAxisExtensionPoints.prototype.ticks = undefined;
16615 /**
16616  * The extension point of the tick panel 
16617  * (does not apply to discrete-hierarchical axes).
16618  * <p>
16619  * One tick panel contains one tick rule and one label.
16620  * It can be used to conveniently hide all the elements 
16621  * of a tick simultaneously.
16622  * 
16623  * @type pvc.options.marks.PanelExtensionPoint
16624  * @category Non-Hierarchical > Style
16625  */
16626 pvc.options.ext.AnyContinuousCartesianAxisExtensionPoints.prototype.ticksPanel = undefined;
16627 /**
16628  * The options documentation class of the cartesian axis panel
16629  * for continuous scale types.
16630  * <p>
16631  * For additional information, please see {@link pvc.options.axes.CartesianAxis}.
16632  * 
16633  * @class
16634  * @extends pvc.options.axes.CartesianAxis
16635  */
16636 pvc.options.axes.NumericCartesianAxis = function(){};
16637         
16638         
16639         
16640         
16641 /**
16642  * The domain alignment to use when the domain has a fixed or implied length (applies to continuous axes).
16643  * <p>
16644  * For more information, see {@link #fixedLength}.
16645  * 
16646  * @type pvc.options.varia.AxisDomainAlign
16647  * @default 'center'
16648  * @category Continuous > Scale
16649  */
16650 pvc.options.axes.NumericCartesianAxis.prototype.domainAlign = undefined;
16651 /**
16652  * Controls the type of scale domain coordination that should be performed
16653  * amongst the axes of the same id of each 
16654  * <i>small chart</i> (applies to continuous axes).
16655  * <p>
16656  * The value {@link pvc.options.varia.AxisDomainScope#Row}
16657  * can only be specified if the axis has vertical orientation.
16658  * Conversely,
16659  * the value {@link pvc.options.varia.AxisDomainScope#Column}
16660  * can only be specified if the axis has horizontal orientation.
16661  * 
16662  * @type pvc.options.varia.AxisDomainScope
16663  * @default 'global'
16664  * @category Continuous > Scale
16665  */
16666 pvc.options.axes.NumericCartesianAxis.prototype.domainScope = undefined;
16667 /**
16668  * The fixed length of the axis domain (applies to continuous axes).
16669  * <p>
16670  * A string value is converted to a number.
16671  * <p>
16672  * The value may be bigger or smaller than the actual length of the data.
16673  * <p>
16674  * By default, the domain of the axis is determined from the actual domain of the data.
16675  * This and other options allow modifying the axis domain.
16676  * <p>
16677  * When the axis domain gets smaller than the data domain,
16678  * and {@link pvc.options.charts.CartesianChart#leafContentOverflow} is set to 
16679  * <tt>auto</tt>,
16680  * the default value,
16681  * clipping is activated in the related plot panels and any overflown content is hidden.
16682  * 
16683  * <h3>Phase I</h3>
16684  * <p>
16685  * The phase I axis domain is determined by the following procedure:
16686  * 
16687  * <ol>
16688  * 
16689  * <li>
16690  * If 
16691  * <tt>fixedLength</tt> is not specified:
16692  * 
16693  * <ol>
16694  * 
16695  * <li>
16696  * If neither 
16697  * <tt>fixedMin</tt> and 
16698  * <tt>fixedMax</tt> are specified,
16699  * the axis domain is the data domain;
16700  * option 
16701  * <tt>originIsZero</tt> may augment the axis domain, on one of its sides;
16702  * </li>
16703  * 
16704  * <li>
16705  * If both 
16706  * <tt>fixedMin</tt> and 
16707  * <tt>fixedMax</tt> are specified,
16708  * the axis domain is fully determined; it's length is implied;
16709  * option 
16710  * <tt>originIsZero</tt> is ignored;
16711  * </li>
16712  * 
16713  * <li>
16714  * If 
16715  * <tt>fixedMin</tt> is specified (and 
16716  * <tt>fixedMax</tt> is not)
16717  * the axis domain minimum is 
16718  * <tt>fixedMin</tt> and
16719  * the axis domain maximum is the data domain maximum, possibly corrected by
16720  * option 
16721  * <tt>originIsZero</tt>;
16722  * </li>
16723  * 
16724  * <li>
16725  * Else, (if 
16726  * <tt>fixedMax</tt> is specified and 
16727  * <tt>fixedMin</tt> is not,)
16728  * the axis domain maximum is 
16729  * <tt>fixedMax</tt> and
16730  * the axis domain minimum is the data domain minimum, possibly corrected by
16731  * option 
16732  * <tt>originIsZero</tt>;
16733  * </li>
16734  * </ol>
16735  * </li>
16736  * 
16737  * <li>
16738  * If 
16739  * <tt>fixedLength</tt> is specified, option 
16740  * <tt>originIsZero</tt> is ignored.
16741  * <p>
16742  * The limits of the axis domain are determined as follows:
16743  * 
16744  * <ol>
16745  * 
16746  * <li>
16747  * If 
16748  * <tt>fixedMin</tt> is specified, the axis domain maximum is implied:
16749  * <br></br>
16750  * 
16751  * <tt>max = fixedMin + fixedLength</tt>;
16752  * <br></br>
16753  * options 
16754  * <tt>originIsZero</tt>, 
16755  * <tt>fixedMax</tt> are ignored;
16756  * option 
16757  * <tt>domainAlign</tt> is ignored in this phase;
16758  * </li>
16759  * 
16760  * <li>
16761  * If 
16762  * <tt>fixedMax</tt> is specified, the axis domain minimum is implied:
16763  * <br></br>
16764  * 
16765  * <tt>min = fixedMax - fixedLength</tt>;
16766  * <br></br>
16767  * option 
16768  * <tt>originIsZero</tt> is ignored;
16769  * option 
16770  * <tt>domainAlign</tt> is ignored in this phase;
16771  * </li>
16772  * 
16773  * <li>
16774  * Else, 
16775  * <tt>domainAlign</tt> is either specified or defaults to 
16776  * <tt>center</tt>.
16777  * The axis domain is aligned to either the minimum, maximum or center of the data domain
16778  * and then taken to have the specified fixed length.
16779  * <p>
16780  * It is determined as follows:
16781  * 
16782  * <ul>
16783  * 
16784  * <li>
16785  * If 
16786  * <tt>domainAlign</tt> is 
16787  * <tt>min</tt>, the axis domain minimum is that of
16788  * the actual data and the axis domain maximum is implied:
16789  * <br></br>
16790  * 
16791  * <tt>max = min(data) + fixedLength</tt>;
16792  * </li>
16793  * 
16794  * <li>
16795  * If 
16796  * <tt>domainAlign</tt> is 
16797  * <tt>max</tt>, the axis domain maximum is that of
16798  * the actual data and the axis domain minimum is implied:
16799  * <br></br>
16800  * 
16801  * <tt>min = max(data) - fixedLength</tt>;
16802  * </li>
16803  * 
16804  * <li>
16805  * Else, 
16806  * <tt>domainAlign</tt> is 
16807  * <tt>center</tt>, or defaults to it,
16808  * and both axis domain limits are determined from the actual data domain,
16809  * as follows:
16810  * 
16811  * <ul>
16812  * 
16813  * <li>
16814  * <tt>min = center(data) - fixedLength / 2</tt></li>
16815  * 
16816  * <li>
16817  * <tt>max = center(data) + fixedLength / 2</tt></li>
16818  * </ul>
16819  * where 
16820  * <tt>center(data)</tt> is determined as:
16821  * <br></br>
16822  * 
16823  * <tt>center(data) = (max(data) - min(data)) / 2</tt>.
16824  * </li>
16825  * </ul>
16826  * </li>
16827  * </ol>
16828  * </li>
16829  * </ol>
16830  * 
16831  * <h3>Phase II</h3>
16832  * <p>
16833  * In phase II, additional options may modify the phase I axis domain.
16834  * <p>
16835  * If {@link #domainRoundMode} is 
16836  * <tt>nice</tt>, the axis domain is made "nice",
16837  * by making sure that its ends are "nice" numbers.
16838  * <p>
16839  * If {@link #ratio} is specified (or a ratio is imposed due to {@link preserveRatio}),
16840  * the length of the axis domain is imposed by the length of the axis' range (a number of pixels).
16841  * The axis domain is aligned relative to the phase I axis domain, according to the value
16842  * of {@link #domainAlign}.
16843  * <p>
16844  * If {@link #domainRoundMode} is 
16845  * <tt>tick</tt>,
16846  * the phase I axis domain is extended to include the calculated ticks and only then are
16847  * the 
16848  * <tt>ratio</tt> and 
16849  * <tt>domainAlign</tt> options processed, so that the domain aligns to
16850  * the calculated ticks.
16851  * 
16852  * <h3>Default</h3>
16853  * <p>
16854  * If a sliding window exists, it is its length {@link pvc.options.SlidingWindow#length},
16855  * otherwise, 
16856  * <tt>null</tt>.
16857  * <p>
16858  * For more information, see:
16859  * {@link #fixedMin},
16860  * {@link #fixedMax},
16861  * {@link #domainAlign},
16862  * {@link #ratio} and
16863  * {@link #originIsZero}.
16864  * 
16865  * @type number|pvc.options.varia.TimeInterval
16866  * @category Continuous > Scale
16867  */
16868 pvc.options.axes.NumericCartesianAxis.prototype.fixedLength = undefined;
16869 /**
16870  * The fixed maximum value of the axis domain (applies to continuous axes).
16871  * <p>
16872  * The value is converted using the {@link pvc.options.DimensionType#converter} of
16873  * the first dimension of the first role bound to the axis.
16874  * <p>
16875  * For example, if the base axis shows the 
16876  * <i>category</i> dimension,
16877  * and the dimension is configured as type 
16878  * <tt>Date</tt>,
16879  * and it uses the default converter, then it accepts:
16880  * 
16881  * <ul>
16882  * 
16883  * <li>
16884  * values of type 
16885  * <tt>number</tt>,
16886  * representing milliseconds as returned by
16887  * the JavaScript's 
16888  * <tt>Date.getTime()</tt> method;
16889  * </li>
16890  * 
16891  * <li>
16892  * values of type 
16893  * <tt>Date</tt>, which are accepted as is;
16894  * </li>
16895  * 
16896  * <li>
16897  * values of type 
16898  * <tt>string</tt>,
16899  * in a format defined by the dimension's
16900  * {@link pvc.options.DimensionType#rawFormat}.
16901  * </li>
16902  * </ul>
16903  * <p>
16904  * The value may be bigger or smaller than the maximum value of the data domain.
16905  * <p>
16906  * For more information, see {@link #fixedLength}.
16907  * 
16908  * @type number|string|Date
16909  * @category Continuous > Scale
16910  */
16911 pvc.options.axes.NumericCartesianAxis.prototype.fixedMax = undefined;
16912 /**
16913  * The fixed minimum value of the axis domain (applies to continuous axes).
16914  * <p>
16915  * The value is converted using the
16916  * {@link pvc.options.DimensionType#converter} of
16917  * the first dimension of the first role bound to the axis.
16918  * <p>
16919  * For example, if the base axis shows the 
16920  * <i>category</i> dimension,
16921  * and the dimension is configured as type Date,
16922  * and it uses the default converter, then it accepts:
16923  * 
16924  * <ul>
16925  * 
16926  * <li>values of type 
16927  * <tt>number</tt>,
16928  * representing milliseconds as returned by
16929  * the JavaScript's 
16930  * <tt>Date.getTime()</tt> method
16931  * </li>
16932  * 
16933  * <li>values of type 
16934  * <tt>Date</tt>, which are accepted as is</li>
16935  * 
16936  * <li>values of type 
16937  * <tt>string</tt>,
16938  * in a format defined by the dimension's
16939  * {@link pvc.options.DimensionType#rawFormat}.
16940  * </li>
16941  * </ul>
16942  * <p>
16943  * The value may be bigger or smaller than the minimum value of the data domain.
16944  * <p>
16945  * For more information, see {@link #fixedLength}.
16946  * 
16947  * @type number|string|Date
16948  * @category Continuous > Scale
16949  */
16950 pvc.options.axes.NumericCartesianAxis.prototype.fixedMin = undefined;
16951 /**
16952  * Indicates if it should be ensured that the 0 domain value is shown (applies to numeric axes).
16953  * <p>
16954  * The properties
16955  * 
16956  * <tt>fixedMin</tt> and
16957  * 
16958  * <tt>fixedMax</tt> have precedence over this one.
16959  * <p>
16960  * If this property is 
16961  * <tt>true</tt>
16962  * and respecting it would require changing
16963  * the minimum value,
16964  * but the option 
16965  * <tt>fixedMin</tt> is also specified,
16966  * then this property is ignored.
16967  * The same would apply if
16968  * it were required to change
16969  * the maximum value,
16970  * but the property 
16971  * <tt>fixedMax</tt> was also specified.
16972  * <p>
16973  * For more information, see: {@link #fixedLength}.
16974  * 
16975  * @type boolean
16976  * @category Continuous > Scale
16977  */
16978 pvc.options.axes.NumericCartesianAxis.prototype.originIsZero = undefined;
16979 /**
16980  * Indicates if the initial proportion between the axis' domain and range lengths should be
16981  * preserved between renders (applies to continuous axes).
16982  * <p>
16983  * When using a sliding window for real time applications,
16984  * the ratio preservation allows for a stable visualization,
16985  * regardless of the data values provided.
16986  * <p>
16987  * When 
16988  * <tt>preserveRatio</tt> is specified,
16989  * following renders will use the 
16990  * <i>effective ratio</i> of the first render,
16991  * whether the ratio was initially fixed using 
16992  * <tt>ratio</tt> or not.
16993  * <p>
16994  * See {@link pvc.options.SlidingWindow}.
16995  * 
16996  * <h3>Default</h3>
16997  * If a sliding window exists: 
16998  * <tt>true</tt>, otherwise, 
16999  * <tt>false</tt>.
17000  * <p>
17001  * See {@link #ratio}.
17002  * 
17003  * @type boolean
17004  * @category Continuous > Scale
17005  */
17006 pvc.options.axes.NumericCartesianAxis.prototype.preserveRatio = undefined;
17007 /**
17008  * The fixed ratio value which is the proportion between the axis' range and domain lengths (applies to continuous axes).
17009  * <p>
17010  * This property can be defined as a number or a string.
17011  * <p>
17012  * For example, if the desired correspondence is that 100 pixels (range) represent 25 days (domain),
17013  * the option can be specified with any of the following equivalent forms:
17014  * 
17015  * <ul>
17016  * 
17017  * <li>
17018  * <tt>ratio = "100/25d"</tt>; or</li>
17019  * 
17020  * <li>
17021  * <tt>ratio = "100/216e7"</tt> (
17022  * <tt>"25d" = 216e7</tt> milliseconds); or</li>
17023  * 
17024  * <li>
17025  * <tt>ratio = 4.63e-8</tt>.</li>
17026  * </ul>
17027  * <p>
17028  * For more information,
17029  * see {@link #fixedLength} and {@link #preserveRatio}.
17030  * 
17031  * @type number|pvc.options.varia.TimeRatio
17032  * @category Continuous > Scale
17033  */
17034 pvc.options.axes.NumericCartesianAxis.prototype.ratio = undefined;
17035 /**
17036  * The 
17037  * <i>desired</i> number of major ticks.
17038  * <p>
17039  * A positive integer, possibly infinite.
17040  * <p>
17041  * Attention: This option is ignored when {@link #tickUnit} is specified!
17042  * <p>
17043  * Depending on
17044  * the domain values extent,
17045  * the labels' font size,
17046  * the available space,
17047  * the axis' orientation,
17048  * and the minimum label spacing
17049  * (given by {@link pvc.options.axes.AnyNonHierarchicalCartesianAxis#labelSpacingMin}),
17050  * a maximum number of ticks is implied.
17051  * <p>
17052  * The value of 
17053  * <i>desiredTickCount</i> is clamped to this layout imposed maximum.
17054  * <p>
17055  * When specified and finite,
17056  * the tick calculation algorithm chooses,
17057  * amongst possible tick units,
17058  * the one that results in a number of ticks
17059  * that is 
17060  * <b>closest</b> to the specified 
17061  * <b>desired</b> value.
17062  * <p>
17063  * When specified and infinite (
17064  * <tt>Infinity</tt>),
17065  * the layout imposed maximum is used instead.
17066  * 
17067  * <p>
17068  * 
17069  * <b>The minimum tick count</b>
17070  * </p>
17071  * <p>
17072  * This actually depends on the value of {@link #domainRoundMode}.
17073  * 
17074  * <ul>
17075  * 
17076  * <li>
17077  * 
17078  * <p>
17079  * <b>
17080  * <i>domainRoundMode</i> is {@link pvc.options.varia.AxisDomainRoundingMode#Tick}</b></p>
17081  * <p>
17082  * For tick counts greater than two or three, the algorithm strives to satisfy the user's desire!
17083  * <p>
17084  * However,
17085  * the algorithm always generates at least two or three ticks,
17086  * ignoring both 
17087  * <i>desiredTickCount</i> and 
17088  * <i>labelSpacingMin</i>,
17089  * if needed.
17090  * <p>
17091  * At least three ticks are generated for numeric domains having both negative and positive data.
17092  * There are also temporal domain cases where a minimum of three ticks are generated.
17093  * <p>
17094  * When the labels of these ticks really overlap,
17095  * one of the labels is kept visible and the other(s) is hidden.
17096  * <p>
17097  * This behavior ensures that, unless it is really impossible to do so,
17098  * the axis serves one of its main purposes - allowing to translate visual lengths.
17099  * <p>
17100  * When three tick labels overlap,
17101  * the middle label is kept visible and the end labels are hidden.
17102  * <p>
17103  * When two tick labels overlap,
17104  * one of the labels
17105  * — the one with tick value 
17106  * <tt>0</tt>, if any, or the first one, if none —
17107  * is kept visible and the other is hidden.
17108  * </li>
17109  * 
17110  * <li>
17111  * 
17112  * <p>
17113  * <b>
17114  * <i>domainRoundMode</i> is
17115  * {@link pvc.options.varia.AxisDomainRoundingMode#None} or
17116  * {@link pvc.options.varia.AxisDomainRoundingMode#Nice}</b></p>
17117  * <p>
17118  * The algorithm always generates at least one tick.
17119  * </li>
17120  * </ul>
17121  * <p>
17122  * Specifying a value of 
17123  * <tt>1</tt> results in the minimum possible tick count.
17124  * 
17125  * <p>
17126  * 
17127  * <b>Domain type specifics</b>
17128  * </p>
17129  * 
17130  * <ul>
17131  * 
17132  * <li>
17133  * 
17134  * <b>Numeric</b>
17135  * <p>
17136  * When unspecified, the default value is 
17137  * <tt>Infinity</tt>.
17138  * </li>
17139  * 
17140  * <li>
17141  * 
17142  * <b>Temporal</b>
17143  * <p>
17144  * The value must be less than or equal to 
17145  * <tt>10</tt>.
17146  * <p>
17147  * When unspecified, the default value is 
17148  * <tt>5</tt>.
17149  * </li>
17150  * </ul>
17151  * <p>
17152  * See {@link #tickUnit} for more information.
17153  * 
17154  * @type number
17155  * @category Continuous > Style
17156  */
17157 pvc.options.axes.NumericCartesianAxis.prototype.desiredTickCount = undefined;
17158 /**
17159  * Indicates if minor ticks are shown between major ticks (applies to continuous axes).
17160  * 
17161  * @type boolean
17162  * @default true
17163  * @category Continuous > Style
17164  */
17165 pvc.options.axes.NumericCartesianAxis.prototype.minorTicks = undefined;
17166 /**
17167  * The ticks' major unit (difference in domain value between consecutive ticks).
17168  * <p>
17169  * When a number, it must be a non-negative, finite, integer.
17170  * 
17171  * <ul>
17172  * 
17173  * <li>
17174  * 
17175  * <b>Numeric axis</b>
17176  * <p>
17177  * Specified values are rounded down to one of the standard precisions:
17178  * a number that is an integer power of 10,
17179  * multiplied by 1, 2 or 5 (e.g. 0.1, 0.2, 0.5, 1, 2, 5, 10, 20, 50, ...).
17180  * </li>
17181  * 
17182  * <li>
17183  * 
17184  * <b>Temporal axis</b>
17185  * <p>
17186  * When a number or numeric string is specified,
17187  * it is a the number of milliseconds of a duration.
17188  * <p>
17189  * It is rounded down to an integer and used directly.
17190  * By default, the corresponding tick format will be the one of the
17191  * greatest standard unit that is below the specified value.
17192  * <p>
17193  * When a (non-numeric) string is specified,
17194  * it should be the code of a standard precision,
17195  * optionally immediately preceded by an integer multiple
17196  * (e.g. 
17197  * <tt>'25d'</tt> means twenty five days).
17198  * <p>
17199  * The standard time precision codes are defined in {@link pvc.options.varia.TimeInterval}
17200  * <p>
17201  * This option should be used instead of the now deprecated
17202  * {@link pvc.options.marks.QuantitativeScaleExtensionPoint#dateTickPrecision}
17203  * extension point, via {@link #extensionPoints} and then 
17204  * <i>scale</i>.
17205  * </li>
17206  * </ul>
17207  * 
17208  * <b>Relations with other options</b>
17209  * <p>
17210  * When both {@link #tickUnitMin} and {@link #tickUnitMax} are specified,
17211  * and the former is greater than or equal to the later,
17212  * then it is as if 
17213  * <i>tickUnit</i> had been specified with the value of 
17214  * <i>tickUnitMin</i>.
17215  * <p>
17216  * When both 
17217  * <i>tickUnit</i> and {@link #tickUnitMin} are specified,
17218  * and 
17219  * <i>tickUnit</i> is less than 
17220  * <i>tickUnitMin</i>,
17221  * then the value of 
17222  * <i>tickUnitMin</i> is used instead.
17223  * <p>
17224  * When both 
17225  * <i>tickUnit</i> and {@link #tickUnitMax} are specified,
17226  * and 
17227  * <i>tickUnit</i> is greater than 
17228  * <i>tickUnitMax</i>,
17229  * then the value of 
17230  * <i>tickUnitMax</i> is used instead.
17231  * <p>
17232  * When specified or implied,
17233  * both {@link #desiredTickCount} and 
17234  * <i>labelSpacingMin</i>
17235  * are ignored.
17236  * <p>
17237  * See related axis options:
17238  * {@link #tickUnitMin},
17239  * {@link #tickUnitMax},
17240  * {@link #domainRoundMode},
17241  * {@link #desiredTickCount} and
17242  * {@link pvc.options.axes.AnyNonHierarchicalCartesianAxis#labelSpacingMin}.
17243  * <p>
17244  * For numeric axes, see also
17245  * {@link pvc.options.axes.NumericCartesianAxis#tickExponentMin} and
17246  * {@link pvc.options.axes.NumericCartesianAxis#tickExponentMax}.
17247  * 
17248  * @type number|string|pvc.options.varia.TimeInterval
17249  * @category Continuous > Style
17250  */
17251 pvc.options.axes.NumericCartesianAxis.prototype.tickUnit = undefined;
17252 /**
17253  * The maximum ticks' major unit (difference in domain value between consecutive ticks).
17254  * <p>
17255  * Use this option to ensure that ticks are separated by at most a certain value.
17256  * For example,
17257  * a value of 
17258  * <tt>100</tt> ensures that the unit 
17259  * <tt>200</tt> will not be used,
17260  * and of 
17261  * <tt>'3m'</tt> that a year or semester unit will not be used.
17262  * <p>
17263  * As another example,
17264  * to ensure that the tick unit is less than 
17265  * <tt>1000</tt>,
17266  * either
17267  * specify a 
17268  * <i>tickUnitMax</i> of 
17269  * <tt>900</tt>, or, maybe better,
17270  * specify a {@link pvc.options.axes.NumericCartesianAxis#tickExponentMax} of 
17271  * <tt>2</tt>.
17272  * <p>
17273  * When a number, it must be a positive integer.
17274  * <p>
17275  * The same value parsing rules of {@link #tickUnit} apply to this option.
17276  * <p>
17277  * For numeric axes,
17278  * the value of this option is combined with that of
17279  * {@link pvc.options.axes.NumericCartesianAxis#tickExponentMax},
17280  * resulting in the most restrictive one being used.
17281  * <p>
17282  * See {@link #tickUnit} for more information.
17283  * 
17284  * @type number|string
17285  * @default Infinity
17286  * @category Continuous > Style
17287  */
17288 pvc.options.axes.NumericCartesianAxis.prototype.tickUnitMax = undefined;
17289 /**
17290  * The minimum ticks' major unit (difference in domain value between consecutive ticks).
17291  * <p>
17292  * Use this option to ensure that ticks are separated by a minimum value.
17293  * For example, a value of 
17294  * <tt>1</tt> ensures ticks are integers,
17295  * and of 
17296  * <tt>'d'</tt>, that hour ticks are not used.
17297  * <p>
17298  * When a number, it must be a non-negative finite integer.
17299  * <p>
17300  * The same value parsing rules of {@link #tickUnit} apply to this option,
17301  * with the exception that rounding to a standard precision is performed 
17302  * <i>up</i>.
17303  * <p>
17304  * For numeric axes,
17305  * the value of this option is combined with that of
17306  * {@link pvc.options.axes.NumericCartesianAxis#tickExponentMin},
17307  * resulting in the most restrictive one being used.
17308  * <p>
17309  * See {@link #tickUnit} for more information.
17310  * 
17311  * @type number|string
17312  * @default 0
17313  * @category Continuous > Style
17314  */
17315 pvc.options.axes.NumericCartesianAxis.prototype.tickUnitMin = undefined;
17316 /**
17317  * The axis' domain rounding mode (applies to continuous axes).
17318  * 
17319  * @type pvc.options.varia.AxisDomainRoundingMode
17320  * @default 'tick'
17321  * @category Continuous-Numeric > Style
17322  */
17323 pvc.options.axes.NumericCartesianAxis.prototype.domainRoundMode = undefined;
17324 /**
17325  * The maximum exponent of 
17326  * <tt>10</tt> that is used to generate ticks (applies to continuous-numeric axes).
17327  * <p>
17328  * The value of this option is combined with that of {@link #tickUnitMax},
