19777  * top side of the parent panel.
19778  * 
19779  * @value 'top'
19780  */
19781 pvc.options.varia.PanelAlignmentTarget.prototype.Top = 'top';
19782 /**
19783  * The sides of a parent panel to 
19784  * which a child panel may be docked to.
19785  * 
19786  * @class
19787  * @enum
19788  * @extends string
19789  */
19790 pvc.options.varia.PanelPosition = function(){};
19791         
19792         
19793         
19794 /**
19795  * The bottom side of the child panel 
19796  * is placed at the same position as the
19797  * bottom side of the parent panel. 
19798  * 
19799  * @value 'bottom'
19800  */
19801 pvc.options.varia.PanelPosition.prototype.Bottom = 'bottom';
19802 /**
19803  * The left side of the child panel 
19804  * is placed at the same position as the
19805  * left side of the parent panel. 
19806  * 
19807  * @value 'left'
19808  */
19809 pvc.options.varia.PanelPosition.prototype.Left = 'left';
19810 /**
19811  * The right side of the child panel 
19812  * is placed at the same position as the
19813  * right side of the parent panel. 
19814  * 
19815  * @value 'right'
19816  */
19817 pvc.options.varia.PanelPosition.prototype.Right = 'right';
19818 /**
19819  * The top side of the child panel 
19820  * is placed at the same position as the
19821  * top side of the parent panel. 
19822  * 
19823  * @value 'top'
19824  */
19825 pvc.options.varia.PanelPosition.prototype.Top = 'top';
19826 /**
19827  * The types of values that a dimension can hold.
19828  * <p>
19829  * Note that, 
19830  * whatever the value type of a dimension type,
19831  * 
19832  * <tt>null</tt> is always a supported value.
19833  * 
19834  * @class
19835  * @enum
19836  * @extends function
19837  */
19838 pvc.options.varia.DimensionValueType = function(){};
19839         
19840         
19841         
19842 /**
19843  * The "any" value type, 
19844  * specified as 
19845  * <tt>null</tt>, 
19846  * means that a dimension can hold any type of data.
19847  * <p>
19848  * Values of this type are 
19849  * <i>not</i> cast.
19850  * <p>
19851  * Each value may have a different type.
19852  * <p>
19853  * Dimension types of this value type
19854  * are discrete.
19855  * 
19856  * @value null
19857  */
19858 pvc.options.varia.DimensionValueType.prototype.Any = null;
19859 /**
19860  * The dimension holds 
19861  * <i>boolean</i> values.
19862  * <p>
19863  * Values of this type are cast by using the standard 
19864  * JavaScript 
19865  * <tt>Boolean</tt> function.
19866  * <p>
19867  * Dimension types of this value type
19868  * are discrete.
19869  * 
19870  * @value Boolean
19871  */
19872 pvc.options.varia.DimensionValueType.prototype.Boolean = Boolean;
19873 /**
19874  * The dimension holds 
19875  * <i>date</i> values.
19876  * <p>
19877  * Values of this type are cast by using the standard 
19878  * JavaScript 
19879  * <tt>Date</tt> constructor.
19880  * <p>
19881  * Dimension types of this value type
19882  * can be continuous or discrete.
19883  * 
19884  * @value Date
19885  */
19886 pvc.options.varia.DimensionValueType.prototype.Date = Date;
19887 /**
19888  * The dimension holds 
19889  * <i>number</i> values.
19890  * <p>
19891  * Values of this type are cast by using the standard 
19892  * JavaScript 
19893  * <tt>Number</tt> function;
19894  * additionally, 
19895  * resulting 
19896  * <tt>NaN</tt> values 
19897  * are converted to 
19898  * <tt>null</tt>. 
19899  * <p>
19900  * Dimension types of this value type
19901  * can be continuous or discrete.
19902  * 
19903  * @value Number
19904  */
19905 pvc.options.varia.DimensionValueType.prototype.Number = Number;
19906 /**
19907  * The dimension holds 
19908  * <i>object</i> values.
19909  * <p>
19910  * Values of this type are cast by using the standard 
19911  * JavaScript 
19912  * <tt>Object</tt> function.
19913  * <p>
19914  * Dimension types of this value type
19915  * are discrete.
19916  * 
19917  * @value Object
19918  */
19919 pvc.options.varia.DimensionValueType.prototype.Object = Object;
19920 /**
19921  * The dimension holds 
19922  * <i>string</i> values.
19923  * <p>
19924  * Values of this type are cast by using the standard 
19925  * JavaScript 
19926  * <tt>String</tt> function.
19927  * <p>
19928  * Dimension types of this value type
19929  * are discrete.
19930  * <p>
19931  * The empty string value is 
19932  * always converted to the null value.
19933  * 
19934  * @value String
19935  */
19936 pvc.options.varia.DimensionValueType.prototype.String = String;
19937 /**
19938  * Control the beahvior of the legend
19939  * when the user clicks a legend item.
19940  * 
19941  * @class
19942  * @enum
19943  * @extends string
19944  */
19945 pvc.options.varia.LegendClickMode = function(){};
19946         
19947         
19948         
19949 /**
19950  * Nothing happens.
19951  * 
19952  * @value 'none'
19953  */
19954 pvc.options.varia.LegendClickMode.prototype.None = 'none';
19955 /**
19956  * The corresponding datums' selected state is toggled. 
19957  * 
19958  * @value 'toggleSelected'
19959  */
19960 pvc.options.varia.LegendClickMode.prototype.ToggleSelected = 'toggleSelected';
19961 /**
19962  * The corresponding datums' visible state is toggled.
19963  * 
19964  * @value 'toggleVisible'
19965  */
19966 pvc.options.varia.LegendClickMode.prototype.ToggleVisible = 'toggleVisible';
19967 /**
19968  * The shapes that are available in protovis Dot marks.
19969  * 
19970  * @class
19971  * @enum
19972  * @extends string
19973  */
19974 pvc.options.varia.DotShapeType = function(){};
19975         
19976         
19977         
19978 /**
19979  * @value 'bar'
19980  */
19981 pvc.options.varia.DotShapeType.prototype.Bar = 'bar';
19982 /**
19983  * @value 'circle'
19984  */
19985 pvc.options.varia.DotShapeType.prototype.Circle = 'circle';
19986 /**
19987  * @value 'cross'
19988  */
19989 pvc.options.varia.DotShapeType.prototype.Cross = 'cross';
19990 /**
19991  * @value 'diamond'
19992  */
19993 pvc.options.varia.DotShapeType.prototype.Diamond = 'diamond';
19994 /**
19995  * @value 'square'
19996  */
19997 pvc.options.varia.DotShapeType.prototype.Square = 'square';
19998 /**
19999  * @value 'tick'
20000  */
20001 pvc.options.varia.DotShapeType.prototype.Tick = 'tick';
20002 /**
20003  * @value 'triangle'
20004  */
20005 pvc.options.varia.DotShapeType.prototype.Triangle = 'triangle';
20006 /**
20007  * The anchors that are available to all protovis marks,
20008  * with the exception of the Wedge mark 
20009  * (see {@link pvc.options.varia.WedgeAnchor}).
20010  * 
20011  * @class
20012  * @enum
20013  * @extends string
20014  */
20015 pvc.options.varia.MarkAnchor = function(){};
20016         
20017         
20018         
20019 /**
20020  * @value 'bottom'
20021  */
20022 pvc.options.varia.MarkAnchor.prototype.Bottom = 'bottom';
20023 /**
20024  * @value 'center'
20025  */
20026 pvc.options.varia.MarkAnchor.prototype.Center = 'center';
20027 /**
20028  * @value 'left'
20029  */
20030 pvc.options.varia.MarkAnchor.prototype.Left = 'left';
20031 /**
20032  * @value 'right'
20033  */
20034 pvc.options.varia.MarkAnchor.prototype.Right = 'right';
20035 /**
20036  * @value 'top'
20037  */
20038 pvc.options.varia.MarkAnchor.prototype.Top = 'top';
20039 /**
20040  * The anchors that are available to the protovis Wedge mark.
20041  * 
20042  * @class
20043  * @enum
20044  * @extends string
20045  */
20046 pvc.options.varia.WedgeAnchor = function(){};
20047         
20048         
20049         
20050 /**
20051  * @value 'center'
20052  */
20053 pvc.options.varia.WedgeAnchor.prototype.Center = 'center';
20054 /**
20055  * @value 'end'
20056  */
20057 pvc.options.varia.WedgeAnchor.prototype.End = 'end';
20058 /**
20059  * @value 'inner'
20060  */
20061 pvc.options.varia.WedgeAnchor.prototype.Inner = 'inner';
20062 /**
20063  * @value 'outer'
20064  */
20065 pvc.options.varia.WedgeAnchor.prototype.Outer = 'outer';
20066 /**
20067  * @value 'start'
20068  */
20069 pvc.options.varia.WedgeAnchor.prototype.Start = 'start';
20070 /**
20071  * The mode of interpolation for filling null or missing measure values.
20072  * <p>
20073  * Some chart types 
20074  * show visual elements corresponding to 
20075  * interpolated data points with a different visual style.
20076  * The automatically generated visual element tooltips 
20077  * indicate that the associated data point 
20078  * is the result of interpolation.
20079  * 
20080  * @class
20081  * @enum
20082  * @extends string
20083  */
20084 pvc.options.varia.NullInterpolationMode = function(){};
20085         
20086         
20087         
20088 /**
20089  * Data is linearly interpolated to 
20090  * fill-in null values or missing datums.
20091  * 
20092  * @value 'linear'
20093  */
20094 pvc.options.varia.NullInterpolationMode.prototype.Linear = 'linear';
20095 /**
20096  * Null values or missing datums are shown as a visual 
20097  * <i>gap</i>.
20098  * 
20099  * @value 'none'
20100  */
20101 pvc.options.varia.NullInterpolationMode.prototype.None = 'none';
20102 /**
20103  * Data is interpolated using the constant value 
20104  * <tt>0</tt> 
20105  * to fill-in null values or missing datums.
20106  * 
20107  * @value 'zero'
20108  */
20109 pvc.options.varia.NullInterpolationMode.prototype.Zero = 'zero';
20110 /**
20111  * The domain alignment is used to determine the domain of an axis
20112  * when it is specified as a 
20113  * <i>floating</i> domain.
20114  * <p>
20115  * For options like  
20116  * <tt>fixedLength</tt> and 
20117  * <tt>ratio</tt>,
20118  * when specified with 
20119  * <tt>domainAlign</tt>,
20120  * the domain is altered so that a given domain length is kept
20121  * (domain length is either 
20122  * <tt>fixedLength</tt> or derived from 
20123  * <tt>ratio</tt>).
20124  * When altering the domain,
20125  * some values will be kept and others may be lost.
20126  * The domain alignment specifies which values are kept.
20127  * <p>
20128  * This only applies when the domain has some order among its elements,
20129  * and, consequently, some minimum and maximum values.
20130  * <p>
20131  * For more information, see the following axis options:
20132  * {@link pvc.options.axes.AnyContinuousCartesianAxis#fixedLength},
20133  * {@link pvc.options.axes.SizeAxis#fixedLength} and
20134  * {@link pvc.options.axes.AnyContinuousCartesianAxis#ratio}.
20135  * 
20136  * @class
20137  * @enum
20138  * @extends string
20139  */
20140 pvc.options.varia.AxisDomainAlign = function(){};
20141         
20142         
20143         
20144 /**
20145  * Both minimum and maximum may be lost. However, the center is kept: 
20146  * 
20147  * <ul>
20148  * 
20149  * <li>center = (maximum - minimum) / 2.</li>
20150  * </ul>
20151  * 
20152  * @value 'center'
20153  */
20154 pvc.options.varia.AxisDomainAlign.prototype.Center = 'center';
20155 /**
20156  * The maximum value is kept in the domain and the minimum may be lost.
20157  * 
20158  * @value 'max'
20159  */
20160 pvc.options.varia.AxisDomainAlign.prototype.Max = 'max';
20161 /**
20162  * The minimum value is kept in the domain and the maximum may be lost.
20163  * 
20164  * @value 'min'
20165  */
20166 pvc.options.varia.AxisDomainAlign.prototype.Min = 'min';
20167 /**
20168  * The type of scale domain coordination 
20169  * amongst axes of the same id of 
20170  * 
20171  * <i>small charts</i>.
20172  * 
20173  * @class
20174  * @enum
20175  * @extends string
20176  */
20177 pvc.options.varia.AxisDomainScope = function(){};
20178         
20179         
20180         
20181 /**
20182  * No scale domain coordination.
20183  * 
20184  * @value 'cell'
20185  */
20186 pvc.options.varia.AxisDomainScope.prototype.Cell = 'cell';
20187 /**
20188  * The axes of same id of 
20189  * 
20190  * <i>small charts</i> of each column
20191  * will use the same scale domain.
20192  * 
20193  * @value 'column'
20194  */
20195 pvc.options.varia.AxisDomainScope.prototype.Column = 'column';
20196 /**
20197  * The axes of same id of 
20198  * all the 
20199  * <i>small charts</i>
20200  * use the same scale domain.  
20201  * 
20202  * @value 'global'
20203  */
20204 pvc.options.varia.AxisDomainScope.prototype.Global = 'global';
20205 /**
20206  * The axes of same id of 
20207  * 
20208  * <i>small charts</i> of each row
20209  * will use the same scale domain.  
20210  * 
20211  * @value 'row'
20212  */
20213 pvc.options.varia.AxisDomainScope.prototype.Row = 'row';
20214 /**
20215  * The axes of same id of 
20216  * 
20217  * <i>small charts</i> of each row or column
20218  * will use the same scale domain.
20219  * <p>
20220  * The determination of whether 
20221  * <tt>section</tt> 
20222  * applies to 
20223  * rows or columns
20224  * is performed according to a reference orientation.
20225  * <p>
20226  * In the case of cartesian axes, 
20227  * the reference orientation
20228  * is the axis' orientation.
20229  * <p>
20230  * If the reference orientation is horizontal, 
20231  * then 
20232  * <tt>section </tt> applies to columns.
20233  * Otherwise it applies to rows.
20234  * 
20235  * @value 'section'
20236  */
20237 pvc.options.varia.AxisDomainScope.prototype.Section = 'section';
20238 /**
20239  * The rounding mode applied to a numeric axis' scale domain.
20240  * 
20241  * @class
20242  * @enum
20243  * @extends string
20244  */
20245 pvc.options.varia.AxisDomainRoundingMode = function(){};
20246         
20247         
20248         
20249 /**
20250  * The scale domain is made "nice" by 
20251  * ensuring that its bounds are "nice" numbers,
20252  * extending the domain, if necessary.
20253  * 
20254  * @value 'nice'
20255  */
20256 pvc.options.varia.AxisDomainRoundingMode.prototype.Nice = 'nice';
20257 /**
20258  * The scale domain is exactly the domain of the data.
20259  * 
20260  * @value 'none'
20261  */
20262 pvc.options.varia.AxisDomainRoundingMode.prototype.None = 'none';
20263 /**
20264  * The scale domain is extended in order to 
20265  * coincide with the calculated ticks.
20266  * <p>
20267  * Ticks naturally are nice numbers, 
20268  * yet, additionally, 
20269  * this mode ensures that ticks coincide with 
20270  * the end of the axis' scale,
20271  * as long as the axis'
20272  * {@link pvc.options.axes.CartesianAxis#offset}
20273  * is zero.
20274  * 
20275  * @value 'tick'
20276  */
20277 pvc.options.varia.AxisDomainRoundingMode.prototype.Tick = 'tick';
20278 /**
20279  * The possible rotation directions.
20280  * 
20281  * @class
20282  * @enum
20283  * @extends string
20284  */
20285 pvc.options.varia.AxisLabelRotationDirection = function(){};
20286         
20287         
20288         
20289 /**
20290  * Circular motion in the same direction as a clock's hands.
20291  * 
20292  * @value 'clockwise'
20293  */
20294 pvc.options.varia.AxisLabelRotationDirection.prototype.Clockwise = 'clockwise';
20295 /**
20296  * Circular motion in the opposite direction as a clock's hands.
20297  * 
20298  * @value 'counterclockwise'
20299  */
20300 pvc.options.varia.AxisLabelRotationDirection.prototype.Counterclockwise = 'counterclockwise';
20301 /**
20302  * The layout modes that handle the situation where 
20303  * labels of axes ticks overlap.
20304  * 
20305  * @class
20306  * @enum
20307  * @extends string
20308  */
20309 pvc.options.varia.AxisOverlappedLabelsMode = function(){};
20310         
20311         
20312         
20313 /**
20314  * Hide labels that overlap.
20315  * <p>
20316  * Between two labels, as many as required are hidden
20317  * until the minimum specified spacing is respected.
20318  * <p>
20319  * In the place of the hidden labels,
20320  * a dot is placed that, 
20321  * when hovering over, 
20322  * indicates the value of the hidden labels.
20323  * 
20324  * @value 'hide'
20325  */
20326 pvc.options.varia.AxisOverlappedLabelsMode.prototype.Hide = 'hide';
20327 /**
20328  * Let labels overlap.
20329  * 
20330  * @value 'leave'
20331  */
20332 pvc.options.varia.AxisOverlappedLabelsMode.prototype.Leave = 'leave';
20333 /**
20334  * Rotate the labels so that they do not overlap.
20335  * If not possible, allows the labels to overlap.
20336  * 
20337  * @value 'rotate'
20338  */
20339 pvc.options.varia.AxisOverlappedLabelsMode.prototype.Rotate = 'rotate';
20340 /**
20341  * Rotate the labels so that they do not overlap.
20342  * If not possible, hides the labels that still overlap.
20343  * 
20344  * @value 'rotatethenhide'
20345  */
20346 pvc.options.varia.AxisOverlappedLabelsMode.prototype.RotateThenHide = 'rotatethenhide';
20347 /**
20348  * The possible value label styles of pie charts
20349  * 
20350  * @class
20351  * @enum
20352  * @extends string
20353  */
20354 pvc.options.varia.PieValuesLabelStyle = function(){};
20355         
20356         
20357         
20358 /**
20359  * Value labels are placed inside 
20360  * their corresponding pie slice.
20361  * 
20362  * @value 'inside'
20363  */
20364 pvc.options.varia.PieValuesLabelStyle.prototype.Inside = 'inside';
20365 /**
20366  * Value labels are placed outside 
20367  * their corresponding pie slice,
20368  * linked to it by a line.
20369  * 
20370  * @value 'linked'
20371  */
20372 pvc.options.varia.PieValuesLabelStyle.prototype.Linked = 'linked';
20373 /**
20374  * The direction of the waterfall.
20375  * 
20376  * @class
20377  * @enum
20378  * @extends string
20379  */
20380 pvc.options.varia.WaterDirection = function(){};
20381         
20382         
20383         
20384 /**
20385  * The water of the waterfall falls,
20386  * from left to right.
20387  * 
20388  * @value 'down'
20389  */
20390 pvc.options.varia.WaterDirection.prototype.Down = 'down';
20391 /**
20392  * The water of the waterfall falls,
20393  * from right to left,
20394  * (or climbs, from left to right).
20395  * 
20396  * @value 'up'
20397  */
20398 pvc.options.varia.WaterDirection.prototype.Up = 'up';
20399 /**
20400  * The type of color scale for continuous color axes.
20401  * 
20402  * @class
20403  * @enum
20404  * @extends string
20405  */
20406 pvc.options.varia.ColorScaleType = function(){};
20407         
20408         
20409         
20410 /**
20411  * A discrete scale is used.
20412  * <p>
20413  * The numeric domain is quantized and 
20414  * then mapped to a discrete number of colors.
20415  * 
20416  * @value 'discrete'
20417  */
20418 pvc.options.varia.ColorScaleType.prototype.Discrete = 'discrete';
20419 /**
20420  * A linear scale is used to map 
20421  * a numeric domain into 
20422  * a color range.
20423  * 
20424  * @value 'linear'
20425  */
20426 pvc.options.varia.ColorScaleType.prototype.Linear = 'linear';
20427 /**
20428  * A normal distribution scale is used.
20429  * <p>
20430  * This scale type is 
20431  * <i>currently</i> unsupported.
20432  * 
20433  * @value 'normal'
20434  */
20435 pvc.options.varia.ColorScaleType.prototype.Normal = 'normal';
20436 /**
20437  * The gravity of the tooltip controls 
20438  * where the tooltip is place relative to the
20439  * visual element's anchor point.
20440  * <p>
20441  * The gravity is the 
20442  * tooltip's corner or side
20443  * that is placed at the visual element's anchor point.
20444  * <p>
20445  * Said in yet another way: 
20446  * «Gravity is the direction of the tooltip arrow.
20447  * The arrow points to the target element.»
20448  * 
20449  * <p>
20450  * The following diagram illustrates the
20451  * tooltip arrow anchor points.
20452  * <p>
20453  * When {@link pvc.options.Tooltip#useCorners}
20454  * is 
20455  * <tt>true</tt>,
20456  * the "crossed" gravities are really at
20457  * the tooltip box corners.
20458  * 
20459  * <pre>
20460  *                nw    n    ne
20461  *               +-o----o----o-+
20462  *               |             |
20463  *             w o   Tooltip   o e
20464  *               |             |
20465  *               +-o----o----o-+
20466  *                sw    s    se
20467  *                 
20468  * </pre>
20469  * 
20470  * <p>
20471  * 
20472  * @class
20473  * @enum
20474  * @extends string
20475  */
20476 pvc.options.varia.TooltipGravity = function(){};
20477         
20478         
20479         
20480 /**
20481  * Right tooltip side is placed at the 
20482  * visual element's anchor point,
20483  * resulting in the tooltip being at its left.
20484  * 
20485  * @value 'e'
20486  */
20487 pvc.options.varia.TooltipGravity.prototype.East = 'e';
20488 /**
20489  * Top tooltip side is placed at the 
20490  * visual element's anchor point,
20491  * resulting in the tooltip being below it. 
20492  * 
20493  * @value 'n'
20494  */
20495 pvc.options.varia.TooltipGravity.prototype.North = 'n';
20496 /**
20497  * Upper-right tooltip corner is placed at the 
20498  * visual element's anchor point,
20499  * resulting in the tooltip being below it and at its left.
20500  * 
20501  * @value 'ne'
20502  */
20503 pvc.options.varia.TooltipGravity.prototype.NorthEast = 'ne';
20504 /**
20505  * Upper-left tooltip corner is placed at the 
20506  * visual element's anchor point,
20507  * resulting in the tooltip being below it and at its right.
20508  * 
20509  * @value 'nw'
20510  */
20511 pvc.options.varia.TooltipGravity.prototype.NorthWest = 'nw';
20512 /**
20513  * Bottom tooltip side is placed at the 
20514  * visual element's anchor point,
20515  * resulting in the tooltip being above it.  
20516  * 
20517  * @value 's'
20518  */
20519 pvc.options.varia.TooltipGravity.prototype.South = 's';
20520 /**
20521  * Lower-right tooltip corner is placed at the 
20522  * visual element's anchor point,
20523  * resulting in the tooltip being above it and at its left.
20524  * 
20525  * @value 'se'
20526  */
20527 pvc.options.varia.TooltipGravity.prototype.SouthEast = 'se';
20528 /**
20529  * Lower-left tooltip corner is placed at the 
20530  * visual element's anchor point,
20531  * resulting in the tooltip being above it and at its right.
20532  * 
20533  * @value 'sw'
20534  */
20535 pvc.options.varia.TooltipGravity.prototype.SouthWest = 'sw';
20536 /**
20537  * Left tooltip side is placed at the 
20538  * visual element's anchor point,
20539  * resulting in the tooltip being at its right.
20540  * 
20541  * @value 'w'
20542  */
20543 pvc.options.varia.TooltipGravity.prototype.West = 'w';
20544 /**
20545  * How to interpolate the line or area between values.
20546  * <p>
20547  * See the associated protovis documentation at
20548  * {@link http://mbostock.github.com/protovis/jsdoc/symbols/pv.Line.html#interpolate}
20549  * and
20550  * {@link http://mbostock.github.com/protovis/jsdoc/symbols/pv.Area.html#interpolate}.
20551  * <p>
20552  * Protovis supports other interpolation values, 
20553  * but these do not work well with the CCC point charts. 
20554  * 
20555  * @class
20556  * @enum
20557  * @extends string
20558  */
20559 pvc.options.varia.LineAreaInterpolation = function(){};
20560         
20561         
20562         
20563 /**
20564  * Produces an open uniform 
20565  * <b>b</b>-spline.
20566  * 
20567  * @value 'basis'
20568  */
20569 pvc.options.varia.LineAreaInterpolation.prototype.Basis = 'basis';
20570 /**
20571  * Produces cardinal splines.
20572  * 
20573  * @value 'cardinal'
20574  */
20575 pvc.options.varia.LineAreaInterpolation.prototype.Cardinal = 'cardinal';
20576 /**
20577  * Produces a straight line between points.
20578  * 
20579  * @value 'linear'
20580  */
20581 pvc.options.varia.LineAreaInterpolation.prototype.Linear = 'linear';
20582 /**
20583  * Produces a Fritsch-Carlson 
20584  * monotone cubic hermite interpolation.
20585  * 
20586  * @value 'monotone'
20587  */
20588 pvc.options.varia.LineAreaInterpolation.prototype.Monotone = 'monotone';
20589 /**
20590  * The possible ways to join the segments of a line.
20591  * <p>
20592  * See {@link http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG/painting.html#StrokeProperties}
20593  * for more information on stroke properties.
20594  * 
20595  * @class
20596  * @enum
20597  * @extends string
20598  */
20599 pvc.options.varia.StrokeLineJoin = function(){};
20600         
20601         
20602         
20603 /**
20604  * Join segments with cut-off corners.
20605  * 
20606  * @value 'bevel'
20607  */
20608 pvc.options.varia.StrokeLineJoin.prototype.Bevel = 'bevel';
20609 /**
20610  * Join segments with sharp angle corners. 
20611  * 
20612  * @value 'miter'
20613  */
20614 pvc.options.varia.StrokeLineJoin.prototype.Miter = 'miter';
20615 /**
20616  * Join segments with rounded corners.
20617  * 
20618  * @value 'round'
20619  */
20620 pvc.options.varia.StrokeLineJoin.prototype.Round = 'round';
20621 /**
20622  * The possible ways to draw the ends of a line or line pattern.
20623  * <p>
20624  * See {@link http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG/painting.html#StrokeProperties}
20625  * for more information on stroke properties.
20626  * 
20627  * @class
20628  * @enum
20629  * @extends string
20630  */
20631 pvc.options.varia.StrokeLineCap = function(){};
20632         
20633         
20634         
20635 /**
20636  * The end is straight, at the end position. 
20637  * 
20638  * @value 'butt'
20639  */
20640 pvc.options.varia.StrokeLineCap.prototype.Butt = 'butt';
20641 /**
20642  * The end is a semi-circle,
20643  * whose radius is half the line width
20644  * and whose center is at the end position.
20645  * 
20646  * @value 'round'
20647  */
20648 pvc.options.varia.StrokeLineCap.prototype.Round = 'round';
20649 /**
20650  * The end is a square,
20651  * whith a side length equal to the line width
20652  * and whose center is at the end position.
20653  * 
20654  * @value 'square'
20655  */
20656 pvc.options.varia.StrokeLineCap.prototype.Square = 'square';
20657 /**
20658  * The possible stroke patterns.
20659  * <p>
20660  * The actual length of stroke patterns' dashes and spaces is 
20661  * proportional to the line width. 
20662  * <p>
20663  * The pattern dashes are sensitive to 
20664  * the line cap property. 
20665  * The use of {@link pvc.options.varia.StrokeLineCap#Round}
20666  * generates circle-ended dashes.
20667  * The line caps {@link pvc.options.varia.StrokeLineCap#Butt}
20668  * and {@link pvc.options.varia.StrokeLineCap#Square}
20669  * yield the same result: 
20670  * square-ended dashes, of equal length.
20671  * <p>
20672  * See {@link http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG/painting.html#StrokeProperties}
20673  * for more information on stroke properties.
20674  * 
20675  * @class
20676  * @enum
20677  * @extends string
20678  */
20679 pvc.options.varia.StrokeDasharray = function(){};
20680         
20681         
20682         
20683 /**
20684  * A pattern.
20685  * Can also be specified as 
20686  * <tt>"- "</tt>
20687  * 
20688  * @value 'dash'
20689  */
20690 pvc.options.varia.StrokeDasharray.prototype.Dash = 'dash';
20691 /**
20692  * A pattern.
20693  * Can also be specified as 
20694  * <tt>"- ."</tt>
20695  * 
20696  * @value 'dashdot'
20697  */
20698 pvc.options.varia.StrokeDasharray.prototype.DashDot = 'dashdot';
20699 /**
20700  * A pattern.
20701  * Can also be specified as 
20702  * <tt>". "</tt>
20703  * 
20704  * @value 'dot'
20705  */
20706 pvc.options.varia.StrokeDasharray.prototype.Dot = 'dot';
20707 /**
20708  * A pattern.
20709  * Can also be specified as 
20710  * <tt>"--"</tt>
20711  * 
20712  * @value 'longdash'
20713  */
20714 pvc.options.varia.StrokeDasharray.prototype.LongDash = 'longdash';
20715 /**
20716  * A pattern.
20717  * Can also be specified as 
20718  * <tt>"--."</tt>
20719  * 
20720  * @value 'longdashdot'
20721  */
20722 pvc.options.varia.StrokeDasharray.prototype.LongDashDot = 'longdashdot';
20723 /**
20724  * A pattern.
20725  * Can also be specified as 
20726  * <tt>"--.."</tt>
20727  * 
20728  * @value 'longdashdotdot'
20729  */
20730 pvc.options.varia.StrokeDasharray.prototype.LongDashDotDot = 'longdashdotdot';
20731 /**
20732  * A pattern.
20733  * Can also be specified as 
20734  * <tt>"."</tt>
20735  * 
20736  * @value 'shortdash'
20737  */
20738 pvc.options.varia.StrokeDasharray.prototype.ShortDash = 'shortdash';
20739 /**
20740  * A pattern.
20741  * Can also be specified as 
20742  * <tt>"-."</tt>
20743  * 
20744  * @value 'shortdashdot'
20745  */
20746 pvc.options.varia.StrokeDasharray.prototype.ShortDashDot = 'shortdashdot';
20747 /**
20748  * A pattern.
20749  * Can also be specified as 
20750  * <tt>"-.."</tt>
20751  * 
20752  * @value 'shortdashdotdot'
20753  */
20754 pvc.options.varia.StrokeDasharray.prototype.ShortDashDotDot = 'shortdashdotdot';
20755 /**
20756  * The horizontal alignment of text. 
20757  * 
20758  * @class
20759  * @enum
20760  * @extends string
20761  */
20762 pvc.options.varia.TextAlignment = function(){};
20763         
20764         
20765         
20766 /**
20767  * @value 'center'
20768  */
20769 pvc.options.varia.TextAlignment.prototype.Center = 'center';
20770 /**
20771  * @value 'left'
20772  */
20773 pvc.options.varia.TextAlignment.prototype.Left = 'left';
20774 /**
20775  * @value 'right'
20776  */
20777 pvc.options.varia.TextAlignment.prototype.Right = 'right';
20778 /**
20779  * The vertical alignment of text. 
20780  * 
20781  * @class
20782  * @enum
20783  * @extends string
20784  */
20785 pvc.options.varia.TextBaseline = function(){};
20786         
20787         
20788         
20789 /**
20790  * @value 'bottom'
20791  */
20792 pvc.options.varia.TextBaseline.prototype.Bottom = 'bottom';
20793 /**
20794  * @value 'middle'
20795  */
20796 pvc.options.varia.TextBaseline.prototype.Middle = 'middle';
20797 /**
20798  * @value 'top'
20799  */
20800 pvc.options.varia.TextBaseline.prototype.Top = 'top';
20801 /**
20802  * The names of the four sides of a rectangle.
20803  * 
20804  * @class
20805  * @enum
20806  * @extends string
20807  */
20808 pvc.options.varia.RectangleSide = function(){};
20809         
20810         
20811         
20812 /**
20813  * @value 'bottom'
20814  */
20815 pvc.options.varia.RectangleSide.prototype.Bottom = 'bottom';
20816 /**
20817  * @value 'left'
20818  */
20819 pvc.options.varia.RectangleSide.prototype.Left = 'left';
20820 /**
20821  * @value 'right'
20822  */
20823 pvc.options.varia.RectangleSide.prototype.Right = 'right';
20824 /**
20825  * @value 'top'
20826  */
20827 pvc.options.varia.RectangleSide.prototype.Top = 'top';
20828 /**
20829  * This type is a documentation type and 
20830  * really just documents the format of color strings.
20831  * <p>
20832  * Colors can be specified as a string that follows one of the following formats:
20833  * 
20834  * <ul>
20835  * 
20836  * <li>
20837  * an RGB or HSL color, as defined in {@link http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-color/}:
20838  * 
20839  * <ul>
20840  * 
20841  * <li>
20842  * 
20843  * <tt>'#AE7'</tt>
20844  * </li>
20845  * 
20846  * <li>
20847  * 
20848  * <tt>'#A0E070'</tt>
20849  * </li>
20850  * 
20851  * <li>
20852  * 
20853  * <tt>rgb(255, 0, 0)</tt>
20854  * </li>
20855  * 
20856  * <li>
20857  * 
20858  * <tt>rgba(100%, 0, 0, 0.5)</tt>
20859  * </li>
20860  * 
20861  * <li>
20862  * 
20863  * <tt>hsl(100, 50%, 20%)</tt>
20864  * </li>
20865  * 
20866  * <li>
20867  * 
20868  * <tt>hsla(100, 50%, 20%, 0.5)</tt>
20869  * </li>
20870  * </ul>
20871  * </li>
20872  * 
20873  * <li>
20874  * an SVG named color, as defined in {@link http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG/types.html#ColorKeywords}:
20875  * 
20876  * <ul>
20877  * 
20878  * <li>
20879  * <tt>'aliceblue'</tt></li>
20880  * 
20881  * <li>
20882  * <tt>'aquamarine'</tt></li>
20883  * </ul>
20884  * </li>
20885  * 
20886  * <li>
20887  * a subset of the CSS3 gradients format,
20888  * as defined in {@link http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-images/#gradients}:
20889  * 
20890  * <ul>
20891  * 
20892  * <li>
20893  * <tt>'linear-gradient(90deg, green, blue)'</tt></li>
20894  * 
20895  * <li>
20896  * <tt>'linear-gradient(to bottom left, red, yellow 20%, green, blue)'</tt></li>
20897  * 
20898  * <li>
20899  * <tt>'linear-gradient(red, rgb(0,0,255))'</tt></li>
20900  * 
20901  * <li>
20902  * <tt>'radial-gradient(red, yellow 40%, red)'</tt></li>
20903  * </ul>
20904  * </li>
20905  * 
20906  * <li>
20907  * 
20908  * <tt>'transparent'</tt> for a transparent background
20909  * </li>
20910  * </ul>
20911  * <p>
20912  * See the associated protovis documentation at
20913  * {@link http://mbostock.github.com/protovis/jsdoc/symbols/pv.html#.color}.
20914  * 
20915  * @class
20916  * @enum
20917  * @extends string
20918  */
20919 pvc.options.varia.ColorString = function(){};
20920         
20921         
20922         
20923 /**
20924  * Controls what to do with content that overflows.
20925  * 
20926  * @class
20927  * @enum
20928  * @extends string
20929  */
20930 pvc.options.varia.ContentOverflow = function(){};
20931         
20932         
20933         
20934 /**
20935  * Content is hidden only if one of the cartesian axis of a plot
20936  * has its 
20937  * <tt>fixedMin</tt>, 
20938  * <tt>fixedMax</tt>, 
20939  * <tt>fixedLength</tt>, 
20940  * <tt>ratio</tt>
20941  * or 
20942  * <tt>preserveRatio</tt> options specified.
20943  * 
20944  * @value 'auto'
20945  */
20946 pvc.options.varia.ContentOverflow.prototype.Auto = 'auto';
20947 /**
20948  * Content that overflows is hidden.  
20949  * 
20950  * @value 'hidden'
20951  */
20952 pvc.options.varia.ContentOverflow.prototype.Hidden = 'hidden';
20953 /**
20954  * Content that overflows is visible.
20955  * 
20956  * @value 'visible'
20957  */
20958 pvc.options.varia.ContentOverflow.prototype.Visible = 'visible';
20959 /**
20960  * The rectangle layout algorithm used by a treemap plot.
20961  * 
20962  * @class
20963  * @enum
20964  * @extends string
20965  */
20966 pvc.options.varia.TreemapLayoutMode = function(){};

20968         
20969         
20970 /**
20971  * @value 'dice'
20972  */
20973 pvc.options.varia.TreemapLayoutMode.prototype.Dice = 'dice';
20974 /**
20975  * @value 'slice'
20976  */
20977 pvc.options.varia.TreemapLayoutMode.prototype.Slice = 'slice';
20978 /**
20979  * @value 'slice-and-dice'
20980  */
20981 pvc.options.varia.TreemapLayoutMode.prototype.Slice-and-Dice = 'slice-and-dice';
20982 /**
20983  * @value 'squarify'
20984  */
20985 pvc.options.varia.TreemapLayoutMode.prototype.Squarify = 'squarify';

20987  * Indicates if the color is assigned to parent nodes or to leaf nodes.
20988  * 
20989  * @class
20990  * @enum
20991  * @extends string
20992  */
20993 pvc.options.varia.TreemapColorMode = function(){};

20996

20998  * Colors are reserved for nodes that have leaf children. Leaf children show the color of their parent.
20999  * 
21000  * @value 'byParent'
21001  */
21002 pvc.options.varia.TreemapColorMode.prototype.By-Parent = 'byParent';
21003 /**
21004  * Colors are reserved for leaf-nodes.
21005  * 
21006  * @value 'bySelf'
21007  */
21008 pvc.options.varia.TreemapColorMode.prototype.By-Self = 'bySelf';
21009 /**

21011  * 
21012  * @class
21013  * @enum
21014  * @extends string
21015  */
21016 pvc.options.varia.TooltipAutoContent = function(){};

21030  * For example, in a discrete cartesian axis, the value is the corresponding tick value. 
21031  * 
21032  * @value 'value'
21033  */
21034 pvc.options.varia.TooltipAutoContent.prototype.Value = 'value';
21035 /**
21036  * The possible strategies for when the number of small charts
21037  * overflows the initial chart dimensions.
21038  * 
21039  * @class
21040  * @enum
21041  * @extends string
21042  */
21043 pvc.options.varia.MultiChartOverflow = function(){};

21048  * Only the first small-charts that entirely fit 
21049  * in the initial chart size are actually shown.
21050  * <p>
21051  * An overflow indicator is shown by default.
21052  * 
21053  * @value 'clip'
21054  */
21055 pvc.options.varia.MultiChartOverflow.prototype.Clip = 'clip';
21056 /**
21057  * The small-charts are sized so that they all fit the initial chart size.
21058  * 
21059  * @value 'fit'
21060  */
21061 pvc.options.varia.MultiChartOverflow.prototype.Fit = 'fit';
21062 /**
21063  * The chart grows in size as needed to fit all of the small-charts.
21064  * 
21065  * @value 'grow'
21066  */
21067 pvc.options.varia.MultiChartOverflow.prototype.Grow = 'grow';
21068 /**
21069  * The types of behavior to apply when the text of value labels does not fit within the bounds of its associated visual element.
21070  * 
21071  * @class
21072  * @enum
21073  * @extends string
21074  */
21075 pvc.options.varia.ValuesOverflow = function(){};
21076         
21077         
21078         
21079 /**
21080  * Hide a value label when it overflows the bounds of its associated visual element.
21081  * 
21082  * @value 'hide'
21083  */
21084 pvc.options.varia.ValuesOverflow.prototype.Hide = 'hide';
21085 /**
21086  * Show a value label whether or not it overflows the bounds of its associated visual element.
21087  * 
21088  * @value 'show'
21089  */
21090 pvc.options.varia.ValuesOverflow.prototype.Show = 'show';
21091 /**
21092  * 
21093  * <i>Hide</i> a value label when the height of its text overflows the bounds of its associated visual element, but otherwise just 
21094  * <i>trim</i> it so that its width fits those bounds.
21095  * <p>
21096  * When only one or two characters of the original text would show after trimming, 
21097  * the text is also not shown.
21098  * 
21099  * @value 'trim'
21100  */
21101 pvc.options.varia.ValuesOverflow.prototype.Trim = 'trim';
21102 /**
21103  * The arrangement of boxes within the same category band.
21104  * 
21105  * @class
21106  * @enum
21107  * @extends string
21108  */
21109 pvc.options.varia.BoxLayoutMode = function(){};
21110         
21111         
21112         
21113 /**
21114  * Multiple boxes within the same category band
21115  * are sized and distributed horizontally
21116  * to fit the width of the category band.
21117  * <p>
21118  * The space between boxes of the same category
21119  * is given by the 
21120  * <i>boxSizeRatio</i> option.
21121  * 
21122  * @value 'grouped'
21123  */
21124 pvc.options.varia.BoxLayoutMode.prototype.Grouped = 'grouped';
21125 /**
21126  * Every box having the same category
21127  * is horizontally placed in the center of the category band,
21128  * and, generally, overlaps.
21129  * 
21130  * @value 'overlapped'
21131  */
21132 pvc.options.varia.BoxLayoutMode.prototype.Overlapped = 'overlapped';
21133 /**
21134  * The pointing mode controls the way that certain pointer events are handled
21135  * for purposes of detecting whether the pointer is pointing to a certain visual element.
21136  * 
21137  * @class
21138  * @enum
21139  * @extends string
21140  */
21141 pvc.options.varia.PointingMode = function(){};
21142         
21143         
21144         
21145 /**
21146  * The mouse is considered to point to a visual element if it is at
21147  * a certain minimum distance of it and there is no other visual element at
21148  * a closer distance.
21149  * 
21150  * @value 'near'
21151  */
21152 pvc.options.varia.PointingMode.prototype.Near = 'near';
21153 /**
21154  * The mouse is considered to point to a visual element when it is over it.
21155  * 
21156  * @value 'over'
21157  */
21158 pvc.options.varia.PointingMode.prototype.Over = 'over';
21159 /**
21160  * The names of position components to be ignored when determining the distance
21161  * between the pointer and a visual element.
21162  * 
21163  * @class
21164  * @enum
21165  * @extends string
21166  */
21167 pvc.options.varia.PointingCollapse = function(){};
21168         
21169         
21170         
21171 /**
21172  * Considers both the horizontal and vertical distance components.
21173  * 
21174  * @value 'none'
21175  */
21176 pvc.options.varia.PointingCollapse.prototype.None = 'none';
21177 /**
21178  * Ignores the horizontal distance.
21179  * 
21180  * @value 'x'
21181  */
21182 pvc.options.varia.PointingCollapse.prototype.X = 'x';
21183 /**
21184  * Ignores the vertical distance.
21185  * 
21186  * @value 'y'
21187  */
21188 pvc.options.varia.PointingCollapse.prototype.Y = 'y';
21189 /**
21190  * The slices' layout order.
21191  * 
21192  * @class
21193  * @enum
21194  * @extends string
21195  */
21196 pvc.options.varia.SliceOrder = function(){};
21197         
21198         
21199         
21200 /**
21201  * Lays out sibling slices by ascending size value.
21202  * 
21203  * @value 'bySizeAscending'
21204  */
21205 pvc.options.varia.SliceOrder.prototype.BySizeAscending = 'bySizeAscending';
21206 /**
21207  * Lays out sibling slices by descending size value.
21208  * 
21209  * @value 'bySizeDescending'
21210  */
21211 pvc.options.varia.SliceOrder.prototype.BySizeDescending = 'bySizeDescending';
21212 /**
21213  * Lays out sibling slices in their natural order (the order in the datasource).
21214  * 
21215  * @value 'none'
21216  */
21217 pvc.options.varia.SliceOrder.prototype.None = 'none';
21218 /**
21219  * Controls how colors are drawn from the color scale to paint visual elements.
21220  * 
21221  * @class
21222  * @enum
21223  * @extends string
21224  */
21225 pvc.options.varia.SunburstColorMode = function(){};
21226         
21227         
21228         
21229 /**
21230  * This color mode only assigns colors from the color scale to the first-level slices.
21231  * The colors of child slices are derived from the color of their parent slice
21232  * by taking successively lighter shades of it.
21233  * 
21234  * @value 'fan'
21235  */
21236 pvc.options.varia.SunburstColorMode.prototype.Fan = 'fan';
21237 /**
21238  * This color mode assigns a distinct color from the color scale to each slice.
21239  * 
21240  * @value 'slice'
21241  */
21242 pvc.options.varia.SunburstColorMode.prototype.Slice = 'slice';
21243 /**
21244  * The confirmation mode of the column types declared in a dataset's metadata.
21245  * <p>
21246  * The column type metadata is sometimes incorrect
21247  * due to the existence of nulls in the first row and
21248  * the inability of some data sources to
21249  * properly identify the data type in that case.
21250  * <p>
21251  * Other times, its incorrect just because...
21252  * "Numeric" columns may be declared as "String",
21253  * and contain either numbers or numeric strings.
21254  * 
21255  * @class
21256  * @enum
21257  * @extends string
21258  */
21259 pvc.options.varia.DataTypeCheckingMode = function(){};
21260         
21261         
21262         
21263 /**
21264  * Checks if columns declared as "String" are "Numeric",
21265  * based on the type and form of the first non-null value.
21266  * <p>
21267  * The column type is established by the
21268  * first row in which the column value is non-null.
21269  * The type will be considered "Numeric" if the
21270  * value is a JavaScript number 
21271  * <i>or</i>
21272  * if it can be parsed as a number.
21273  * 
21274  * @value 'extended'
21275  */
21276 pvc.options.varia.DataTypeCheckingMode.prototype.Extended = 'extended';
21277 /**
21278  * Checks if columns declared as "String" are "Numeric",
21279  * based on the type of first non-null value.
21280  * <p>
21281  * The column type is established by the
21282  * first row in which the column value is non-null.
21283  * The type will be considered "Numeric" if the
21284  * value is a JavaScript number.
21285  * 
21286  * @value 'minimum'
21287  */
21288 pvc.options.varia.DataTypeCheckingMode.prototype.Minimum = 'minimum';
21289 /**
21290  * Trusts the data source column type metadata.
21291  * 
21292  * @value 'none'
21293  */
21294 pvc.options.varia.DataTypeCheckingMode.prototype.None = 'none';
21295 /**
21296  * The presented string should be the code of a standard precision,
21297  * optionally immediately preceded by an integer multiple.
21298  * <p>
21299  * E.g. 
21300  * <tt>'25d'</tt> means twenty five days.
21301  * 
21302  * <h2>The standard time precisions and codes:</h2>
21303  * 
21304  * <ul>
21305  * 
21306  * <li>
21307  * <tt>31536e6</tt> ms - 'y' or 'year' (pvc.time.intervals.y)  </li>
21308  * 
21309  * <li>
21310  * <tt>2592e6</tt> ms - 'm' or 'month' (pvc.time.intervals.m or pvc.time.intervals.d30)</li>
21311  * 
21312  * <li>
21313  * <tt>6048e5</tt> ms - 'w' or 'week' (pvc.time.intervals.w or pvc.time.intervals.d7)</li>
21314  * 
21315  * <li>
21316  * <tt>864e5</tt> ms - 'd' or 'day' (pvc.time.intervals.d)</li>
21317  * 
21318  * <li>
21319  * <tt>36e5</tt> ms - 'h' or 'hour' (pvc.time.intervals.h)</li>
21320  * 
21321  * <li>
21322  * <tt>6e4</tt> ms - 'M' or 'minute' (pvc.time.intervals.M)</li>
21323  * 
21324  * <li>
21325  * <tt>1e3</tt> ms - 's' or 'second' (pvc.time.intervals.s)</li>
21326  * 
21327  * <li>
21328  * <tt>1</tt> ms - 'ms' or 'millisecond' (pvc.time.intervals.ms)</li>
21329  * </ul>
21330  * 
21331  * @class
21332  * @enum
21333  * @extends string
21334  */
21335 pvc.options.varia.TimeInterval = function(){};
21336         
21337         
21338         
21339 /**
21340  * The presented string should be composed by a number of pixels and a time interval,
21341  * as described in {@link pvc.options.varia.TimeInterval},
21342  * separated by the character '/'.
21343  * <p>
21344  * E.g. 
21345  * <tt>'100 / 25d'</tt> means the specified ratio is of 100 pixels per twenty five days.
21346  * E.g. 
21347  * <tt>'100 / 2592e6'</tt> means the specified ratio is of 100 pixels per month.
21348  * 
21349  * @class
21350  * @enum
21351  * @extends string
21352  */
21353 pvc.options.varia.TimeRatio = function(){};
21354         
21355         
21356         
21357 /**
21358  * Use these possible strategies when the number of legend items exceeds
21359  * the {@link pvc.options.panels.LegendPanel#itemCountMax} or overflows the
21360  * legend panel dimensions.
21361  * 
21362  * @class
21363  * @enum
21364  * @extends string
21365  */
21366 pvc.options.varia.LegendOverflow = function(){};
21367         
21368         
21369         
21370 /**
21371  * All legend items are rendered but the overflow in
21372  * the legend panel is hidden.
21373  * <p>
21374  * This option does not affect the case when the number
21375  * of legend items exceeds {@link pvc.options.panels.LegendPanel#itemCountMax}.
21376  * <p>
21377  * No overflow indicator is shown.
21378  * 
21379  * @value 'clip'
21380  */
21381 pvc.options.varia.LegendOverflow.prototype.Clip = 'clip';
21382 /**
21383  * When overflow is detected, the whole legend panel
21384  * is collapsed and the legend is not displayed.
21385  * 
21386  * @value 'collapse'
21387  */
21388 pvc.options.varia.LegendOverflow.prototype.Collapse = 'collapse';
21389 /**
21390  * Describes the distances from
21391  * each of the four sides of a rectangle:
21392  * "left", "right", "top" and "bottom".
21393  * <p>
21394  * It is used to describe the margins and the paddings of panels.
21395  * <p>
21396  * It is possible to specify any combination of the side properties.
21397  * <p>
21398  * All side properties support values in absolute or relative units:
21399  * 
21400  * <dl>
21401  * 
21402  * <dt>absolute</dt>
21403  * 
21404  * <dd>
21405  * if it is a 
21406  * <tt>number</tt> or a numeric 
21407  * <tt>string</tt>,
21408  * the measure is in pixel units
21409  * </dd>
21410  * 
21411  * <dt>relative</dt>
21412  * 
21413  * <dd>
21414  * if it is a numeric 
21415  * <tt>string</tt> with a "%" suffix,
21416  * the measure is a percentage of some reference size;
21417  * usually, the reference size is
21418  * the size of the corresponding container panel side
21419  * ("width" if side is "left" or "right", or "height" otherwise)
21420  * </dd>
21421  * </dl>
21422  * 
21423  * <h3>Special properties</h3>
21424  * 
21425  * <p>The special property, 
21426  * <tt>all</tt>, affects all unspecified properties at once.</p>
21427  * 
21428  * <p>The special property, 
21429  * <tt>width</tt>, is interpreted as if both "left" and "right" had been specified, with half the value.</p>
21430  * 
21431  * <p>The special property, 
21432  * <tt>height</tt>, is interpreted as if both "top" and "bottom" had been specified, with half the value.</p>
21433  * 
21434  * <p>When all, width, or height are specified, they are evaluated in that order, and before normal properties.</p>
21435  * 
21436  * <h3>JSON syntax example</h3>
21437  * 
21438  * <p>
21439  * The following is an example of a 
21440  * <i>sides</i>-structured object,
21441  * the hypothetical margins of a legend panel:
21442  * 
21443  * <pre>
21444  * var legendMargins = {left: 10, right: '20', all: '15%'};
21445  *                 
21446  * </pre>
21447  * It says that
21448  * the left margin has 10 pixels,
21449  * the right margin has 20 pixels, and
21450  * the top and bottom margins have each
21451  * the size of 15 percent of the legend panel's parent client height.
21452  * 
21453  * <p>
21454  * 
21455  * <h3>Single number or numeric string interpretation</h3>
21456  * All chart options of type {@link pvc.options.varia.Sides}
21457  * allow specifying
21458  * a 
21459  * <tt>number</tt> or
21460  * a 
21461  * <tt>string</tt> of a single number, possibly followed by a "%" sign,
21462  * instead of the JSON form,
21463  * as meaning 
21464  * <i>all</i> properties.
21465  * 
21466  * <h3>String syntax</h3>
21467  * All chart options of type {@link pvc.options.varia.Sides}
21468  * also allow specifying a CSS2-like margins string,
21469  * {@link http://www.w3.org/TR/CSS21/box.html#propdef-margin}.
21470  * 
21471  * <p>
21472  * The following shows the equivalence between the string and JSON syntax:
21473  * 
21474  * <pre>
21475  * var margins1 = '1';       // {all: '1'}
21476  * var margins2 = '1 2';     // {top: '1', bottom: '1', right: '2', left: '2'}
21477  * var margins3 = '1 2 3';   // {top: '1', bottom: '3', right: '2', left: '2'}
21478  * var margins4 = '1 2 3 4'; // {top: '1', bottom: '3', right: '2', left: '4'}
21479  *                 
21480  * </pre>
21481  * 
21482  * <p>
21483  * 
21484  * @class
21485  */
21486 pvc.options.varia.Sides = function(){};
21487         
21488         
21489         
21490         
21491 /**
21492  * @type number|string
21493  */
21494 pvc.options.varia.Sides.prototype.all = undefined;
21495 /**
21496  * @type number|string
21497  */
21498 pvc.options.varia.Sides.prototype.bottom = undefined;
21499 /**
21500  * @type number|string
21501  */
21502 pvc.options.varia.Sides.prototype.height = undefined;
21503 /**
21504  * @type number|string
21505  */
21506 pvc.options.varia.Sides.prototype.left = undefined;
21507 /**
21508  * @type number|string
21509  */
21510 pvc.options.varia.Sides.prototype.right = undefined;
21511 /**
21512  * @type number|string
21513  */
21514 pvc.options.varia.Sides.prototype.top = undefined;
21515 /**
21516  * @type number|string
21517  */
21518 pvc.options.varia.Sides.prototype.width = undefined;
21519 /**
21520  * Describes the size
21521  * of the horizontal and vertical dimensions
21522  * of an axis aligned box.
21523  * It is used to describe the margins and the paddings of panels.
21524  * <p>
21525  * It is possible to specify any combination of the size properties.
21526  * <p>
21527  * All size properties support values in absolute or relative units:
21528  * 
21529  * <dl>
21530  * 
21531  * <dt>absolute</dt>
21532  * 
21533  * <dd>
21534  * if it is a 
21535  * <tt>number</tt> or a numeric 
21536  * <tt>string</tt>,
21537  * the measure is in pixel units
21538  * </dd>
21539  * 
21540  * <dt>relative</dt>
21541  * 
21542  * <dd>
21543  * if it is a numeric 
21544  * <tt>string</tt> with a "%" suffix,
21545  * the measure is a percentage of some reference size;
21546  * usually,
21547  * the reference size is
21548  * the container panel's corresponding size
21549  * </dd>
21550  * </dl>
21551  * <p>
21552  * The special property, 
21553  * <tt>all</tt>, affects all unspecified properties at once.
21554  * 
21555  * <p>
21556  * The following is an example of a 
21557  * <i>size</i>-structured object,
21558  * the hypothetical size of a title panel:
21559  * 
21560  * <pre>
21561  * var titleSize = {width: '80%', all: 100};
21562  *                 
21563  * </pre>
21564  * It says that
21565  * the height has 100 pixels,
21566  * and that the width is 80 percent of the base panel's width.
21567  * 
21568  * <p>
21569  * 
21570  * <h3>Single number or numeric string interpretation</h3>
21571  * All chart options of type {@link pvc.options.varia.Size}
21572  * allow specifying
21573  * a 
21574  * <tt>number</tt> or
21575  * a 
21576  * <tt>string</tt> of a single number, possibly followed by a "%" sign,
21577  * instead of the JSON form.
21578  * <p>
21579  * The interpretation of what the number or percentage stand
21580  * for depends on the specific option.
21581  * In the legend and title panels, for example,
21582  * it is the size of the dimension orthogonal to the anchored to side.
21583  * So if a legend is anchored to the 
21584  * <tt>'left'</tt> side,
21585  * the number or percentage is the legend's width.
21586  * 
21587  * <h3>String syntax</h3>
21588  * All chart options of type {@link pvc.options.varia.Size}
21589  * also allow specifying a string with a fixed structure.
21590  * 
21591  * <p>
21592  * The following shows the equivalence between the string and JSON syntax:
21593  * 
21594  * <pre>
21595  * var size1 = '1';   // {all: '1'}
21596  * var size2 = '1 2'; // {width: '1', height: '2'}
21597  *                 
21598  * </pre>
21599  * 
21600  * <p>
21601  * 
21602  * @class
21603  */
21604 pvc.options.varia.Size = function(){};
21605         
21606         
21607         
21608         
21609 /**
21610  * @type number|string
21611  */
21612 pvc.options.varia.Size.prototype.all = undefined;
21613 /**
21614  * @type number|string
21615  */
21616 pvc.options.varia.Size.prototype.height = undefined;
21617 /**
21618  * @type number|string
21619  */
21620 pvc.options.varia.Size.prototype.width = undefined;
21621 /**
21622  * The options documentation class of the tooltip.
21623  * 
21624  * @class
21625  */
21626 pvc.options.Tooltip = function(){};
21627         
21628         
21629         
21630         
21631 /**
21632  * The duration for the tooltip move animation, in milliseconds.
21633  * <p>
21634  * A value of 
21635  * <tt>0</tt> disables the move animation.
21636  * <p>
21637  * The default value depends on
21638  * the value of {@link pvc.options.Tooltip#followMouse}.
21639  * When 
21640  * <tt>false</tt>, the default value is 
21641  * <tt>400</tt> ms.
21642  * Otherwise, it is 
21643  * <tt>0</tt>, resulting in no animation.
21644  * 
21645  * @type number
21646  */
21647 pvc.options.Tooltip.prototype.animate = undefined;
21648 /**
21649  * Indicates if the tooltip shows an arrow
21650  * pointing to the
21651  * visual element's anchor point.
21652  * <p>
21653  * Most chart types use a default value of 
21654  * <tt>true</tt>.
21655  * 
21656  * @type boolean
21657  */
21658 pvc.options.Tooltip.prototype.arrowVisible = undefined;
21659 /**
21660  * A custom class to mark the root tooltip element.
21661  * <p>
21662  * The root tooltip element is always marked with the class 
21663  * <tt>tipsy</tt>.
21664  * This option allows you to specify an additional class to style the tooltip
21665  * differently for a single chart or group of charts.
21666  * 
21667  * @type string
21668  * @default ''
21669  */
21670 pvc.options.Tooltip.prototype.className = undefined;
21671 /**
21672  * The delay for the tooltip to show, in milliseconds.
21673  * 
21674  * @type number
21675  * @default 200
21676  */
21677 pvc.options.Tooltip.prototype.delayIn = undefined;
21678 /**
21679  * The delay for the tooltip to hide, in milliseconds.
21680  * 
21681  * @type number
21682  * @default 80
21683  */
21684 pvc.options.Tooltip.prototype.delayOut = undefined;
21685 /**
21686  * Indicates if the tooltip is enabled.
21687  * 
21688  * @type boolean
21689  * @default true
21690  */
21691 pvc.options.Tooltip.prototype.enabled = undefined;
21692 /**
21693  * Indicates if the tooltip fades in and out,
21694  * after the corresponding delay has expired.
21695  * 
21696  * @type boolean
21697  * @default true
21698  */
21699 pvc.options.Tooltip.prototype.fade = undefined;
21700 /**
21701  * Indicates if the
21702  * visual element's anchor point
21703  * should be the current mouse position.
21704  * 
21705  * @type boolean
21706  * @default false
21707  */
21708 pvc.options.Tooltip.prototype.followMouse = undefined;
21709 /**
21710  * A callback function that is called
21711  * to build the tooltip of a visual element.
21712  * <p>
21713  * If {@link #html} is 
21714  * <tt>true</tt>,
21715  * the resulting text must be valid HTML,
21716  * otherwise,
21717  * it is considered plain text.
21718  * 
21719  * @returns {string}
21720  * The tooltip text.
21721  * 
21722  * @method
21723  * @this pvc.visual.Context
21724  * @param {pvc.visual.Scene} scene
21725  * The scene whose tooltip is to be built.
21726  * <p>
21727  * Use the data contained in the scene object to 
21728  * build the tooltip.
21729  * 
21730  */
21731 pvc.options.Tooltip.prototype.format = function(){};
21732 /**
21733  * The preferred tooltip gravity.
21734  * <p>
21735  * The default value depends on the chart type.
21736  * Most use the {@link pvc.options.varia.TooltipGravity#South} gravity,
21737  * but others, like the Pie chart,
21738  * calculate an adequate gravity per visual element.
21739  * <p>
21740  * When using the preferred gravity causes the
21741  * tooltip to be placed off the browser window,
21742  * a more suitable gravity may be automatically chosen.
21743  * 
21744  * @type pvc.options.varia.TooltipGravity
21745  */
21746 pvc.options.Tooltip.prototype.gravity = undefined;
21747 /**
21748  * Indicates if the tooltip text
21749  * that the format function builds
21750  * is in HTML format.
21751  * 
21752  * @type boolean
21753  * @default true
21754  */
21755 pvc.options.Tooltip.prototype.html = undefined;
21756 /**
21757  * The distance of the closest tooltip edge or corner
21758  * to the visual element's tooltip anchor point, in pixel units.
21759  * <p>
21760  * The default value depends on the chart type.
21761  * 
21762  * @type number
21763  */
21764 pvc.options.Tooltip.prototype.offset = undefined;
21765 /**
21766  * The opacity level of the tooltip box (range from 0, completely transparent, to 1).
21767  * 
21768  * @type number
21769  * @default 0.9
21770  */
21771 pvc.options.Tooltip.prototype.opacity = undefined;
21772 /**
21773  * Indicates if the collateral tooltip gravities should be
21774  * aligned with corners.
21775  * <p>
21776  * Most chart types use a default value of 
21777  * <tt>false</tt>.
21778  * 
21779  * @type boolean
21780  */
21781 pvc.options.Tooltip.prototype.useCorners = undefined;
21782 /**
21783  * The options documentation class of a visual role.
21784  * <p>
21785  * Where a visual role argument is expected,
21786  * a 
21787  * <tt>string</tt> value is also accepted,
21788  * with the content of what would be specified in
21789  * the property {@link #dimensions}.
21790  * 
21791  * @class
21792  */
21793 pvc.options.VisualRole = function(){};
21794         
21795         
21796         
21797         
21798 /**
21799  * A list of dimension names and respective
21800  * sort orders.
21801  * <p>
21802  * A dimensions string is similar to an SQL 'order by' clause,
21803  * like the following examples show:
21804  * 
21805  * <dl>
21806  * 
21807  * <dt>
21808  * 
21809  * <tt>"productType"</tt>
21810  * </dt>
21811  * 
21812  * <dd>
21813  * the visual role is bound to the single dimension named 
21814  * <tt>"productType"</tt>,
21815  * and data will be sorted in ascending order
21816  * </dd>
21817  * </dl>
21818  * 
21819  * <dl>
21820  * 
21821  * <dt>
21822  * 
21823  * <tt>"sales"</tt>
21824  * </dt>
21825  * 
21826  * <dd>
21827  * the visual role is bound to the single dimension named 
21828  * <tt>"sales"</tt>,
21829  * and data will be sorted in ascending order
21830  * </dd>
21831  * </dl>
21832  * 
21833  * <dl>
21834  * 
21835  * <dt>
21836  * 
21837  * <tt>"country, productType"</tt>
21838  * </dt>
21839  * 
21840  * <dd>
21841  * the visual role is bound to the dimensions
21842  * named 
21843  * <tt>"country"</tt> and 
21844  * <tt>"productType"</tt>,
21845  * and data will be sorted first by
21846  * 
21847  * <tt>"country"</tt>, in ascending order,
21848  * and then by
21849  * 
21850  * <tt>"productType"</tt>, in ascending order
21851  * </dd>
21852  * </dl>
21853  * 
21854  * <dl>
21855  * 
21856  * <dt>
21857  * 
21858  * <tt>"country desc, productType asc"</tt>
21859  * </dt>
21860  * 
21861  * <dd>
21862  * the visual role is bound to the dimensions
21863  * named 
21864  * <tt>"country"</tt> and 
21865  * <tt>"productType"</tt>,
21866  * and data will be sorted first by
21867  * 
21868  * <tt>"country"</tt>, in descending order,
21869  * and then by
21870  * 
21871  * <tt>"productType"</tt>, in ascending order
21872  * </dd>
21873  * </dl>
21874  * 
21875  * @type string
21876  */
21877 pvc.options.VisualRole.prototype.dimensions = undefined;
21878 /**
21879  * The 
21880  * <i>name</i> of another visual role
21881  * whose dimensions are to be used by this one.
21882  * <p>
21883  * This property takes precedence over {@link pvc.options.VisualRole#dimensions}.
21884  * <p>
21885  * If the source role is reversed,
21886  * this visual role's
21887  * {@link pvc.options.VisualRole#isReversed} is toggled.
21888  * <p>
21889  * If this is a plot visual role and it is being
21890  * specified from within {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart#plots},
21891  * then {@link pvc.options.VisualRole#from} is relative to the enclosing plot.
21892  * <p>
21893  * To refer to a visual role of the 
21894  * <i>main</i> plot,
21895  * prefix the local name of the visual role with "main.", to obtain, for example, "main.series".
21896  * <p>
21897  * To refer, unambiguously, to a visual role of the 
21898  * <i>chart</i>,
21899  * prefix its local name with "$.", to obtain, for example, "$.multiChart".
21900  * 
21901  * @type string
21902  */
21903 pvc.options.VisualRole.prototype.from = undefined;
21904 /**
21905  * Indicates that the visual role's data
21906  * should be ordered in reverse order
21907  * in relation to the sort orders specified in
21908  * {@link #dimensions}.
21909  * <p>
21910  * This option provides a quick way to reverse the order
21911  * of the whole visual role, without changing any partial
21912  * sort orders assigned to each dimension of the visual role.
21913  * <p>
21914  * This option can be used to reverse the order of
21915  * the data that is shown in a discrete axis.
21916  * <p>
21917  * See also {@link pvc.options.VisualRole#from}.
21918  * 
21919  * @type boolean
21920  * @default false
21921  */
21922 pvc.options.VisualRole.prototype.isReversed = undefined;
21923 /**
21924  * The legend options of a visual role.
21925  * 
21926  * @type pvc.options.VisualRoleLegend
21927  */
21928 pvc.options.VisualRole.prototype.legend = undefined;
21929 /**
21930  * The options documentation class of the legend options of a visual role.
21931  * <p>
21932  * This class contains 
21933  * <i>normal</i> and 
21934  * <i>extension point</i> properties.
21935  * 
21936  * @class
21937  */
21938 pvc.options.VisualRoleLegend = function(){};
21939         
21940         
21941         
21942         
21943 /**
21944  * The extension point of the dot mark of a legend item.
21945  * 
21946  * @type pvc.options.marks.DotExtensionPoint
21947  */
21948 pvc.options.VisualRoleLegend.prototype.dot = undefined;
21949 /**
21950  * The extension point of the rule mark of a legend item.
21951  * 
21952  * @type pvc.options.marks.RuleExtensionPoint
21953  */
21954 pvc.options.VisualRoleLegend.prototype.rule = undefined;
21955 /**
21956  * Indicates if the data and visual function
21957  * represented by the visual role can display a
21958  * legend describing it.
21959  * <p>
21960  * For example, this option allows hiding the color legend
21961  * for the data of a particular plot and color axis combination.
21962  * Contrast this option with that of the color axis,
21963  * {@link pvc.options.axes.DiscreteColorAxis#legendVisible},
21964  * which totally hides the legend of a color axis.
21965  * <p>
21966  * The items in a legend are visible only if all the following are 
21967  * <tt>true</tt>tt>:
21968  * 
21969  * <ul>
21970  * 
21971  * <li>their associated visual role's {@link pvc.options.VisualRoleLegend#visible}</li>
21972  * 
21973  * <li>their associated color axis' {@link pvc.options.axes.DiscreteColorAxis#legendVisible}</li>
21974  * 
21975  * <li>the chart's {@link pvc.options.charts.Chart#legend}</li>
21976  * </ul>
21977  * 
21978  * @type boolean
21979  * @default true
21980  */
21981 pvc.options.VisualRoleLegend.prototype.visible = undefined;
21982 /**
21983  * The options documentation class for the pointing behaviours.
21984  * 
21985  * @class
21986  */
21987 pvc.options.Pointing = function(){};
21988         
21989         
21990         
21991         
21992 /**
21993  * The position components that are to be ignored when determining the
21994  * distance between the pointer and a visual element.
21995  * <p>
21996  * Applies to the 
21997  * <i>near</i> pointing mode only.
21998  * 
21999  * @type pvc.options.varia.PointingCollapse
22000  */
22001 pvc.options.Pointing.prototype.collapse = undefined;
22002 /**
22003  * The desired pointing mode.
22004  * 
22005  * @type pvc.options.varia.PointingMode
22006  * @default 'near'
22007  */
22008 pvc.options.Pointing.prototype.mode = undefined;
22009 /**
22010  * The minimum distance, in pixels, that the pointer must be from the visual element
22011  * for it to be considered to be pointing to it
22012  * (applies to the 
22013  * <i>near</i> pointing mode only).
22014  * <p>
22015  * The value must be non-negative and can be 
22016  * <tt>Infinity</tt>.
22017  * <p>
22018  * Applies to the 
22019  * <i>near</i> pointing mode only.
22020  * 
22021  * @type number
22022  * @default 10
22023  */
22024 pvc.options.Pointing.prototype.radius = undefined;
22025 /**
22026  * The minimum distance, in pixels,
22027  * that a new chosen point must be from the previously chosen point.
22028  * <p>
22029  * This parameter adds some hysteresis to the pointing behavior
22030  * in an effort to stabilize cases where small mouse moves
22031  * would cause frequent point change and alternation.
22032  * <p>
22033  * The value must be non-negative and finite.
22034  * <p>
22035  * The value 
22036  * <tt>0</tt> disables point change hysteresis.
22037  * <p>
22038  * Applies to the 
22039  * <i>near</i> pointing mode only.
22040  * 
22041  * @type number
22042  * @default 4
22043  */
22044 pvc.options.Pointing.prototype.radiusHyst = undefined;
22045 /**
22046  * Whether a click that occurs when an visual element is being pointed to
22047  * should be redirected to it.
22048  * <p>
22049  * Applies to the 
22050  * <i>near</i> pointing mode only.
22051  * 
22052  * @type boolean
22053  * @default true
22054  */
22055 pvc.options.Pointing.prototype.stealClick = undefined;
22056 /**
22057  * Compatibility flags control CCC features which are in the process of deprecation.
22058  * <p>
22059  * See also {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart#compatVersion} and
22060  * {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart#compatFlags}.
22061  * 
22062  * @class
22063  */
22064 pvc.options.varia.CompatibilityFlags = function(){};
22065         
22066         
22067         
22068         
22069 /**
22070  * Enables discrete scale cartesian axes of single
22071  * 
22072  * <tt>Date</tt> dimension to format tick labels with a format that is determined
22073  * according to an automatically determined precision,
22074  * like it is done with cartesian axes of continuous scale.
22075  * <p>
22076  * This behaviour sometimes results in multiple categories being formatted with the
22077  * same label and is discouraged for use with generic data.
22078  * <p>
22079  * This option will have a default value of 
22080  * <tt>false</tt> when
22081  * {@link pvc.options.charts.BasicChart#compatVersion} 
22082  * <tt>3</tt> is introduced and used.
22083  * 
22084  * @type boolean
22085  * @default true
22086  */
22087 pvc.options.varia.CompatibilityFlags.prototype.discreteTimeSeriesTickFormat = undefined;
